original: Bhatakāti bhatiyā jīvanakā. Kasikammādikammaṃ karontīti kammakarā. Upajīvinoti sammantanādinā upagantvā nissayaṃ katvā jīvantīti upajīvino.🔽Itthīti thiyati etissaṃ gabbhoti itthī. Pariggahoti sahāyī sassāmikā. Mātāpitibandhavāpi
analyzed: bhatakā ati bhatiyā jīvanakā kasi kamma ādi kammam karonti iti kamma karāḥ upajīvinaḥ iti sammantana ādinā upagantvā nissayam katvā jīvanti iti upajīvinaḥ  itthī iti thiyati etissam gabbho ti itthī pariggaho ti sahāyī sa sāmikā mātā piti bandhavā api
translated: “Hired workers” : those who live by wages. “Those who work for their keep” : those who work in the fields and so on. “Dependants” : those who live by going to others for support.🔽“Woman” : she is a woman because she bears a child in her womb. “A wife” : a companion with a husband. “A mother, a father, relatives, and kinsmen” :

original: ñātibandhu. Sagotto gottabandhu. Ekācariyakule vā ekajātimantaṃ vā uggahitamanto
analyzed: ñāti bandhu sagottaḥ gotta bandhu eka ācariya kule vā eka jātimantam vā uggahitamantaḥ
translated: relatives and kinsmen. “A clan” : kinsmen by clan. “One who has received the precepts from the same teacher” : one who has received the same training.

original: mantabandhu. Dhanusippādisaddhiṃ uggahitako sippabandhu. “Mittabandhavātipi bandhū”ti🔽katthaci potthake pāṭho dissati.🔽Gijjhatīti kilesakāmena pattheti. Anugijjhatīti anu anu gijjhati punappunaṃ pattheti.🔽Paligijjhatīti samantato pattheti. Palibajjhatīti visesena pattheti. “Oḷārikattena
analyzed: manta bandhu dhanu sippa ādi saddhim sippa bandhu bandhu iti  katthaci potthake pāṭhaḥ dissati  gijjhati iti kilesa kāmena pattheti anugijjhati iti anu anu gijjhati punappunam pattheti  paligijjhati iti samantataḥ pattheti palibajjhati iti visesena pattheti oḷārika ttena
translated: ‘ Kinsman by speech ’: a friend by speech. ‘ Kinsman by virtue ’: a friend by virtue. ‘ Kinsman by clan ’: a friend by clan. ‘ Kinsman by boon ’: a friend by boon. ‘ Kinsman by training ’: a friend by training. ‘ Kinsman by precept ’: a friend by precept. ‘ Kinsman by view ’: a friend by view. ‘ Kinsman by alms ’: a friend by alms. ‘ Kinsman by fear ’: a friend by fear. ‘ Kinsman by service ’: a friend by service. ‘ Kinsman by giving ’: a friend by giving. ‘ Kinsman by sharing ’: a friend by sharing. ‘ Kinsman by counsel ’: a friend by counsel. ‘ Kinsman by craft ’: a friend by craft. ‘ Kinsman by friendship ’: a friend by friendship.🔽In some books the reading is ‘ kinsman by friendship ’.🔽‘ He pursues ’: he desires and seeks with lust for defilement. ‘ He pursues in pursuit ’: he pursues again and again.🔽‘ He pursues in pursuit of pursuit ’: he seeks all round. ‘ He pursues in pursuit of pursuit of pursuit ’: he seeks in particular. ‘ He pursues in pursuit of pursuit of pursuit of pursuit ’: he seeks in particular and again and again.🔽

original: nimittaggāhavasena gijjhati, anugijjhati, anubyañjanaggāhavasena paligijjhati, palibajjhatī”ti evameke vaṇṇayanti.🔽5. Pañcamagāthāyaṃ ayaṃ saṅkhepattho – taṃ puggalaṃ abalakhyā kilesā balīyanti sahanti🔽maddanti. Saddhābalādivirahena vā abalaṃ taṃ puggalaṃ abalā kilesā balīyanti, abalattā🔽balīyantīti attho. Atha vā taṃ kāmagiddhaṃ kāmarattaṃ kāmapariyesantañca sīhādayo
analyzed: nimitta ggāha vasena gijjhati anugijjhati anubyañjana ggāha vasena paligijjhati palibajjhati iti evam eke vaṇṇayanti 🔽pañcama gāthā ayam ayam saṅkhepa atthaḥ tam puggalam abala khyā kilesāḥ balīyanti sahanti 🔽maddanti saddhā bala ādi virahena vā abalam tam puggalam abalā kilesāḥ balīyanti abala tā 🔽balīyanti iti atthaḥ atha vā tam kāma giddham kāma rattam kāma pariyesantam ca sīha ādayaḥ
translated: ‘ Kinsman by speech ’: a kinsman by the speech of the True Idea. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kinsman by the True Ideal of the Path and its Fruit. ‘ Kinsman by the True Ideal ’: a kins

original: ca pākaṭaparissayā, kāyaduccaritādayo ca apākaṭaparissayā maddanti. Tato apākaṭaparissayehi
analyzed: ca pākaṭa parissayā kāya duccarita ādayo ca apākaṭa parissayāḥ maddanti tatas apākaṭa parissayehi
translated: and the manifest kinds of danger, such as bodily misconduct, etc., do not.

original: abhibhūtaṃ taṃ puggalaṃ jātiādidukkhaṃ bhinnaṃ nāvaṃ udakaṃ viya anveti.🔽Abalāti natthi etesaṃ balanti abalā, balavirahitā. Dubbalāti mandapayogābalena kattabbakiccavirahitā.
analyzed: abhibhūtam tam puggalam jāti ādi dukkham bhinnam nāvam udakam viya anveti  abalā ati natthi etesam balanti abalā bala virahitā dubbalā ati manda payoga abalena kattabba kicca virahitā
translated: Then the suffering of birth, etc., follows upon that person who is overcome by the unmanifest kinds of danger, as the water does the broken boat.🔽“Weak” : they have no strength, thus they are “weak” ; they are devoid of strength. “Feeble” : they are devoid of the function of strength.🔽“Powerless” : they have little strength, thus they are “powerless” ; they are incapable of contending. “Of little courage” :

original: Appabalāti appaṃ parittaṃ etesaṃ balanti appabalā, yujjhituṃ asamatthā. Appathāmakāti
analyzed: appabalā ati appam parittam etesam balanti appa balāḥ yujjhitum asamatthāḥ appathāmakā ti
translated: they have little courage, thus they are “of little courage” ; they are devoid of effort, of exertion.🔽“Cowardly” : they are devoid of courage through the absence of the function of courage.

original: appo paritto thāmo etesaṃ vāyāmo ussāhoti appathāmakā. Hīnā nihīnā payogahīnena.🔽Omakā thāmahīnena. Lāmakā paccayahīnena. Chatukkā ajjhāsayahīnena. Parittā pattihīnena.
analyzed: appaḥ paritto thāmaḥ etesam vāyāmaḥ ussāhaḥ ti appathāmakā hīnā nihīnā payoga hīnena  omakā thāma hīnena lāmakā paccaya hīnena chatukkā ajjhāsaya hīnena parittā patti hīnena
translated: “Timorous” : they are devoid of courage through the absence of the power of courage. “Small-minded” : they are devoid of courage through the absence of the power of courage. “Limited” : they are devoid of courage through the absence of the power of courage.

original: Sahantīti maddanti ghaṭṭanaṃ uppādenti. Parisahantīti sabbato maddanti. Abhibhavanti
analyzed: sahanti iti maddanti ghaṭṭanam uppādenti parisahanti iti sabbatas maddanti abhibhavanti
translated: “They endure” : they are crushed, they are struck down. “They are crushed” : they are crushed on all sides. “They are overcome” :🔽they are overcome by the occurrence of danger again and again. “They are submerged” :

original: aparāparaṃ uppattivasena. Ajjhottharanti punappunaṃ uppattivasena. Pariyādiyanti
analyzed: apara aparam uppatti vasena ajjhottharanti punappunam uppatti vasena pariyādiyanti
translated: they are submerged by the occurrence of danger again and again.

original: sussosetvā ṭhānena. Maddanti kusaluppattinivāraṇena.
analyzed: sussosetvā ṭhānena maddanti kusala uppatti nivāraṇena
translated: and by “he should guard” by means of the place. “He should restrain” by preventing the arising of what is unprofitable.

original: Saddhābalanti saddahanti etāya, sayaṃ vā saddahati, saddahanamattameva vā esāti saddhā.🔽Sā saddahanalakkhaṇā, okappanalakkhaṇā vā, sampasādanarasā udakappasādakamaṇi viya.🔽Pakkhandanarasā vā oghuttaraṇo viya. Akālusiyapaccupaṭṭhānā, adhimuttipaccupaṭṭhānā
analyzed: saddhā balanti saddahanti etāya sayam vā saddahati saddahana mattam eva vai esā ati saddhā  sā saddahana lakkhaṇā okappana lakkhaṇā vā sampasādana rasā udaka ppasāda kamaṇi viya  pakkhandana rasāḥ vā oghuttaraṇaḥ viya akālusiya paccupaṭṭhānā adhimutti paccupaṭṭhānā
translated: The faith faculty: it is believed by means of this, or it itself believes, or it is just mere believing, thus it is faith .🔽Its characteristic is that of believing, or its characteristic is that of resolving, like a water-purifying gem.🔽Its function is to have no doubt, like a raft. It is manifested as the crossing of a flood, like a ferry. It is manifested as non-delusion, like a torch.

original: vā. Saddheyyavatthupadaṭṭhānā, sotāpattiyaṅgapadaṭṭhānā vā. Sā hatthavittabījāni🔽viya daṭṭhabbā. Asaddhiye na kampatīti saddhābalaṃ. Vīriyabalanti vīrassa bhāvo vīriyaṃ,🔽vīrānaṃ vā kammaṃ vīriyaṃ, vidhinā vā nayena upāyena īrayitabbaṃ pavattayitabbanti
analyzed: vā saddheyya vatthu padaṭṭhānā sotāpattiyaṅga padaṭṭhānā vā sā hattha vitta bījāni  viya daṭṭhabbā a saddhiye na kampati iti saddhā balam vīriya balam ti vīrassa bhāvaḥ vīriyam  vīrānam vā kammam vīriyam vidhinā vā nayena upāyena īrayitabbam pavattayitabbam ti
translated: Its proximate cause is a trustworthy person, or it is manifested as the footing for stream-entry. It should be regarded as seeds to be sown in good soil.🔽The energy faculty: it is the state of being energetic , or it is the work of the energetic , or it is what should be made to move by means of a method, by means of a way, thus it is energy .🔽But this energy has the characteristic of exertion or the characteristic of instigation.

original: vīriyaṃ. Taṃ panetaṃ upatthambhanalakkhaṇañca paggahaṇalakkhaṇañca vīriyaṃ, sahajātānaṃ
analyzed: vīriyam tam pana etam upatthambhana lakkhaṇam ca paggahaṇa lakkhaṇam ca vīriyam sahajātānam
translated: Its function is to be indefatigable in accomplishing one’s own welfare and that of others. It is manifested as the non-abandoning of the task.

original: upatthambhanarasaṃ, asaṃsīdanabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ, “saṃviggo yoniso padahatī”ti vacanato🔽saṃvegapadaṭṭhānaṃ, vīriyārambhavatthupadaṭṭhānaṃ vā. Sammā āraddhaṃ sabbasampattīnaṃ
analyzed: upatthambhana rasam a saṃsīdana bhāva paccupaṭṭhānam saṃviggaḥ yonisas padahati iti vacanato  saṃvega padaṭṭhānam vīriya ārambha vatthu padaṭṭhānam vā sammā āraddham sabba sampattīnam
translated: Its characteristic is that of consolidating; its function is that of not collapsing; its manifestation is steadiness;🔽it is manifested as urgency, or it is manifested as the footing for urgency, since it is said, “One who is urgent investigates with proper method” .

original: mūlanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Kosajje na kampatīti vīriyabalaṃ. Satiyā lakkhaṇādīni vuttāneva.
analyzed: mūlanti daṭṭhabbam kosajje na kampati iti vīriya balam satiyā lakkhaṇa ādīni vuttāni eva
translated: It should be regarded as the root of all attainment, since it is said, “When energy is rightly exerted understanding arrives at its culmination” . It does not waver in idleness: this is the strength of energy. The characteristics, etc., of mindfulness are stated in the Description of the Faculties .

original: Muṭṭhassacce na kampatīti satibalaṃ. Sahajātāni sammā ādhīyati ṭhapetīti samādhi.🔽So pāmokkhalakkhaṇo avikkhepalakkhaṇo vā, sahajātānaṃ dhammānaṃ ārammaṇe sampiṇḍanaraso
analyzed: muṭṭhaḥ sacce na kampati iti sati balam sahajātāni ādhīyati ṭhapeti iti samādhi  so pāmokkha lakkhaṇaḥ avikkhepa lakkhaṇaḥ vā sahajātānam dhammānam ārammaṇe sampiṇḍana raso
translated: It does not waver in confusedness: this is the strength of mindfulness. It is concentration since it concentrates, or it is concentration since it is concentrated, or it is concentration since it causes the associated states to be concentrated.

original: nhāniyacuṇṇānaṃ udakaṃ viya, upasamapaccupaṭṭhāno, ñāṇapaccupaṭṭhāno vā. “Samāhito🔽yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti passatī”ti hi vuttaṃ. Visesato sukhapadaṭṭhāno nivāte padīpaccīnaṃ
analyzed: udakam viya upasama paccupaṭṭhāno ñāṇa paccupaṭṭhāno vā samāhitaḥ  yathābhūtam pajānāti passati iti hi vuttam visesataḥ sukha padaṭṭhānaḥ nivāte
translated: Its characteristic is non-distraction, or its characteristic is non-wavering, or its characteristic is non-scattering; its function is to gather together, or its function is to collect, or its function is to bind together, the associated states, as water does sesamum seeds, or sand does gold-dust; its manifestation is tranquillization, or its manifestation is knowledge;

original: ṭhiti viya cetaso ṭhitīti daṭṭhabbo. Uddhacce na kampatīti samādhibalaṃ. Pajānātīti
analyzed: ṭhiti viya cetasaḥ ṭhiti iti daṭṭhabbaḥ uddhacce na kampati iti samādhi balam pajānāti iti
translated: for it is said, “When he is concentrated, understanding arrives at its culmination” . It should be regarded as the footing for distinction, as steadiness of cognizance, as non-wavering, as non-distraction, as non- scattering, as non-wavering of cognizance, as non-wavering of consciousness, as non-wavering of mind, as non-wavering of thought, as non-wavering of the triple-rod , as non-wavering of the fourfold noble clan , as non-wavering of the five aggregates of virtue, as non-wavering of the six kinds of direct knowledge, as non-wavering of the seven factors of enlightenment, as non-wavering of the eight factors of the path, as non-wavering of the nine succession states, as non-wavering of the ten powers of one who knows and sees. It does not waver in agitation: this is the strength of concentration.

original: paññā. Kiṃ pajānāti? “Idaṃ dukkha”ntiādinā nayena ariyasaccāni. Sā yathāsabhāvapaṭivedhalakkhaṇā,🔽akkhalitapaṭivedhalakkhaṇā vā kusalissāsakhittausupaṭivedho viya, visayobhāsanarasā
analyzed: paññā kim pajānāti idam dukkham ti ādinā nayena ariya saccāni sā yathā sabhāva paṭivedha lakkhaṇā  akkhalita paṭivedha lakkhaṇā vā viya visaya ubhāsana rasā
translated: Understanding. What does it understand? It understands the noble truths in the way beginning, “This is suffering” . Its characteristic is the penetration of the specific nature of an object.

original: padīpo viya, asammohapaccupaṭṭhānā araññagatasudesako viya. Avijjāya na kampatīti
analyzed: padīpaḥ viya asammoha paccupaṭṭhānā arañña gata sudesakaḥ viya avijjāya na kampati iti
translated: Or its characteristic is unerring penetration, like the penetration of the target by an arrow shot by a skilled archer. Its function is to illuminate an objective field, like a lamp. It is manifested as non-confusion, like a guide in a forest. It does not waver in the face of ignorance.

original: paññābalaṃ. Hiribalaṃ ottappabalanti ahirike na kampatīti hiribalaṃ. Anottappe na🔽kampatīti ottappabalaṃ. Ayaṃ ubhayavasena atthavaṇṇanā hoti. Kāyaduccaritādīhi hirīyatīti
analyzed: paññā balam hiri balam ottappa balanti ahirike na kampati iti hiri balam anottappe na  kampati iti ottappa balam ayam ubhaya vasena attha vaṇṇanā hoti kāya duccarita ādīhi hirīyati iti
translated: This is the strength of understanding. The strength of conscience and the strength of shame: it does not waver in the face of that which is no cause for conscience and shame.🔽This is the strength of conscience and the strength of shame. This is the commentary on the meaning of the words.

original: hirī, lajjāyetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Tehi eva ottappatīti ottappaṃ, pāpato ubbegassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: hirī lajjāya itam adhivacanam tehi eva ottappati iti ottappam pāpataḥ ubbegassa itam adhivacanam
translated: One is ashamed of bodily misconduct, etc., thus it is conscience . This is a term for shame . One is ashamed of those same things, thus it is shame . This is a term for fear of blame .

original: Tesaṃ nānākaraṇadīpanatthaṃ – “samuṭṭhānaṃ adhipati, lajjādilakkhaṇena cā”ti imaṃ
analyzed: tesam nānākaraṇa dīpana attham samuṭṭhānam adhipati lajjā ādi lakkhaṇena ca ati imam
translated: In order to point out their difference, it is said: “The source, the predominance, The characteristic of shame, and so on” .

original: mātikaṃ ṭhapetvā ayaṃ vitthārakathā vuttā – ajjhattasamuṭṭhānā hirī nāma, bahiddhāsamuṭṭhānaṃ🔽ottappaṃ nāma. Attādhipati hirī nāma, lokādhipati ottappaṃ nāma. Lajjāsabhāvasaṇṭhitā🔽hirī nāma, bhayasabhāvasaṇṭhitaṃ ottappaṃ nāma. Sappatissavalakkhaṇā hirī nāma, vajjabhīrukabhayadassāvilakkhaṇaṃ ottappaṃ nāma.🔽Tattha ajjhattasamuṭṭhānaṃ hiriṃ catūhi kāraṇehi samuṭṭhāpeti – jātiṃ paccavekkhitvā,
analyzed: mātikam ṭhapetvā ayam vitthāra kathā vuttā ajjhatta samuṭṭhānā hirī nāma bahiddhā samuṭṭhānam  ottappam nāma atta adhipati hirī nāma loka adhipati ottappam nāma lajjā sabhāva saṇṭhitā  hirī nāma bhaya sabhāva saṇṭhitam ottappam nāma sappa tissava lakkhaṇā hirī nāma vajja bhīruka bhaya dassāvi lakkhaṇam ottappam nāma  tattha ajjhatta samuṭṭhānam hirim catūhi kāraṇehi samuṭṭhāpeti jātim paccavekkhitvā
translated: The following is the detailed explanation of the above brief description: “Conscience is what originates from within;🔽shame is what originates from without.🔽Conscience is the master of oneself; shame is the master of the world.🔽Conscience is the state of being ashamed of oneself; shame is the state of being ashamed before others.🔽Conscience is the characteristic of fear of blame; shame is the characteristic of fear of punishment.🔽Herein, conscience originates from within in four ways: by reflecting on one’s birth,🔽

original: vayaṃ paccavekkhitvā, sūrabhāvaṃ paccavekkhitvā, bāhusaccaṃ paccavekkhitvā. Kathaṃ?🔽“Pāpakaraṇaṃ nāmetaṃ na jātisampannānaṃ kammaṃ, hīnajaccānaṃ kevaṭṭādīnaṃ idaṃ kammaṃ,🔽mādisassa jātisampannassa idaṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ na yutta”nti evaṃ tāva jātiṃ paccavekkhitvā
analyzed: vayam paccavekkhitvā sūra bhāvam paccavekkhitvā bāhusaccam paccavekkhitvā katham 🔽pāpa karaṇam nāma etam na jāti sampannānam kammam hīna jaccānam kevaṭṭa ādīnam idam kammam 🔽mādisassa jāti sampannassa idam kammam kātum na yuttan ti evam tāva jātim paccavekkhitvā
translated: The detailed explanation of this is given in the Paṭisambhidā: “‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what? ‘Conscientiousness’ is what? ‘Fear of wrongdoing’ is what

original: pāṇātipātādipāpaṃ akaronto hiriṃ samuṭṭhāpeti. Tathā “pāpakaraṇaṃ nāmetaṃ daharehi
analyzed: pāṇa atipāta ādi pāpam a karontaḥ hirim samuṭṭhāpeti tathā pāpa karaṇam nāma etam daharehi
translated: for when he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things, etc., he arouses shame.🔽

original: kattabbaṃ kammaṃ, mādisassa vaye ṭhitassa idaṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ na yutta”nti evaṃ vayaṃ🔽paccavekkhitvā pāṇātipātādipāpaṃ akaronto hiriṃ samuṭṭhāpeti. Tathā “pāpakammaṃ nāmetaṃ🔽dubbalajātikānaṃ kammaṃ, mādisassa sūrabhāvasampannassa idaṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ na yutta”nti
analyzed: kattabbam kammam mādisassa vaye ṭhitassa idam kammam kātum na yuttan ti evam vayam  paccavekkhitvā pāṇātipāta ādi pāpam a karontaḥ hirim samuṭṭhāpeti tathā pāpa kammam nāma etam  dubbala jātikānam kammam mādisassa sūra bhāva sampannassa idam kammam kātum na yuttan ti
translated: For when he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things, he arouses shame in this way: “This is not the kind of deed to be done by one who has gone forth from the home life. It is not the kind of deed that should be done by one who has gone forth from the home life.”🔽So he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things.🔽Again, when he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things, he arouses shame in this way: “This is not the kind of deed to be done by one who has reached the age of sense-desire’s decay. It is not the kind of deed that should be done by one who has reached the age of sense-desire’s decay.”🔽So he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things.

original: evaṃ sūrabhāvaṃ paccavekkhitvā pāṇātipātādipāpaṃ akaronto hiriṃ samuṭṭhāpeti. Tathā🔽“pāpakammaṃ nāmetaṃ andhabālānaṃ kammaṃ, na paṇḍitānaṃ. Mādisassa paṇḍitassa bahussutassa
analyzed: evam sūra bhāvam paccavekkhitvā pāṇātipāta ādi pāpam a karontaḥ hirim samuṭṭhāpeti tathā  pāpa kammam nāma etam andha bālānam kammam na paṇḍitānam mādisassa paṇḍitassa bahu sutassa
translated: Again, when he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things, he arouses shame in this way: “This is not the kind of deed to be done by one who has attained the state of being a man. It is not the kind of deed that should be done by one who has attained the state of being a man.”🔽So he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things.🔽Again, when he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things, he arouses shame in this way: “This is not the kind of deed to be done by one who has attained the state of being a human being. It is not the kind of deed that should be done by one who has attained the state of being a human being.”

original: idaṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ na yutta”nti evaṃ bāhusaccaṃ paccavekkhitvā pāṇātipātādipāpaṃ akaronto
analyzed: idam kammam kātum na yuttan ti evam bāhusaccam paccavekkhitvā pāṇātipāta ādi pāpam a karontaḥ
translated: So he does not commit such evil deeds as killing breathing things.

original: hiriṃ samuṭṭhāpeti. Evaṃ ajjhattasamuṭṭhānaṃ hiriṃ catūhi kāraṇehi samuṭṭhāpeti.
analyzed: hirim samuṭṭhāpeti evam ajjhatta samuṭṭhānam hirim catūhi kāraṇehi samuṭṭhāpeti
translated: Thus he arouses shame in four ways by means of the shame that arises from within himself.

original: Samuṭṭhāpetvā ca pana attano citte hiriṃ pavesetvā pāpakammaṃ na karoti. Evaṃ ajjhattasamuṭṭhānā
analyzed: samuṭṭhāpetvā ca pana attano citte hirim pavesetvā pāpa kammam na karoti evam ajjhatta samuṭṭhānā
translated: and having aroused it, he enters into his own mind and does not commit evil. This is called shame that arises internally.

original: hirī nāma hoti. Kathaṃ bahiddhāsamuṭṭhānaṃ ottappaṃ nāma? “Sace tvaṃ pāpakammaṃ karissasi,
analyzed: hirī nāma hoti katham bahiddhā samuṭṭhānam ottappam nāma sace tvam pāpa kammam karissasi
translated: How is there fear of blame that arises externally? “If you commit evil,

original: catūsu parisāsu garahappatto bhavissasi –
analyzed: catūsu parisāsu garaha ppattaḥ bhavissasi
translated: you will be blamed in the four assemblies🔽and by the wise,

original: “Garahissanti taṃ viññū, asuciṃ nāgariko yathā;
analyzed: garahissanti tam viññū asucim nāgarikaḥ yathā
translated: like a naked ascetic who is impure.🔽Reproached by those who are virtuous,

original: Vajjito sīlavantehi, kathaṃ bhikkhu karissasī”ti. –
analyzed: vajjitaḥ sīlavantehi katham bhikkhu karissasi iti
translated: how will you act, O monk?”

original: Evaṃ paccavekkhanto hi bahiddhāsamuṭṭhitena ottappena pāpakammaṃ na karoti, evaṃ bahiddhāsamuṭṭhānaṃ ottappaṃ nāma hoti.
analyzed: evam paccavekkhantaḥ hi bahiddhā samuṭṭhitena ottappena pāpa kammam na karoti evam bahiddhā samuṭṭhānam ottappam nāma hoti
translated: Thus, reflecting, he does not commit evil through the fear of blame that arises externally. This is called fear of blame that arises externally.

original: Kathaṃ attādhipati hirī nāma? Idhekacco kulaputto attānaṃ adhipatiṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā
analyzed: katham attā adhipati hirī nāma idha ekaccaḥ kula puttaḥ attānam adhipatim jeṭṭhakam katvā
translated: How is there shame that is a controlling faculty? Here a clansman makes himself the head and chief,

original: “mādisassa saddhāpabbajitassa bahussutassa dhutaṅgadharassa na yuttaṃ pāpakammaṃ
analyzed: mādisassa saddhā pabbajitassa bahu ssutassa dhutaṅga dharassa na yuttam pāpa kammam
translated: thinking: “It is not proper for one like me, who has gone forth out of faith …

original: kātu”nti pāpaṃ na karoti. Evaṃ attādhipati hirī nāma hoti. Tenāha bhagavā “so attānaṃyeva🔽adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ
analyzed: pāpam na karoti evam attā adhipatiḥ hirī nāma tena āha bhagavā saḥ attā anaṃyā iva  adhipatim karitvā akusalam pajahati kusalam bhāveti sa avajjam pajahati anavajjam
translated: He does not do evil. Thus there is conscience as self-control. Hence the Blessed One said: “He controls himself with self,

original: bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharatī”ti.
analyzed: bhāva iti suddham attānam pariharati iti
translated: renounces the unwholesome and develops the wholesome” .

original: Kathaṃ lokādhipati ottappaṃ nāma? Idhekacco kulaputto lokaṃ adhipatiṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā pāpakammaṃ na karoti. Yathāha –
analyzed: katham loka adhipati ottappam nāma idha ekaccaḥ kula puttaḥ lokam adhipatim jeṭṭhakam katvā pāpa kammam na karoti yathā āha
translated: How is there shame as world-control? Here someone does not do evil because of the world, making the world the chief factor. As it is said:

original: “Mahā kho panāyaṃ lokasannivāso, mahantasmiṃ kho pana lokasannivāse santi samaṇabrāhmaṇā
analyzed: mahā kho pana ayam loka sannivāsaḥ mahantasmin kho pana loka sannivāse santi samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: “This world is extensive, and in this extensive world there are ascetics and brahmans

original: iddhimanto dibbacakkhukā paracittaviduno, te dūratopi passanti, āsannāpi na dissanti,
analyzed: iddhimantaḥ dibba cakkhukā para citta vidunaḥ te dūratas pi passanti āsannā api na dissanti
translated: who have spiritual power and the divine eye. They see from afar, though they are near not seen,

original: cetasāpi cittaṃ jānanti. Tepi maṃ evaṃ jāneyyuṃ ‘passatha bho imaṃ kulaputtaṃ saddhāya
analyzed: cetasā api cittam jānanti te api mama evam jāneyyum passatha bho imam kula puttam saddhāya
translated: and they know the mind with its thoughts. They would know me thus: ‘See, sirs, this clansman, having gone forth out of faith from the home life into homelessness,

original: agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito samāno vokiṇṇo viharati pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehī’ti.
analyzed: agārasmaā anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ vokiṇṇaḥ viharati pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi iti
translated: lives corrupted with evil unwholesome states.’

original: Devatāpi kho santi iddhimantiniyo dibbacakkhukā paracittaviduniyo, tā dūratopi passanti,
analyzed: devatā api kho santi iddhimantiniyaḥ dibba cakkhukā para citta viduniyaḥ tāḥ dūratas pi passanti
translated: There are deities who are powerful, with the divine eye, who know the minds of others. They see from afar

original: āsannāpi na dissanti, cetasāpi cittaṃ jānanti. Tāpi maṃ evaṃ jāneyyuṃ ‘passatha bho
analyzed: āsannā api na dissanti cetasā api cittam jānanti tā api mama evam jāneyyum passatha bho
translated: and do not see what is near. They know the mind with the mind. They would know me thus: ‘See, sirs,

original: imaṃ kulaputtaṃ saddhāya agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito samāno vokiṇṇo viharati pāpakehi🔽akusalehi dhammehī’ti. So iti paṭisañcikkhati ‘āraddhaṃ kho pana me vīriyaṃ bhavissati
analyzed: imam kula puttam saddhāya agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ vokiṇṇaḥ viharati pāpakehi  akusalehi dhammehi iti saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati āraddham kho pana me vīriyam bhavissati
translated: this clansman, having gone forth out of faith from the home life into homelessness, is living mixed up with low people,

original: asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ🔽ekagga’nti. So lokaṃyeva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ
analyzed: a sallīnam upaṭṭhitā sati a sammuṭṭhā passaddhaḥ kāyaḥ a sāraddhaḥ samāhitam cittam  ekagganti saḥ lokam yā iva adhipatim karitvā akusalam pajahati kusalam bhāveti sa avajjam
translated: practicing the wrong way. ’ So he reflects thus: ‘My energy will be aroused and untiring, my mindfulness established and unconfused, my body calm and undisturbed, my mind concentrated and one-pointed’

original: pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharatī”ti.
analyzed: pajahati anavajjam bhāveti suddham attānam pariharati iti
translated: “He abandons what is unwholesome and develops what is wholesome, he abandons what is blameworthy and develops what is blameless, and he keeps himself pure. ”🔽Thus there is fear of public censure. “Hīra is the state of being established in shame,

original: Evaṃ lokādhipati ottappaṃ nāma hoti. “Lajjāsabhāvasaṇṭhitā hirī, bhayasabhāvasaṇṭhitaṃ
analyzed: evam loka adhipatiḥ ottappam nāma hoti lajjā sabhāva saṇṭhitā hirī bhaya sabhāva saṇṭhitam
translated: and ottappa is the state of being established in fear.

original: ottappa”nti ettha pana lajjāti lajjanākāro, tena sabhāvena saṇṭhitā hirī. Bhayanti🔽apāyabhayaṃ, tena sabhāvena saṇṭhitaṃ ottappaṃ. Tadubhayampi pāpaparivajjane pākaṭaṃ
analyzed: ettha pana lajjā ati lajjana ākāraḥ tena sabhāvena saṇṭhitāḥ  apāya bhayam tena sabhāvena saṇṭhitam ottappam tat ubhayam pi pāpa parivajjane pākaṭam
translated: Herein, shame is the state of being ashamed; it is virtue that is so called because it is established with that as its individual essence. Fear is🔽fear of the states of loss; it is fear that is so called because it is established with that as its individual essence. And both these are evident in the avoiding of evil. For one man, for example, a clansman who is modest,

original: hoti. Ekacco hi yathā nāma eko kulaputto uccārapassāvādīni karonto lajjitabbayuttakaṃ
analyzed: hoti ekaccaḥ hi yathā nāma ekaḥ kula puttaḥ uccāra passāva ādīni karontaḥ lajjitabba yuttakam
translated: when he sees a place suitable for defecation, urine, or spittle, is ashamed to do it there, and he holds back. Another man, who is fearful,

original: ekaṃ disvā lajjanākārappatto bhaveyya hīḷito, evameva ajjhattaṃ lajjīdhammaṃ okkamitvā🔽pāpakammaṃ na karoti. Ekacco apāyabhayabhīto hutvā pāpakammaṃ na karoti.🔽Tatridaṃ opammaṃ – yathā hi dvīsu ayoguḷesu eko sītalo bhaveyya gūthamakkhito, eko🔽uṇho āditto. Tattha paṇḍito sītalaṃ gūthamakkhitattā jigucchanto na gaṇhāti, itaraṃ
analyzed: ekam disvā lajjana ākāra ppattaḥ bhaveyya evam eva ajjhattam lajjī dhammaṃ okkamitvā  pāpa kammam na karoti ekaccaḥ apāya bhaya bhītaḥ hutvā pāpa kammam na karoti  tatra idam opammam yathā hi dvīsu ayaḥ guḷesu ekaḥ sītalaḥ bhaveyya gūtha makkhitaḥ ekaḥ  uṇhaḥ ādittaḥ tattha paṇḍito sītalam gūtha makkhitattā jigucchantaḥ na gaṇhāti itaram
translated: when he sees such a place, is afraid of the states of loss, and he holds back.

original: ḍāhabhayena. Tattha sītalassa gūthamakkhanajigucchāya agaṇhanaṃ viya ajjhattaṃ lajjīdhammaṃ
analyzed: ḍāha bhayena tattha sītalassa gūtha makkhana jigucchāya a gaṇhanam viya ajjhattam lajjī dhammam
translated: Here is a simile. Suppose there were two iron balls, one cold and wet with mud, the other hot and glowing with heat. Then an intelligent man would not take hold of the cold one because of his disgust at its being cold and wet with mud, and he would not take hold of the other because of his fear of being burnt. Herein, just as the intelligent man does not take hold of the cold one because of his disgust at its being cold and wet with mud, so the man who is modest does not do evil because of his disgust at it.🔽And just as he does not take hold of the other because of his fear of being burnt, so the man who is fearful does not do evil because of his fear of the states of loss.

original: okkamitvā pāpassa akaraṇaṃ, uṇhassa ḍāhabhayena agaṇhanaṃ viya apāyabhayena pāpassa
analyzed: okkamitvā pāpassa a karaṇam uṇhassa ḍāha bhayena a gaṇhanam viya apāya bhayena pāpassa
translated: and the non-doing of evil is like the non-taking of the hot coal through fear of being burnt, and through fear of the states of loss through fear of evil.

original: akaraṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: a karaṇam veditabbam
translated: And the avoidance of evil should be understood as the non-doing of evil through fear of the states of loss, just as the non- grasping of hot water is through fear of being burned.🔽“Conscientiousness is the characteristic of shame;

original: “Sappatissavalakkhaṇā hirī, vajjabhīrukabhayadassāvilakkhaṇaṃ ottappa”nti idampi
analyzed: sappatissava lakkhaṇā hirī vajja bhīruka bhaya dassāvi lakkhaṇam ottappanti idam pi
translated: embarrassment is the characteristic of the appearance of fear of blame” .

original: dvayaṃ pāpaparivajjane eva pākaṭaṃ hoti. Ekacco hi jātimahattapaccavekkhaṇā satthumahattapaccavekkhaṇā
analyzed: dvayam pāpa parivajjane eva pākaṭam hoti ekaccaḥ hi jāti mahatta paccavekkhaṇā satthu mahatta paccavekkhaṇā
translated: This pair is evident only in the avoidance of evil. For one man arouses shame, which has the characteristic of being apprehensive of blame,🔽through four reasons: through reflection on the greatness of the Noble Ones’ state, through reflection on the greatness of the Master,

original: dāyajjamahattapaccavekkhaṇā sabrahmacārimahattapaccavekkhaṇāti catūhi kāraṇehi sappatissavalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: dāyajja mahatta paccavekkhaṇā sabrahmacāri mahatta paccavekkhaṇā ati catūhi kāraṇehi sa patissava lakkhaṇam
translated: through reflection on the greatness of the heritage, and through reflection on the greatness of the companions in the divine life.

original: hiriṃ samuṭṭhāpetvā pāpaṃ na karoti. Ekacco attānuvādabhayaṃ parānuvādabhayaṃ daṇḍabhayaṃ🔽duggatibhayanti catūhākārehi vajjabhīrukabhāvadassāvilakkhaṇaṃ ottappaṃ samuṭṭhāpetvā
analyzed: hirim samuṭṭhāpetvā pāpam na karoti ekaccaḥ attā anuvāda bhayam para anuvāda bhayam daṇḍa bhayam  duggati bhayanti catūhākārehi ottappam samuṭṭhāpetvā
translated: And another man arouses embarrassment, which has the characteristic of the appearance of fear of blame,🔽through four reasons: through fear of blame by oneself, through fear of blame by others, through fear of punishment, and through fear of states of loss.

original: pāpaṃ na karoti. Tattha jātimahattapaccavekkhaṇādīni ceva attānuvādabhayādīni ca
analyzed: pāpam na karoti tattha jāti mahatta paccavekkhaṇa ādīni ca iva atta anuvāda bhaya ādīni ca
translated: Herein, the reflection on the greatness of the Noble Ones’ state, etc., and the fear of blame by oneself, etc.,

original: vitthāretvā kathetabbāni. Evaṃ vuttaṃ sattavidhaṃ balaṃ yassa puggalassa natthi,
analyzed: vitthāretvā kathetabbāni evam vuttam sattavidham balam yassa puggalassa na atthi
translated: and should be told in detail.

original: te kilesā taṃ puggalaṃ sahanti…pe… pariyādiyanti maddantīti.
analyzed: te kilesā tam puggalam
translated: The defilements can stand up to that person, can overpower him, can overwhelm him.

original: Dve parissayāti pākaṭāpākaṭavasena dve eva upaddavā, na ekaṃ, na tīṇi. Te vibhāgato
analyzed: dve parissayā ti pākaṭa apākaṭa vasena dve eva upaddavā na ekam na tīṇi te vibhāgato
translated: Two kinds of troubles: there are only two kinds of troubles, not one or three, according to whether they are manifest or unmanifest.

original: dassetuṃ “katame pākaṭaparissayā”tiādimāha. Tattha kokāti kekā. Ayameva vā pāṭho.
analyzed: dassetum katame pākaṭa parissayā ti ādim āha tattha koka ati kekā ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: To show them classified, he said: “What are the manifest troubles? ” and so on. Herein, kokā means kokilā . This is the reading.

original: Corāti coriyakammehi yuttā. Māṇavāti sāhasikakammehi yuttā. Katakammāti sandhicchedādikatacorikakammā.🔽Akatakammāti taṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ nikkhantā. Ettha assūti bhaveyyunti attho. Cakkhurogoti
analyzed: corā ati coriya kammehi yuttā māṇavā ati sāhasika kammehi yuttā kata kammā ati sandhi cheda ādi kata corika kammā  a kata kammā ti tam kammam kātum nikkhantāḥ ettha bhaveyyunti attho cakkhu rogaḥ ti
translated: Coras means those engaged in theft. Māṇavas means those engaged in violence. Katakamma means thieves who have done their job of cutting the lock, etc.

original: cakkhusmiṃ uppannarogo, rujatīti rogo. Cakkhurogotiādayo vatthuvasena veditabbā.
analyzed: cakkhusmiṃ uppanna rogaḥ rujati iti rogo cakkhu roga uti ādayaḥ vatthu vasena veditabbā
translated: Akatakamma means those who have gone forth to do that job. Ettha assu means they might be here. Cakkhuroga means an eye disease. Ruja means a disease. Cakkhuroga, etc., should be understood according to the physical basis.

original: Nibbattitapasādānañhi rogo nāma natthi. Kaṇṇarogoti bahikaṇṇarogo. Mukharogoti mukhe
analyzed: nibbatti tapasā ādānam hi rogaḥ nāma natthi kaṇṇa rogo ti bahi kaṇṇa rogaḥ mukha rogo ti mukhe
translated: For those who have produced confidence have no disease. Kaṇṇaroga means an external ear disease. Mukharoga means a disease of the mouth.

original: uppannarogo. Dantarogoti dantasūlaṃ. Kāsoti khayarogo. Sāsoti svāso uggārarogo. Pināsoti
analyzed: uppanna rogaḥ danta rogaḥ iti danta sūlam kāso ti khaya rogo sāso ti svāso uggāra rogo pināso ti
translated: A disease that has arisen. Toothache: a tooth-ache. Cough: a disease of the lungs. Asthma: a disease of the chest. Catarrh: a disease of the nose.

original: bahināsikāya rogo. Ḍāhoti abbhantare uppajjanako uṇho. Mucchāti sativissajjanakā.🔽Pakkhandikāti lohitapakkhandikā atisāro. Sūlāti āmasūlā kucchivāto. Visūcikāti mahanto🔽virecanako. Kilāsoti sabalo. Sosoti sukkhanako sosabyādhi. Apamāroti amanussaggāho
analyzed: bahi nāsikāya rogaḥ ḍāhoti abbhantare uppajjanakaḥ uṇhaḥ mucchāti sati vissajjanakā  pakkhandikā ati lohitapakkhandikā atisāraḥ sūlā ati āmasūlā kucchivātaḥ visūcikā ati mahanto  virecanakaḥ kilāso ti sa balaḥ sosaḥ oti sukkhanakaḥ sosa byādhi apamāro ti a manussa ggāho
translated: Fever: a heat that arises inside. Fainting: a loss of consciousness.🔽Dysentery: blood dysentery. Colic: a disease of the stomach. Cholera: a severe🔽diarrhea. Smallpox: a disease of the blood. Leprosy: a disease of the flesh. Epilepsy: a disease caused by non-human beings,

original: veriyakkhābādho. Daddūti daddupīḷakā. Kaṇḍūti khuddakapīḷakā. Kacchūti mahākacchu.
analyzed: veriyakkha ābādhaḥ daddūti daddu pīḷakā kaṇḍūti khuddaka pīḷakā kacchūti mahākacchu
translated: a disease caused by fear, a disease caused by spirits. Itch: small pimples. Itch: large pimples.

original: Rakhasāti nakhehi vilikhitaṭṭhāne rogo. “Nakhasā”tipi pāḷi. Vitacchikāti hatthatalapādatalesu
analyzed: rakhasā ati nakhehi vilikhita ṭṭhāne rogaḥ vitacchikā ati hattha tala pāda talesu
translated: Rash: a disease in the place where one has been scratched with the nails. The text has “nail-scratch.” Carbuncles: a disease that arises by breaking out in blisters

original: hīraṃ hīraṃ katvā phālento uppajjanakarogo. Lohitapittanti soṇitapittaṃ, rattapittanti
analyzed: hīram hīram katvā uppajjanaka rogaḥ lohita pittanti soṇita pittam ratta pittanti
translated: on the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet. Blood-dysentery: blood-dysentery. Blood-flux:

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Madhumehoti sarīrabbhantare ukkaṭṭharogo. Vuttañhetaṃ “api ca madhumeho ābādho ukkaṭṭho”ti.
analyzed: vuttam hoti madhumehaḥ iti sarīra bbhantare ukkaṭṭha rogaḥ vuttam ha etam api ca madhumehaḥ ābādhaḥ ukkaṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: is what is meant. Diabetes: a disease of the blood in the body. For this is said: “Diabetes is a disease of the blood” .

original: Aṃsāti arisarogo. Pīḷakāti lohitapīḷakā. Bhagaṃ dālayatīti bhagandalā, vaccamaggaṃ
analyzed: pīḍakā ati lohitapīḍakā bhagam dālayati iti bhagandalā vaccamaggaṃ
translated: Erysipelas: a disease of the flesh. Boils: blood-boils. Fistula: a disease of the anus.

original: phāletīti attho. Pittasamuṭṭhānāti pittena samuṭṭhānaṃ uppatti etesanti pittasamuṭṭhānā.
analyzed: phāleti iti attho pitta samuṭṭhānā ti pittena samuṭṭhānam uppatti etesan ti pitta samuṭṭhānā
translated: The meaning is, it bursts the passage of excrement. Pitta-origined: they originate from, are produced from, bile.

original: Te kira dvattiṃsa honti. Semhasamuṭṭhānādīsupi eseva nayo. Sannipātikāti vātapittasemhānaṃ🔽sannipātena ekībhāvena uppannā. Ābādhaṭṭhena ābādhā. Utupariṇāmajāti utupariṇāmena.
analyzed: te kira dvattiṃsa honti semha samuṭṭhāna ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ sannipātikā ati vāta pitta semhānam  sannipātena ekībhāvena uppannā ābādha aṭṭhena ābādhā utu pariṇāma jāti utu pariṇāmena
translated: They are said to be thirty-two. The same method of explanation applies to the phlegm-origined, etc.,🔽Sannipātika: produced by the combination, the concurrence, of wind, bile, and phlegm.🔽They are afflictions in the sense of afflicting. Season-born: born of a change of season.🔽Cold-born: diseases that arise from cold.

original: Accuṇhāti sītena uppajjanakarogā. Visamaparihārajāti atiṭṭhānanisajjādinā visamaparihārena
analyzed: sītena uppajjanaka rogā visama parihāra jāti atiṭṭhāna nisajja ādinā visama parihārena
translated: Unwholesome-born: born of unwholesome conduct, of standing, sitting, etc., too much.

original: jātā. Opakkamikāti vadhabandhanādinā upakkamena jātā. Kammavipākajāti balavakammavipākasambhūtā.
analyzed: jātā opakkamikā ati vadha bandhana ādinā upakkamena jātā kamma vipāka jāti balava kamma vipāka sambhūtā
translated: Misadventure-born: born of misadventure, of murder, imprisonment, etc. Kamma-resultant: produced by strong kamma-result.

original: Sītaṃ uṇhaṃ…pe… samphassoti ime pākaṭā eva. Iti vāti evaṃ vā. Ime vuccantīti nigamento āha.
analyzed: sītam samphasso ti ime pākaṭāḥ eva iti vā ati evam vā ime vuccanti iti nigamentaḥ āha
translated: Cold, heat, etc., are obvious. “Thus” is thusness. “These are said” : he said, concluding.

original: Katame paṭicchannaparissayāti apākaṭā acchāditaupaddavā katameti pucchati. Tattha🔽kāyaduccaritanti pāṇātipātaadinnādānamicchācāracetanā veditabbā. Vacīduccaritanti
analyzed: katame paṭicchanna parissayā ati apākaṭā acchādita aupaddavā katamā iti pucchati tattha  pāṇa atipāta a dinna ādānam icchā ācāra cetanā veditabbā
translated: “Which are the hidden dangers?” : he asks which are not obvious, which are concealed dangers. Herein,

original: musāvādapisuṇavācāpharusavācāsamphappalāpacetanā veditabbā. Manoduccaritanti abhijjhābyāpādamicchādiṭṭhiyo🔽veditabbā. Kāye pavattaṃ, kāyato vā pavattaṃ, duṭṭhu caritaṃ, kilesapūtikattā vā
analyzed: musāvāda pisuṇa vācā pharusa vācā samphappalāpa cetanāḥ veditabbāḥ manaḥ duccaritanti abhijjhā byāpāda micchā diṭṭhiyaḥ  veditabbā kāye pavattam kāyataḥ vā pavattam duṭṭhu caritam kilesa pūtikattā vā
translated: bodily misconduct should be understood as the volition of killing breathing things, of taking what is not given, and of unchastity. Verbal misconduct should be understood as the volition of false speech, malicious speech, harsh speech, and gossip. Mental misconduct should be understood as covetousness, ill will, and wrong view.

original: duṭṭhu caritanti kāyaduccaritaṃ. Vacīmanoduccaritesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: duṭṭhu kāya duccaritam vacī manaḥ duccaritesu pi esā iva nayo
translated: It is bodily misconduct because it occurs in the body or because it occurs from the body, or because it is misconduct that is rotten with defilements. So too with verbal and mental misconduct.

original: Kāmīyantīti kāmā, pañca kāmaguṇā. Kāmesu chando kāmacchando. Kāmayatīti vā kāmo,
analyzed: kāmīyanti iti kāmā pañca kāma guṇā kāmesu chandaḥ kāmacchandaḥ kāmayati iti vā kāmaḥ
translated: “Desires” are the five strands of sense pleasure. Desire for sense desires is sense-desire lust. Or alternatively, one desires with sense desires, thus a sense desire is a desire;

original: kāmo eva chando, kāmacchando na kattukamyatāchando, na dhammacchando vā. Kāmataṇhāva
analyzed: kāmaḥ eva chando kāma chandaḥ na kattu kamyatā chandaḥ na dhamma chandaḥ vā
translated: it is sense-desire lust, not lust to do, not lust for Dhamma. Sense-desire lust itself is sense-desire lust.

original: evaṃnāmikā. Kusaladhamme nīvaratīti nīvaraṇaṃ, kāmacchando eva nīvaraṇaṃ kāmacchandanīvaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: evaṃnāmikā kusala dhamme nīvarati iti nīvaraṇam kāmacchandaḥ eva nīvaraṇam kāmacchanda nīvaraṇam
translated: It is called a hindrance because it hinders or obstructs profitable states. Sensual desire is a hindrance, thus it is the hindrance of sensual desire.

original: Evaṃ sesesupi. Byāpajjati tena cittaṃ pūtibhāvaṃ upagacchati, byāpādayati vā vinayācārarūpasampattihitasukhādīnīti
analyzed: evam sesesu pi byāpajjati tena cittam pūti bhāvam upagacchati byāpādayati vā vinaya ācāra rūpa sampatti hita sukha ādīni iti
translated: So too with ill will, etc. It distresses, thus it is ill will. Or alternatively, it distresses by making the mind distressed, or it distresses by making the person distressed, thus it is ill will. It is a hindrance, thus it is a hindrance of ill will.

original: vā byāpādo. Thinanatā thinaṃ. Middhanatā middhaṃ, anussāhasaṃhananatā asattivighātatā🔽cāti attho. Thinañca middhañca thinamiddhaṃ. Tattha thinaṃ anussāhanalakkhaṇaṃ, vīriyavinodanarasaṃ,
analyzed: vā byāpādaḥ thina natā thinam middha natā middham anussāha saṃhanana tā a satti vighāta tā  ca ati attho thinam ca middham ca thinam iddham tattha thinam anussāhana lakkhaṇam vīriya vinodana rasam
translated: It makes the mind slack, thus it is sloth. It makes the mind limp, thus it is torpor. The meaning is that it makes it incapable of exerting itself and of bearing up.

original: saṃsīdanapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ. Middhaṃ akammaññatālakkhaṇaṃ, onahanarasaṃ, līnabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: saṃsīdana paccupaṭṭhānam middham akammañña tā lakkhaṇam onahana rasam līna bhāva paccupaṭṭhānam
translated: Sloth and torpor are sloth and torpor. Herein, sloth has the characteristic of making the body unserviceable. Its function is to make the body unserviceable and to obscure consciousness. It is manifested as the state of not being able to bear up. Torpor has the characteristic of making the mind unserviceable. Its function is to make the mind unserviceable and to obscure consciousness.

original: pacalāyikāniddāpaccupaṭṭhānaṃ vā. Ubhayampi aratitandīvijambhitādīsu ayonisomanasikārapadaṭṭhānanti.
analyzed: vā ubhayam pi arati tandīvijambhi tā ādīsu a yoniso manasikāra padaṭṭhānam ti
translated: It is manifested as the state of being limp. Or the manifestation of both is sluggishness in consciousness and in the body. Their proximate cause is discontent, idleness, over-eating, and unwise attention.

original: Uddhatassa bhāvo uddhaccaṃ. Taṃ avūpasamalakkhaṇaṃ vātābhighātacalajalaṃ viya, anavaṭṭhānarasaṃ
analyzed: uddhatassa bhāvaḥ uddhaccam tam a vūpasama lakkhaṇam vāta abhighāta cala jalam viya an avaṭṭhāna rasam
translated: It is the state of one who is excited. Its characteristic is non-quiet. Its function is to make the mind uncalm. It is manifested as distraction. Its proximate cause is a former cause of the same kind.

original: vātābhighātacaladhajapaṭākaṃ viya, bhantattapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ pāsāṇābhighātasamuddhatabhasmaṃ
analyzed: vāta abhighāta cala dhaja paṭākam viya bhantatta paccupaṭṭhānam pāsāṇa abhighāta samuddhata bhasmam
translated: like ashes stirred up by the wind from a fire-place,

original: viya, cetaso avūpasamo ayonisomanasikārapadaṭṭhānaṃ. Cittavikkhepoti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Kucchitaṃ kataṃ kukataṃ, tassa bhāvo kukkuccaṃ. Taṃ pacchānutāpalakkhaṇaṃ, katākatānusocanarasaṃ,
analyzed: viya cetasaḥ a vūpasamaḥ a yoniso manasikāra padaṭṭhānam citta vikkhepaḥ ti daṭṭhabbam  kucchitam katam kukatam tassa bhāvo kukkuccam tam pacchā anutāpa lakkhaṇam kata akata anusocana rasam
translated: and the non-pacification of the mind is the proximate cause of unwise attention. “Distraction of mind” should be regarded as a slave.🔽“Remorse” is what is done badly, badly performed; its state is “remorse” . It has the characteristic of subsequent regret; its function is to lament what has and what has not been done;

original: vippaṭisārapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ, katākatapadaṭṭhānaṃ dāsabyaṃ viya daṭṭhabbaṃ. Uddhaccañca
analyzed: vippaṭisāra paccupaṭṭhānam kata akata padaṭṭhānam dāsabyam viya daṭṭhabbam uddhaccam ca
translated: its manifestation is annoyance; its proximate cause is what has and what has not been done. It should be regarded as slavery.🔽“Restlessness and remorse” :

original: kukkuccañca uddhaccakukkuccaṃ. Vigatā cikicchāti vicikicchā, sabhāvaṃ vā vicinanto🔽etāya kicchati kilamatīti vicikicchā, sā saṃsayalakkhaṇā, saṃsappanarasā, anicchayapaccupaṭṭhānā,
analyzed: uddhat ca kukkuccam vigatā cikicchāti vicikicchā sabhāvam vā vicinantaḥ  etāya kicchati kilamati iti vicikicchā sā saṃsaya lakkhaṇā saṃsappana rasā anicchaya paccupaṭṭhānā
translated: “Doubt” : it is doubt because one doubts , is doubtful, about what is past, etc., or because one doubts, is doubtful, about what is not manifest ;🔽or it is doubt because one doubts, is doubtful, about the specific nature of what is manifest. Its characteristic is indecision; its function is to penetrate indecisively;

original: anekaṃsaggāhapaccupaṭṭhānā vā, ayonisomanasikārapadaṭṭhānā. Paṭipattiantarāyakarāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: aneka saggāha paccupaṭṭhānā vā a yoniso manasikāra padaṭṭhānā paṭipatti antarāya karā ti daṭṭhabbā
translated: its manifestation is the state of indecision; its proximate cause is unwise attention. It should be regarded as an obstacle to crossing the flood, as a whirlpool in the middle of the water.

original: Rajjanalakkhaṇo rāgo. Dussanalakkhaṇo doso. Muyhanalakkhaṇo moho. Kujjhanalakkhaṇo
analyzed: rajjana lakkhaṇaḥ rāgaḥ dussana lakkhaṇaḥ doso muyhana lakkhaṇaḥ moho kujjhana lakkhaṇo
translated: Lust has the characteristic of lusting. Hatred has the characteristic of hating. Delusion has the characteristic of deluding. Conceit has the characteristic of being conceited.

original: kodho, caṇḍikkalakkhaṇo vā, āghātakaraṇaraso, dūsanapaccupaṭṭhāno. Upanandhanalakkhaṇo🔽upanāho, veraappaṭinissajjanaraso, kodhānubandhabhāvapaccupaṭṭhāno. Vuttañcetaṃ “pubbakālaṃ
analyzed: kodho caṇḍikka lakkhaṇaḥ vā āghāta karaṇa rasaḥ dūsana paccupaṭṭhānaḥ upanandhana lakkhaṇo  upanāhaḥ vera appaṭinissajjana rasaḥ kodha anubandha bhāva paccupaṭṭhāno vuttam ca itam pubba kālam
translated: Greed has the characteristic of greediness. Hate has the characteristic of hating. Delusion has the characteristic of deluding. Anger has the characteristic of annoyance or of fierceness. Its function is to make one burn up. It is manifested as corruption.

original: kodho, aparakālaṃ upanāho”tiādi.🔽Paraguṇamakkhanalakkhaṇo makkho. Tesaṃ vināsanaraso, tadacchādanapaccupaṭṭhāno. Yugaggāhalakkhaṇo
analyzed: kodhaḥ apara kālam  para guṇa makkhana lakkhaṇaḥ makkho tesam vināsana raso tad acchādana paccupaṭṭhāno yuga ggāha lakkhaṇo
translated: Enmity has the characteristic of holding on. Its function is not to relinquish resentment. It is manifested as the state of being pursued by anger. For this is said: “Anger at the time is one thing, resentment at the time is another” , and so on.🔽Spite has the characteristic of concealing one’s own faults. Its function is to destroy them. It is manifested as the covering up of them.

original: paḷāso, paraguṇehi attano guṇānaṃ samīkaraṇaraso, paresaṃ guṇappamāṇena upaṭṭhānapaccupaṭṭhāno.🔽Parasampattikhīyanalakkhaṇā issā, tassa akkhamanalakkhaṇā vā, tattha anabhiratirasā,
analyzed: paḷāsaḥ para guṇehi attanaḥ guṇānam samīkaraṇa raso paresam guṇa ppamāṇena upaṭṭhāna paccupaṭṭhāno  para sampatti khīyana lakkhaṇā issā tassa akkhamana lakkhaṇā vā tattha an abhirati rasā
translated: Jealousy has the characteristic of envying another’s success. Its function is to deprecate it. It is manifested as the inability to bear it.

original: tato vimukhabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānā. Attano sampattinigūhanalakkhaṇaṃ macchariyaṃ, attano
analyzed: tatas vimukha bhāva paccupaṭṭhānā attano sampatti nigūhana lakkhaṇam macchariyam attano
translated: Avarice has the characteristic of concealing one’s own good qualities. Its function is not to reveal them. It is manifested as the state of one who has nothing to give .

original: sampattiyā parehi sādhāraṇabhāvaṃ akkhamanarasaṃ, saṅkocanapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: sampattiyā parehi sādhāraṇa bhāvam akkhamana rasam saṅkocana paccupaṭṭhānam
translated: Its characteristic is the unwillingness to share one’s good fortune with others. Its function is to contract the mind. Its manifestation is concealment.

original: Katapāpapaṭicchādanalakkhaṇā māyā, tassa nigūhanarasā, tadāvaraṇapaccupaṭṭhānā. Attano
analyzed: kata pāpa paṭicchādana lakkhaṇā māyā tassa nigūhana rasā tad āvaraṇa paccupaṭṭhānā attano
translated: Its characteristic is the concealing of one’s own faults. Its function is to hide them. Its manifestation is the covering up of them.

original: avijjamānaguṇappakāsanalakkhaṇaṃ sāṭheyyaṃ, tesaṃ samudāharaṇarasaṃ, sarīrākārehipi🔽tesaṃ vibhūtakaraṇapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: avijjamāna guṇa ppakāsana lakkhaṇam sāṭheyyam tesam samudāharaṇa rasam sarīra ākārehi pi  tesam vibhūta karaṇa paccupaṭṭhānam
translated: Its characteristic is the advertising of non-existent good qualities. Its function is to bring them forward. Its manifestation is the assuming of postures.

original: Cittassa uddhumātabhāvalakkhaṇo thambho, appatissavavuttiraso, amaddavapaccupaṭṭhāno. Karaṇuttariyalakkhaṇo sārambho, vipaccanīkatāraso, agāravapaccupaṭṭhāno.
analyzed: cittassa uddhumāta bhāva lakkhaṇo thambhaḥ appatissava vutti rasaḥ amaddava paccupaṭṭhāno karaṇa uttariya lakkhaṇaḥ sa ārambhaḥ vipaccanīka tā rasaḥ agārava paccupaṭṭhāno
translated: Its characteristic is the stiffening of the mind. Its function is to be unyielding. Its manifestation is inflexibility. Its characteristic is the over-riding of the function of the mind. Its function is to be contrary. Its manifestation is lack of respect.

original: Uṇṇatilakkhaṇo māno, ahaṃkāraraso, uddhumātabhāvapaccupaṭṭhāno. Abbhuṇṇatilakkhaṇo atimāno, ativiya ahaṃkāraraso, accuddhumātabhāvapaccupaṭṭhāno.
analyzed: uṇṇa ti lakkhaṇaḥ mānaḥ ahaṃkāra raso uddhu māta bhāva paccupaṭṭhāno abbhuṇṇa ti lakkhaṇaḥ atimānaḥ ativiya ahaṃkāra raso accuddhu māta bhāva paccupaṭṭhāno
translated: Its characteristic is haughtiness. Its function is to make a display of “I am.” Its manifestation is the state of being puffed up. Its characteristic is excessive haughtiness. Its function is to make a very great display of “I am.” Its manifestation is the state of being very puffed up.

original: Mattabhāvalakkhaṇo mado, madaggahaṇaraso, ummādapaccupaṭṭhāno. Pañcasu kāmaguṇesu
analyzed: matta bhāva lakkhaṇaḥ madaḥ mada gahaṇa rasaḥ ummāda paccupaṭṭhāno pañcasu kāmaguṇesu
translated: Its characteristic is the state of being intoxicated. Its function is to grasp at intoxication. Its manifestation is madness. Its characteristic is the state of being infatuated with the five cords of sense desire.

original: cittassa vossaggalakkhaṇo pamādo, vossaggānuppadanaraso, sativippavāsapaccupaṭṭhānoti🔽evaṃ imesaṃ dhammānaṃ lakkhaṇādīni veditabbāni. Ayamettha saṅkhepo, vitthāro pana
analyzed: cittassa vossagga lakkhaṇaḥ pamādaḥ vossagga anuppada na raso sati vippavāsa paccupaṭṭhāno ti  evam imesam dhammānam lakkhaṇa ādīni veditabbāni ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthāraḥ pana
translated: Slackness is characterized by the giving up of cognizance; its function is not to give up; it is manifested as the opposite of mindfulness.

original: “tattha katamo kodho”tiādinā vibhaṅge vuttanayeneva veditabbo.🔽Visesato cettha āmisagiddho attanā alabhanto aññassa lābhino kujjhati, tassa sakiṃ
analyzed: tattha katamo kodhaḥ ti ādinā vibhaṅge vutta nayena iva veditabbo  visesato ca ittha āmisa giddhaḥ attanā a labhantaḥ aññassa lābhinaḥ kujjhati tassa sakim
translated: These are the characteristics, etc., of these states. This is the brief treatment of them. The detailed treatment should be understood according to the method of treatment given in the Vibhaṅga beginning with the words: “Herein, what is anger? ”

original: uppanno kodho kodhoyeva. Taduttari upanāho. So evaṃ kuddho upanayhanto ca santepi🔽aññassa lābhino guṇaṃ makkheti “ahampi tādiso”ti ca yugaggāhaṃ gaṇhāti. Ayamassa🔽makkho ca palāso ca, so evaṃ makkhī palāsī tassa lābhasakkārādīsu “kiṃ imassa iminā”ti
analyzed: uppannaḥ kodhaḥ kodhaḥ yā iva tad uttari upanāhaḥ saḥ evam kuddhaḥ ca sante pi  aññassa lābhinaḥ guṇam makkheti aham pi tādisaḥ iti ca yuga ggāham gaṇhāti ayam assa  makkho ca palāsaḥ ca saḥ evam makkhī palāsī tassa lābha sakkāra ādīsu kim imassa
translated: In particular, here, one who is greedy for sensual desires, not getting what he wants, is annoyed with one who gets it. His anger, which has arisen once, is anger. What is more than that is resentment.🔽When he is annoyed and is resentful, he disparages the other’s good qualities even if they exist, and he takes the opposite view even in regard to what is good. This is his disparagement and scorn.

original: issati padussati, ayamassa issā. Sace panassa kāci sampatti hoti, tassā tena sādhāraṇabhāvaṃ
analyzed: issati padussati ayam assa issā sace pana assa kāci sampatti hoti tassā tena sādhāraṇa bhāvam
translated: When he is thus disparaging and scornful, he is envious of the other’s gain, honour, etc., thinking “What has he to do with these? ” He is jealous. But if he has some success, he is not prepared to share it with the other.

original: na sahati, idamassa maccheraṃ. Lābhahetu kho pana attano santepi dose paṭicchādeti,
analyzed: na sahati idam assa maccheram lābha hetu kho pana attanaḥ sante pi dose paṭicchādeti
translated: He cannot bear it: this is his stinginess. For the sake of gain he conceals his own faults and does not admit them even when they are pointed out by others:

original: ayamassa māyā. Asantepi guṇe pakāseti, idamassa sāṭheyyaṃ. So evaṃ paṭipanno sace
analyzed: ayam assa māyā asante pi guṇe pakāseti idam assa sāṭheyyam saḥ evam paṭipannaḥ sace
translated: this is his deceit. He extols his own good qualities even when they are not evident: this is his fraud.

original: pana yathādhippāyaṃ lābhaṃ labhati, tena thaddho hoti amuducitto “na idaṃ evaṃ kātabba”nti🔽ovadituṃ asakkuṇeyyo, ayamassa thambho. Sace pana naṃ koci kiñci vadati “na idaṃ
analyzed: pana yathā adhippāyam lābham labhati tena thaddhaḥ hoti amudu cittaḥ na idam evam kātabbanti  ovaditum a sakkuṇeyyaḥ ayam assa thambho sace pana nam koci kiñci vadati naḥ idam
translated: When he is thus engaged, if he gets gain according to his wishes, he becomes arrogant and his mind is not tractable. He cannot be advised thus: “This should not be done in this way.”

original: evaṃ kātabba”nti, tena sāraddhacitto hoti, bhākuṭikamukho “ko me tva”nti pasayhabhāṇī,
analyzed: evam kātabbanti tena sa āraddha cittaḥ hoti bhākuṭikamukho kaḥ me pasayha bhāṇī
translated: This is his obstinacy. If someone tells him, “This should not be done in this way,” he becomes angry and his face takes on an ugly expression. He speaks harshly, saying, “Who are you?”

original: ayamassa sārambho. Tato thambhena “ahameva seyyo”ti attānaṃ maññanto mānī hoti. Sārambhena
analyzed: ayam assa sa ārambhaḥ tatas thambhena aham eva seyyo ti attānam maññantaḥ mānī hoti sa ārambhena
translated: This is his violence. Then, because of his obstinacy, he thinks, “I am the best,” and he becomes conceited. Because of his violence,

original: “ke ime”ti pare atimaññanto atimānī, ayamassa māno ca atimāno ca. So tehi mānātimānehi
analyzed: ke ime iti pare atimaññantaḥ atimānī ayam assa māno ca atimāno ca saḥ tehi māna atimānehi
translated: he despises others, thinking, “Who are they?” and he becomes over-conceited. This is his conceit and over-conceit. Because of these conceits and over-conceits,

original: jātimadādianekarūpaṃ madaṃ janeti, matto samāno kāmaguṇādibhedesu vatthūsu pamajjati,
analyzed: jāti mada ādi aneka rūpam madam janeti mattaḥ samānaḥ kāma guṇa ādi bhedesu vatthūsu pamajjati
translated: he generates intoxication of many kinds, such as intoxication with birth, etc. Being intoxicated, he becomes negligent with regard to objects such as the strands of sensual pleasure.

original: ayamassa mado ca pamādo cāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ayam assa mado ca pamādaḥ ca ati veditabbam
translated: This is his conceit and his negligence.

original: Sabbe kilesāti sabbepi akusalā dhammā. Upatāpanaṭṭhena vibādhanaṭṭhena ca kilesā.
analyzed: sabbe kilesā ti sabbe pi akusalāḥ dhammāḥ upatāpana ṭṭhena vibādhana ṭṭhena ca kilesā
translated: All defilements: all unprofitable states are defilements in the sense of defiling and in the sense of afflicting.

original: Kilesapūtikattā duccaritā. Kilesadarathakaraṇaṭṭhena darathā. Antoḍāhādikaraṇaṭṭhena
analyzed: kilesa pūti kattā duccaritā kilesa daratha karaṇa ṭṭhena darathā antoḍāha ādi karaṇa ṭṭhena
translated: They are misconduct because they are rotten with defilement. They are quarrels because they cause friction of defilement.🔽They are fevers because they cause burning.

original: pariḷāhā. Sadā tāpanaṭṭhena santāpā. Akosallasambhūtaṭṭhena abhisaṅkharaṇaṭṭhena🔽ca sabbe akusalābhisaṅkhārā.
analyzed: pariḷāhā sadā tāpana ṭṭhena santāpā akosalla sambhūta ṭṭhena abhisaṅkharaṇa ṭṭhena  ca sabbe akusala abhisaṅkhārā
translated: They are always burning because they are always hot. They are determinations because they originate unskilfulness and because they determine.

original: Kenaṭṭhenāti kena atthena. Abhibhavanāditividhaṃ atthaṃ dassetuṃ “parisahantīti parissayā”tiādimāha.🔽Parisahantīti dukkhaṃ uppādenti abhibhavanti. Parihānāya saṃvattantīti kusalānaṃ🔽dhammānaṃ pariccajanāya saṃvattanti. Tatrāsayāti tasmiṃ sarīre akusalā dhammā āsayanti
analyzed: kenaṭṭhena ati kena atthena abhibhavanāt itividham attham dassetum parisahanti iti parissayā iti ādim āha  parisahanti iti dukkham uppādenti abhibhavanti parihānāya saṃvattanti iti kusalānam  dhammānam pariccajanāya saṃvattanti tatra āsayā ati tasmin sarīre akusalāḥ dhammāḥ āsayanti
translated: In what sense? In what sense? In order to show the three kinds of sense, he said “They overcome, thus they are dangers” .🔽They overcome: they cause suffering to arise, they overcome. They lead to loss: they lead to the relinquishing of profitable states.

original: nivasanti uppajjantīti attho. Te parissayāti kāyaduccaritādayo upaddavā. Kusalānaṃ
analyzed: nivasanti uppajjanti iti attho te parissayā ti kāya duccarita ādayaḥ upaddavā kusalānam
translated: They are a lair: unprofitable states lie in wait in the body, they lie in wait in the mind, they lie in wait in the object, is the meaning. They are dangers: bodily misconduct, etc., are calamities.

original: dhammānaṃ antarāyāyāti upari vattabbānaṃ sammāpaṭipadādito kosallasambhūtānaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: dhammānam antarāyāya ati upari vattabbānam sammāpaṭipada āditas kosalla sambhūtānam dhammānam
translated: To the hindrance of ideas: to the disappearance, to the non-appearance, of ideas that should be undertaken above, such as the skill in the special qualities of the right way.

original: antaradhānāya adassanatthāya saṃvattanti. Sammāpaṭipadāyāti sundarāya pasaṭṭhāya🔽vā paṭipadāya, na micchāpaṭipadāya. Anulomapaṭipadāyāti aviruddhapaṭipadāya, na paṭilomapaṭipadāya.
analyzed: antaradhānāya a dassana tthāya saṃvattanti sammāpaṭipadāya ati sundarāya pasaṭṭhāya  vā paṭipadāya na micchā paṭipadāya anuloma paṭipadāya ati aviruddha paṭipadāya na paṭiloma paṭipadāya
translated: To the right way: to the beautiful way, to the right way,🔽not to the wrong way. To the way in conformity: to the way that is not in conflict, not to the way in conflict.

original: Apaccanīkapaṭipadāyāti na paccanīkapaṭipadāya, apaccatthikapaṭipadāya. Anvatthapaṭipadāyāti
analyzed: apaccanīka paṭipadāya ati na paccanīka paṭipadāya apaccatthika paṭipadāya anvattha paṭipadāya ati
translated: To the way that is not contrary: not to the way that is contrary, to the way that is not contrary. To the way that is in accordance:

original: atthaanugatāya paṭipadāya, uparūpari vaḍḍhitāya paṭipadāya. Yathā attho, tathā paṭipajjitabbāya
analyzed: attha anugatāya paṭipadāya uparūpari vaḍḍhitāya paṭipadāya yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabbāya
translated: to the way that is in accordance with the benefit, to the way that is increased above. To the way that is in accordance with the meaning is what is meant.

original: paṭipadāyāti vuttaṃ hoti. “Attatthapaṭipadāyā”tipi pāḷi, taṃ na sundaraṃ. Dhammānudhammapaṭipadāyāti
analyzed: paṭipadāya iti vuttam hoti tam na sundaram dhamma anudhamma paṭipadāya ati
translated: The reading “to the way that is one’s own benefit” is not a good one. To the way in conformity with the True Idea:

original: dhammo nāma navalokuttaradhammo. Anudhammo nāma vipassanādi. Tassa dhammassa anurūpā
analyzed: dhammo nāma nava lokuttara dhammo anudhammaḥ nāma vipassanā ādi tassa dhammassa anurūpā
translated: the True Idea is the nine supramundane ideas. The conformity is insight, etc., and the way is in accordance with that True Idea.

original: dhammapaṭipadā dhammānudhammapaṭipadā, tassā dhammānudhammapaṭipadāya.
analyzed: dhamma paṭipadā dhamma anudhamma paṭipadā tassāḥ dhamma anudhamma paṭipadāya
translated: The practice of the way of the Dhamma is the practice of the way of the Dhamma in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: Sīlesu paripūrikāritāyāti pātimokkhasīlesu pāripūriṃ katvā ṭhitatāya. Indriyesu guttadvāratāyāti
analyzed: sīlesu paripūri kāri tāya ati pātimokkha sīlesu pāripūrim katvā ṭhita tāya indriyesu gutta dvāra tāya ati
translated: The fulfilment of virtue: by establishing himself in the fulfilment of virtue consisting in the Pātimokkha rule.

original: “cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā”tiādinā nayena vuttesu manacchaṭṭhesu indriyesu sugopitadvārabhāvassa.
analyzed: cakkhunā rūpam disvā ati ādinā nayena vuttesu mana chaṭṭhesu indriyesu su gopita dvāra bhāvassa
translated: The guarding of the doors of the sense faculties: by guarding the six faculties beginning with the eye, as described in the way beginning, “On seeing a visible object with the eye” .

original: Bhojane mattaññutāyāti paṭiggahaṇādīsu pamāṇayuttatāya. Alaṃsāṭakādiṃ muñcitvā mitabhojanatāya.🔽Jāgariyānuyogassāti “divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehī”ti evamādinā
analyzed: bhojane mattaññu tāya ati paṭiggahaṇa ādīsu pamāṇa yutta tāya alaṃsāṭaka ādim muñcitvā mita bhojana tāya  jāgariya anuyogassa ati divasam caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi iti evamādinā
translated: Moderation in eating: by knowing the measure in receiving food, etc., by not taking more than the right amount, by not eating greedily like a pig.

original: nayena pañca jāgaraṇadhamme anuyogassa. Satisampajaññassāti sabbakammaṭṭhānabhāvanānuyuttānaṃ
analyzed: nayena pañca jāgaraṇa dhamme anuyogassa sati sampajaññassa ati sabba kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanā anuyuttānam
translated: The practice of keeping awake: by the practice of the five things that keep one awake, namely, walking up and down, sitting, using the light, rubbing, and by the practice of the things that dispel drowsiness, namely, the recollection of the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha, the recollection of virtue, and the recollection of generosity, as described in the way beginning, “During the day, while walking up and down and sitting” .

original: sabbayogīnaṃ sabbadā upakārakassa satisampajaññassa.
analyzed: sabba yogīnam sabbadā upakārakassa sati sampajaññassa
translated: The establishment of mindfulness: of those who are devoted to the development of all meditation subjects, mindfulness is helpful at all times.

original: Satipaṭṭhānānanti ārammaṇesu okkantitvā pakkanditvā upaṭṭhānato paṭṭhānaṃ, satiyeva
analyzed: sati paṭṭhānānaṃ ti ārammaṇesu okkantitvā pakkanditvā upaṭṭhānato paṭṭhānam satiyā eva
translated: The foundations of mindfulness: because of the establishment of mindfulness after it has entered and settled on the objects, it is establishment ; it is mindfulness .

original: paṭṭhānaṃ satipaṭṭhānaṃ. Kāyavedanācittadhammesu panassā asubhadukkhāniccānattākāragahaṇavasena
analyzed: paṭṭhānam sati paṭṭhānam kāya vedanā citta dhammesu pana assā asubha dukkha anicca anatta ākāra gahaṇa vasena
translated: The establishment is the establishment of mindfulness. But it has a fourfold division according to its occurrence in the four ways of apprehending in the case of the body, feelings, cognizance, and mental objects, as foul, painful, impermanent, and not-self,

original: subhasukhaniccattasaññāpahānakiccasādhanavasena ca pavattito catudhā pabhedo hoti,
analyzed: ca pavattito catudhā pabhedaḥ hoti
translated: and according to its accomplishment of the function of abandoning perception of beauty, pleasure, permanence, and self.

original: tesaṃ catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ.
analyzed: tesam catunnam sati paṭṭhānānam
translated: Of those four foundations of mindfulness.

original: Catunnaṃ sammappadhānānanti padahanti etenāti padhānaṃ, sobhanaṃ padhānaṃ sammappadhānaṃ,
analyzed: catunnam sammappadhānānam ti padahanti etena ati padhānam sobhanam padhānam sammappadhānam
translated: Of the four right endeavours: the right endeavour is the endeavour that is right.

original: sammā vā padahanti etenāti sammappadhānaṃ, sobhanaṃ vā taṃ kilesavirūpattavirahato,
analyzed: sammā vā padahanti etena ati sammappadhānam sobhanam vā tam kilesa virūpa tta virahato
translated: Or alternatively, they endeavour rightly by means of this, thus it is right endeavour. Or alternatively, it is the right endeavour because it is the good endeavour.

original: padhānañca hitasukhanipphādakaṭṭhena seṭṭhabhāvāvahanato, padhānabhāvakaraṇato cāti🔽sammappadhānaṃ, vīriyassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Uppannuppannānaṃ anuppannuppannānañca catunnaṃ🔽akusalakusalānaṃ pahānānuppattiuppādaṭṭhitikiccasādhanavasena pavattito panassa catudhā
analyzed: padhānam ca hita sukha nipphādaka ṭṭhena seṭṭha bhāva āvahanataḥ padhāna bhāva karaṇataḥ ca ati  sammappadhānam vīriyassa itam adhivacanam uppanna uppannānam an uppanna uppannānam ca catunnam  akusala kusalānam pahāna anuppatti uppāda ṭṭhiti kicca sādhana vasena pavattito pana assa catudhā
translated: And it is the right endeavour because it is the endeavour that is the best, or because it is the endeavour that is the cause of the best, that is to say, of the welfare and pleasure that is its fruit.🔽It is a term for energy. But it has a fourfold division according to its occurrence in the four ways of abandoning the four unprofitable roots and of arousing the four profitable roots that have already arisen and of causing those that have not yet arisen to arise and of maintaining those that have arisen by accomplishing the function of abandoning, causing to stop, preventing the arising of, and maintaining, respectively.

original: pabhedo hoti, tesaṃ catunnaṃ sammappadhānānaṃ.
analyzed: pabhedaḥ hoti tesam catunnam sammappadhānānam
translated: Of those four right endeavours.

original: Catunnaṃ iddhipādānanti ettha chandavīriyacittavīmaṃsāsu ekeko ijjhatīti iddhi, samijjhati
analyzed: catunnam iddhipādānan ti ettha chanda vīriya citta vīmaṃsāsu ekekaḥ ijjhati iti id hi samijjhati
translated: ‘Four bases for success’: here, in the case of the will, energy, consciousness, and investigation, each one succeeds,🔽so it is success. The meaning is that it is successful, it comes about,

original: nipphajjatīti attho. Ijjhanti vā etāya sattā iddhā vuddhā ukkaṃsagatā hontīti iddhi.
analyzed: nipphajjati iti atthaḥ ijjhanti vai etāya sattāḥ iddhāḥ vuddhāḥ ukkaṃsa gatāḥ honti iti id hi
translated: or beings succeed by means of it, they are successful, they reach the summit, so it is success.

original: Paṭhamena atthena iddhiyeva pādoti iddhipādo, iddhikoṭṭhāsoti attho. Dutiyena atthena
analyzed: paṭhamena atthena iddhiyā iva pādo ti iddhipādaḥ iddhi koṭṭhāsaḥ ti atthaḥ dutiyena atthena
translated: In the first case, it is a base for success, thus it is a base for success. The meaning is: a footing for success. In the second case,🔽it is a base of success, thus it is a base for success. The meaning is: a footing, a means of attaining.

original: iddhiyā pādoti iddhipādo, pādoti patiṭṭhā adhigamupāyoti attho. Tena hi yasmā uparūparivisesasaṅkhātaṃ🔽iddhiṃ pajjanti pāpuṇanti, tasmā pādoti vuccati. Tesaṃ catunnaṃ iddhipādānaṃ.
analyzed: iddhiyā pādo ti iddhi pādo pādo ti patiṭṭhā adhigama upāyo ti attho tena hi yasmai upari upari visesa saṅkhātam  iddhim pajjanti pāpuṇanti tasmā pādaḥ ti vuccati tesam catunnam iddhipādānam
translated: For it is said that they are called ‘bases’ because they reach, attain, higher and higher kinds of success.

original: Sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānanti bodhiyā, bodhissa vā aṅgāti bojjhaṅgā. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti,
analyzed: sattannam bojjhaṅgānan ti bodhiyā bodhissa vā aṅgā ati bojjhaṅgāḥ idam vuttam hoti
translated: ‘Seven enlightenment factors’: enlightenment is the same as awakening. Or enlightenment is the factor of awakening, thus it is an enlightenment factor. This is what is said:

original: yā esā dhammasāmaggī yāya lokuttaramaggakkhaṇe uppajjamānāya līnuddhaccapatiṭṭhānāyūhanakāmasukhattakilamathānuyogaucchedasassatābhinivesādīnaṃ
analyzed: yā esā dhamma sāmaggī yāya lokuttara magga kkhaṇe uppajjamānāya
translated: it is the path of conformity with the True Idea, which arises at the moment of the supramundane path’s appearance, and it is the means for the abandoning of the misinterpretations of depression and agitation, of the pursuit of enjoyment and the pursuit of mere self- mortification, of annihilationism and eternalism, and so on.

original: anekesaṃ upaddavānaṃ paṭipakkhabhūtāya satidhammavicayavīriyapītipassaddhisamādhiupekkhāsaṅkhātāya🔽dhammasāmaggiyā ariyasāvako bujjhatīti katvā “bodhī”ti vuccati, bujjhatīti kilesasantānaniddāya
analyzed: anekesam upaddavānam paṭipakkha bhūtāya sati dhamma vicaya vīriya pīti passaddhi samādhi upekkhā saṅkhātāya  dhamma sāmaggiyā ariya sāvakaḥ bujjhati iti katvā bodhi iti vuccati bujjhati iti kilesa santāna niddāya
translated: It is called enlightenment because a noble disciple is enlightened by the combination of states consisting of mindfulness, investigation of states, energy, rapture, tranquillity, concentration, and equanimity, which is opposed to the many kinds of misfortune beginning with the eight worldly ideas . He is enlightened in the sense of being awakened to the four noble truths or in the sense of realizing Nibbāna.

original: uṭṭhahati, cattāri vā ariyasaccāni paṭivijjhati, nibbānameva vā sacchikaroti, tassā
analyzed: uṭṭhahati cattāri vā ariya saccāni paṭivijjhati nibbānam eva vā sacchikaroti tassā
translated: So they are enlightenment factors because they are the side of enlightenment, in the way stated, and they are also enlightenment factors because they are the side of the person who is enlightened, in the way stated, that is to say, the noble disciple who is called “enlightened.”

original: dhammasāmaggisaṅkhātāya bodhiyā aṅgātipi bojjhaṅgā jhānaṅgamaggaṅgādīni viya. Yo
analyzed: dhamma sāmaggi saṅkhātāya bodhiyā bojjhaṅgāḥ jhānaṅga maggaṅga ādīni viya
translated: They are enlightenment factors in the way that the factors of the jhāna, path, etc., are the jhāna and path.

original: panesa yathāvuttappakārāya etāya dhammasāmaggiyā bujjhatīti katvā ariyasāvako “bodhī”ti
analyzed: pana esa yathā vutta ppakārāya etāya dhamma sāmaggiyā bujjhati iti katvā ariya sāvakaḥ bodhi iti
translated: But the teachers of the commentaries say that they are enlightenment factors because they are the side of the person who is being enlightened, in the way stated, that is to say, the noble disciple who is called “enlightened.”

original: vuccati, tassa bodhissa aṅgātipi bojjhaṅgā senaṅgarathaṅgādayo viya. Tenāhu aṭṭhakathācariyā
analyzed: vuccati tassa bodhissa bojjhaṅgā senaṅga rathaṅga ādayaḥ tena āhu aṭṭhakathā cariyā
translated: They are enlightenment factors in the way that the factors of the army, chariot, etc., are the army and chariot. Hence they say:🔽“Enlightenment factors because they are the side of the person who is being enlightened” .

original: “bujjhanakassa puggalassa aṅgāti bojjhaṅgā”ti. Tesaṃ sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ.
analyzed: bujjhanakassa puggalassa aṅgā ati bojjhaṅgā ati tesam sattannam bojjhaṅgānam
translated: Of these seven enlightenment factors,

original: Ariyassa aṭṭhaṅgikassa maggassāti ariyoti taṃtaṃmaggavajjhakilesehi ārakattā ariyabhāvakarattā🔽ariyaphalapaṭilābhakarattā ca ariyo. Aṭṭhaṅgāni assāti aṭṭhaṅgiko. Svāyaṃ caturaṅgikā
analyzed: ariyassa aṭṭhaṅgikassa maggassa ati ariyaḥ ti tad tad magga vajjha kilesehi ārakattā ariya bhāva karattā  ariya phala paṭilābhaka rattā ca ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgāni assāti aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ svāyam caturaṅgikā
translated: The noble eight-factored path: it is noble because it is noble in the sense of being far from defilements that are to be avoided by the various paths, in the sense of being the maker of the noble state,

original: viya senā, pañcaṅgikaṃ viya ca tūriyaṃ aṅgamattameva hoti, aṅgavinimutto natthi.
analyzed: viya senā pañcaṅgikam viya ca tūriyam aṅga mattam eva hoti aṅga vinimuttaḥ natthi
translated: and in the sense of being the maker of the attainment of the noble fruit. It has eight factors, thus it is eight- factored. It is just a factor, like an army with four factors, or like a five- factored musical instrument, and there is no such thing as a factor-less one.

original: Nibbānaṃ maggati, kilese vā mārento gacchatīti maggo, tassa ariyassa aṭṭhaṅgikassa
analyzed: nibbānam maggati kilese vā mārentaḥ gacchati iti maggaḥ tassa ariyassa aṭṭhaṅgikassa
translated: It is a path because it goes to extinction, or because it goes killing defilements. It is the noble eight-factored path.

original: maggassa bhāvanānuyogassa. Imesaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānanti vuttappakārānaṃ lokiyalokuttarakusaladhammānaṃ.
analyzed: maggassa bhāvanā anuyogassa imesam kusalānam dhammānam ti vutta ppakārānam lokiya lokuttara kusala dhammānam
translated: Of the development of that: of the development of that noble eight-factored path. Of these profitable ideas: of the kinds of profitable ideas stated thus: “Profitable ideas are of two kinds, I say: worldly and unworldly” .

original: Antarāyāyāti lokuttarakusaladhammānaṃ antarāyāya antaradhānāya lokiyakusaladhammānaṃ pariccāgāya.
analyzed: antarāyāya ati lokuttara kusala dhammānam antarāyāya antaradhānāya lokiya kusala dhammānam pariccāgāya
