analyzed: tiṇṇa oghaḥ taṇhā diṭṭhi pariggahesu taṇhā diṭṭhi kilesa ppahānena an upalittaḥ khīṇāsava muni
translated: having crossed the flood, unsoiled by the grasping of craving and views through the abandoning of the defilements of craving and views, a sage whose cankers are destroyed,

original: rāgādisallānaṃ abbūḷhattā abbūḷhasallo, sativepullappattiyā appamatto caraṃ, pubbabhāge
analyzed: rāga ādi sallānam abbūḷha ttā abbūḷha sallaḥ sati vepulla ppattiyāḥ appamattaḥ caram pubbabhāge
translated: He is one who has drawn out the dart of lust, etc., because he has drawn out the dart of lust, etc., and he is heedful because he has reached the state of fullness of mindfulness.

original: vā appamatto caranto tena appamādacārena abbūḷhasallo hutvā sakaparattabhāvādibhedaṃ
analyzed: vā appamattaḥ carantaḥ tena appamāda cārena abbūḍha sallaḥ hutvā saka paratta bhāva ādi bhedam
translated: Or alternatively, he is heedful because he is heedful in the earlier stage, and he is one who has drawn out the dart because he has drawn out the dart by means of that heedfulness.

original: nāsīsati lokamimaṃ parañca, aññadatthu carimacittanirodhā nirupādānova jātavedo parinibbātīti🔽arahattanikūṭena desanaṃ niṭṭhāpesi, dhammanettiṭhapanameva karonto; na tu imāya
analyzed: na āsīsati lokam imam param ca aññadatthu carima citta nirodhā nirupādānaḥ uva jātavedo parinibbāti iti  arahatta nikūṭena desanam niṭṭhāpesi dhamma netti ṭhapanam eva karontaḥ na tu imāya
translated: He does not remember this world and the world beyond, in other words, he attains Nibbāna without substrate left, with the cessation of the last consciousness.

original: desanāya maggaṃ vā phalaṃ vā uppādesi, khīṇāsavassa desitattāti.
analyzed: desanāya maggam vā phalam vā uppādesi khīṇāsavassa desita ttā ti
translated: He concluded the teaching with the peak of the arahants, in other words, he established the standard of the Dhamma, but he did not arouse either the path or the fruit by this teaching, because it was taught for one whose cankers are destroyed.

original: Nīlādibhedaṃ ārammaṇaṃ sañjānātīti saññā. Sā sañjānanalakkhaṇā paccābhiññāṇarasā.
analyzed: nīla ādi bhedam ārammaṇam sañjānāti iti saññā sā sañjānana lakkhaṇā pacca abhiññāṇa rasā
translated: Perception is the perceiving of an object such as blue, etc. Its characteristic is perceiving; its function is to overspread, as a dye does a lotus; its manifestation is the overspreading of an object; its proximate cause is an undemonstrable object.

original: Catubhūmikasaññā hi nosañjānanalakkhaṇā nāma natthi, sabbā sañjānanalakkhaṇāva. Yā
analyzed: catu bhūmika saññā hi nosañjānana lakkhaṇā nāma natthi sabbā sañjānana lakkhaṇā ava yā
translated: For there is no perception in the four planes that does not have the characteristic of perceiving. All perception has the characteristic of perceiving.

original: panettha abhiññāṇena sañjānāti, sā paccābhiññāṇarasā nāma hoti. Tassā vaḍḍhakissa
analyzed: pana ittha abhiññāṇena sañjānāti sā paccābhiññāṇarasā nāma hoti tassā vaḍḍhakissa
translated: But that which perceives by means of direct knowledge has the essence of direct knowledge. Its increase is this.

original: dārumhi abhiññāṇaṃ katvā puna tena abhiññāṇena taṃ paccābhijānanakāle, purisassa🔽kāḷatilakādiabhiññāṇaṃ sallakkhetvā puna tena abhiññāṇena “asuko nāma eso”ti tassa
analyzed: dārumhi abhiññāṇam katvā puna tena abhiññāṇena tam paccābhijānana kāle purisassa  kāḷatilaka ādi abhiññāṇam sallakkhetvā puna tena abhiññāṇena asukaḥ nāma esaḥ ti tassa
translated: and when he recognizes it again by means of that recognition,🔽and when he brings it by means of the light and the torch,

original: paccābhijānanakāle, rañño piḷandhanagopakabhaṇḍāgārikassa tasmiṃ tasmiṃ piḷandhane🔽nāmapaṇṇakaṃ bandhitvā “asukaṃ piḷandhanaṃ nāma āharā”ti vutte dīpaṃ jāletvā sāragabbhaṃ🔽pavisitvā paṇṇaṃ vācetvā tassa tasseva piḷandhanassa āharaṇakāle ca pavatti veditabbā.🔽Aparo nayo – sabbasaṅgāhikavasena hi sañjānanalakkhaṇā saññā, punasañjānanapaccayanimittakaraṇarasā🔽dāruādīsu tacchakādayo viya, yathāgahitanimittavasena abhinivesakaraṇapaccupaṭṭhānā
analyzed: pacca abhijānana kāle raññaḥ piḷandhana gopaka bhaṇḍāgārikassa tasmim tasmim piḷandhane  nāmapaṇṇakam bandhitvā asukam piḷandhanam nāma āharāti vutte dīpam jāletvā sāragabbham  pavisitvā paṇṇam vācetvā tassa tassa iva piḷandhanassa āharaṇa kāle ca pavatti veditabbā  aparaḥ nayaḥ sabba saṅgāhika vasena hi sañjānana lakkhaṇā saññā puna sañjānana paccaya nimitta karaṇa rasā  dāru ādīsu tad śaka ādayaḥ yathā gahita nimitta vasena abhinivesa karaṇa paccupaṭṭhānā
translated: and when he brings it by means of the light and the torch,

original: hatthidassakaandho viya, ārammaṇe anogāḷhavuttitāya aciraṭṭhānapaccupaṭṭhānā vā vijju
analyzed: hatthi dassaka andhaḥ viya ārammaṇe anogāḷha vutti tāya acira ṭṭhāna paccupaṭṭhānā vā vijju
translated: Another method: perception has the characteristic of perceiving. Its function is to cause the condition for the recognition of what has been sensed. It is manifested as the apprehending of the sign of what has been sensed. Its proximate cause is the corresponding group of mental factors. It should be regarded as like a person who recognizes a man by his name and clan after recognizing him by his appearance.🔽Perception has the characteristic of perceiving. Its function is to cause the condition for the recognition of what has been sensed. It is manifested as the apprehending of the sign of what has been sensed. Its proximate cause is the corresponding group of mental factors. It should be regarded as like a person who recognizes a man by his name and clan after recognizing him by his appearance.

original: viya, yathāupaṭṭhitavisayapadaṭṭhānā tiṇapurisakesu migapotakānaṃ purisāti uppannasaññā🔽viya. Yā panettha ñāṇasampayuttā hoti, sā ñāṇameva anuvattati, sasambhārapathavīādīsu
analyzed: viya yathā upaṭṭhita visaya padaṭṭhānā tiṇapurisakesu miga potakānam purisā ati uppanna saññā  viya yā pana ittha ñāṇa sampayuttā hoti sā ñāṇam eva anuvattati sa sambhāra pathavī ādīsu
translated: like the perception of a man that arises in young fawns in regard to a manikin made up of grass and sticks, etc., which is placed in front of them as a decoy to lure them to their destruction.

original: sesadhammā pathavīādīni viyāti veditabbā.🔽Kāmapaṭisaññuttā saññā kāmasaññā. Byāpādapaṭisaññuttā saññā byāpādasaññā. Vihiṃsāpaṭisaññuttā🔽saññā vihiṃsāsaññā. Tesu dve sattesupi saṅkhāresupi uppajjanti. Kāmasaññā hi piye🔽manāpe satte vā saṅkhāre vā vitakkentassa uppajjati. Byāpādasaññā appiye amanāpe
analyzed: sesa dhammā pathavī ādīni viya ati veditabbā  kāma paṭisaññuttā saññā kāma saññā byāpāda paṭisaññuttā saññā byāpāda saññā vihiṃsā paṭisaññuttā  saññā vihiṃsā saññā tesu dve sattesu pi saṅkhāresu pi uppajjanti kāma saññā hi piye  manāpe satte vā saṅkhāre vā vitakkentassa uppajjati byāpāda saññā appiye amanāpe
translated: But the perception that is associated with knowledge follows after knowledge itself, and the remaining states should be understood as earth, etc., in the case of the knowledge of earth, etc.

original: satte vā saṅkhāre vā kujjhitvā olokanakālato paṭṭhāya yāva vināsanā uppajjati. Vihiṃsāsaññā
analyzed: satte vā saṅkhāre vā kujjhitvā olokana kālataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva vināsanā uppajjati vihiṃsā saññā
translated: Perception associated with sensual desire is perception of sensual desire. Perception associated with ill will is perception of ill will. Perception associated with cruelty is perception of cruelty. These three arise in regard to living beings and formations. Perception of sensual desire arises in one who reflects on a loved and pleasing living being or formation. Perception of ill will arises in one who reflects on an unloved and unpleasing living being or formation, from the time of his annoyance with it until it is destroyed. Perception of cruelty arises in one who reflects on a living being or formation in a way that leads to cruelty.

original: saṅkhāresu na uppajjati. Saṅkhāro hi dukkhāpetabbo nāma natthi. “Ime sattā haññantu
analyzed: saṅkhāresu na uppajjati saṅkhāraḥ hi dukkha apetabbaḥ nāma natthi ime sattā haññantu
translated: It does not arise in regard to formations. For a formation is not something that can be killed. “May these living beings be killed, destroyed, annihilated, or exterminated!”

original: vā, ucchijjantu vā, vinassantu vā, mā vā ahesu”nti cintanakāle pana sattesu uppajjati.
analyzed: vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesunti cintana kāle pana sattesu uppajjati
translated: and the thought “Let them be destroyed, let them vanish, let them not be” arises in him towards beings.

original: Nekkhammapaṭisaññuttā saññā nekkhammasaññā, sā asubhapubbabhāge kāmāvacarā hoti,
analyzed: nekkhamma paṭisaññuttā saññā nekkhamma saññā sā asubha pubbabhāge kāmāvacarā hoti
translated: Perception associated with renunciation is renunciation perception. It is in the sense sphere in the preliminary stage of foulness,

original: asubhajhāne rūpāvacarā, taṃ jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā uppannamaggaphalakāle lokuttarā.
analyzed: asubha jhāne rūpāvacarā tam jhānam pādakam katvā uppanna magga phala kāle lokuttarā
translated: in the fine-material sphere in foulness jhāna, and it is supramundane when it arises in the path and fruition consciousness that has foulness jhāna as its support.

original: Abyāpādapaṭisaññuttā saññā abyāpādasaññā, sā mettāpubbabhāge kāmāvacarā hoti, mettājhāne🔽rūpāvacarā, taṃ jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā uppannamaggaphalakāle lokuttarā. Avihiṃsāpaṭisaññuttā
analyzed: a byāpāda paṭisaññuttā saññā a byāpāda saññā sā mettā pubbabhāge kāmāvacarā hoti mettā jhāne  rūpāvacarā tam jhānam pādakam katvā uppanna magga phala kāle lokuttarā avihiṃsā paṭisaññuttā
translated: Perception associated with non-ill will is non-ill will perception. It is in the sense sphere in the preliminary stage of loving-kindness,

original: saññā avihiṃsāsaññā, sā karuṇāpubbabhāge kāmāvacarā, karuṇājhāne rūpāvacarā, taṃ
analyzed: saññā avihiṃsā saññā sā karuṇā pubbabhāge kāma avacarā karuṇā jhāne rūpa avacarā taṃ
translated: in the fine-material sphere in loving-kindness jhāna, and it is supramundane when it arises in the path and fruition consciousness that has loving-kindness jhāna as its support. Perception associated with non-cruelty is non-cruelty perception. It is in the sense sphere in the preliminary stage of compassion,

original: jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā uppannamaggaphalakāle lokuttarā. Yadā alobho sīsaṃ hoti, tadā
analyzed: jhānam pādakam katvā uppanna magga phala kāle lokuttarā yadā alobho sīsam hoti tadā
translated: in the fine-material sphere in compassion jhāna, and it is supramundane when it arises in the path and fruition consciousness that has compassion jhāna as its support. When non-greed is the head,

original: itare dve tadanvāyikā bhavanti. Yadā mettā sīsaṃ hoti, tadā itare dve tadanvāyikā
analyzed: itare dve tad anvāyikāḥ bhavanti yadā mettā sīsam hoti tadā itare dve tad anvāyikā
translated: the other two are its followers. When loving-kindness is the head, the other two are its followers.

original: bhavanti. Yadā karuṇā sīsaṃ hoti, tadā itare dve tadanvāyikā bhavanti. Rūpārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: bhavanti yadā karuṇā sīsam hoti tadā itare dve tad anvāyikāḥ bhavanti rūpa ārammaṇam
translated: When compassion is the head, the other two are its followers. The object is visible form.

original: ārabbha uppannā saññā rūpasaññā. Saddasaññādīsupi eseva nayo. Idaṃ tassāyeva ārammaṇato
analyzed: ārabbha uppannā saññā rūpa saññā sadda saññā ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ idam tassā yeva ārammaṇato
translated: When compassion is the head, the other two are its followers. Perception that arises in regard to materiality as object is perception of materiality. The same method applies in the case of perception of sound, and so on. This is its name according to the object.

original: nāmaṃ. Ārammaṇānaṃ vuttattā cakkhusamphassajādivatthūnipi vuttāneva honti.
analyzed: nāmam ārammaṇānam vuttattā cakkhu samphassa ja ādi vatthūni pi vuttāni eva honti
translated: Since the objects are mentioned, the bases, which are the eye-contact, etc., are also mentioned.

original: Yā evarūpā saññāti aññāpi “paṭighasamphassajā saññā adhivacanasamphassajā saññā”ti
analyzed: yā evarūpā saññā ati aññā api paṭigha samphassa jā saññā adhivacana samphassa jā saññā iti
translated: “Such perception” is also to be understood as other kinds of perception, such as perception born of contact accompanied by resistance, and perception born of contact not accompanied by resistance.

original: evamādikā veditabbā. Tattha adhivacanasamphassajā saññātipi pariyāyena chadvārikāyeva.🔽Tayo hi arūpino khandhā sayaṃ piṭṭhivaṭṭakā hutvā attanā sahajātasaññāya “adhivacanasamphassajā
analyzed: evamādikā veditabbā tattha adhivacana samphassa jā saññā atipi pariyāyena chadvārikāya iva  tayaḥ hi arūpino khandhā sayam piṭṭhivaṭṭakā hutvā attanā sahajāta saññāya adhivacana samphassa jā
translated: Herein, perception born of contact not accompanied by resistance is also, by implication, the six-door kind.

original: saññā”ti nāmaṃ karonti, nippariyāyena pana paṭighasamphassajā saññā nāma pañcadvārikā
analyzed: saññā ti nāmam karonti nippariyāyena pana paṭigha samphassa jā saññā nāma pañca dvārikā
translated: For the three immaterial aggregates, like the three sticks in a tripod, make the name “perception born of contact not accompanied by resistance” for the perception that is associated with them. But in the ultimate sense, perception born of contact accompanied by resistance is the five-door kind of perception;

original: saññā, adhivacanasamphassajā saññā nāma manodvārikā saññā. Etā atirekasaññā pariggahitāti veditabbā.
analyzed: saññā adhivacana samphassa jā saññā nāma manaḥ dvārikā saññā etāḥ atireka saññā pariggahitā ti veditabbā
translated: perception born of contact not accompanied by resistance is the mind-door kind of perception. These are the kinds of perception that are to be understood as “excess perception.”

original: Saññāti sabhāvanāmaṃ. Sañjānanāti sañjānanākāro. Sañjānitattanti sañjānitabhāvo.
analyzed: saññā iti sabhāva nāmam sañjānanā ati sañjānana ākāraḥ sañjānita bhāvaḥ
translated: Perception is the name for the individual essence. Apprehending is the mode of apprehending. Apprehendedness is the state of being apprehended.

original: Avijjoghanti pūretuṃ ayuttaṭṭhena kāyaduccaritādi avindiyaṃ nāma, aladdhabbanti attho.
analyzed: pūretum ayutta ṭṭhena kāya duccarita ādi avindiyam nāma a laddhabbam ti attho
translated: The flood of ignorance is called “invincible” because it is not possible to conquer bodily misconduct, etc., in the sense of not being able to overcome it. The meaning is: it cannot be obtained.

original: Taṃ avindiyaṃ vindatīti avijjā. Tabbiparītato kāyasucaritādi vindiyaṃ nāma, taṃ vindiyaṃ
analyzed: tam avindiyam vindati iti avijjā kāya su carita ādi vindiyam nāma tam vindiyam
translated: It conquers that which is invincible, thus it is ignorance . The opposite of that is called “vincible,” namely, bodily good conduct, etc.

original: na vindatīti avijjā. Khandhānaṃ rāsaṭṭhaṃ, āyatanānaṃ āyatanaṭṭhaṃ, dhātūnaṃ suññaṭṭhaṃ,🔽indriyānaṃ adhipatiyaṭṭhaṃ, saccānaṃ tathaṭṭhaṃ aviditaṃ karotītipi avijjā. Dukkhādīnaṃ
analyzed: na vindati iti avijjā khandhānam rāsa aṭṭham āyatanānam āyatana aṭṭham dhātūnam suñña ṭṭham  indriyānam adhipatiya ṭṭham saccānam tathaṭṭham aviditam karoti iti pi avijjā dukkha ādīnam
translated: It does not conquer that which is vincible, thus it is ignorance . It makes unknown the sixfold base of the aggregates, the sixfold base of the sense spheres, the voidness of the elements,

original: pīḷanādivasena vuttaṃ catubbidhaṃ atthaṃ aviditaṃ karotītipi avijjā. Antavirahite🔽saṃsāre yonigatibhavaviññāṇaṭṭhitisattāvāsesu satte javāpetīti avijjā. Paramatthato
analyzed: pīḷana ādi vasena vuttam catubbidham attham aviditam karoti iti pi avijjā anta virahite  saṃsāre yoni gati bhava viññāṇa ṭṭhiti sattā vāsesu satte javāpeti iti avijjā paramatthataḥ
translated: the dominant status of the faculties, the suchness of the truths. It makes unknown the fourfold meaning stated as oppression, etc., of the truths. It makes unknown the fact that in the world without end

original: avijjamānesu itthipurisādīsu javati, vijjamānesu khandhādīsu na javatīti avijjā.
analyzed: avijjamānesu itthi purisa ādīsu javati vijjamānesu khandha ādīsu na javati iti avijjā
translated: beings are born in the various wombs, in the various destinies, in the various planes of existence, in the various realms of existence, in the various abodes of beings. It runs towards women and men, etc., which do not exist in the ultimate sense, and it does not run towards the aggregates, etc., which do exist.

original: Api ca cakkhuviññāṇādīnaṃ vatthārammaṇānaṃ paṭiccasamuppādapaṭiccasamuppannānañca
analyzed: api ca cakkhu viññāṇa ādīnam vattha ārammaṇānam paṭiccasamuppāda paṭiccasamuppannānam ca
translated: And ignorance is so called also because it conceals the eye-consciousness, etc., and the bases and objects of eye-consciousness, etc., and the states that arise contingent upon a cause and those that are contingent upon a cause.🔽He should cross over the flood of sensuality,

original: dhammānaṃ chādanatopi avijjā, taṃ avijjoghaṃ. Kāmoghavasena uttareyya. Bhavoghavasena
analyzed: dhammānam chādanataḥ pi avijjā tam avijja ogham kāma ogha vasena uttareyya bhava ogha vasena
translated: He should escape from the flood of becoming,🔽He should transcend the flood of views,🔽He should put an end to the flood of ignorance.

original: patareyya. Diṭṭhoghavasena samatikkameyya. Avijjoghavasena vītivatteyya. Atha vā🔽sotāpattimaggena pahānavasena uttareyya. Sakadāgāmimaggena pahānavasena patareyya.
analyzed: patareyya diṭṭha ogha vasena samatikkameyya avijja ogha vasena vītivatteyya atha vā  sotāpatti maggena pahāna vasena uttareyya sakadāgāmi maggena pahāna vasena patareyya
translated: Or alternatively, he should cross over by means of the path of stream-entry,🔽He should escape by means of the path of once-return,🔽He should transcend by means of the path of non-return,

original: Anāgāmimaggena pahānavasena samatikkameyya. Arahattamaggena pahānavasena vītivatteyya.
analyzed: anāgāmi maggena pahāna vasena samatikkameyya arahatta maggena pahāna vasena vītivatteyya
translated: He should put an end by means of the path of Arahantship.

original: Atha vā “tareyyādipañcapadaṃ tadaṅgādipañcapahānena yojetabba”nti keci vadanti.
analyzed: atha vā tareyyādi pañca padam tad aṅga ādi pañca apahānena yojetabbanti keci vadanti
translated: Or else, some say that the five terms beginning with “cross over” should be construed with the five terms beginning with “part” .

original: “Monaṃ vuccati ñāṇa”nti vatvā taṃ pabhedato dassetuṃ “yā paññā pajānanā”tiādimāha.🔽Taṃ vuttanayameva ṭhapetvā “amoho dhammavicayo”ti padaṃ. Amoho kusalesu dhammesu
analyzed: monam vuccati ñāṇam ti vatvā tam pabhedataḥ dassetum yā paññā pajānanā iti ādim āha 🔽tam vutta nayam eva ṭhapetvā amohaḥ dhamma vicayaḥ ti padam amohaḥ kusalesu dhammesu
translated: “Knowledge is called ‘wisdom’” . Having said this, he now said “Understanding of thusness” in order to show its different kinds.🔽The rest is as already stated. But the term “non-delusion” should be understood as a term for understanding in the sense of penetration of the three general characteristics of impermanence, etc., according to the method stated in the Paṭisambhidā: “Understanding of rise and fall is knowledge, is insight, is wisdom, is light, is science, is clear knowing, is the torch, is the lamp, is the gleam, is the splendour, is the non-delusion” .

original: abhāvanāya paṭipakkho bhāvanāhetu. Amohena aviparītaṃ gaṇhāti mūḷhassa viparītaggahaṇato.
analyzed: abhāvanāya paṭipakkhaḥ bhāvanā hetu amohena aviparītam gaṇhāti mūḷhassa viparīta ggahaṇato
translated: The cause for the development of non-delusion is the opposite of non-development. One who is not deluded apprehends things as they really are, because the deluded person apprehends things in a perverted way.

original: Amohena yāthāvaṃ yāthāvato dhārento yathāsabhāve pavattati. Mūḷho hi “tacchaṃ atacchaṃ,🔽atacchañca taccha”nti gaṇhāti; tathā icchitālābhadukkhaṃ na hoti. Amūḷhassa “taṃ🔽kutettha labbhā”ti evamādipaccavekkhaṇasambhavato maraṇadukkhaṃ na hoti. Sammohamaraṇañhi
analyzed: amohena yāthāvam yāthāvataḥ dhārentaḥ yathā sabhāve pavattati mūḍhaḥ hi taccham a taccham  a tacchan ca tacchanti gaṇhāti tathā icchitā lābha dukkham na hoti amūḷhassa tam  kutas ittha evamādi paccavekkhaṇa sambhavataḥ maraṇa dukkham na hoti sammoha maraṇam hi
translated: One who is not deluded, while apprehending things as they really are, as they have come to be, proceeds in accordance with the true nature of things. For the deluded person apprehends what is true as untrue and what is untrue as true.🔽Thus, the suffering of not getting what one wants does not arise for one who is not deluded. The suffering of death does not arise for one who is not deluded, because he is able to reflect thus: “Where can I find

original: dukkhaṃ, na ca taṃ amūḷhassa hoti. Pabbajitānaṃ sukhasaṃvāso hoti, tiracchānayoniyaṃ
analyzed: dukkham na ca tat amūḷhassa hoti pabbajitānam sukha saṃvāsaḥ hoti tiracchānayoniyam
translated: escape from this?” For the suffering of death is for one who is deluded, and it does not arise for one who is not deluded.

original: nibbatti na hoti. Mohena hi niccasammūḷhā tiracchānayoniṃ upapajjanti. Mohapaṭipakkho
analyzed: nibbatti na hoti mohena hi nicca sammūḷhāḥ tiracchānayonim upapajjanti moha paṭipakkho
translated: There is pleasant companionship for those who have gone forth, because they are not reborn in the animal realm. For the animal realm is the rebirth-state for those who are always deluded.

original: ca amoho mohavasena amajjhattabhāvassa abhāvakaro. Amohena avihiṃsāsaññā dhātusaññā
analyzed: ca amohaḥ moha vasena a majjhatta bhāvassa abhāva karaḥ amohena avihiṃsā saññā dhātu saññā
translated: And the opposite of delusion is non-delusion, which prevents the unbalancing that comes through delusion. Non-delusion is the perception of harmlessness, the perception of the elements,

original: majjhimāya paṭipattiyā paṭipajjanaṃ, pacchimaganthadvayassa pabhedanañca hoti. Pacchimāni
analyzed: majjhimāya paṭipattiyā paṭipajjanam pacchima gantha dvayassa pabhedanam ca hoti pacchimāni
translated: the practice of the middle way, and the analysis of the last two knots.

original: dve satipaṭṭhānāni tasseva ānubhāvena ijjhanti. Amoho dīghāyukatāya paccayo hoti.
analyzed: dve satipaṭṭhānāni tassa iva ānubhāvena ijjhanti amohaḥ dīgha āyuka tāya paccayaḥ hoti
translated: and the two foundations of mindfulness succeed through his influence. Non-delusion is a condition for long life.

original: Amūḷho hi hitāhitaṃ ñatvā ahitaṃ parivajjento hitañca paṭisevamāno dīghāyuko hoti,
analyzed: amūḍhaḥ hi hita ahitam ñatvā ahitam parivajjentaḥ hitam ca paṭisevamānaḥ dīgha āyukaḥ hoti
translated: For one who is undeluded, having understood what is beneficial and harmful, avoids what is harmful and resorts to what is beneficial, he becomes long-lived.

original: attasampattiyā aparihīno hoti. Amūḷho hi attano hitameva karonto attānaṃ sampādeti.
analyzed: atta sampattiyāḥ a parihīnaḥ hoti amūḍhaḥ hi attanaḥ hitam eva karontaḥ attānam sampādeti
translated: He is not lacking in the perfection of self. For one who is undeluded, doing only what is beneficial to himself, perfects himself.

original: Ariyavihārassa paccayo hoti, udāsinapakkhesu nibbuto hoti amūḷhassa sabbābhisaṅgatāya🔽abhāvato. Amohena anattadassanaṃ hoti. Asammūḷho hi yāthāvagahaṇakusalo apariṇāyakaṃ
analyzed: ariya vihārassa paccayaḥ hoti udāsina pakkhesu nibbutaḥ hoti amūḷhassa sabba abhisaṅga tāya  abhāvataḥ amohena anatta dassanam hoti asammūḷhaḥ hi yāthāva gahaṇa kusalaḥ apariṇāyakam
translated: He is a condition for the noble dwelling, and he is extinguished in the neutral faction, because of the absence of all attachment of one who is undeluded.🔽Through non-delusion there is the view of not-self. For one who is undeluded, being skilled in the understanding of things as they are, awakens to the fact that the five aggregates of clinging are without a leader,

original: khandhapañcakaṃ apariṇāyakato bujjhati. Yathā ca etena anattadassanaṃ, evaṃ attadassanaṃ
analyzed: khandha pañcakam apariṇāyakataḥ bujjhati yathā ca etena anatta dassanam evam atta dassanam
translated: as a leader. And just as through this there is the view of not-self, so through delusion there is the view of self.

original: mohena. Ko hi nāma attasuññataṃ bujjhitvā puna sammohaṃ āpajjeyyāti.
analyzed: mohena kaḥ hi nāma atta suññatam bujjhitvā puna sammoham āpajjeyya ati
translated: For who, having awakened to the emptiness of self, would again fall into delusion?

original: Tena ñāṇena samannāgatoti etena vuttappakārena ñāṇena samaṅgībhūto sekkhādayo muni.
analyzed: tena ñāṇena samannāgataḥ ti etena vutta ppakārena ñāṇena samaṅgībhūtaḥ sekkha ādayaḥ muni
translated: Endowed with this knowledge: endowed with the knowledge of the kind described, the trainee, etc., are sages.

original: Monappattoti paṭiladdhañāṇo munibhāvaṃ patto. Tīṇīti gaṇanaparicchedo. Moneyyānīti🔽munibhāvakarā moneyyakarā paṭipadā dhammā. Kāyamoneyyantiādīsu viññattikāyarūpakāyavasena
analyzed: monappatto ti paṭiladdha ñāṇaḥ muni bhāvam patto tīṇi iti gaṇana paricchedaḥ moneyyāni iti  muni bhāva karā moneyya karā paṭipadāḥ dhammā viññatti kāya rūpa kāya vasena
translated: ‘He has attained to the state of a sage’: he has attained to the state of one who has reached the knowledge of the destruction of cankers. ‘Three’: this is a delimitation by number. ‘He has measured’:🔽he has measured the states that are the practice that brings about the state of a sage. ‘The body to be measured’: the body to be measured should be defined as the material body and the body of intimation.

original: paññāpetabbaṃ kāyamoneyyaṃ. Viññattivācāsaddavācāvasena paññāpetabbaṃ vacīmoneyyaṃ.
analyzed: paññāpetabbam kāya moneyyam viññatti vācā sadda vācā vasena paññāpetabbam vacī moneyyam
translated: ‘Speech to be measured’: speech to be measured should be defined as speech that is intimation and speech that is sound.

original: Manodvārikacittādivasena paññāpetabbaṃ manomoneyyaṃ. Tividhakāyaduccaritānaṃ pahānanti
analyzed: manodvārika citta ādi vasena paññāpetabbam manomoneyyam tividha kāya duccaritānam pahānan ti
translated: ‘The mind to be measured’: the mind to be measured should be defined as the mind that is mental volition and the mind that is consciousness. ‘The abandoning of the three kinds of misconduct of the body’:

original: pāṇātipātādividhānaṃ kāyato pavattānaṃ duṭṭhu caritānaṃ pajahanaṃ. Kāyasucaritanti🔽kāyato pavattaṃ suṭṭhu caritaṃ. Kāyārammaṇe ñāṇanti kāyaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā aniccādivasena🔽pavattaṃ kāyārammaṇe ñāṇaṃ. Kāyapariññāti kāyaṃ ñātatīraṇappahānapariññāhi jānanavasena
analyzed: pāṇa atipāta ādi vidhānam kāyataḥ pavattānam duṭṭhu caritānam pajahanam kāya su caritanti  kāyato pavattam suṭṭhu caritam kāya ārammaṇe ñāṇan ti kāyam ārammaṇam katvā anicca ādi vasena  pavattam kāya ārammaṇe ñāṇam kāya pariññā ati kāyam jānana vasena
translated: the abandoning of the three kinds of bad conduct that occur by means of the body, such as killing breathing things, etc. ‘Good bodily conduct’:🔽good conduct that occurs by means of the body. ‘Knowledge of the body as a condition’: knowledge that occurs by way of impermanence, etc.,

original: pavattaṃ ñāṇaṃ. Pariññāsahagato maggoti ajjhattikaṃ kāyaṃ sammasitvā uppāditamaggo
analyzed: pavattam ñāṇam pariññā sahagataḥ maggo ti ajjhattikam kāyam sammasitvā uppādita maggaḥ
translated: taking the body as its object. ‘Full understanding of the body’: knowledge that occurs by way of the full understanding of the body through the full understanding of the known, the investigated, and the abandoned. ‘The path conjoined with full understanding’: the path that is aroused by comprehending the internal body.

original: pariññāsahagato. Kāye chandarāgassa pahānanti kāye taṇhāchandarāgassa pajahanaṃ.
analyzed: pariññā sahagataḥ kāye chanda rāgassa pahānanti kāye taṇhā chanda rāgassa pajahanaṃ
translated: Accompanied by full understanding. Abandoning desire and lust for the body: abandoning craving and lust for the body.

original: Kāyasaṅkhāranirodhoti assāsapassāsānaṃ nirodho āvaraṇo, catutthajjhānasamāpattisamāpajjanaṃ.
analyzed: kāya saṅkhāra nirodhaḥ ti assāsa passāsānam nirodhaḥ āvaraṇaḥ catuttha jhāna samāpatti samāpajjanam
translated: Cessation of bodily formations: the cessation of in-breaths and out-breaths is the obstruction to the attainment of the fourth jhāna.

original: Vacīsaṅkhāranirodhoti vitakkavicārānaṃ nirodho āvaraṇo, dutiyajjhānasamāpattisamāpajjanaṃ.
analyzed: vacī saṅkhāra nirodhaḥ ti nirodhaḥ āvaraṇaḥ dutiya jhāna samāpatti samāpajjanam
translated: Cessation of verbal formations: the cessation of applied and sustained thought is the obstruction to the attainment of the second jhāna.

original: Cittasaṅkhāranirodhoti saññāvedanānaṃ nirodho āvaraṇo, saññāvedayitanirodhasamāpattisamāpajjanaṃ.
analyzed: citta saṅkhāra nirodho ti saññā vedanānam nirodhaḥ āvaraṇaḥ saññā vedayita nirodha samāpatti samāpajjanam
translated: Cessation of mental formations: the cessation of perception and feeling is the obstruction to the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: Paṭhamagāthāya kāyamunintiādīsu kāyaduccaritappahānavasena kāyamuni. Vacīduccaritappahānavasena
analyzed: paṭhama gāthāya kāya muni nti ādīsu kāya duccarita ppahāna vasena kāya muni vacī duccarita ppahāna vasena
translated: In the first stanza, in the case of the words “the body sage” and so on, he is a body sage in the sense of abandoning bodily misconduct.🔽He is a speech sage in the sense of abandoning verbal misconduct.

original: vācāmuni. Manoduccaritappahānavasena manomuni. Sabbākusalappahānavasena anāsavamuni.
translated: He is a mind sage in the sense of abandoning mental misconduct. He is a taintless sage in the sense of abandoning all unprofitable things.

original: Moneyyasampannanti jānitabbaṃ jānitvā phale ṭhitattā moneyyasampannaṃ. Āhu sabbappahāyinanti
analyzed: moneyya sampannanti jānitabbam jānitvā phale moneyya sampannam āhu sabba ppahāyinam ti
translated: He is to be known as “accomplished in the way”: he is accomplished in the way because he has reached the fruition.

original: sabbakilese pajahitvā ṭhitattā sabbappahāyinaṃ kathayanti.
analyzed: sabba kilese pajahitvā ṭhita ttā sabba ppahāyinam kathayanti
translated: They call him “all-abandoner”: they call him “all-abandoner” because he has reached the state of all-abandoner by abandoning all defilements.

original: Dutiyagāthāya ninhātapāpakanti yo ajjhattabahiddhasaṅkhāte sabbasmimpi āyatane ajjhattabahiddhārammaṇavasena
analyzed: dutiya gāthāya yaḥ ajjhatta bahiddha saṅkhāte sabbasmim pi āyatane ajjhatta bahiddha ārammaṇa vasena
translated: In the second stanza, “washed out the stain” means that he washed out the stain in all the sense bases, both internal and external, by means of the internal and external objects.

original: uppattirahāni sabbapāpakāni maggañāṇena ninhāya dhovitvā ṭhitattā ninhātapāpakaṃ🔽āhūti evamattho daṭṭhabbo. Agāramajjhe vasantā agāramunino. Pabbajjupagatā anagāramunino.
analyzed: uppatti rahāni sabba pāpakāni magga ñāṇena ninhāya dhovitvā ṭhita ttā ninhāta pāpakam  āhu iti evamattho daṭṭhabbo agāra majjhe vasantāḥ agāra munino pabbajja upagatāḥ anagāra munino
translated: In the second stanza, “who have washed out evil” : in all the sense bases, which are called “inside” and “outside,” all evil has been washed out, that is, all evil has been washed away and washed out by the path-knowledge, and they stand thus having washed out all evil.🔽Therefore they are called “who have washed out evil.”🔽The word “called” should be understood in this way. Those who live in the midst of the household life are householders. Those who have gone forth are those who are not householders.

original: Tattha sekkhā sekkhamunino. Arahanto asekkhamunino. Paccekabuddhā paccekamunino.
analyzed: tattha sekkhā sekkha munino arahantaḥ asekkha munino paccekabuddhā paccekamunino
translated: Herein, those who are in training are those who are in training and are called “monks.” Those who are arahants are those who are not in training and are called “monks.” Those who are paccekabuddhas are those who are solitary and are called “monks.”

original: Sammāsambuddhā munimunino.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhāḥ muni muninaḥ
translated: Those who are perfectly enlightened are those who are the best of those who are monks and are called “monks.”🔽Again, by way of a question asked with the desire to speak further, he said: “Which are the householders who are monks?”

original: Puna kathetukamyatāpucchāvasena “katame agāramunino”ti āha. Agārikāti kasigorakkhādiagārikakamme
analyzed: puna kathā itu kamyatā pucchā vasena katame agāra muninā iti āha agārikā ati kasi gorakkha ādi agārika kamme
translated: Those who are householders are those who are engaged in the work of householders, such as agriculture and commerce.

original: niyuttā. Diṭṭhapadāti diṭṭhanibbānā. Viññātasāsanāti viññātaṃ sikkhattayasāsanaṃ
analyzed: niyuttā diṭṭha padā ati diṭṭha nibbānā viññāta sāsanā ati viññātam sikkhattaya sāsanam
translated: Those who have seen the state are those who have seen nibbāna. Those who have understood the dispensation are those who have understood the dispensation of the three trainings.

original: etesanti viññātasāsanā. Anagārāti kasigorakkhādiagāriyakammaṃ etesaṃ natthīti pabbajitā
analyzed: etesan ti viññāta sāsanāḥ anagārā ati kasi gorakkha ādi agāriya kammam etesam na atthi iti pabbajitā
translated: Those who are not householders are those who have gone forth, for whom there is no work of householders such as agriculture and commerce.

original: “anagārā”ti vuccanti. Satta sekkhāti sotāpannādayo satta. Tīsu sikkhāsu sikkhantīti🔽sekkhā. Arahanto na sikkhantīti asekkhā. Taṃ taṃ kāraṇaṃ paṭicca ekakāva anācariyakāva
analyzed: anagārā ti vuccanti satta sekkhā ati sotāpanna ādayo satta tīsu sikkhāsu sikkhanti iti  sekkhāḥ arahantaḥ na sikkhanti iti asekkhāḥ tam tam kāraṇam paṭicca ekakā va
translated: “They are called ‘gone forth’ ” : seven trainees, stream-enterers, etc. “They train in the three trainings” :

original: catusaccaṃ bujjhitavantoti paccekabuddhā paccekamunino.🔽Munimunino vuccanti tathāgatāti ettha aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā tathāgato – tathā
analyzed: catusaccam bujjhitavanto ti paccekabuddhāḥ paccekamunino  muni muninaḥ vuccanti tathāgatāḥ ti ettha aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā tathāgataḥ tathā
translated: they are called “trainers.” Arahants do not train, thus they are called “non-trainers.” “They are called ‘paccekabuddhas’ ” : they are called “paccekabuddhas” because they awaken to the four truths by themselves, without a teacher.

original: āgatoti tathāgato, tathā gatoti tathāgato, tathalakkhaṇaṃ āgatoti tathāgato, tathadhamme🔽yāthāvato abhisambuddhoti tathāgato, tathadassitāya tathāgato, tathavāditāya tathāgato,🔽tathākāritāya tathāgato, abhibhavanaṭṭhena tathāgatoti.
analyzed: āgato ti tathāgato tathā gataḥ iti tathāgataḥ tatha lakkhaṇam āgataḥ ti tathāgataḥ tatha dhamme  yāthāvataḥ abhisambuddhaḥ iti tathāgato tatha dassitāya tathāgato tatha vāditāya tathāgato  tathā kāritāya tathāgataḥ abhibhavana ṭṭhena tathāgataḥ iti
translated: “They are called ‘munis’ ” : here, the Blessed One is a Tathāgata for eight reasons: he has come in accordance with the Dhamma , thus he is a Tathāgata; he has gone in accordance with the Dhamma, thus he is a Tathāgata; he has come to the characteristics of the Dhamma, thus he is a Tathāgata; he has fully awakened to the Dhamma as it really is, thus he is a Tathāgata; he has seen the Dhamma as it really is, thus he is a Tathāgata; he has taught the Dhamma as it really is, thus he is a Tathāgata; he has acted in accordance with the Dhamma, thus he is a Tathāgata; he is a Tathāgata in the sense of overcoming .

original: Kathaṃ bhagavā tathā āgatoti tathāgato? Yathā sabbalokahitāya ussukkamāpannā purimakā
analyzed: katham bhagavā tathā āgataḥ ti tathāgataḥ yathā sabbaloka hitāya ussukkam āpannā purimakā
translated: How is the Blessed One a Tathāgata because he has come in accordance with the Dhamma ? The Blessed One has come in accordance with the Dhamma of the perfections, in accordance with the Dhamma of the factors of enlightenment, in accordance with the Dhamma of the path, in accordance with the Dhamma of the fruits , in accordance with the Dhamma of the jhānas and the supernormal powers, in accordance with the Dhamma of the aggregates, sense bases, and elements, in accordance with the Dhamma of dependent origination, in accordance with the Dhamma of the faculties, in accordance with the Dhamma of the truths, in accordance with the Dhamma of the vehicle, in accordance with the Dhamma of the defilements, in accordance with the Dhamma of the purification of the defilements, in accordance with the Dhamma of the training rules, in accordance with the Dhamma of the offense and the non-offense, in accordance with the Dhamma of the blameworthy and the blameless, in accordance with the Dhamma of the condemnation and the non-condemnation, in accordance with the Dhamma of the offense entailing expulsion and the offense

original: sammāsambuddhā āgatā. Kiṃ vuttaṃ hoti? Yenābhinīhārena purimakā bhagavanto āgatā,
analyzed: sammāsambuddhāḥ āgatā kim vuttam hoti yena abhinīhārena purimakāḥ bhagavantaḥ āgatā
translated: The Fully Enlightened Ones have come. What is meant? By the aspiration by which the former Blessed Ones came,

original: teneva amhākampi bhagavā āgato. Atha vā yathā purimakā bhagavanto dānasīlanekkhammapaññāvīriyakhantisaccādhiṭṭhānamettupekkhāsaṅkhātā
analyzed: tena iva amhākam pi bhagavā āgataḥ atha vā yathā purimakāḥ bhagavantaḥ dāna sīla nekkhamma paññā vīriya khanti sacca adhiṭṭhāna mettu pekkhā saṅkhātā
translated: by that very aspiration our Blessed One has come. Or else, just as the former Blessed Ones fulfilled the thirty perfections called giving, virtue, renunciation, wisdom, energy, patience, truthfulness, determination, loving kindness, and equanimity,

original: dasa pāramiyo dasa upapāramiyo dasa paramatthapāramiyoti samatiṃsapāramiyo pūretvā
analyzed: dasa pāramiyaḥ dasa upapāramiyaḥ dasa paramattha pāramiyaḥ ti sama tiṃsa pāramiyaḥ pūretvā
translated: the ten primary and ten subsidiary perfections and the ten ultimate perfections,

original: aṅgapariccāgaṃ nayanadhanarajjaputtadārapariccāganti ime pañca mahāpariccāge pariccajitvā
analyzed: aṅga pariccāgam nayana dhana rajja putta dāra pariccāganti ime pañca mahā pariccāge pariccajitvā
translated: and after giving up the five great gifts of a limb, an eye, wealth, a kingdom, and a son and wife,

original: pubbayogapubbacariyadhammakkhānañātatthacariyādayo pūretvā buddhicariyāya koṭiṃ patvā
analyzed: pubba yoga pubba cariya dhamma kkhāna ñāta attha cariyā ādayaḥ pūretvā buddhi cariyāya koṭim patvā
translated: and after fulfilling the former practice, the former striving, the preaching of the Dhamma, the knowledge of the truth, the practice of the truth, and so on, and after reaching the pinnacle of the practice of the Buddha,

original: āgatā, tathā amhākampi bhagavā āgato. Yathā ca purimakā bhagavanto cattāro satipaṭṭhāne,
analyzed: āgatā tathā amhākam pi bhagavā āgataḥ yathā ca purimakāḥ bhagavanto cattāro sati paṭṭhāne
translated: they came, so has our Blessed One come. And just as the former Blessed Ones came after developing the four foundations of mindfulness,

original: cattāro sammappadhāne, cattāro iddhipāde, pañcindriyāni, pañca balāni, satta bojjhaṅge,
analyzed: cattāraḥ sammappadhāne cattāraḥ iddhipāde pañca indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅge
translated: the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power, the five spiritual faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of enlightenment,

original: ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ bhāvetvā pūretvā āgatā, tathā amhākampi bhagavā āgato.
analyzed: ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam bhāvetvā pūretvā āgatā tathā amhākam pi bhagavā āgataḥ
translated: Translation: ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ bhāvetvā pūretvā āgatā, tathā amhākampi bhagavā āgato.

original: Evaṃ tathā āgatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: evam tathā āgataḥ iti tathāgataḥ
translated: Evaṃ tathā āgatoti tathāgato.

original: “Yathā ca dīpaṅkarabuddhaādayo, sabbaññubhāvaṃ munayo idhāgatā;
analyzed: yathā ca dīpaṅkara buddha ādayaḥ sabbaññu bhāvam munayaḥ idha āgatāḥ
translated: Yathā dīpaṅkarabuddhādayo, sabbaññubhāvaṃ munayo idhāgatā;

original: Tathā ayaṃ sakyamunīpi āgato, tathāgato vuccati tena cakkhumā”ti.
analyzed: tathā ayam āgataḥ tathāgataḥ vuccati tena cakkhumā ti
translated: Tathā ayaṃ sakyamunīpi āgato, tathāgato vuccati tena cakkhumā”ti.

original: Kathaṃ tathā gatoti tathāgato? Yathā sampatijātā purimakā bhagavanto gatā. Kathañca🔽te gatā? Te hi sampatijātā samehi pādehi pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhāya uttarābhimukhā sattapadavītihārena gatā. Yathāha –
analyzed: katham tathā gatā iti tathāgataḥ yathā sampati jātā purimakāḥ bhagavantaḥ gatā kathañca  te gatā te hi sampati jātā samehi pādehi pathaviyam patiṭṭhāya uttara abhimukhā satta padavī tihārena gatā yathā āha
translated: Kathaṃ tathā gatoti tathāgato? Yathā sampatijātapubbakā bhagavanto gatā. Kathañca te gatā? Te hi sampatijātapubbakā bhagavanto samehi pādehi pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhāya uttarābhimukhā sattapadavītihārena gatā. Yathāha –

original: “Sampatijāto, ānanda, bodhisatto samehi pādehi pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhahitvā uttarābhimukho
analyzed: sampatijātaḥ ānanda bodhisatto samehi pādehi pathaviyam patiṭṭhahitvā uttara abhimukhaḥ
translated: “Sampatijāto kho, ānanda, bodhisatto samehi pādehi patiṭṭhahitvā uttarābhimukho

original: sattapadavītihārena gacchati, setamhi chatte anudhāriyamāne sabbā ca disā anuviloketi,🔽āsabhiñca vācaṃ bhāsati – ‘aggohamasmi lokassa, jeṭṭhohamasmi lokassa, seṭṭhohamasmi
analyzed: gacchati setamhi chatte anudhāriyamāne sabbā ca disā 🔽āsabhiḥ ca vācam bhāsati aggaḥ uham asmi lokassa jeṭṭhaḥ uham asmi lokassa seṭṭhaḥ uham asmi
translated: sattapadavītihārena gacchati setamhi chatte anudhāriyamāne sabb

original: lokassa, ayamantimā jāti, natthi dāni punabbhavo”’ti.
analyzed: lokassa ayam antimā jāti natthi dāni punabbhavoti
translated: “This is the last birth, now there is no renewal of being. ”

original: Tañcassa gamanaṃ tathaṃ ahosi avitathaṃ anekesaṃ visesādhigamānaṃ pubbanimittabhāvena.
analyzed: tat cassa gamanam tatham ahosi avitatham anekesam visesa adhigamānam pubba nimitta bhāvena
translated: And that going of his was true, not otherwise, in that it was the forerunner of the attainment of many special qualities.

original: Yañhi so sampatijāto samehi pādehi patiṭṭhāti, idamassa caturiddhipādapaṭilābhassa🔽pubbanimittaṃ. Uttaramukhabhāvo panassa sabbalokuttarabhāvassa pubbanimittaṃ. Sattapadavītihāro
analyzed: yat hi saḥ sampati jātaḥ samehi pādehi patiṭṭhāti idam assa catur iddhipāda paṭilābhassa  pubba nimittam uttara mukha bhāvaḥ pana sabba lokuttara bhāvassa pubba nimittam satta padavī tihāraḥ
translated: For when he stood firm with his feet placed evenly on the ground, this was the forerunner of his acquisition of the four bases for spiritual power;🔽and his facing north was the forerunner of his becoming the highest in the whole world;🔽and his taking seven strides was the forerunner of his acquisition of the seven gems of enlightenment;

original: sattabojjhaṅgaratanapaṭilābhassa. “Suvaṇṇadaṇḍā vītipatanti cāmarā”ti ettha vuttacāmarukkhepo🔽pana sabbatitthiyanimmadanassa. Setacchattadhāraṇaṃ arahattavimuttivaravimalasetacchattapaṭilābhassa.
analyzed: satta bojjhaṅga ratana paṭilābhassa suvaṇṇa daṇḍāḥ vītipatanti cāmarā ti ettha vutta cāmara ukkhepo  pana sabba titthiya nimmadanassa seta chatta dhāraṇam arahatta vimutti vara vimala seta chatta paṭilābhassa
translated: and the waving of the fans of coral-wood was the forerunner of his fanning away all the world’s defilements;🔽and the holding up of the white parasol was the forerunner of his acquisition of the supreme spotless liberation of the state of full enlightenment;

original: Sabbadisānuvilokanaṃ sabbaññutānāvaraṇañāṇapaṭilābhassa. Āsabhivācābhāsanaṃ pana🔽appaṭivattiyavaradhammacakkapavattanassa pubbanimittaṃ. Tathā ayaṃ bhagavāpi gato.
analyzed: sabbadisā anuvilokanam sabbaññu tā anāvaraṇa ñāṇa paṭilābhassa pana 🔽appaṭivattiya vara dhamma cakka pavattanassa pubba nimittam tathā ayam bhagavā api gataḥ
translated: and his surveying all the quarters was the forerunner of his acquisition of unobstructed knowledge of the whole world;🔽and his uttering the words “In the heavens above and the world below, I alone am the chief of seers” was the forerunner of his setting in motion the incomparable wheel of the True Idea that is irresistible and has but one sound.

original: Tañcassa gamanaṃ tathaṃ ahosi avitathaṃ tesaṃyeva visesādhigamānaṃ pubbanimittabhāvena. Tenāhu porāṇā –
analyzed: tat cassa gamanam tatham ahosi avitatham tesam yeva visesa adhigamānam pubba nimitta bhāvena tena āhu porāṇā
translated: And that going of his was such, was not otherwise, in that it was the forerunner of the attainment of those distinctions. Hence the Ancients said:🔽“As soon as he was born, the Leader of the Herd,

original: “Muhuttajātova gavampatī yathā, samehi pādehi phusī vasundharaṃ;
analyzed: muhutta jātā uva gavampatī yathā samehi pādehi phusī vasundharam
translated: With feet placed level, touched the earth;🔽Gotama took seven steps,

original: So vikkamī satta padāni gotamo, setañca chattaṃ anudhārayuṃ marū.
analyzed: saḥ vikkamī satta padāni gotamaḥ sa itam ca chattam marū
translated: And the Maras then were seen by him.🔽“Gotama took seven steps,

original: “Gantvāna so satta padāni gotamo, disā vilokesi samā samantato;
analyzed: gantvāna saḥ satta padāni gotamaḥ disā vilokesi samā samantataḥ
translated: And looked over the world in all directions;🔽He uttered speech endowed with eight factors,

original: Aṭṭhaṅgupetaṃ giramabbhudīrayi, sīho yathā pabbatamuddhaniṭṭhito”ti. ;
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅga upetam giram abbhudīrayi sīhaḥ yathā
translated: Like a lion on a mountain top” .

original: Evaṃ tathā gatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: evam tathā gataḥ iti tathāgataḥ
translated: So he is the Tathāgata because he has gone in such a way.

original: Atha vā yathā purimakā bhagavanto, ayampi bhagavā tatheva nekkhammena kāmacchandaṃ…pe…
analyzed: atha vā yathā purimakāḥ bhagavantaḥ ayam pi bhagavā tathā iva nekkhammena
translated: Or alternatively, just as the former Blessed Ones, so this Blessed One, by means of renunciation, went from the baits of sensual desires, …

original: paṭhamajjhānena nīvaraṇe…pe… aniccānupassanāya niccasaññaṃ…pe… arahattamaggena sabbakilese
analyzed: paṭhama jhānena anicca anupassanāya nicca saññaṃpe arahatta maggena sabba kilese
translated: by means of the first jhāna, from the hindrances, … by means of the contemplation of impermanence, from the perception of permanence, … by means of the path of arahatship, from all defilements,

original: pahāya gato, evampi tathā gatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: pahāya gataḥ evam pi tathā gataḥ iti tathāgataḥ
translated: and abandoned them. So he is the Tathāgata because he has gone in such a way.

original: Kathaṃ tathalakkhaṇaṃ āgatoti tathāgato? Pathavīdhātuyā kakkhaḷattalakkhaṇaṃ tathaṃ
analyzed: katham tatha lakkhaṇam āgataḥ ti tathāgataḥ pathavī dhātuyā kakkhaḷatta lakkhaṇam tatham
translated: How has he come to the state of such a specific characteristic? He has come to the state of the specific characteristic of the earth element as hardness,

original: avitathaṃ, āpodhātuyā paggharaṇalakkhaṇaṃ, tejodhātuyā uṇhattalakkhaṇaṃ, vāyodhātuyā
analyzed: avitatham āpaḥ dhātuyā paggharaṇa lakkhaṇam tejaḥ dhātuyā uṇhatta lakkhaṇam vāyo dhātuyā
translated: of the water element as cohesion, of the fire element as caloricity, of the air element as mobility,

original: vitthambhanalakkhaṇaṃ, ākāsadhātuyā asamphuṭṭhalakkhaṇaṃ, viññāṇadhātuyā vijānanalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: vitthambhana lakkhaṇam ākāsa dhātuyā asamphuṭṭha lakkhaṇam viññāṇa dhātuyā vijānana lakkhaṇam
translated: of the space element as invisibility, of the consciousness element as cognizing.

original: Rūpassa ruppanalakkhaṇaṃ, vedanāya vedayitalakkhaṇaṃ, saññāya sañjānanalakkhaṇaṃ, saṅkhārānaṃ abhisaṅkharaṇalakkhaṇaṃ, viññāṇassa vijānanalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: rūpassa ruppana lakkhaṇam vedanāya vedayita lakkhaṇam saññāya sañjānana lakkhaṇam saṅkhārānam abhisaṅkharaṇa lakkhaṇam viññāṇassa vijānana lakkhaṇam
translated: He has come to the state of the specific characteristic of material form as deformation, of feeling as the act of being felt, of perception as perceiving, of formations as forming, of consciousness as cognizing.

original: Vitakkassa abhiniropanalakkhaṇaṃ, vicārassa anumajjanalakkhaṇaṃ, pītiyā pharaṇalakkhaṇaṃ, sukhassa sātalakkhaṇaṃ, cittekaggatāya avikkhepalakkhaṇaṃ, phassassa phusanalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: vitakkassa abhiniropana lakkhaṇam vicārassa anumajjana lakkhaṇam pītiyā pharaṇa lakkhaṇam sukhassa sāta lakkhaṇam citta ekagga tāya avikkhepa lakkhaṇam phassassa phusana lakkhaṇam
translated: He has come to the state of the specific characteristic of applied thought as adverting, of sustained thought as pressing, of happiness as exhilaration, of bliss as soothing, of concentration as non-distraction, of contact as touching.

original: Saddhindriyassa adhimokkhalakkhaṇaṃ, vīriyindriyassa paggahalakkhaṇaṃ, satindriyassa upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṃ, samādhindriyassa avikkhepalakkhaṇaṃ, paññindriyassa pajānanalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: saddhi indriyassa adhimokkha lakkhaṇam vīriya indriyassa paggaha lakkhaṇam sati indriyassa upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇam samādhi indriyassa avikkhepa lakkhaṇam paññindriyassa pajānana lakkhaṇam
translated: The faculty of faith has the characteristic of resolution. The faculty of energy has the characteristic of exerting. The faculty of mindfulness has the characteristic of establishing. The faculty of concentration has the characteristic of non-distraction. The faculty of wisdom has the characteristic of penetrating.

original: Saddhābalassa assaddhiye akampiyalakkhaṇaṃ, vīriyabalassa kosajje, satibalassa muṭṭhassacce, samādhibalassa uddhacce, paññābalassa avijjāya akampiyalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: saddhā balassa a ssaddhiye akampiya lakkhaṇam vīriya balassa kosajje sati balassa muṭṭhassacce samādhi balassa uddhacce paññā balassa avijjāya akampiya lakkhaṇam
translated: The power of faith has the characteristic of unshakability by non-faith. The power of energy has the characteristic of unshakability by indolence. The power of mindfulness has the characteristic of unshakability by forgetfulness. The power of concentration has the characteristic of unshakability by agitation. The power of wisdom has the characteristic of unshakability by ignorance.

original: Satisambojjhaṅgassa upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṃ, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa pavicayalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅgassa upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇam dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgassa pavicaya lakkhaṇam
translated: The mindfulness factor of complete awakening has the characteristic of establishing. The investigation-of-states factor of complete awakening has the characteristic of investigating.

original: vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa paggahalakkhaṇaṃ, pītisambojjhaṅgassa pharaṇalakkhaṇaṃ, passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa
analyzed: vīriya sambojjhaṅgassa paggaha lakkhaṇam pīti sambojjhaṅgassa pharaṇa lakkhaṇam passaddhi sambojjhaṅgassa
translated: The energy factor of complete awakening has the characteristic of exerting. The rapture factor of complete awakening has the characteristic of pervading. The tranquillity factor of complete awakening has the characteristic of

original: upasamalakkhaṇaṃ, samādhisambojjhaṅgassa avikkhepalakkhaṇaṃ, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa
analyzed: upasama lakkhaṇam samādhi sambojjhaṅgassa avikkhepa lakkhaṇam upekkhā sambojjhaṅgassa
translated: calm. The concentration factor of complete awakening has the characteristic of non-distraction. The equanimity factor of complete awakening has the characteristic of

original: paṭisaṅkhānalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna lakkhaṇam
translated: reflection.

original: Sammādiṭṭhiyā dassanalakkhaṇaṃ, sammāsaṅkappassa abhiniropanalakkhaṇaṃ, sammāvācāya🔽pariggahalakkhaṇaṃ, sammākammantassa samuṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṃ, sammāājīvassa vodānalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhiyāḥ dassana lakkhaṇam sammāsaṅkappassa abhiniropana lakkhaṇam sammāvācāya  pariggaha lakkhaṇam sammākammantassa samuṭṭhāna lakkhaṇam sammāājīvassa vodāna lakkhaṇam
translated: Right view has the characteristic of seeing; right thought, of directing onto;🔽right speech, of delimitation; right action, of originating; right livelihood, of cleansing;

original: sammāvāyāmassa paggahalakkhaṇaṃ, sammāsatiyā upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṃ, sammāsamādhissa avikkhepalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: sammāvāyāmassa paggaha lakkhaṇam sammā satiyāḥ upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇam sammā samādhissa avikkhepa lakkhaṇam
translated: right effort, of exerting; right mindfulness, of establishing; right concentration, of non-distraction.

original: Avijjāya aññāṇalakkhaṇaṃ, saṅkhārānaṃ cetanālakkhaṇaṃ, viññāṇassa vijānanalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: avijjāya aññāṇa lakkhaṇam saṅkhārānam cetanā lakkhaṇam viññāṇassa vijānana lakkhaṇam
translated: Ignorance has the characteristic of non-penetration; formations, of volition; consciousness, of cognizing;

original: nāmassa namanalakkhaṇaṃ, rūpassa ruppanalakkhaṇaṃ, saḷāyatanassa āyatanalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: nāmassa namana lakkhaṇam rūpassa ruppana lakkhaṇam saḷāyatanassa āyatana lakkhaṇam
translated: mentality, of bending; materiality, of being molested; the sixfold base, of acting as a basis;

original: phassassa phusanalakkhaṇaṃ, vedanāya vedayitalakkhaṇaṃ, taṇhāya hetulakkhaṇaṃ, upādānassa
analyzed: phassassa phusana lakkhaṇam vedanāya vedayita lakkhaṇam taṇhāya hetu lakkhaṇam upādānassa
translated: contact, of touching; feeling, of being felt; craving, of driving ; clinging, of holding;

original: gahaṇalakkhaṇaṃ, bhavassa āyūhanalakkhaṇaṃ, jātiyā nibbattilakkhaṇaṃ, jarāya jīraṇalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: gahaṇa lakkhaṇam bhavassa āyūhana lakkhaṇam jātiyāḥ nibbatti lakkhaṇam jarāya jīraṇa lakkhaṇam
translated: existence, of accumulating; birth, of causing to be born; ageing, of causing to decay;

original: maraṇassa cutilakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: maraṇassa cuti lakkhaṇam
translated: death, of causing to die.

original: Dhātūnaṃ suññatalakkhaṇaṃ, āyatanānaṃ āyatanalakkhaṇaṃ, satipaṭṭhānānaṃ upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṃ,🔽sammappadhānānaṃ padahanalakkhaṇaṃ, iddhipādānaṃ ijjhanalakkhaṇaṃ, indriyānaṃ adhipatilakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: dhātūnam suññata lakkhaṇam āyatanānam āyatana lakkhaṇam sati paṭṭhānānam upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇam  sammappadhānānam padahana lakkhaṇam iddhipādānam ijjhana lakkhaṇam indriyānam adhipati lakkhaṇam
translated: The characteristic of the elements is voidness. The characteristic of the sense bases is their being the respective doors for the arising of the corresponding kinds of consciousness. The characteristic of the foundations of mindfulness is establishment.🔽The characteristic of the right efforts is exerting. The characteristic of the bases of success is succeeding. The characteristic of the faculties is predominance.

original: balānaṃ akampiyalakkhaṇaṃ, bojjhaṅgānaṃ niyyānalakkhaṇaṃ, maggassa hetulakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: balānaṃ akampiya lakkhaṇam bojjhaṅgānaṃ niyyāna lakkhaṇam maggassa hetu lakkhaṇam
translated: The characteristic of the powers is unshakability. The characteristic of the enlightenment factors is leading out. The characteristic of the path is cause.

original: Saccānaṃ tathalakkhaṇaṃ, samathassa avikkhepalakkhaṇaṃ, vipassanāya anupassanālakkhaṇaṃ, samathavipassanānaṃ ekarasalakkhaṇaṃ, yuganaddhānaṃ anativattanalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: saccānam tatha lakkhaṇam samathassa avikkhepa lakkhaṇam vipassanāya anupassanā lakkhaṇam samatha vipassanānam eka rasa lakkhaṇam yuga naddhānam an ativattana lakkhaṇam
translated: The characteristic of the truths is suchness. The characteristic of serenity is non-distraction. The characteristic of insight is contemplation. The characteristic of serenity and insight in union is single flavour. The characteristic of the yoked team is non-excess.

original: Sīlavisuddhiyā saṃvaraṇalakkhaṇaṃ, cittavisuddhiyā avikkhepalakkhaṇaṃ, diṭṭhivisuddhiyā
analyzed: sīla visuddhiyā saṃvaraṇa lakkhaṇam citta visuddhiyā avikkhepa lakkhaṇam diṭṭhi visuddhiyā
translated: The characteristic of purification of virtue is restraint. The characteristic of purification of consciousness is non-distraction. The characteristic of purification of view is

original: dassanalakkhaṇaṃ, khaye ñāṇassa samucchedalakkhaṇaṃ, anuppāde ñāṇassa passaddhilakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: dassana lakkhaṇam khaye ñāṇassa samuccheda lakkhaṇam anuppāde ñāṇassa passaddhi lakkhaṇam
translated: seeing. The characteristic of the knowledge of destruction is cutting off. The characteristic of the knowledge of non-arising is tranquillization.

original: chandassa mūlalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: chandassa mūlalakkhaṇaṃ
translated: The characteristic of zeal is root.

original: Manasikārassa samuṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṃ, phassassa samodhānalakkhaṇaṃ, vedanāya samosaraṇalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: manasikārassa samuṭṭhāna lakkhaṇam phassassa samodhāna lakkhaṇam vedanāya samosaraṇa lakkhaṇam
translated: Its characteristic is the arousing of attention. Its characteristic is the meeting together of the three. Its characteristic is the convergence of feeling.

original: samādhissa pamukhalakkhaṇaṃ, satiyā ādhipateyyalakkhaṇaṃ, paññāya tatuttariyalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: samādhissa pamukha lakkhaṇam satiyāḥ ādhipateyya lakkhaṇam paññāya tatuttariya lakkhaṇam
translated: Its characteristic is the predominance of concentration. Its characteristic is the sovereignty of mindfulness. Its characteristic is the surmounting of understanding.

original: vimuttiyā sāralakkhaṇaṃ, amatogadhassa nibbānassa pariyosānalakkhaṇaṃ tathaṃ avitathaṃ,
analyzed: vimuttiyā sāra lakkhaṇam amatogadhassa nibbānassa pariyosāna lakkhaṇam tatham avitatham
translated: Its characteristic is the heartwood of deliverance. Its characteristic is the culmination of the deathless Nibbāna.

original: etaṃ tathalakkhaṇaṃ ñāṇagatiyā āgato avirajjhitvā patto anuppattoti tathāgato. Evaṃ
analyzed: etam tatha lakkhaṇam ñāṇa gatiyā āgataḥ a virajjhitvā pattaḥ an uppattaḥ ti tathāgataḥ evam
translated: He has come to know and realized this suchlike characteristic, which is real and not unreal, not otherwise, without attachment, attained, attained completely. Thus he is the Tathāgata.

original: tathalakkhaṇaṃ āgatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: tathalakkhaṇam āgato ti tathāgataḥ
translated: He has come to the suchlike characteristic: thus he is the Tathāgata.

original: Kathaṃ tathadhamme yāthāvato abhisambuddhoti tathāgato? Tathadhammā nāma cattāri ariyasaccāni. Yathāha –
analyzed: katham tathadhamme yāthāvataḥ abhisambuddhaḥ ti tathāgataḥ tathadhammā nāma cattāri ariya saccāni yathā āha
translated: How is it that he is the Tathāgata because he has discovered the suchlike real state of things? The suchlike real state of things is the four noble truths, according as it is said:

original: “Cattārimāni, bhikkhave, tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni. Katamāni cattāri? ‘Idaṃ dukkha’nti, bhikkhave, tathametaṃ avitathametaṃ anaññathameta”nti vitthāro.
analyzed: cattāri imāni bhikkhave tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni katamāni cattāri idam dukkhan ti bhikkhave tatham etam avitatham etam anaññatham etam ti vitthāraḥ
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these four suchlike things that are not otherwise. What four? ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering’: this is the suchlike, not otherwise, of things” .

original: Tāni ca bhagavā abhisambuddhoti tathānaṃ abhisambuddhattā tathāgatoti vuccati. Abhisambuddhattho hi ettha gatasaddo.
analyzed: tāni ca bhagavā abhisambuddhaḥ ti tathānam abhisambuddha ttā tathāgato ti vuccati abhisambuddha atthaḥ hi ettha gata saddo
translated: and the Blessed One has awakened to that, thus he is the “Awakened One” . The word “gone” has the meaning of “awakened” here.

original: Api ca jarāmaraṇassa jātipaccayasambhūtasamudāgataṭṭho tatho avitatho anaññatho…pe…
analyzed: api ca jarā maraṇassa jāti paccaya sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭho tathaḥ avitathaḥ anaññathā upe
translated: Furthermore, the meaning of “arisen” and “originated” through the condition of birth in aging-and-death is “thus,” not otherwise, not otherwise. …

original: saṅkhārānaṃ avijjāpaccayasambhūtasamudāgataṭṭho tatho avitatho anaññatho. Tathā avijjāya
analyzed: saṅkhārānaṃ avijjā paccaya sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭho tathaḥ avitathaḥ anaññathaḥ tathā avijjāya
translated: The meaning of “arisen” and “originated” through the condition of ignorance in formations is “thus,” not otherwise, not otherwise. Thus the meaning of the condition of ignorance

original: saṅkhārānaṃ paccayaṭṭho…pe… jātiyā jarāmaraṇassa paccayaṭṭho tatho avitatho anaññatho.🔽Taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavā abhisambuddho, tassāpi tathānaṃ abhisambuddhattā tathāgato. Evaṃ
analyzed: saṅkhārānam paccaya ṭṭho upe jātiyā jarā maraṇassa paccaya ṭṭho tathaḥ avitathaḥ anaññathaḥ  tam sabbam bhagavā abhisambuddhaḥ tassa api tathānam abhisambuddha ttā tathāgataḥ evam
translated: in formations … the meaning of the condition of birth in aging-and-death is “thus,” not otherwise, not otherwise.🔽The Blessed One has awakened to all that, thus he is the “Awakened One” .

original: tathadhamme yāthāvato abhisambuddhoti tathāgato.🔽Kathaṃ tathadassitāya tathāgato? Bhagavā yaṃ sadevake loke…pe… sadevamanussāya pajāya
analyzed: tatha dhamme yāthāvataḥ abhisambuddhaḥ ti tathāgataḥ  katham tatha dassitāya tathāgataḥ bhagavā yam sa devake lokepe sa deva manussāya pajāya
translated: Thus he is the “Awakened One” because he has awakened to the “thusness” of things as they really are.🔽How is he the “Awakened One” because he has seen “thus”? The Blessed One has seen the visible form that comes into the eye’s focus in the world with its gods …

original: aparimāṇāsu lokadhātūsu aparimāṇānaṃ sattānaṃ cakkhudvāre āpāthaṃ āgacchantaṃ rūpārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: aparimāṇāsu lokadhātūsu aparimāṇānam sattānam cakkhu dvāre āpātham āgacchantam rūpa ārammaṇam
translated: in the generation with its rulers and its men …

original: nāma atthi, taṃ sabbākārena jānāti passati. Evaṃ jānatā passatā ca tena taṃ iṭṭhāniṭṭhādivasena🔽vā diṭṭhasutamutaviññātesu labbhamānakapadavasena vā “katamaṃ taṃ rūpaṃ rūpāyatanaṃ?
analyzed: nāma atthi tam sabba ākārena jānāti passati evam jānatā passatā ca tena tam iṭṭha aniṭṭha ādi vasena  vā diṭṭha suta muta viññātesu labbhamānaka pada vasena vā katamam tam rūpam rūpa āyatanam
translated: He knows and sees it in all its modes. And when he knows and sees thus, then whatever states there are that are liable to destruction, he understands: ‘All states are impermanent.’ Whatever states there are that are liable to sorrow, he understands: ‘All states are painful.’ Whatever states there are that are liable to change, he understands: ‘All dhammas are not self.’🔽“What is that material form that is the form base?🔽That material form which is derived from the four great elements and is colour and shape, visible, impinging, blue, yellow, red, white, long, short, square, round, large, small, low, high, even, uneven, bright, dim, soft, rough, the moon, the sun, dust, smoke, mist, cloud, shadow, light, darkness, lightning—

original: Yaṃ rūpaṃ catunnaṃ mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya vaṇṇanibhā sanidassanaṃ sappaṭighaṃ nīlaṃ🔽pītaka”ntiādinā nayena anekehi nāmehi terasahi vārehi dvipaññāsāya nayehi vibhajjamānaṃ
analyzed: yam rūpam catunnam mahābhūtānam upādāya vaṇṇa nibhā sa nidassanam sa paṭigham nīlam  pītakanti ādinā nayena anekehi nāmehi terasahi vārehi dvipaññāsāya nayehi vibhajjamānam
translated: that is the material form that is the form base.

original: tathameva hoti, vitathaṃ natthi. Esa nayo sotadvārādīsupi āpāthamāgacchantesu saddādīsu.
analyzed: tatham eva hoti vitatham natthi sadda ādīsu
translated: So it is in the case of sounds cognizable by the ear … in the case of odours cognizable by the nose … in the case of flavours cognizable by the tongue … in the case of tangibles cognizable by the body … in the case of mind-objects cognizable by the mind.

original: Vuttampi cetaṃ bhagavatā –🔽“Yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa…pe… sadevamanussāya pajāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ
analyzed: vuttam pi ca itam bhagavatā  yam bhikkhave sa devakassa lokassape sa deva manussāya pajāya diṭṭham sutam mutam
translated: And this is said by the Blessed One:🔽“Bhikkhus, whatever in this world—with its devas, Māras, and Brahmās, this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans—is seen, heard, sensed, cognized, reached, sought after, pondered by the mind, that has been fully awakened to by the Tathāgata.

original: viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tamahaṃ jānāmi…pe… tamahaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ.
analyzed: viññātam pattam pariyesitam anuvicaritam manasā tam aham jānāmi pe tam aham abbhaññāsim
translated: The Tathāgata is liberated from reckoning in terms of the world;

original: Taṃ tathāgatassa viditaṃ, taṃ tathāgato na upaṭṭhāsī”ti.
analyzed: tam tathāgatassa viditam tam tathāgataḥ na upaṭṭhāsi iti
translated: he is deep, immeasurable, hard to fathom like the ocean.

original: Evaṃ tathadassitāya tathāgato. Tattha tathadassīatthe tathāgatoti padasambhavo veditabbo.
analyzed: evam tathā dassitāya tathāgato tattha tathadassīatthe tathāgato ti pada sambhavaḥ veditabbo
translated: Thus he is the Enlightened One because of seeing thus. The derivation of the word should be understood in this way as “the Tathāgata because of seeing thus in that way.”

original: Kathaṃ tathavāditāya tathāgato? Yaṃ rattiṃ bhagavā bodhimaṇḍe aparājitapallaṅke nisinno
analyzed: katham tathavāditāya tathāgataḥ yam rattim bhagavā bodhimaṇḍe aparājita pallaṅke nisinnaḥ
translated: How is he the Tathāgata because of speaking thus? On the night when the Blessed One, sitting in the invincible seat of enlightenment,

original: catunnaṃ mārānaṃ matthakaṃ madditvā anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddho, yañca
analyzed: catunnam mārānam matthakam madditvā anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ yat ca
translated: after crushing the head of the four Māras, reached the supreme full enlightenment,

original: rattiṃ yamakasālānamantare anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyi, etthantare pañcacattālīsavassaparimāṇe
analyzed: rattim yamaka sālānam antare an upādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyi ettha antare pañcacattālīsa vassa parimāṇe
translated: and on the night when, between the twin sāla trees, he attained final Nibbāna in the element of Nibbāna that has no substrate remaining for further existence, during the period of forty-five years that intervened,

original: kāle paṭhamabodhiyampi majjhimabodhiyampi pacchimabodhiyampi yaṃ bhagavatā bhāsitaṃ
analyzed: kāle majjhima bodhiyam pi pacchima bodhiyam pi yam bhagavatā bhāsitam
translated: whether in the first, middle, or final period of his teaching, whatever the Blessed One spoke,🔽whether sutta, geyya, … or vedalla, all that is irreproachable in meaning and phrasing,

original: suttaṃ geyyaṃ…pe… vedallaṃ. Sabbaṃ taṃ atthato byañjanato ca anupavajjaṃ anūnamanadhikaṃ
analyzed: suttam geyyam pe vedallam sabbam tam atthataḥ byañjanato ca anupavajjam anūnam anadhikam
translated: neither less nor more, complete, perfect,

original: sabbākāraparipuṇṇaṃ rāgamadanimmadanaṃ dosamohamadanimmadanaṃ, natthi tattha vālaggamattampi
analyzed: sabba ākāra paripuṇṇam rāga mada nimmadanam dosa moha mada nimmadanam natthi tattha vā ālagga mattam pi
translated: and fully purified. It is the crushing of lust, hate, and delusion. There is not even so much as a single syllable in it that is spoken without reference to the crushing of lust, hate, and delusion.

original: pakkhalitaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ ekamuddikāya lañchitaṃ viya, ekanāḷiyā mitaṃ viya, ekatulāya
analyzed: pakkhalitam sabbam tam eka muddikāya lañchitam viya eka nāḷiyā mitam viya eka tulāya
translated: and all that is as if branded with the one seal, as if measured with the one rule, as if weighed with the one balance,

original: tulitaṃ viya ca tathameva hoti avitathaṃ anaññathaṃ. Yathāha –
analyzed: tulitam viya ca tatham eva hoti avitatham anaññatham yathā āha
translated: and it is so and not otherwise. As it is said:

original: “Yañca, cunda, rattiṃ tathāgato anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambujjhati, yañca rattiṃ
analyzed: yañca cunda rattim tathāgataḥ anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambujjhati yañca rattim
translated: “Whatever the Tathāgata speaks, utters, or expounds by the voice,

original: anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati, yaṃ etasmiṃ antare bhāsati lapati niddisati,
analyzed: an upādisesāya nibbāna dhātuyā parinibbāyati yam etasmin antare bhāsati lapati niddisati
translated: whatever he says in the interval between his supreme enlightenment and his attainment of final Nibbāna,

original: sabbaṃ taṃ tatheva hoti no aññathā, tasmā ‘tathāgato’ti vuccatī”ti.
analyzed: sabbam tam tathā iva hoti no aññathā tasmā tathāgataḥ iti vuccati iti
translated: all that is so and not otherwise. Therefore he is called the Tathāgata” .

original: Gadaattho hi ettha gatasaddo. Evaṃ tathavāditāya tathāgato.
analyzed: gada atthaḥ hi ettha gata saddo evam tathavāditāya tathāgataḥ
translated: For the word gata here has the meaning of “gone” . This is how the Tathāgata is so called because of his speech that is so in such a way.

original: Api ca āgadanaṃ āgado, vacananti attho. Tatho aviparīto āgado assāti dakārassa takāraṃ katvā tathāgatoti evametasmiṃ atthe padasiddhi veditabbā.
analyzed: api ca āgadanam āgadaḥ vacananti aviparītaḥ āgadaḥ assa ati dakārassa takāram katvā tathāgataḥ iti evam etasmin atthe pada siddhi veditabbā
translated: Moreover, āgati is coming, speech is the meaning; he has that, thus he is a tathāgata, making the t of the tathā into the th of the tathāgata. This is how the derivation of the word should be understood in this sense.

original: Kathaṃ tathākāritāya tathāgato? Bhagavato hi vācāya kāyo anulometi, kāyassāpi vācā.
analyzed: katham tathā kāritāya tathāgataḥ bhagavataḥ hi vācāya kāyaḥ kāyassa api vācā
translated: How is he the Tathāgata because of his conduct that is so in such a way? The Blessed One’s body conforms to his speech and his speech to his body.

original: Tasmā yathāvādī tathākārī, yathākārī tathāvādī ca hoti. Evaṃbhūtassa cassa yathā
analyzed: tasmai yathāvādī tathākārī yathākārī tathāvādī ca hoti evaṃbhūtassa ca ssa yathā
translated: So he is one who acts as he speaks and speaks as he acts. And his body has gone the way of his speech,

original: vācā, kāyopi tathā gato pavattoti attho. Yathā ca kāyo, vācāpi tathā gatā pavattāti🔽tathāgato. Tenevāha – “yathāvādī, bhikkhave, tathāgato tathākārī, yathākārī tathāvādī.🔽Iti yathāvādī tathākārī, yathākārī tathāvādī. ‘Tasmā tathāgato’ti vuccatī”ti. Evaṃ
analyzed: vācā kāyaḥ api tathā gato pavattoti atthaḥ yathā ca kāyaḥ vācā api tathā gatā pavattā ati  tathāgato tena iva āha yathāvādī bhikkhave tathāgataḥ tathākārī yathākārī tathāvādī  iti yathāvādī tathākārī yathākārī tathāvādī tasmai tathāgataḥ ti vuccati iti evam
translated: his speech the way of his body. So the meaning is that his body and speech are in conformity. And his speech has gone the way of his body,

original: tathākāritāya tathāgato.
analyzed: tathākāritāya tathāgataḥ
translated: his body the way of his speech. So the meaning is that his body and speech are in conformity. That is why he is called the Tathāgata. Thus he is the Tathāgata because he acts in conformity with the truth.

original: Kathaṃ abhibhavanaṭṭhena tathāgato? Upari bhavaggaṃ heṭṭhā avīciṃ pariyantaṃ katvā
analyzed: katham abhibhavana ṭṭhena tathāgataḥ upari bhavaggam heṭṭhā avīcim pariyantam katvā
translated: How is he the Tathāgata in the sense of overcoming?

original: tiriyaṃ aparimāṇāsu lokadhātūsu sabbasatte abhibhavati sīlena samādhinā paññāya vimuttiyā🔽vimuttiñāṇadassanena, na tassa tulā vā pamāṇaṃ vā atthi, atha kho atulo appameyyo
analyzed: tiriyam aparimāṇāsu lokadhātūsu sabba satte abhibhavati sīlena samādhinā paññāya vimuttiyā  vimutti ñāṇa dassanena na tassa tulā vā pamāṇam vā atthi atha kho atulaḥ appameyyaḥ
translated: He has overcome all beings in the immeasurable world systems that lie in the three times, in the ten directions, above and below, in the sense of virtue, concentration, understanding, deliverance,

original: anuttaro rājātirājā devānaṃ atidevo sakkānaṃ atisakko brahmānaṃ atibrahmā. Tenāha –
analyzed: anuttaraḥ rājā atirājā devānam atidevaḥ sakkānam atisakkaḥ brahmānam atibrahmā tena āha
translated: and the knowledge and vision of deliverance. There is no one equal to him, let alone anyone greater. He has no superior, or equal, or rival. He is unique, incomparable, matchless, peerless, unsurpassed, the best, the foremost, the highest, supreme, the unsur- passed one, the tamer of the untamed, the supreme teacher. That is why he is called the Tathāgata. Thus he is the Tathāgata because he has overcome.🔽How is he the Tathāgata in the sense of leading?

original: “Sadevake, bhikkhave, loke…pe… sadevamanussāya pajāya tathāgato abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī, tasmā ‘tathāgato’ti vuccatī”ti.
analyzed: sa devake bhikkhave lokepe sa deva manussāya pajāya tathāgataḥ an abhibhūtaḥ añña datthudasaḥ vasa vattī tasmā tathāgataḥ iti vuccati iti
translated: “Bhikkhus, the Tathagata, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is the vanquisher of all, the ender of all, the knower of all, the seer of all, the master of all, the comprehender of all, the expounder of all, the overcomer of all, the enlightener of all, the proclaimer of all, the Buddha, the Lord.

original: Tatthevaṃ padasiddhi veditabbā – agado viya agado. Ko panesa? Desanāvilāso ceva puññussayo🔽ca. Tena hesa mahānubhāvo bhisakko dibbāgadena sappe viya sabbaparappavādino sadevakañca
analyzed: tattha ivam veditabbā agadaḥ viya agadaḥ kaḥ pana isa desanā vilāsaḥ ca iva puññussayo  ca tena ha isa mahā anubhāvaḥ bhisakkaḥ dibbāgadena sappe viya sabba para ppavādinaḥ sa devakam ca
translated: The word “Tathāgata” should be understood as follows: “agada” is a medicine. What is that? It is the display of teaching and the store of merit.🔽Therefore, this one of great power, like a doctor with a divine medicine, vanquishes all opposing doctrines and the world with its gods.

original: lokaṃ abhibhavati. Iti sabbalokābhibhavane tatho aviparīto desanāvilāsamayo ceva
analyzed: lokam abhibhavati iti sabba loka abhibhavane aviparītaḥ desanā vilāsa mayaḥ ca iva
translated: Thus, in the vanquishing of all the world, the medicine of the display of teaching and the medicine of merit are not otherwise, not wrongly, but are just so.

original: puññamayo ca agado assāti dakārassa takāraṃ katvā tathāgatoti veditabbo. Evaṃ abhibhavanaṭṭhena tathāgato.
analyzed: puñña mayaḥ ca agadaḥ assa ati dakārassa takāram katvā tathāgataḥ iti veditabbaḥ evam abhibhavana ṭṭhena tathāgataḥ
translated: Therefore, he should be understood as the Tathāgata, by changing the “da” to “ta”. Thus, the Tathāgata is in the sense of vanquishing.

original: Api ca tathāya gatotipi tathāgato, tathaṃ gatotipi tathāgato. Gatoti avagato, atīto
analyzed: api ca tathāya gata utipi tathāgataḥ tatham gata utipi tathāgataḥ gata uti avagataḥ atītaḥ
translated: Moreover, he is the Tathāgata because he has gone thus, and he is the Tathāgata because he has gone in such a way. “Gone” means understood, passed beyond,

original: patto paṭipannoti attho. Tattha sakalaṃ lokaṃ tīraṇapariññāya tathāya gato avagatoti
analyzed: patto paṭipanno ti attho tattha sakalam lokam tīraṇa pariññāya tathāya gataḥ avagataḥ ti
translated: attained, and entered upon. Therein, he has gone thus, he has understood, by means of the full understanding of the crossing of the entire world.

original: tathāgato, lokasamudayaṃ pahānapariññāya tathāya gato atītoti tathāgato, lokanirodhaṃ🔽sacchikiriyāya tathāya gato pattoti tathāgato, lokanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ tathaṃ
analyzed: tathāgataḥ loka samudayam pahāna pariññāya tathāya gataḥ atītaḥ iti tathāgataḥ loka nirodham  sacchikiriyāya tathāya gataḥ patto ti tathāgataḥ loka nirodha gāminim paṭipadam
translated: The Realised One has gone thus to the passing away of the origin of the world through full understanding, thus he is the Realised One, the Realised One has gone thus, has attained, through realisation, the cessation of the world, thus he is the Realised One, the Realised One has gone thus, has developed,🔽🔽

original: gato paṭipannoti tathāgato. Tena yaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā –
analyzed: gataḥ paṭipannaḥ ti tathāgataḥ tena yam vuttam bhagavatā
translated: The Realised One has gone thus to the passing away of the origin of the world through full understanding of giving up, thus he is the Realised One, the Realised One has gone thus to the realisation of the cessation of the world, thus he is the Realised One, the Realised One has gone thus to the practice leading to the cessation of the world through practice, thus he is the Realised One. Therefore it was said by the Fortunate One:

original: “Loko, bhikkhave, tathāgatena abhisambuddho, lokasmā tathāgato visaṃyutto. Lokasamudayo,🔽bhikkhave, tathāgatena abhisambuddho, lokasamudayo tathāgatassa pahīno. Lokanirodho,
analyzed: lokaḥ bhikkhave tathāgatena abhisambuddhaḥ lokasmā tathāgataḥ visaṃyuttaḥ loka samudayaḥ  bhikkhave tathāgatena abhisambuddhaḥ loka samudayaḥ tathāgatassa pahīnaḥ loka nirodho
translated: “The world, monks, is realised by the Realised One, the Realised One is detached from the world. The origination of the world,🔽monks, is realised by the Realised One, the origination of the world is given up by the Realised One. The cessation of the world,

original: bhikkhave, tathāgatena abhisambuddho, lokanirodho tathāgatassa sacchikato. Lokanirodhagāminī🔽paṭipadā, bhikkhave, tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, lokanirodhagāminī paṭipadā tathāgatassa
analyzed: bhikkhave tathāgatena abhisambuddhaḥ loka nirodhaḥ tathāgatassa sacchikataḥ loka nirodha gāminī  paṭipadā bhikkhave tathāgatena abhisambuddhā loka nirodha gāminī paṭipadā tathāgatassa
translated: monks, is realised by the Realised One, the cessation of the world is experienced by the Realised One. The practice leading to the cessation of the world,

original: bhāvitā. Yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa…pe… anuvicaritaṃ manasā, sabbaṃ taṃ
analyzed: bhāvitā yam bhikkhave sa devakassa lokassape anuvicaritam manasā sabbam tam
translated: monks, is realised by the Realised One, the practice leading to the cessation of the world is developed by the Realised One. Whatever, monks, in this world with its Divinities,

original: tathāgatena abhisambuddhaṃ. Tasmā ‘tathāgato’ti vuccatī”ti.
analyzed: tathāgatena abhisambuddham tasmai tathāgataḥ iti vuccati iti
translated: and it was discovered by the Tathāgata. Therefore he is called the Tathāgata.”

original: Tassa evampi attho veditabbo. Idampi ca tathāgatassa tathāgatabhāvadīpena mukhamattameva.
analyzed: tassa evam pi atthaḥ veditabbaḥ idam pi ca tathāgatassa tathāgata bhāva dīpena mukham attam eva
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way. And this is only a mere indication of the Tathāgata’s Tathāgatahood by the light of the Tathāgata’s Tathāgatahood.

original: Sabbākārena pana tathāgatova tathāgatassa tathāgatabhāvaṃ vaṇṇeyya. Yasmā pana sabbabuddhā
analyzed: sabba ākārena pana tathāgataḥ uva tathāgatassa tathāgata bhāvam vaṇṇeyya yasmā pana sabba buddhāḥ
translated: But only a Tathāgata could expound the Tathāgata’s Tathāgatahood in all its aspects.🔽But since all Buddhas are equal in the qualities of a Tathāgata,

original: tathāgataguṇenāpi samasamā, tasmā sabbesaṃ vasena “tathāgatā”ti āha.
analyzed: tathāgata guṇena api samasamā tasmā sabbesam vasena tathāgatā iti āha
translated: he said “Tathāgatas” in the plural.
