translated: “The undertaking of energy” is the taking up of energy. “Greed” is a particle in the sense of “one by one.” “Sinews” are the sinewy cords. “Bones” are the bones. “Let the flesh and blood dry up” means let all the flesh and blood become dry. “Skin” is one part, “sinews” is one part, “bones” is one part, “let the flesh and blood dry up” is one part. “What remains” is the remaining skeleton.

original: sambandho. Purisathāmenāti purisassa kāyikena balena, balenāti ñāṇabalena. Vīriyenāti
analyzed: sambandho purisa thāmena ati purisassa kāyikena balena balena ati ñāṇa balena vīriyena ati
translated: ‘Bond’: the man’s bodily strength. ‘Strength’: the strength of knowledge. ‘Energy’:

original: cetasikañāṇavīriyatejena. Parakkamenāti paraṃ paraṃ ṭhānaṃ akkamanena ussāhappattavīriyena.
analyzed: cetasika ñāṇa vīriya tejena parakkamena ati param param ṭhānam akkamanena ussāha ppatta vīriyena
translated: the energy of the mind and of knowledge. ‘Effort’: by going further and further, by the energy that has reached the climax.🔽‘To be reached’: what is to be attained. ‘Without having reached it’: without having attained what is to be reached. ‘The slackness of energy’: the slackness, the flabbiness, of the kind of energy stated.

original: Pattabbanti yaṃ taṃ pāpuṇitabbaṃ. Na taṃ apāpuṇitvāti taṃ pattabbaṃ appatvā. Vīriyassa🔽saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatīti vuttappakārassa vīriyassa sithilattaṃ osīdanaṃ na bhavissati.
analyzed: pattabbanti yam tam pāpuṇitabbam na tam a pāpuṇitvā ati tam pattabbam ap patvā vīriyassa  saṇṭhānam bhavissati iti vutta ppakārassa vīriyassa sithila ttam osīdanam na bhavissati
translated: ‘The slackness of energy will not come to be’ means that it will not be. ‘The state of being slack’: the state of being flabby. ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’: the flabby state will not come to be.🔽‘The state of being slack will not come to be’ means that it will not be. ‘The state of being slack’: the state of being flabby. ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’: the flabby state will not come to be.🔽‘The state of being slack will not come to be’ means that it will not be. ‘The state of being slack’: the state of being flabby. ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’: the flabby state will not come to be.🔽‘The state of being slack will not come to be’ means that it will not be. ‘The state of being slack’: the state of being flabby. ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’: the flabby state will not come to be.🔽‘The state of being slack will not come to be’ means that it will not be. ‘The state of being slack’: the state of being flabby. ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’: the flabby state will not come to be.🔽‘The state of being slack will not come to be’ means that it will not be. ‘The state of being slack’: the state of being flabby. ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’: the flabby state will not come to be.

original: “Paṭṭhāna”ntipi pāṭho, ayamevattho. Cittaṃ paggaṇhātīti cittaṃ ussāhaṃ gaṇhāpeti.
analyzed: paṭṭhānam tipi pāṭhaḥ ayam eva atthaḥ cittam paggaṇhāti iti cittam ussāham gaṇhāpeti
translated: ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’ means that it will not be. ‘The state of being slack’: the state of being flabby. ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’: the flabby state will not come to be.

original: Padahatīti patiṭṭhāpeti.🔽Nāsissanti na khādissāmi na bhuñjissāmi. Na pivissāmīti yāgupānādīni na pivissāmi.🔽Vihārato na nikkhameti senāsanato bahi na nikkhameyyaṃ. Napi passaṃ nipātessanti
analyzed: padahati iti patiṭṭhāpeti 🔽na āsissanti na khādissāmi na bhuñjissāmi na pivissāmi iti yāgu pāna ādīni na pivissāmi 🔽vihārataḥ na nikkhameti senāsanataḥ bahi na nikkhameyyam na pi passam nipātessanti
translated: ‘The state of being slack will not come to be’ means that it will not be. ‘

original: passaṃ mañce vā pīṭhe vā bhūmiyaṃ vā kaṭasantharake vā pātanaṃ ṭhapanaṃ na karissāmi.
analyzed: passam mañce vā pīṭhe vā bhūmiyam vā kaṭasantharake vā pātanam ṭhapanam na karissāmi
translated: I will not put it down or lay it aside on a couch, a chair, or on the bare ground, on a mat, or on a straw mat.

original: Taṇhāsalle anūhateti taṇhāsaṅkhāte kaṇḍe anuddhaṭe, avigateti attho.
analyzed: taṇhā salle taṇhā saṅkhāte kaṇḍe anuddhaṭe a vigatā iti attho
translated: Taṇhāsalle anūhate: the ‘taṇhā-wound’ is the craving called ‘taṇhā’; when it is not dug out, not removed, is what is meant.

original: Imaṃ pallaṅkanti samantato ābhujitaṃ ūrubaddhāsanaṃ. Na bhindissāmīti na vijahissāmi.
analyzed: imam samantataḥ ābhujitam ūru baddha āsanam na bhindissāmi iti na vijahissāmi
translated: Imaṃ pallaṅkaṃ: the sitting mat spread all round and tied with a waistband. Na bhindissāmi: I will not abandon.

original: Yāva me na anupādāyāti catūhi upādānehi gahaṇaṃ aggahetvā. Āsavehīti kāmāsavādīhi🔽catūhi āsavehi. Vimuccissatīti samucchedavimuttiyā na muccissati. Na tāvāhaṃ imamhā
analyzed: yāva me na an upādāya ati catūhi upādānehi gahaṇam aggahetvā āsavehi iti kāma āsava ādīhi  catūhi āsavehi vimuccissati iti samuccheda vimuttiyāḥ na muccissati na tāva aham imamhā
translated: Yāva me na anupādāya āsavā na parikkhayaṃ gacchantīti: as long as I do not grasp the four kinds of clinging, the taints of sense desire, etc.,

original: āsanā vuṭṭhahissāmīti ādiṃ katvā yāva rukkhamūlā nikkhamissāmīti okāsavasena vuttā.
analyzed: āsanā vuṭṭhahissāmi iti ādim katvā yāva rukkha mūlā nikkhamissāmi iti okāsa vasena vuttā
translated: the four taints, I will not be liberated by the liberation of eradication. Na tāvāhaṃ imamhā āsanaṃ vuṭṭhahissāmīti: I will not rise from this seat, etc., until I go out from the root of the tree, etc.

original: Imasmiññeva pubbaṇhasamayaṃ ariyadhammaṃ āharissāmīti ādiṃ katvā yāva gimheti kālavasena
analyzed: imasmin ñeva pubbaṇhasamayam ariya dhammam āharissāmi iti ādim katvā yāva gimhā iti kāla vasena
translated: Imasmiññeva pubbaṇhasamayaṃ ariyadhammaṃ āharissāmīti: I will bring forth the noble truth, etc., until the hot season, etc.🔽The first section, etc., is stated according to the place,

original: vuttā. Purime vayokhandhetiādayo vayavasena vuttā. Tattha āsanā na vuṭṭhahissāmīti
analyzed: vuttā purime vayaḥ khandha iti ādayaḥ vaya vasena vuttā tattha āsanā na vuṭṭhahissāmi iti
translated: the second, according to the time,🔽and the third, according to the age.

original: nisinnāsanā na uṭṭhahissāmi. Aḍḍhayogāti nikuṇḍagehā. Pāsādāti dīghapāsādā. Hammiyāti
analyzed: nisinna āsanā na uṭṭhahissāmi aḍḍhayogā ati nikuṇḍagehā pāsādā ati dīghapāsādā hammiyā ati
translated: I will not rise from my seat. Aḍḍhayogas are houses with projecting gables. Pāsādas are long houses. Hammiyas are

original: muṇḍacchadanagehā. Guhāyāti paṃsuguhāya. Leṇāti mariyādachinnacchiddā pabbataleṇā.
analyzed: muṇḍacchadana gehā guhāya ati paṃsu guhāya leṇā ati mariyāda chinna chiddā pabbata leṇā
translated: I will not rise from my seat. Aḍḍhayogā means a house with a courtyard. Pāsāda means a long house. Hammiya means a house with a peaked roof. Guhā means a cave of clay. Leṇa means a cave in a rock with a defined entrance.

original: Kuṭiyāti ullittādikuṭiyā. Kūṭāgārāti kaṇṇikaṃ āropetvā katagehato. Aṭṭāti dvāraṭṭālakā.🔽Māḷāti vaṭṭagehā. Uddaṇḍo nāma eko patissayaviseso. “Tichadanageho”tipi eke. Upaṭṭhānasālāti🔽sannipātasālā bhojanasālā vā. Maṇḍapādayo pākaṭāyeva. Ariyadhammanti anavajjadhammaṃ,
analyzed: kuṭiyā ati ullitta ādi kuṭiyā kūṭāgārā iti kaṇṇikam āropetvā kata gehataḥ aṭṭā ati dvāra aṭṭālakā  māḷā ti vaṭṭa gehā uddaṇḍaḥ nāma eko patissaya viseso ti chadana geho ti pi eke upaṭṭhāna sālā ati  sannipāta sālāḥ bhojana sālāḥ vā maṇḍapa ādayaḥ pākaṭāya iva ariya dhammanti anavajja dhammam
translated: Kuṭi means a hut with a peaked roof. Kūṭāgāra means a house built on pillars. Aṭṭa means a door-bolt.

original: ariyānaṃ vā buddhapaccekabuddhabuddhasāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ. Āharissāmīti mama cittasamīpaṃ🔽ānayissāmi sīlena. Samāharissāmīti visesena ānayissāmi samādhinā. Adhigacchissāmīti
analyzed: ariyānam vā buddha paccekabuddha buddha sāvakānam dhammam āharissāmi iti mama citta samīpam  ānayissāmi sīlena samāharissāmi iti visesena ānayissāmi samādhinā adhigacchissāmi iti
translated: Māḷa means a circular house. Uddanda is a kind of lodging. “A house with a roof of thatch” is said by some. Upaṭṭhānasālā means a meeting hall or a dining hall. Maṇḍapa, etc., are well known. Ariyadhamma means blameless states or the states of the noble ones, that is, the Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and disciples.

original: paṭilābhavasena gamissāmi tadaṅgena. Phassayissāmīti phusissāmi maggena. Sacchikarissāmīti
analyzed: paṭilābha vasena gamissāmi tad aṅgena phassayissāmi iti phusissāmi maggena sacchikarissāmi iti
translated: I will bring it into the presence of my mind by means of virtue. I will bring it into close proximity by means of concentration. I will reach it by means of the factors of absorption. I will touch it by means of the path. I will realize it by means of fruition.

original: paccakkhaṃ karissāmi phalena. Atha vā sotāpattimaggena āharissāmi. Sakadāgāmimaggena
analyzed: paccakkham karissāmi phalena atha vā sotāpatti maggena āharissāmi sakadāgāmi maggena
translated: I shall experience it with the fruit. Or else I shall bring it about with the path of stream-entry.

original: samāharissāmi, anāgāmimaggena adhigacchissāmi, arahattamaggena phassayissāmi, paccavekkhaṇena
analyzed: samāharissāmi anāgāmi maggena adhigacchissāmi arahatta maggena phassayissāmi paccavekkhaṇena
translated: I shall gather it together with the path of once-return. I shall attain it with the path of non-return. I shall experience it with the path of Arahantship. I shall realize it with reviewing.

original: sacchikarissāmi. Dvīsupi nayesu phassayissāmīti nāmakāyena nibbānaṃ phusissāmīti attho.
analyzed: sacchikarissāmi dvīsu pi nayesu phassayissāmi iti nāmakāyena nibbānam phusissāmi iti attho
translated: In both cases the meaning is: I shall experience Nibbāna with the body.

original: Apuṭṭhoti mūlapadaṃ, tassa apucchitoti attho. Apucchitoti ajānāpito. Ayācitoti anāyācito.🔽Anajjhesitoti anāṇāpito, “na icchito”ti eke. Apasāditoti na pasādāpito. Pāvadatīti🔽kathayati. Ahamasmīti ahaṃ asmi bhavāmi. Jātiyā vāti khattiyabrāhmaṇajātiyā vā. Gottena
analyzed: a puṭṭhaḥ ti mūla padam tassa a pucchitaḥ iti atthaḥ a pucchitaḥ iti a jānāpitaḥ a yācitaḥ uti an āyācitaḥ  an ajjhesito ti an āṇāpitaḥ na icchitaḥ iti eke apasādito ti na pasādāpitaḥ pāvadati iti  kathayati aham asmi iti aham asmi bhavāmi jātiyā vā ati khattiya brāhmaṇa jātiyā vā gottena
translated: Unasked is the basic phrase. The meaning is: not asked. Not asked is not informed. Not requested is not asked for.🔽Not invited is not asked for. “Not desired” is according to some. Not approved is not approved of. He speaks is he says. I am is I exist. By birth is by khattiya or brahmin birth.

original: vāti gotamādigottena vā. Kolaputtiyena vāti kulaputtabhāvena vā. Vaṇṇapokkharatāya
analyzed: vā ati gotama ādi gottena vā kola puttiyena vā ati kula putta bhāvena vā vaṇṇa pokkhara tāya
translated: By clan is by the clan called Gotama, etc. By being a clansman is by being a clansman. By being a noble is by being a noble. By being a brahmin is by being a brahmin. By being a householder is by being a householder. By being a monk is by being a monk. By being a recluse is by being a recluse. By being a Buddhist is by being a Buddhist. By being a Jain is by being a Jain. By being a naked ascetic is by being a naked ascetic. By being a Bāhukā ascetic is by being a Bāhukā ascetic. By being a Paribbājaka is by being a Paribbājaka. By being a Mātaṅga is by being a Mātaṅga. By being a Rathakāra is by being a Rathakāra. By being a Nesāda is by being a Nesāda. By being a Vessa is by being a Vessa. By being a Sudda is by being a Sudda. By being a Candāla is by being a Candāla. By being a Pukkusa is by being a Pukkusa. By being a Soṇḍa is by being a Soṇḍa. By being a Barabba is by being a Barabba. By being a Dhovaka is by being a Dhovaka. By being a Naṭa is by being a Naṭa. By being a Lohitaṅga is by being a Lohitaṅga. By being a Tambapaṇṇiyan is by being a Tambapaṇṇiyan. By being a Yona is by being a Yona. By being a Kamboja is

original: vāti sarīrasundaratāya vā. Dhanena vāti dhanasampattiyā vā. Ajjhenena vāti ajjhāyakaraṇena
analyzed: vāti sarīra sundara tāya vā dhanena vāti dhana sampattiyā vā ajjhenena vāti ajjhāya karaṇena
translated: or by the beauty of the body. By wealth: by the possession of wealth. By birth: by the performance of the ceremony of birth.

original: vā. Kammāyatanena vāti kammameva kammāyatanaṃ, tena kammāyatanena, kasigorakkhakammādinā🔽vā. Sippāyatanena vāti dhanusippādinā vā. Vijjāṭṭhānena vāti aṭṭhārasavijjāṭṭhānena
analyzed: vā kamma āyatanena vāti kammam eva kamma āyatanam tena kamma āyatanena kasi gorakkha kamma ādinā  vā sippāyatanena vā ati dhanu sippa ādinā vā vijjāṭṭhānena vā ati aṭṭhārasa vijjāṭṭhānena
translated: By the field of work: the field of work is just work itself, or by the field of work such as agriculture, commerce, and government service.🔽By the field of craft: by the craft of archery, etc. By the field of learning: by the eighteen fields of expertise.

original: vā. Sutena vāti bahussutaguṇena vā. Paṭibhānena vāti kāraṇākāraṇapaṭibhānasaṅkhātañāṇena
analyzed: vā sutena vā ati bahussuta guṇena vā paṭibhānena vā ati kāraṇa akāraṇa paṭibhāna saṅkhāta ñāṇena
translated: By learning: by the quality of being learned, or by the knowledge called “the ability to speak on a variety of topics.”

original: vā. Aññataraññatarena vā vatthunāti jātiādīnaṃ ekekena vatthunā vā.🔽Uccā kulāti khattiyabrāhmaṇakulā, etena jātigottamahattaṃ dīpeti. Mahābhogakulāti
analyzed: vā aññatara aññatarena vā vatthunā ati jāti ādīnam ekekena vatthunā vā  uccā khattiya brāhmaṇa kulā etena jāti gottama hattam dīpeti mahā bhoga kulā ati
translated: By some other means: by one of the factors such as birth, etc.🔽High family: the families of nobles and brahmins. This shows the excellence of birth and lineage. A wealthy family:

original: gahapatimahāsālakulā, etena aḍḍhamahattaṃ dīpeti. Uḷārabhogakulāti avasesavessādikulā,
analyzed: gahapati mahā sāla kulā etena aḍḍha mahattam dīpeti uḷāra bhoga kulā ati avasesa vessa ādi kulā
translated: the families of wealthy householders. This shows the excellence of wealth. A family of great means: the families of the remaining kings, etc.

original: etena pahūtajātarūparajatādiṃ dīpeti. Caṇḍālāpi hi uḷārabhogā honti. Ñātoti pākaṭo.
analyzed: etena pahūta jātarūpa rajata ādim dīpa iti hi uḷāra bhogāḥ honti pākaṭaḥ
translated: This shows the abundance of gold, silver, etc. Even outcastes can be of great means. Well known: well known.

original: Yassassīti parivārasampanno. Suttantikoti suttante niyutto. Vinayadharoti vinayapiṭakadharo.
analyzed: parivāra sampannaḥ suttantikaḥ iti suttante niyuttaḥ vinaya dharo ti vinaya piṭaka dharo
translated: “He who has” : he who has a following. “One who is versed in the Suttas” : one who is occupied with the Suttas. “One who has mastered the Vinaya” : one who has mastered the Vinaya Piṭaka.

original: Dhammakathikoti ābhidhammiko. Āraññikotiādayo dhutaṅgapubbaṅgamapaṭipattidassanatthaṃ
analyzed: dhamma kathiko ti ābhidhammikaḥ āraññikaḥ iti ādayaḥ dhutaṅga pubbaṅgama paṭipatti dassana ttham
translated: “One who expounds the Dhamma” : one who is versed in the Abhidhamma. “One who lives in the forest” and the rest are stated🔽in order to show the practice that is headed by the ascetic practices.🔽“One who has attained the first jhāna” and the rest are stated

original: vuttā. Paṭhamassa jhānassa lābhītiādayo rūpārūpaaṭṭhasamāpattiyo dassetvā paṭivedhadassanavasena
analyzed: vuttā paṭhamassa jhānassa lābhī iti ādayo rūpa arūpa aṭṭha samāpattiyaḥ dassetvā paṭivedha dassana vasena
translated: in order to show penetration after having demonstrated the eight meditative attainments of the form and formless worlds.

original: vuttā. Pāvadatīti mūlapadaṃ. Kathetīti “piṭakācariyosmī”ti kathayati. Bhaṇatīti “dhutaṅgikomhī”ti🔽pākaṭaṃ karoti. Dīpayatīti “rūpajjhānaṃ lābhīmhī”ti paridīpayati. Voharatīti “arūpajjhānaṃ
analyzed: vuttā pāvadati iti mūla padam kathā iti iti piṭakā cariyaḥ asmi iti kathayati bhaṇati iti dhutaṅgikaḥ asmi iti  pākaṭam karoti dīpayati iti rūpa jhānam lābhīmhi iti paridīpayati voharati iti arūpa jhānam
translated: “He proclaims” : this is the basic statement. “He expounds” : he expounds, “I am a teacher of the Piṭakas.” “He speaks” : he makes it clear that he is “one who practices the ascetic practices.”🔽“He demonstrates” : he demonstrates, “I have attained the jhāna of the form sphere.” “He proclaims” : he proclaims, “I have attained the jhāna of the formless sphere.”

original: lābhīmhī”ti vākyabhedaṃ karoti.
analyzed: vākya bhedam karoti
translated: “He prattles” : he makes a distinction in speech, “I have attained the jhāna of the formless sphere.”

original: Khandhakusalāti pañcasu khandhesu salakkhaṇasāmaññalakkhaṇesu chekā, ñātatīraṇapahānavasena
analyzed: khandha kusalā ti pañcasu khandhesu salakkhaṇa sāmañña lakkhaṇesu chekāḥ ñāta tīraṇa pahāna vasena
translated: “Skilled in the aggregates” : skilled in the five aggregates with their characteristics and their general characteristics. The meaning is that he is skilled in them by way of knowing, investigating, and abandoning them.

original: kusalāti attho. Dhātuāyatanapaṭiccasamuppādādīsupi eseva nayo. Nibbānakusalāti nibbāne
analyzed: kusalā ati atthaḥ dhātu āyatana paṭiccasamuppāda ādīsu pi esa eva nayaḥ nibbāna kusalā ati nibbāne
translated: The same method applies to the elements, sense bases, dependent origination, and so forth. “Skilled in Nibbāna” : skilled in Nibbāna

original: chekā. Anariyānanti na ariyānaṃ. Eso dhammoti eso sabhāvo. Bālānanti apaṇḍitānaṃ.
analyzed: chekāḥ anariyānam ti na ariyānam eso dhammaḥ ti esaḥ sabhāvaḥ bālānam ti apaṇḍitānam
translated: “The wise” : not the unwise. “The noble ones” : not the ignoble ones. “This is the Dhamma” : this is the nature of things. “The fools” : the undiscerning.

original: Asappurisānanti na sobhanapurisānaṃ. Attāti attānaṃ.
analyzed: na sobhana purisānam attā ati attānam
translated: “The bad men” : not the good men. “Himself” : himself.

original: 18. Santoti rāgādikilesūpasamena santo. Tathā abhinibbutatto. Iti’hanti sīlesu akatthamānoti🔽“ahamasmi sīlasampanno”tiādinā nayena iti sīlesu akatthamāno, sīlanimittaṃ attupanāyikaṃ
analyzed: santaḥ iti rāga ādi kilesu upasamena santaḥ tathā abhinibbuta ttaḥ itihanti sīlesu akatthamāno ti  aham asmi sīla sampannaḥ iti ādinā nayena iti sīlesu sīla nimittam attu panāyikam
translated: “The peaceful” : peaceful through the pacification of the defilements of lust, etc. Likewise, “the one who has attained Nibbāna.” “Thus” : thus,

original: vācaṃ abhāsamānoti vuttaṃ hoti. Tamariyadhammaṃ kusalā vadantīti tassa taṃ akatthanaṃ🔽“ariyadhammo eso”ti buddhādayo khandhādikusalā vadanti. Yassussadā natthi kuhiñci
analyzed: vācam a bhāsamānaḥ iti vuttam hoti tam ariya dhammam kusalāḥ vadanti iti tassa tam a katthanam  ariya dhammo eso ti buddha ādayaḥ khandha ādi kusalāḥ vadanti natthi kuhiñci
translated: “I am perfect in virtue” , etc., he does not extol himself. Or else, “thus” means “in this way,” and “in this way he does not extol himself in regard to virtue” means that he does not utter speech that extols himself in regard to virtue, making virtue the reason .

original: loketi yassa khīṇāsavassa rāgādayo sattussadā kuhiñci loke natthi. Tassa taṃ akatthanaṃ
analyzed: loke ti yassa khīṇāsavassa rāga ādayo sattuḥ sadā kuhiñci loke na atthi tassa tam a katthanam
translated: “The wise call that the noble Dhamma” : the Buddhas and the noble disciples who are wise in regard to the aggregates, etc., call that non-extolling “the noble Dhamma.” “He in whom there is no pride anywhere in the world” : in whom, a person of destroyed taints, there is no pride of lust, etc., anywhere in the world.

original: “ariyadhammo eso”ti evaṃ kusalā vadantīti sambandho.
analyzed: ariya dhammo esaḥ ti evam kusalāḥ vadanti iti sambandhaḥ
translated: “The wise call that the noble Dhamma” : this is the connection.

original: Santoti mūlapadaṃ. Rāgassa samitattāti rañjanalakkhaṇassa rāgassa samitabhāvena.
analyzed: santo ti mūla padam rāgassa samita ttā ati rañjana lakkhaṇassa rāgassa samita bhāvena
translated: “Tranquil” is the basic expression. “With lust quieted” : with the quieting of lust, which has the characteristic of delighting.

original: Dosādīsupi eseva nayo. Vijjhātattāti sabbapariḷāhānaṃ jhāpitattā. Nibbutattāti sabbasantāpānaṃ🔽nibbāpitabhāvena. Vigatattāti sabbākusalābhisaṅkhārānaṃ vigatabhāvena dūrabhāvena.
analyzed: dosa ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ vijjhāta ttā ati sabba pariḷāhānam jhāpita ttā nibbuta ttā ati sabba santāpānam  nibbāpita bhāvena vigata ttā ati sabba akusala abhisaṅkhārānam vigata bhāvena dūra bhāvena
translated: The same method applies in the case of hate, etc. “With anger abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of resentment.🔽“With enmity destroyed” : with the destruction of all forms of enmity. “With distress abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of distress.🔽“With hate abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of hate. “With malice abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of malice.

original: Paṭipassaddhattāti sabbākārena abhabbuppattikabhāvena. Sattannaṃ dhammānaṃ bhinnattā🔽bhikkhūti upari vattabbānaṃ sattadhammānaṃ bhinditvā ṭhitabhāvena bhikkhu. Sakkāyadiṭṭhivicikicchāsīlabbataparāmāsoti🔽ime tayo kilesā sotāpattimaggena bhinnā, rāgo dosoti ime dve kilesā oḷārikā sakadāgāmimaggena
analyzed: paṭipassaddhattā ati sabba ākārena abhabbuppattika bhāvena sattannam dhammānam bhinnattā  bhikkhu iti upari vattabbānam satta dhammānam bhinditvā ṭhita bhāvena bhikkhu sakkāya diṭṭhi vicikicchā sīlabbata parāmāso ti  ime tayo kilesā sotāpatti maggena bhinnā rāgaḥ doso ti ime dve kilesā oḷārikā sakadāgāmi maggena
translated: “With anger abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of anger. “With enmity destroyed” : with the destruction of all forms of enmity. “With distress abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of distress.

original: bhinnā, te eva aṇusahagatā anāgāmimaggena bhinnā, moho mānoti ime dve kilesā arahattamaggena
analyzed: bhinnā te eva aṇu sahagatāḥ anāgāmi maggena bhinnā mohaḥ ime dve kilesāḥ arahatta maggena
translated: “With hate abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of hate. “With malice abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of malice. “With anger abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of anger. “With enmity destroyed” : with the destruction of all forms of enmity. “With distress abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of distress. “With hate abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of hate. “With malice abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of malice. “With anger abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of anger. “With enmity destroyed” : with the destruction of all forms of enmity. “With distress abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of distress. “With hate abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of hate. “With malice abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of malice. “With anger abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of anger. “With enmity destroyed” : with the destruction of all forms of enmity. “With distress abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of distress. “With hate abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of hate. “With malice abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of malice. “With anger abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of anger. “With enmity destroyed” : with the destruction of all forms of enmity. “With distress abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of distress. “With hate abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of hate. “With malice abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of malice. “With anger abolished” : with the abolition of all forms of anger

original: bhinnā. Avasese kilese dassetuṃ “bhinnāssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā”ti āha. Saṃkilesikāti
analyzed: bhinnā avasese kilese dassetum bhinnāḥ assa honti pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammā ti āha saṃkilesikā iti
translated: “Defiled” means

original: kilesapaccayā. Ponobhavikāti punabbhavadāyikā. Sadarāti kilesadarathā ettha santīti
analyzed: kilesa paccayā ponobhavikā ati punabbhava dāyikā sa darā ati kilesa darathāḥ ettha santi iti
translated: having defilements as condition. “Leading to renewed existence” means giving rise to renewed existence. “With fear” means

original: sadarā. “Saddarā”tipi pāṭho, sahadarathāti attho. Dukkhavipākāti phalakāle dukkhadāyikā.
analyzed: sadarā saddarā atipi pāṭhaḥ sahadarathā ati atthaḥ dukkha vipākā ati phala kāle dukkha dāyikā
translated: they have the fear of defilements. “With dread” is the reading; the meaning is: with the dread of defilements. “With suffering as fruit” means giving rise to suffering as fruit.

original: Āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇiyāti anāgate jātijarāmaraṇassa paccayā.
analyzed: āyatim jāti jarā maraṇiyā ti anāgate jāti jarā maraṇassa paccayā
translated: “In the future, leading to birth, aging, and death” means being a condition for birth, aging, and death in the future.

original: Pajjena katena attanāti gāthāya ayaṃ piṇḍattho – yo attanā bhāvitena maggena parinibbānaṃ
analyzed: pajjena katena attanā iti gāthāya ayam piṇḍa atthaḥ yaḥ attanā bhāvitena maggena parinibbānam
translated: “Having made himself” : the meaning of the verse is this: He who has attained extinction by means of the path developed by himself,

original: gato, kilesaparinibbānaṃ patto, parinibbānagatattā eva ca vitiṇṇakaṅkho, vipattisampattihānivuddhiucchedasassataapuññapuññappabhedaṃ
analyzed: gataḥ kilesa parinibbānam pattaḥ parinibbāna gata ttā eva ca vitiṇṇa kaṅkhaḥ vipatti sampatti hāni vuddhi uccheda sassata apuñña puñña ppabhedam
translated: who has attained the extinction of defilements, and who, because he has attained extinction, has crossed over doubt, and who, having abandoned gain, honor, and fame, and having abandoned the distinction of merit and demerit,

original: bhavañca vibhavañca vippahāya maggavāsaṃ vusitavā khīṇapunabbhavoti etesaṃ thutivacanānaṃ araho so bhikkhūti.
analyzed: bhavam ca vibhavam ca vippahāya magga vāsam vusitavā khīṇa punabbhavaḥ ti etesam thuti vacanānam araho so bhikkhu iti
translated: and having abandoned existence and non-existence, has lived the life of the path, and whose renewed existence has come to an end, is worthy of the words of praise.

original: Itihanti, idahantīti duvidho pāṭho. Itīti padasandhiādayo sandhāya “idaha”nti pāṭhaṃ🔽na rocenti. Tattha itīti yaṃ vuttaṃ. Padasandhīti padānaṃ sandhi padasandhi, padaghaṭananti
analyzed: itihanti idahanti iti duvidhaḥ pāṭhaḥ iti iti pada sandhi ādayaḥ sandhāya idahanti pāṭham  na rocenti tattha iti iti yam vuttam pada sandhi iti padānam sandhi pada sandhi pada ghaṭanan ti
translated: ‘Iti’ and ‘idha’ are the two readings. The reading ‘idha’ is not approved by those who take ‘iti’ to mean a link of words, etc.

original: attho. Padasaṃsaggoti padānaṃ ekībhāvo. Padapāripūrīti padānaṃ paripūraṇaṃ dvinnaṃ🔽padānaṃ ekībhāvo. Akkharasamavāyoti ekībhūtopi aparipuṇṇopi hoti, ayaṃ na evaṃ. Akkharānaṃ🔽samavāyo sannipāto hotīti dassanatthaṃ “akkharasamavāyo”ti āha. Byañjanasiliṭṭhatāti
analyzed: attho pada saṃsaggo ti padānam ekībhāvo pada pāripūrī iti padānam paripūraṇam dvinnam  padānam ekībhāvaḥ akkhara samavāyaḥ ti ekībhūtaḥ api a paripuṇṇaḥ api hoti ayam na evam  samavāyaḥ sannipātaḥ hoti iti dassana attham akkhara samavāyaḥ iti āha byañjana siliṭṭha tā ti
translated: ‘Padasandhi’ is the linking of words, the putting together of words is the meaning. ‘Padasaṃsaṭṭha’ is the unity of words. ‘Padapāripūri’ is the completion of words, the unity of two words. ‘Akkharasamavāya’ is the coming together, the meeting of syllables.

original: byañjanasamuccayo padamīti vuttānaṃ byañjanānaṃ atthabyañjanānaṃ atthabyattikāraṇānaṃ🔽vā madhurabhāvattā pāṭhassa mudubhāvo. Padānupubbatā metanti padānaṃ anupubbabhāvo
analyzed: byañjana samuccayaḥ vuttānam byañjanānam attha byañjanānam attha byatti kāraṇānam  vā madhura bhāva ttā pāṭhassa mudu bhāvaḥ pada anupubba tā mā itanti padānam anupubba bhāvaḥ
translated: Though they become one, they are not complete. This is not so. He said ‘akkharasamavāya’ in order to show that there is a coming together, a meeting of syllables. ‘Byañjanasiliṭṭha’ is the collection of syllables. It is said that a word is the collection of syllables. The softness of the recitation is due to the sweetness of the syllables, of the syllables that express the meaning, or of the causes of the variety of meanings.

original: padānupubbatā, padapaṭipāṭibhāvoti attho. Metanti etaṃ. Katamanti ce? Itīti idaṃ.
analyzed: pada anupubba tā pada paṭipāṭi bhāvaḥ ti atthaḥ mā itanti etam kataman ti ce iti iti idam
translated: ‘Padānupubbatā’ is the sequence of words, the order of words is the meaning. ‘Metan’ is this. If you ask ‘what?’ it is ‘iti’ this.

original: Metanti ettha ma-kāro padasandhivasena vutto. Katthī hotīti “ahamasmi sīlasampanno”ti🔽attānaṃ ukkaṃsetvā kathanasīlo hoti. Katthatīti vuttanayena kathayati. Vikatthatīti🔽vividhā kathayati. Katthanāti kathanā. Āratoti dūrato rato. Viratoti ṭhānasaṅkantivasena
analyzed: ettha makāro pada sandhi vasena vutto katthī hoti iti aham asmi sīla sampannaḥ ti  attānam ukkaṃsetvā kathana sīlaḥ hoti katthati iti vutta nayena kathayati vikatthati iti  vividhā kathayati katthanā ati kathanā ārato ti dūratas rataḥ virataḥ iti ṭhāna saṅkanti vasena
translated: Metanti: here the syllable ma is used for the purpose of euphony. Katthī hotīti: he is one who is of the nature of speaking thus: “I am endowed with virtue.”

original: vigatabhāvena rato. Paṭiviratoti tato nivattitvā sabbākārena viyutto hutvā rato.🔽Tattha pisācaṃ viya disvā palāto ārato. Hatthimhi maddante viya paridhāvitvā gato
analyzed: vigata bhāvena rato paṭivirato ti tatas nivattitvā sabba ākārena viyuttaḥ hutvā rato  tattha pisācam viya disvā palātaḥ ārataḥ hatthimhi maddante viya paridhāvitvā gataḥ
translated: Attānaṃ ukkaṃsetvā: having extolled himself. Katthatīti: he speaks in the manner stated. Vikatthatīti: he speaks in various ways. Katthanāti: speaking. Ārato: he is one who is delighted from afar. Virato: he is one who is delighted by being free from the state of being mixed up. Paṭivirato: he is one who is delighted by turning back from that and by being free from it in every way.

original: virato. Yodhasampahāraṃ viya pothetvā maddetvā gato paṭivirato.
analyzed: virataḥ yodha sampahāram viya pothetvā maddetvā gataḥ paṭivirataḥ
translated: Herein, one who is delighted from afar is like one who sees a demon and runs away. One who is delighted by being free is like one who runs about when an elephant is trumpeting. One who is delighted by turning back is like one who, after having fought and killed, runs away.

original: Khīṇāsavassāti khīṇakilesāsavassa. Kammussadoti puññābhisaṅkhāraapuññābhisaṅkhāraāneñjābhisaṅkhārasaṅkhātānaṃ kammānaṃ ussado ussannatā. Yassimeti yassa khīṇāsavassa ime ussadā.
analyzed: khīṇa āsavassa ati khīṇa kilesa āsavassa kamma ussadaḥ ti puñña abhisaṅkhāra apuñña abhisaṅkhāra āneñja abhisaṅkhāra saṅkhātānam kammānam ussadaḥ ussanna tā yassa ime iti yassa khīṇa āsavassa ime ussadā
translated: Khīṇāsavassāti: of one whose cankers are destroyed. Kammussado: the height of the kamma called meritorious formation, demeritorious formation, and imperturbable formation. Yassimeti: these are the heights of one whose cankers are destroyed.

original: 19. Evaṃ khīṇāsavapaṭipattiṃ dassetvā idāni diṭṭhigatikānaṃ titthiyānaṃ paṭipattiñca
analyzed: evam khīṇāsava paṭipattim dassetvā idāni diṭṭhi gatikānam titthiyānam paṭipattiñca
translated: Having thus shown the way of practice of one whose cankers are destroyed, he now shows the way of practice of the sectarians who are theorists.

original: dassento āha “pakappitā saṅkhatā”ti. Tattha pakappitāti parikappitā. Saṅkhatāti paccayābhisaṅkhatā.
analyzed: dassentaḥ āha pakappitā saṅkhatā ati tattha pakappitā ati parikappitā saṅkhatā ati paccaya abhisaṅkhatā
translated: Having thus shown the way of practice of one whose cankers are destroyed, now, in order to show the way of practice of the sectarians who are theorists, he said, “The fabricated, the conditioned” . Herein, fabricated is conjectured. Conditioned is conditioned by conditions.

original: Yassāti yassa kassaci diṭṭhigatikassa. Dhammāti diṭṭhiyo. Purakkhatāti purato katā.
analyzed: yassa iti yassa kassaci diṭṭhi gatikassa dhammā ati diṭṭhiyaḥ purakkhatā āti puratas katā
translated: Whose: of anyone who is a theorist. Ideas: views. Are placed foremost: are made to be in front.

original: Santīti saṃvijjanti. Avīvadātāti avodātā. Yadattani passati ānisaṃsaṃ, taṃ nissito
analyzed: santi iti saṃvijjanti avīvadātā ati avodātā passati ānisaṃsam tam nissitaḥ
translated: Exist: are found. Are not cleared away: are not removed. Whatever advantage he sees in them, he is dependent on that.

original: kuppapaṭiccasantinti yassete diṭṭhidhammā ‘purakkhatā avodātā santi, so evaṃvidho
analyzed: kuppa paṭicca santim ti yassa ete diṭṭhi dhammā purakkhatāḥ avodātāḥ santi saḥ evaṃvidho
translated: The fabricated, the conditioned, the view: whoever has these ideas placed foremost and not cleared away, he,

original: yasmā attani tassā diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhadhammikañca sakkārādiṃ, samparāyikañca gativisesādiṃ🔽ānisaṃsaṃ sampassati, tasmā tañca ānisaṃsaṃ, tañca kuppatāya ca paṭiccasamuppannatāya
analyzed: yasmai attani tassā diṭṭhiyāḥ diṭṭhadhammikam ca sakkāra ādim samparāyikam ca gati visesa ādim  ānisaṃsam sampassati tasmai tam ca ānisaṃsam tam ca kuppa tāya ca paṭiccasamuppanna tāya
translated: because he sees in himself the advantage of the ideas of views, which is the respect, etc., in this visible world, and the distinction of destiny, etc., in the next world,

original: ca sammutisantitāya ca kuppapaṭiccasantisaṅkhātaṃ diṭṭhiṃ nissito ca hoti. So taṃ
analyzed: ca sammuti santi tāya ca kuppa paṭiccasanti saṅkhātam diṭṭhim nissitaḥ ca hoti saḥ tam
translated: therefore he is dependent on that advantage and on the view called the fabricated, the conditioned, because it is fabricated and because it is dependently arisen and because it is a conventional existent.

original: nissitattā attānaṃ vā ukkaṃseyya, pare vā vambheyya abhūtehipi guṇadosehi.🔽Saṅkhatāti mūlapadaṃ. Saṅkhatāti paccayehi samāgantvā katā. Upasaggavasena padaṃ🔽vaḍḍhitaṃ. Abhisaṅkhatāti paccayehi abhikatā. Saṇṭhapitāti paccayavaseneva sammā
analyzed: nissita ttā attānam vā ukkaṃseyya pare vā vambheyya abhūtehi pi guṇa dosehi  saṅkhatā ati mūla padam saṅkhatā ati paccayehi samāgantvā katā upasagga vasena padam  vaḍḍhitam paccayehi abhikatā saṇṭhapitā ati paccaya vasena iva sammā
translated: or he might exalt himself and disparage others because of non-existent qualities and faults.🔽The word “conditioned” is the basic term. “Conditioned” means made by coming together through conditions. The word is extended by way of the prefix abhi.

original: ṭhapitā. Aniccāti hutvā abhāvena. Paṭiccasamuppannāti vatthārammaṇaṃ paṭicca uppannā.
analyzed: ṭhapitā aniccā ati hutvā abhāvena paṭicca samuppannā ati vattha ārammaṇam paṭicca uppannā
translated: “Well-conditioned” means made by conditions. “Well-established” means well-established by conditions. “Impermanent” means by way of having become and then being destroyed. “Dependent” means arisen by way of the object-base.

original: Khayadhammāti kamena khayasabhāvā. Vayadhammāti pavattivasena parihāyanasabhāvā.
analyzed: khaya dhammā ati kamena khaya sabhāvā vaya dhammā ati pavatti vasena parihāyana sabhāvā
translated: “Subject to destruction” means by way of destruction. “Subject to passing away” means by way of occurrence, subject to passing away.

original: Virāgadhammāti anivattī hutvā vigacchanasabhāvā. Nirodhadhammāti nirujjhanasabhāvā,
analyzed: virāga dhammā ati a nivattī hutvā vigacchana sabhāvā nirodha dhammā ati nirujjhana sabhāvā
translated: “Subject to fading away” means subject to fading away without returning. “Subject to cessation” means subject to cessation,

original: anuppattidhammā hutvā nirujjhanasabhāvāti attho. Diṭṭhigatikassāti dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhiyo🔽gahetvā ṭhitapuggalassa.
analyzed: an uppatti dhammā hutvā nirujjhana sabhāvā ti attho diṭṭhi gatikassa ti dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhiyaḥ  gahetvā ṭhita puggalassa
translated: the meaning is: subject to cessation by not arising. “One who has views” means one who stands by way of the sixty-two views.

original: Purekkhārāti pure katā. Taṇhādhajoti ussāpitaṭṭhena taṇhādhajo, taṇhāpaṭākā assa
analyzed: purekkhārā ati pure katā taṇhā dhajoti ussāpita ṭṭhena taṇhā dhajo taṇhā paṭākā assa
translated: “Preceding” means done before. “Banner of craving” means the banner of craving in the sense of being raised, the flag of craving.

original: atthīti taṇhādhajo. Purecārikaṭṭhena taṇhā eva ketu assāti taṇhāketu. Taṇhādhipateyyoti🔽chandādhipativasena, taṇhā adhipatito āgatāti vā taṇhādhipateyyo, taṇhādhipati vā
analyzed: atthi iti purecārika ṭṭhena taṇhā eva ketu assa ati taṇhā ketu taṇhā ādhipateyyaḥ ti  chanda adhipati vasena taṇhāḥ adhipatitaḥ āgatā ati vā taṇhā ādhipateyyaḥ taṇhā adhipati vā
translated: “It has craving as its banner”: it is bannered with craving. “Craving is its ensign”: craving is its ensign. “Craving is its overlord”:

original: etassa atthīti taṇhādhipateyyo. Diṭṭhidhajādīsupi eseva nayo. Avodātāti aparisuddhā.
analyzed: etassa atthi iti taṇhā ādhipateyyaḥ diṭṭhi dhac ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ avodātā ati aparisuddhā
translated: it is overlord-ed by craving. “It has craving as its overlord”: it has craving as its overlord. The same method applies to the views banner, etc. “Unclean”: impure.

original: Saṃkiliṭṭhāti sayaṃ kiliṭṭhā. Saṃkilesikāti tapanīyā.🔽Dve ānisaṃse passatīti dve guṇe dakkhati. Diṭṭhadhammikañca ānisaṃsanti imasmiṃyeva
analyzed: saṃkiliṭṭhā ati sayam kiliṭṭhā saṃkilesikā ati tapanīyā  dve ānisaṃse passati iti dve guṇe dakkhati diṭṭhadhammikañca ānisaṃsanti imasmiṃ yeva
translated: “Defiled”: defiled itself. “Corrupted”: corruptible.🔽“He sees two advantages”: he sees two benefits. The advantage visible here and now: the benefit to be experienced in this visible world.

original: attabhāve paccakkhadhammānisaṃsañca. Samparāyikanti paraloke pattabbaṃ ānisaṃsañca.
analyzed: atta bhāve paccakkha dhamma ānisaṃsañca samparāyikan ti para loke pattabbam ānisaṃsañca
translated: The advantage in the life to come: the benefit to be experienced in future lives.

original: Yaṃdiṭṭhiko satthā hotīti satthā yathāladdhiko bhavati. Taṃdiṭṭhikā sāvakā hontīti
analyzed: yaṃdiṭṭhikaḥ satthā hoti iti satthā yathāladdhikaḥ bhavati taṃdiṭṭhikā sāvakāḥ honti iti
translated: “The teacher has such a view”: the teacher has such a view as he has acquired. “The disciples have such a view”:

original: tassa vacanaṃ suṇantā sāvakāpi tathāladdhikā honti. Sakkarontīti sakkārappattaṃ karonti.
analyzed: tassa vacanam suṇantā sāvakā api tathāladdhikāḥ honti sakkaronti iti sakkāra ppattam karonti
translated: the disciples also have such a view as he has acquired by listening to his words. “They honor him”: they make him an object of honor.

original: Garuṃ karontīti garukārappattaṃ karonti. Mānentīti manasā piyāyanti. Pūjentīti catupaccayābhihārapūjāya🔽pūjenti. Apacitiṃ karontīti apacitippattaṃ karonti. Tattha yassa cattāro paccaye🔽sakkaritvā suabhisaṅkhate paṇīte katvā denti, so sakkato. Yasmiṃ garubhāvaṃ paṭṭhapetvā
analyzed: garum karonti iti garukāra ppattam karonti mānenti iti manasā piyāyanti pūjenti iti catu paccaya abhihāra pūjāya  pūjenti apacitim karonti iti apaciti ppattam karonti tattha yassa cattāro paccaye  sakkaritvā su abhisaṅkhate paṇīte katvā denti saḥ sakkataḥ yasmin garu bhāvam paṭṭhapetvā
translated: They make him respected: they make him attain respect. They honour him: they love him in their minds. They revere him: they revere him with the four kinds of requisites.

original: denti, so garukato. Yaṃ manasā piyāyanti, so mānito. Yassa sabbampetaṃ karonti, so🔽pūjito. Yassa abhivādanapaccupaṭṭhānaañjalikammādivasena paramanipaccakāraṃ karonti,
analyzed: denti saḥ garukataḥ yam manasā piyāyanti saḥ mānitaḥ yassa sabbam petam karonti so  pūjitaḥ yassa abhivādana paccupaṭṭhāna añjali kamma ādi vasena parama nipaccakāram karonti
translated: They do homage to him: they make him attain homage. Herein, one who is given the requisites after being honoured is “honoured.” One who is given them after being made respected is “respected.” One who is loved in the mind is “honoured.” One who is given them after all this is done is “revered.” One who is given them after being saluted, served, and done homage to by raising hands palm to palm above the head is “done homage to.”

original: so apacito. Keci “sakkaronti kāyena, garuṃ karonti vācāya, mānenti cittena, pūjenti
analyzed: saḥ apacitaḥ keci sakkaronti kāyena garum karonti vācāya mānenti cittena pūjenti
translated: Some explain that he is honoured by the body, respected by speech, loved by the mind, and revered by requisites.

original: lābhenā”ti vaṇṇayanti. Alaṃ nāgattāya vāti nāgabhāvāya nāgarājabhāvāya vā alaṃ pariyattaṃ.
analyzed: lābhena ati vaṇṇayanti alam nāga ttāya vā ati nāga bhāvāya nāga rāja bhāvāya vā alam pariyattam
translated: Enough for non-coming: enough for the state of being a nāga, or enough for the state of a nāga king.

original: Supaṇṇattāya vāti supaṇṇarājabhāvāya. Yakkhattāya vāti yakkhasenāpatibhāvāya. Asurattāya
analyzed: supaṇṇattāya vāti supaṇṇa rāja bhāvāya yakkhattāya vāti yakkha senāpati bhāvāya asurattāya
translated: As a Supaṇṇa: for the state of a Supaṇṇa king. As a Yakkha: for the state of a Yakkha general. As an Asura:

original: vāti asurabhāvāya. Gandhabbattāya vāti gandhabbadevaghaṭe nibbattabhāvāya. Mahārājattāya
analyzed: vāti asura bhāvāya gandhabba ttāya vāti gandhabba deva ghaṭe nibbatta bhāvāya mahā rāja ttāya
translated: for the state of an Asura. As a Gandhabba: for the state of being reborn in the deva-host of the Gandhabba gods. As a Mahārāja:

original: vāti catunnaṃ mahārājānaṃ aññatarabhāvāya. Indattāya vāti sakkabhāvāya. Brahmattāya
analyzed: vāti catunnam mahā rājānam aññatara bhāvāya indattāya vāti sakka bhāvāya brahmattāya
translated: for the state of being one of the Four Great Kings. As Sakka: for the state of Sakka. As Brahmā:

original: vāti brahmakāyikādīnaṃ aññatarabhāvāya. Devattāya vāti sammutidevādīnaṃ aññatarabhāvāya.
analyzed: vāti brahmakāyika ādīnam aññatara bhāvāya devattāya vāti sammuti deva ādīnam aññatara bhāvāya
translated: for the state of being one of the Brahmā-world gods. As a deva: for the state of being one of the gods of the world of men.

original: Suddhiyāti parisuddhabhāvāya alaṃ pariyattaṃ. Visuddhiyāti sabbamalarahitaaccantaparisuddhabhāvāya.
analyzed: suddhiyā ati parisuddha bhāvāya alam pariyattam visuddhiyā ati sabba mala rahita accanta parisuddha bhāvāya
translated: Purity: for the state of being completely pure, being quite sufficient. Purification: for the state of being completely pure, being quite free from all defilements.

original: Parisuddhiyāti sabbākārena parisuddhabhāvāya.
analyzed: parisuddhiyā ti sabba ākārena parisuddha bhāvāya
translated: Complete purity: for the state of being completely pure in every way.

original: Tattha tiracchānayoniyaṃ adhipaccattaṃ suddhiyā. Devaloke adhipaccattaṃ visuddhiyā.
analyzed: tattha tiracchānayoniyam adhipaccattam suddhiyā deva loke adhipaccattam visuddhiyā
translated: Herein, in the animal realm the state of being is purity. In the deva world the state of being is purification.

original: Brahmaloke adhipaccattaṃ parisuddhiyā. Caturāsītikappasahassāni atikkamitvā muccanatthaṃ
analyzed: brahma loke adhipaccattam parisuddhiyā caturāsīti kappa sahassāni atikkamitvā muccana attham
translated: In the Brahmā world the state of being is complete purity. For the purpose of not falling away for eighty-four thousand eons,

original: muttiyā. Antarāyābhāvena muccanatthaṃ vimuttiyā. Sabbākārena muttiyā parimuttiyā.🔽Sujjhantīti tasmiṃ samaye pabbajitabhāvena suddhiṃ pāpuṇanti. Visujjhantīti pabbajjaṃ🔽gahetvā paṭipattiyā yuttabhāvena vividhena sujjhanti. Parisujjhantīti nipphattiṃ🔽pāpetvā sabbākārena sujjhanti. Muccanti tesaṃ samayantaradhammena. Vimuccanti etassa
analyzed: muttiyāḥ antarāya abhāvena muccana attham vimuttiyā sabba ākārena muttiyā parimuttiyā  sujjhanti iti tasmin samaye pabbajita bhāvena suddhim pāpuṇanti visujjhanti iti pabbajjam  gahetvā paṭipattiyā yutta bhāvena vividhena sujjhanti parisujjhanti iti nipphattim  pāpetvā sabba ākārena sujjhanti muccanti tesam samaya antara dhammena vimuccanti etassa
translated: By means of deliverance: for the purpose of deliverance by the absence of obstruction. By means of complete deliverance: by means of all-round deliverance.

original: satthuno ovādena. Parimuccanti etassa satthuno anusāsanena. Sujjhissāmītiādayo anāgatavasena🔽vuttā. Āyatiṃ phalapāṭikaṅkhīti anāgate vipākaphalamākaṅkhamāno. Idaṃ diṭṭhigatikānaṃ
analyzed: satthuno ovādena parimuccanti etassa satthuno anusāsanena sujjhissāmi iti ādayaḥ anāgata vasena  vuttā āyatim phala pāṭikaṅkhī iti anāgate vipāka phalam ākaṅkhamāno idam diṭṭhi gatikānam
translated: They are purified: they reach purity by means of going forth at that time. They are cleansed: having gone forth, they are cleansed in various ways by being occupied with the practice. They are quite cleansed: having brought about the fruit, they are cleansed in all ways. They are liberated: by the state of the time they are liberated. They are well liberated: by the teacher’s instruction they are well liberated. They are quite liberated: by the teacher’s advice they are quite liberated. They will be purified, etc., are stated with reference to the future.

original: icchāmattaṃ. Diṭṭhigatañhi ijjhamānaṃ nirayaṃ vā tiracchānayoniṃ vā nipphādeti.
analyzed: icchāmattam diṭṭhi gatam hi ijjhamānam nirayam vā tiracchānayonim vā nipphādeti
translated: He who desires the fruit in the future: he who desires the ripening fruit in the future. This is the mere wish of those who have views. For when a view succeeds, it produces either hell or the animal kingdom.

original: Accantasantīti atiantanissaraṇasanti. Tadaṅgasantīti paṭhamajjhānādiguṇaṅgena nīvaraṇādiaguṇaṅgaṃ
analyzed: accanta santi iti ati anta nissaraṇa santi tad aṅga santi iti paṭhamajjhāna ādi guṇa aṅgena nīvaraṇa ādi aguṇa aṅgam
translated: The peace of the utter end: the peace of the utter escape. The peace of a part: the part-peace of the virtue of the first jhāna, etc., which is the opposite of the part-vice of the hindrances, etc.

original: sametīti jhānaṃ tadaṅgasanti. Sammutisantīti samāhāravasena diṭṭhisanti. Tā vibhāgato🔽dassetuṃ “katamā accantasantī”tiādimāha. Amataṃ nibbānanti evamādayo heṭṭhā vuttatthāyeva.
analyzed: sameti iti jhānam tat aṅga santi sammuti santi iti samāhāra vasena diṭṭhi santi tāḥ vibhāgato  dassetum katamāḥ accantasanti itiādim āha amatam nibbānam ti evamādayaḥ heṭṭhā vutta tthāya eva
translated: “It is met with” is the “state of jhāna” as a factor of it. “Conventional state” is the “state of view” as a collection. In order to show these in detail, he said, “What is the absolute state? ” and so on. The “deathless element, Nibbāna” and so on have the same meaning as given below .

original: Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa nīvaraṇā santā hontīti evamādayo anto appanāyaṃ atisayavasena🔽vuttā. Api ca sammutisanti imasmiṃ atthe adhippetā, santīti itare dve santiyo paṭikkhipitvā
analyzed: paṭhamam jhānam samāpannassa nīvaraṇā santā honti iti evamādayaḥ antaḥ appanā ayam atisaya vasena  vuttā api ca sammuti santi imasmin atthe adhippetā santi iti itare dve santiyaḥ paṭikkhipitvā
translated: “When he has attained the first jhāna, the hindrances are tranquillized” and so on are said by way of excess in absorption.

original: sammutisantimeva dīpeti. Kuppasantinti vipākajanakavasena parivattanavasena calasantiṃ.🔽Pakuppasantinti visesena calasantiṃ. Eritasantinti kampanasantiṃ. Sameritasantinti
analyzed: sammuti santim eva dīpeti kuppa santim ti vipāka janaka vasena parivattana vasena cala santim  pakuppa santim ti visesena cala santim erita santim kampana santim samerita santim
translated: Moreover, the “conventional state” is intended here. After excluding the other two states, he shows only the conventional state. “The state of agitation” is the state of agitation by way of change, by way of producing result.🔽“The state of non-agitation” is the state of agitation by way of distinction. “The state of shaking” is the state of trembling. “The state of trembling”

original: visesena kampitasantiṃ. Calitasantinti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Ghaṭṭitasantinti pīḷitasantiṃ.
analyzed: visesena kampita santim calita santim ti tassa iva vevacanam ghaṭṭita santim ti pīḷita santim
translated: is the state of trembling by way of distinction. “The state of moving” is a synonym for that. “The state of being struck” is the state of being oppressed.

original: Santiṃ nissitoti diṭṭhisaṅkhātaṃ santiṃ nissito. Assitoti āsito visesena nissito. Allīnoti ekībhūto.🔽20. Evaṃ nissite tāva “diṭṭhīnivesā…pe… ādiyatī ca dhamma”nti tattha diṭṭhīnivesāti
analyzed: santim nissitoti diṭṭhi saṅkhātam santim nissitaḥ assitoti āsitaḥ visesena nissitaḥ allīnaḥ ti ekībhūtaḥ  evam nissite tāva diṭṭhī nivesa āpe ādiyatī ca tattha diṭṭhī nivesā ti
translated: “He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special way. “He is stuck” means that he is stuck, that he is united.🔽“He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special way. “He is stuck” means that he is stuck, that he is united.

original: idaṃsaccābhinivesasaṅkhātāni diṭṭhinivesanāni. Na hi svātivattāti sukhena ativattitabbā🔽na honti. Dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītanti dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhigatesu taṃ taṃ samuggahitaṃ
analyzed: idaṃsacca abhinivesa saṅkhātāni diṭṭhi nivesanāni na hi sva ativattā ati sukhena ativattitabbā  na honti dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītanti dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi gatesu tam tam samuggahitam
translated: “He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special way. “He is stuck” means that he is stuck, that he is united.

original: abhiniviṭṭhadhammaṃ nicchinitvā pavattā diṭṭhinivesā na hi svātivattāti vuttaṃ hoti.🔽Tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu, nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammanti yasmā na hi svātivattā,
analyzed: abhiniviṭṭha dhammam nicchinitvā pavattāḥ diṭṭhi nivesā na hi su ativattā iti vuttam hoti  tasmai naraḥ tesu nivesanesu nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammanti yasmai na hi su ativattā
translated: “He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special way. “He is stuck” means that he is stuck, that he is united.🔽“He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special way. “He is stuck” means that he is stuck, that he is united.🔽“He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special way. “He is stuck” means that he is stuck, that he is united.🔽“He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special way. “He is stuck” means that he is stuck, that he is united.

original: tasmā naro tesuyeva diṭṭhinivesanesu ajasīlagosīlakukkurasīlapañcātapamaruppapātaukkuṭikappadhānakaṇṭakāpassayādibhedaṃ
analyzed: tasmā naro tesu yeva diṭṭhi nivesanesu aja sīla go sīla kukkura sīla pañcātapa maruppa pāta aukkuṭika ppadhāna kaṇṭaka apassaya ādi bhedam
translated: “He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special way. “He is stuck” means that he is stuck, that he is united.🔽“He is dependent on a calm state” means that he is dependent on a calm state called a view. “He is attached” means that he is attached, that he is dependent in a special

original: satthāraṃ dhammakkhānaṃ gaṇādibhedañca taṃ taṃ dhammaṃ nirassati ca ādiyati ca jahati
analyzed: satthāram dhamma kkhānam gaṇa ādi bhedam ca tam tam dhammam nirassati ca ādiyati ca jahati
translated: he rejects and accepts that Dhamma, the Teacher, the Dhamma, the Saṅgha, and so on, and he abandons

original: ca gaṇhāti ca vanamakkaṭo viya taṃ taṃ sākhanti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: ca gaṇhāti ca vana makkaṭaḥ viya tam tam sākhanti vuttam hoti
translated: He rejects and accepts, abandons and grasps, this and that teaching, the Teacher, the Dhamma, the Saṅgha, and so on, like a forest monkey the branches of the trees. He rejects and accepts, abandons and grasps, this and that teaching, the Teacher, the Dhamma, the Saṅgha, and so on, like a forest monkey the branches of the trees. He rejects and accepts, abandons and grasps, this and that teaching, the Teacher, the Dhamma, the Saṅgha, and so on, like a forest monkey the branches of the trees.

original: Evaṃ nirassanto ca ādiyanto ca anavaṭṭhitacittattā asantehipi guṇadosehi attano vā🔽parassa vā yasāyasaṃ uppādeyya. Durativattāti atikkamituṃ dukkhā. Duttarāti duuttarā.
analyzed: evam nirassantaḥ ca ādiyantaḥ ca anavaṭṭhita citta ttā asantehi pi guṇa dosehi attanaḥ vā  parassa vā yasā āyasam uppādeyya durativattā ati atikkamitum dukkhā duttarā ati duuttarā
translated: Because of his unsettled mind, he will arouse fame and disrepute for himself or others through nonexistent good qualities and faults.🔽“Hard to overcome”: difficult to overcome. “Hard to cross”: difficult to cross.

original: Duppatarā dussamatikkamā dubbinivattāti upasaggena vaḍḍhitā.🔽Nicchinitvāti sassatavasena nicchayaṃ katvā. Vinicchinitvāti attavasena nānāvidhena
analyzed: duppatarā dussamatikkamā dubbinivattā ati upasaggena vaḍḍhitā  nicchinitvā iti sassata vasena nicchayam katvā vinicchinitvā iti atta vasena nānāvidhena
translated: “Hard to get beyond”: difficult to get beyond. “Hard to turn back”: with the prefix du it is intensified.🔽“Having decided”: having decided by way of eternalism. “Having judged”: having judged by way of self.

original: vinicchayaṃ katvā. Vicinitvāti pariyesitvā. Pavicinitvāti attaniyavasena sabbākārena
analyzed: vinicchayam katvā vicinitvā ati pariyesitvā pavicinitvā ati attaniya vasena sabba ākārena
translated: “Having examined”: having sought. “Having investigated”: having sought in all ways by way of one’s own view.

original: pariyesitvā. “Nicinitvā viccinitvā”tipi pāṭho. Odhiggāhoti avadhiyitvā gāho. Bilaggāhoti
analyzed: pariyesitvā nicinitvā viccinitvā atipi pāṭhaḥ odhiggāho ti gāhaḥ bilaggāho ti
translated: “Having decided and examined” is another reading. “Grasping at”: grasping after. “Grasping at a cave”:

original: koṭṭhāsavasena gāho “bilaso vibhajitvā”tiādīsu viya. Varaggāhoti uttamagāho. Koṭṭhāsaggāhoti🔽avayavavasena gāho. Uccayaggāhoti rāsivasena gāho. Samuccayaggāhoti koṭṭhāsavasena
analyzed: koṭṭhāsa vasena gāhaḥ bilasaḥ vibhajitvā ati ādīsu viya vara ggāho ti uttama gāho koṭṭhāsa ggāho ti  avayava vasena gāho uccaya ggāho ti rāsi vasena gāho samuccaya ggāho ti koṭṭhāsa vasena
translated: as in the case of the words “having divided the bilva fruit” . The grasping of the best is the grasping of the highest. The grasping of the parts is the grasping of the components. The grasping of the heap is the grasping of the collection. The grasping of the accumulation is the grasping of the parts.

original: rāsivasena ca gāho. Idaṃ saccanti idameva sabhāvaṃ. Tacchanti tathabhāvaṃ aviparītasabhāvaṃ.
analyzed: rāsi vasena ca gāho idam idam eva sabhāvam tacchanti tathabhāvam aviparīta sabhāvam
translated: ‘Apprehending by parts’ is apprehending by way of parts. ‘Apprehending by the best’ is apprehending the best. ‘Apprehending by parts’ is apprehending by way of components. ‘Apprehending by accumulation’ is apprehending by way of a heap. ‘Apprehending by combination’ is apprehending by way of parts and by way of a heap. ‘This is true’ is the individual essence. ‘This is real’ is the real individual essence, the non-inverted individual essence.

original: Tathanti vipariṇāmarahitaṃ. Bhūtanti vijjamānaṃ. Yāthāvanti yathāsabhāvaṃ. Aviparītanti na viparītaṃ.🔽Nirassatīti niassati vikkhipati. Paravicchindanāya vāti parehi vissajjāpanena. Anabhisambhuṇanto
analyzed: tathanti vipariṇāma rahitam bhūtanti vijjamānam yāthāvanti yathā sabhāvam aviparītanti na viparītam  nirassati iti niassati vikkhipati para vicchindanāya vāti parehi vissajjāpanena an abhisambhuṇantaḥ
translated: ‘Thus’ is without change. ‘Exists’ is what is present. ‘As it is’ is according to the individual essence. ‘Non-inverted’ is not inverted.

original: vāti asampāpuṇanto vā asakkonto vā vissajjeti. Paro vicchindetīti añño viyogaṃ karoti.
analyzed: vāti a sampāpuṇantaḥ vā a sakkontaḥ vā vissajjeti paraḥ vicchindeti iti aññaḥ viyogam karoti
translated: ‘He denies’ is he denies, he scatters. ‘For the sake of another’s investigation’ is for the sake of another’s explanation. ‘Not being able to’ is not reaching, not attaining, not succeeding, he explains. ‘Another investigates’ is another makes separation.

original: Natthetthāti natthi ettha. Sīlaṃ anabhisambhuṇantoti sīlaṃ asampādento. Sīlaṃ nirassatīti🔽sīlaṃ vissajjeti. Ito paresupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: nattha itthā ati natthi ettha sīlam an abhisambhuṇanto ati sīlam a sampādento sīlam nirassati iti 🔽sīlam vissajja iti itas paresu pi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: ‘There is not’ is there is not. ‘Not being able to’ is not reaching, not attaining, not succeeding. ‘He denies’ is he explains. The same method applies to the rest.

original: 21. Yo panāyaṃ sabbadiṭṭhigatādidosadhunanāya paññāya samannāgatattā dhono, tassa🔽dhonassa hi…pe… anūpayo so. Kiṃ vuttaṃ hoti? Dhonadhammasamannāgamā dhonassa dhutasabbapāpassa
analyzed: yaḥ pana ayam sabba diṭṭhi gata ādi dosa dhunanāya paññāya samannāgata ttā tassa  dhonassa hipe anūpayaḥ so kim vuttam hoti dhona dhamma samannāgamā dhonassa dhuta sabba pāpassa
translated: He who is a “wielder of the cudgel” because he possesses the wisdom that smashes all views,🔽for that wielder of the cudgel,

original: arahato katthaci loke tesu tesu bhavesu saṃkappanā diṭṭhi natthi. So tassā diṭṭhiyā🔽abhāvā, yāya ca attanā kataṃ pāpakammaṃ paṭicchādentā titthiyā māyāya vā mānena vā
analyzed: arahataḥ katthaci loke tesu tesu bhavesu saṃkappanā diṭṭhi natthi so tassā diṭṭhiyā  abhāvā yāya ca attanā katam pāpa kammam paṭicchādentā titthiyā māyāya vā mānena vā
translated: who has shaken off all evil, has no speculation anywhere in the world, in any of the modes of existence.🔽Because he has no such speculation, he does not go to a bad destination by way of deception or conceit, as do the sectarians who conceal their evil deeds by deception.

original: evaṃ agatiṃ gacchanti, tampi māyañca mānañca pahāya dhono rāgādīnaṃ dosānaṃ kena
analyzed: evam agatim gacchanti māyam ca mānam ca pahāya kena
translated: Having abandoned deception and conceit, by what means could the wielder of the cudgel go to a bad destination, by lust, hatred, or delusion?

original: gaccheyya, diṭṭhadhamme samparāye vā nirayādīsu gativisesesu kena saṅkhaṃ gaccheyya,
analyzed: gaccheyya diṭṭhadhamme samparāye vā niraya ādīsu gati visesesu kena saṅkham gaccheyya
translated: Or by what means could he be reckoned in the various destinies, such as hell, in the present life or in the life to come?

original: anūpayo so, so hi taṇhādiṭṭhiupayānaṃ dvinnaṃ abhāvena anūpayoti.
analyzed: saḥ saḥ hi taṇhā diṭṭhi upayānam dvinnam abhāvena
translated: He has no means. He has no means because he has no two means, craving and views.🔽By what means? By what reason?

original: Kiṃ kāraṇāti kena kāraṇena. Dhonā vuccati paññāti dhonā iti kiṃkāraṇā paññā kathīyati.
analyzed: kim kāraṇā ati kena kāraṇena dhonā vuccati paññā ati dhonā iti kiṃkāraṇā paññā kathīyati
translated: Wisdom is called a “cudgel” . Why is wisdom called a “cudgel”?

original: Tāya paññāya kāyaduccaritanti tāya vuttappakārāya paññāya kāyato pavattaṃ duṭṭhu
analyzed: tāya paññāya kāya duccaritan ti tāya vutta ppakārāya paññāya kāyataḥ pavattam duṭṭhu
translated: By that understanding: by that understanding of the kind already stated,🔽what is called bodily misconduct is conduct that is bad,

original: kilesapūtikattā vā caritanti kāyaduccaritaṃ. Dhūtañca dhotañcāti kampitañca dhovitañca.
analyzed: kilesa pūti kattā vā kāya duccaritam dhūtam ca dhotam ca ati kampitam ca dhovitam ca
translated: or conduct that is corrupt with defilements.🔽Shaken off and washed away: shaken and washed.🔽Well shaken off: well shaken off.

original: Sandhotañcāti sammā dhovitañca. Niddhotañcāti visesena suṭṭhu niddhotañca. Rāgo dhuto
analyzed: sandhotañca ati sammā dhovitañca niddhotañca ati visesena suṭṭhu niddhotañca rāgaḥ dhuto
translated: Well washed away: well washed away.

original: cātiādayo catunnaṃ maggānaṃ vasena yojetabbā.
analyzed: cāti ādayaḥ catunnam maggānam vasena yojetabbā
translated: Lust is shaken off, etc. should be construed with the four paths.

original: Sammādiṭṭhiyā micchādiṭṭhi dhutā cāti maggasampayuttāya sammādiṭṭhiyā micchādiṭṭhi🔽kampitā calitā dhovitā. Sammāsaṅkappādīsupi eseva nayo. Vuttañhetaṃ “sammādiṭṭhikassa,
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhiyā micchādiṭṭhi dhutā ca ati magga sampayuttāya sammādiṭṭhiyā micchādiṭṭhi  kampitā calitā dhovitā sammāsaṅkappa ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ vuttam ha etam sammādiṭṭhikassa
translated: By right view wrong view is shaken off: by right view associated with the path wrong view is shaken off,🔽moved, washed away. The same method applies in the case of right thinking, etc. For this is said: “Bhikkhus, for one possessing right view, wrong view is discarded” . The sutta should be elaborated in detail.

original: bhikkhave, micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hotī”ti suttaṃ vitthāretabbaṃ. Sammāñāṇenāti maggasampayuttañāṇena,
analyzed: bhikkhave micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hoti iti suttam vitthāretabbam sammāñāṇena ati magga sampayutta ñāṇena
translated: By right knowledge: by knowledge associated with the path,🔽or by reviewing knowledge.

original: paccavekkhaṇañāṇena vā. Micchāñāṇanti viparītañāṇaṃ ayāthāvañāṇaṃ, pāpakiriyāsu upacintāvasena
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇena vā micchā ñāṇam ti viparīta ñāṇam ayāthāva ñāṇam pāpa kiriyāsu upacintā vasena
translated: By wrong knowledge: by distorted knowledge, by knowledge that is not in accordance with the facts, by knowledge that is a condition for evil-doing,

original: pāpaṃ katvā “sukataṃ mayā”ti paccavekkhaṇākārena ca uppanno moho. Sammāvimuttiyā
analyzed: pāpam katvā su katam mayā ati paccavekkhaṇa ākārena ca uppannaḥ mohaḥ sammāvimuttiyā
translated: and delusion that arises in the form of reviewing what has been done as “well done” by one who has done evil.

original: micchāvimuttīti samucchedavimuttiyā viparītā ayāthāvavimuttiyeva cetovimuttisaññitā.🔽Arahā imehi dhoneyyehi dhammehīti rāgādīhi kilesehi dūre ṭhito arahā imehi vuttappakārehi
analyzed: micchā vimutti iti samuccheda vimuttiyāḥ viparītā a yāthāva vimuttiyā iva cetaḥ vimutti saññitā  arahā imehi dhoneyyehi dhammehi iti rāga ādīhi kilesehi dūre ṭhitaḥ arahā imehi vutta ppakārehi
translated: Wrong liberation: the wrong, unfactual liberation called “deliverance of mind” is the opposite of right liberation.

original: kilesadhovanehi dhammehi upeto hoti. Dhonoti dhono puggalo, teneva “so dhutarāgo”tiādayo āha.
analyzed: kilesa dhovanehi dhammehi upetaḥ hoti dhonoti dhono puggalo tena iva so āha
translated: Endowed with these states that are worthy of the noble ones: the arahant, who stands far away from the defilements of lust, etc., is endowed with these states that are worthy of the noble ones, that is, with these states that are worthy of the noble ones, that is, with these states that purify the defilements.🔽“Endowed” : the person endowed is called “one who has washed away his stains” , and so on.

original: Māyā vuccati vañcanikācariyāti vañcanakiriyaṃ vañcanakaraṇaṃ assā atthīti vañcanikācariyā.
analyzed: māyā vuccati vañcanikā cariyā ati vañcana kiriyam vañcana karaṇam assā atthi iti vañcanikā cariyā
translated: Deceit is a craftiness of deception: it is a craftiness that is a craft for deceiving, a craft for cheating.🔽Because of the desire to conceal: because of the desire to conceal those bad actions.

original: Tassa paṭicchādanahetūti tesaṃ duccaritānaṃ appakāsanakāraṇā. Pāpikaṃ icchaṃ paṇidahatīti
analyzed: tassa paṭicchādana hetu uti tesam duccaritānam appakāsana kāraṇā pāpikam iccham paṇidahati iti
translated: He generates a wicked will: he establishes a wicked wish.

original: lāmakaṃ patthanaṃ patiṭṭhāpeti. “Mā maṃ jaññā”ti icchatīti “mayhaṃ kataṃ pāpaṃ pare
analyzed: lāmakam patthanam patiṭṭhāpeti mā mam jaññāti icchati iti mayham katam pāpam pare
translated: He wishes: “Let them not know me” : he resolves: “Let others not know my evil deeds.”🔽He conceals: he generates a thought.

original: mā jāniṃsū”ti paccāsīsati. Saṅkappetīti vitakkaṃ uppādeti. Vācaṃ bhāsatīti jānaṃyeva
analyzed: mā jāniṃsu iti paccāsīsati saṅkappeti iti vitakkam uppādeti vācam bhāsati iti jānaṃyā iva
translated: He speaks words: knowing.

original: paṇṇattiṃ vītikkamanto bhikkhu bhāriyaṃ karoti. “Amhākaṃ vītikkamaṭṭhānaṃ nāma natthī”ti
analyzed: paṇṇattim vītikkamantaḥ bhikkhu bhāriyam karoti amhākam vītikkamaṭṭhānam nāma natthi iti
translated: When a bhikkhu transgresses the rules of training, he commits a serious offence.🔽He speaks as if he were calm, saying, “There is nothing in me that needs to be confessed.”

original: upasanto viya bhāsati. Kāyena parakkamatīti “mayā kataṃ idaṃ pāpakammaṃ mā keci jāniṃsū”ti🔽kāyena vattaṃ karoti. Vijjamānadosapaṭicchādanato cakkhumohanamāyā assāti māyāvī,
analyzed: upasantaḥ viya bhāsati kāyena parakkamati iti mayā katam idam pāpa kammam mā keci jāniṃsu iti  kāyena vattam karoti vijjamāna dosa paṭicchādanato cakkhu mohana māyāḥ assāti māyāvī
translated: He acts with his body, thinking, “Let no one know that I have done this evil deed.”🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.

original: māyāvino bhāvo māyāvitā. Katvā pāpaṃ puna paṭicchādanato aticca assarati etāya sattoti🔽accasarā. Kāyavācākiriyāhi aññathā dassanato vañcetīti vañcanā. Etāya sattā nikarontīti
analyzed: māyāvinaḥ bhāvaḥ māyāvi tā katvā pāpam puna paṭicchādanataḥ aticca assarati etāya sattā ti  accasarā kāya vācā kiriyāhi aññathā dassanataḥ vañceti iti vañcanā etāya sattāḥ nikaronti iti
translated: He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.

original: nikati, micchā karontīti attho. “Nāhaṃ evaṃ karomī”ti pāpānaṃ vikkhipanato nikiraṇā.🔽“Nāhaṃ evaṃ karomī”ti parivajjanato pariharaṇā. Kāyādīhi saṃharaṇato gūhanā. Samabhāgena
analyzed: nikati micchā karonti iti atthaḥ na aham evam karomi iti pāpānam vikkhipanataḥ nikiraṇā  na aham evam karomi iti parivajjanataḥ pariharaṇā kāya ādīhi saṃharaṇataḥ gūhanā sama bhāgena
translated: He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.

original: gūhanā parigūhanā. Tiṇapaṇṇehi viya gūthaṃ kāyavacīkammehi pāpaṃ chādetīti chādanā.
analyzed: gūhanā parigūhanā tiṇa paṇṇehi viya gūtham kāya vacī kammehi pāpam chādeti iti chādanā
translated: He is a deceiver because he deceives by means of the magic of concealing his real faults.🔽He is a deceiver because he

original: Sabbato bhāgena chādanā paricchādanā. Na uttāniṃ katvā dassetīti anuttānikammaṃ.
analyzed: sabbatas bhāgena chādanā paricchādanā na uttānim katvā dasseti iti an uttāni kammam
translated: Covering up by all sides is concealing. Not showing by turning it outside is not turning it inside out.

original: Na pākaṭaṃ katvā dassetīti anāvikammaṃ. Suṭṭhu chādanā vocchādanā. Katapaṭicchādanavasena
analyzed: na pākaṭam katvā dasseti iti anāvikammam suṭṭhu chādanā vā ucchādanā kata paṭicchādana vasena
translated: Not showing by making it obvious is not turning it inside out. Covering up well is concealing.

original: punapi pāpassa karaṇato pāpakiriyā. Ayaṃ vuccatīti ayaṃ katapaṭicchādanalakkhaṇā
analyzed: puna api pāpassa karaṇato pāpa kiriyā ayam vuccati iti ayam kata paṭicchādana lakkhaṇā
translated: Doing evil again by way of concealing what has been done is doing evil. This is called: this concealing by way of characteristic is called

original: māyā nāma vuccati, yāya samannāgato puggalo bhasmapaṭicchanno viya aṅgāro, udakapaṭicchanno
analyzed: māyā nāma vuccati yāya samannāgataḥ puggalo bhasma paṭicchannaḥ viya aṅgāro udaka paṭicchanno
translated: deceit, by means of which a person is like a coal covered with ashes,

original: viya khāṇu, pilotikapaliveṭhitaṃ viya ca satthaṃ hoti.
analyzed: viya khāṇu pilotika paliveṭhitam viya ca sattham hoti
translated: like a stump covered with water, like a knife hidden in a sheath.

original: Ekavidhena mānoti ekaparicchedena ekakoṭṭhāsena māno. Yā cittassa unnatīti yā cittassa abbhussāpanā, ayaṃ mānoti attho. Ettha puggalaṃ anāmasitvā nibbattitamānova vutto.
analyzed: ekavidhena māno ti eka paricchedena eka koṭṭhāsena māno yā cittassa unnati iti yā cittassa abbhussāpanā ayam māno ti atthaḥ ettha puggalam an āmasitvā nibbattita mānaḥ iva vutto
translated: Conceit is one-sided, by one definition, by one portion. The heightening of the mind is the lifting up of the mind; this is the meaning of conceit. Herein, without mentioning a person, conceit itself is spoken of.

original: Attukkaṃsanamānoti attānaṃ upari ṭhapanamāno. Paravambhanamānoti pare lāmakakaraṇamāno. Ime dve mānā yebhuyyena tathā pavattākāravasena vuttā.
analyzed: attukkaṃsana mānaḥ ti attānam upari ṭhapana mānaḥ paravambhana mānaḥ iti pare lāmaka karaṇa mānaḥ ime dve mānā yebhuyyena tathā pavatta ākāra vasena vuttā
translated: “Exalting oneself” is exalting oneself above others. “Disparaging others” is disparaging others. These two kinds of conceit are mentioned according to the way in which they occur.

original: “Seyyohamasmī”ti mānoti jātiādīni nissāya “ahamasmi seyyo”ti uppanno māno. Sadisamānādīsupi
analyzed: seyyaḥ uham asmi iti māno ti jāti ādīni nissāya aham asmi seyyaḥ iti uppannaḥ māno sadisa māna ādīsu pi
translated: “I am better” is conceit that arises thinking “I am better” in regard to birth, etc. “I am equal” is conceit that arises thinking “I am equal” in regard to birth, etc. “I am worse” is conceit that arises thinking “I am worse” in regard to birth, etc.

original: eseva nayo. Evamimepi tayo mānā puggalavisesaṃ anissāya tathā pavattākāravasena vuttā.
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ evam ime api tayaḥ mānā puggala visesam a nissāya tathā pavatta ākāra vasena vuttā
translated: The same method applies to the other two. Thus these three kinds of conceit are mentioned according to the way in which they occur, taking as their support a distinction among persons.

original: Tesu ekeko tiṇṇampi seyyasadisahīnānaṃ uppajjati. Tattha “seyyohamasmī”ti māno seyyasseva🔽yāthāvamāno, sesānaṃ ayāthāvamāno. “Sadisohamasmī”ti māno sadisasseva yāthāvamāno,
analyzed: tesu ekekaḥ tiṇṇam pi seyya sadisa hīnānam uppajjati tattha seyyā uham asmi iti māno seyyassa iva  yāthāvamānaḥ sesānam a yāthāvamānaḥ sadisaḥ ham asmi iti mānaḥ sadisassa iva yāthāvamānaḥ
translated: Among them, each of the three kinds of conceit can arise in regard to one who is better, equal, or worse. Herein, “I am better” is conceit that occurs in regard to one who is better.🔽It is right conceit in regard to one who is better, wrong conceit in regard to one who is equal or worse. “I am equal” is conceit that occurs in regard to one who is equal.🔽It is right conceit in regard to one who is equal, wrong conceit in regard to one who is better or worse. “I am worse” is conceit that occurs in regard to one who is worse.

original: sesānaṃ ayāthāvamāno. “Hīnohamasmī”ti māno hīnasseva yāthāvamāno, sesānaṃ ayāthāvamāno.
analyzed: sesānam a yāthāvamānaḥ hīnaḥ aham asmi iti mānaḥ hīnassa iva yāthāvamānaḥ sesānam a yāthāvamānaḥ
translated: It is right conceit in regard to one who is worse, wrong conceit in regard to one who is better or equal.

original: Catubbidhena māno lokadhammavasena vutto. Pañcavidhena māno pañcakāmaguṇavasena vutto. Chabbidhena māno cakkhādisampattivasena vutto. Tattha mānaṃ janetīti mānaṃ uppādeti.
analyzed: catubbidhena mānaḥ loka dhamma vasena vutto pañcavidhena māno pañca kāmaguṇa vasena vutto chabbidhena māno cakkha ādi sampatti vasena vuttaḥ tattha mānam janeti iti mānam uppādeti
translated: Conceit is spoken of as fourfold according to the worldly ideas. It is spoken of as fivefold according to the five strands of sense pleasure. It is spoken of as sixfold according to the excellence of eye, etc. Herein, he generates conceit means he produces conceit.

original: Sattavidhena mānaniddese mānoti unnamo. Atimānoti “jātiādīhi mayā sadiso natthī”ti
analyzed: sattavidhena māna niddese mānoti unnamo atimānoti jāti ādīhi mayā sadiso natthi iti
translated: In the description of the sevenfold conceit, conceit is exaltation. Exaggerated conceit is conceit that arises through the exaggeration of thinking “There is no one equal to me in clan, etc.”

original: atikkamitvā maññanavasena uppanno māno. Mānātimānoti “ayaṃ pubbe mayā sadiso, idāni🔽ahaṃ seṭṭho, ayaṃ hīnataro”ti uppanno māno. Ayaṃ bhārātibhāro viya purimaṃ sadisamānaṃ
analyzed: atikkamitvā maññana vasena uppannaḥ mānaḥ māna atimānaḥ ti ayam pubbe mayā sadisaḥ idāni  aham seṭṭhaḥ ayam hīnataraḥ iti uppannaḥ mānaḥ ayam bhāra atibhāraḥ viya purimam
translated: Conceit and exaggerated conceit are conceit that arises thinking “This one was formerly equal to me, but now🔽he is better, I am inferior.” This is called conceit and exaggerated conceit, as if it were a burden, in order to show that it is a burden in comparison with the former kind of conceit that is equal to it.

original: upādāya mānātimāno nāmāti dassetuṃ “mānātimāno”ti āha. Omānoti hīnamāno. Yo “hīnohamasmī”ti
analyzed: upādāya mānātimānaḥ nāma ati dassetum mānātimānoti āha omāno ti hīna mānaḥ yaḥ hīnaḥ uham asmi iti
translated: Humility is lowliness. It is called humility because it is conceit that is spoken of as “I am low.”

original: māno nāma vutto, ayaṃ omāno nāma. Api cettha “tvaṃ jātimā, kākajāti viya te jāti.
analyzed: mānaḥ nāma vuttaḥ ayam omānaḥ nāma api ca ittha tvam jātimā kāka jāti viya te jāti
translated: But here “You are of clan, your clan is like a crow’s clan.

original: Tvaṃ gottavā, caṇḍālagottaṃ viya te gottaṃ. Tuyhaṃ saro atthi, kākasaro viya te saro”ti
analyzed: tvam caṇḍāla gottam viya te gottam tuyham saraḥ atthi kāka saraḥ viya te saraḥ ti
translated: You have a family, your family is like a caṇḍāla’s family. You have a voice, your voice is like a crow’s voice.”

original: evaṃ attānaṃ heṭṭhā katvā pavattanavasena ayaṃ “omāno”ti veditabbo.
analyzed: evam attānam heṭṭhā katvā pavattana vasena ayam omānaḥ ti veditabbo
translated: Thus it should be understood as “conceit” in the sense of “making oneself high” .

original: Adhimānoti cattāri saccāni appatvā pattasaññissa, catūhi maggehi kattabbe kicce akateyeva
analyzed: adhimānaḥ ti cattāri saccāni a patvā patta saññissa catūhi maggehi kattabbe kicce a kateyeva
translated: “Overweening conceit” : in one who has not reached the four paths and fruits, conceit arises with the perception of having reached them;🔽in one who has not done the duties required by the four paths and fruits, conceit arises with the perception that he has done them;

original: katasaññissa, catusaccadhamme anadhigate adhigatasaññissa, arahatte asacchikate sacchikatasaññissa
analyzed: kata saññissa catu sacca dhamme anadhigate adhigata saññissa arahatte a sacchikate sacchikata saññissa
translated: in one who has not attained the four paths and fruits, conceit arises with the perception that he has attained them; in one who has not realized arahatship, conceit arises with the perception that he has realized it.

original: uppanno adhigatamāno adhimāno nāma. Ayaṃ pana kassa uppajjati, kassa na uppajjatīti?
analyzed: uppannaḥ adhigata mānaḥ adhimānaḥ nāma ayam pana kassa uppajjati kassa na uppajjati iti
translated: But who is it that does not give rise to conceit?

original: Ariyasāvakassa tāva na uppajjati. So hi maggaphalanibbānapahīnakilesāvasiṭṭhakilesapaccavekkhaṇena
analyzed: ariya sāvakassa tāva na uppajjati so hi magga phala nibbāna pahīna kilesa avasiṭṭha kilesa paccavekkhaṇena
translated: The ariyan disciple does not give rise to conceit. For he reflects on the defilements that have been abandoned by the paths and fruits and on the defilements that remain,

original: sañjātasomanasso ariyaguṇapaṭivedhe nikkaṅkho, tasmā sotāpannādīnaṃ “ahaṃ sakadāgāmī”tiādivasena
analyzed: sañjāta somanassaḥ ariya guṇa paṭivedhe nikkaṅkho tasmā sotāpanna ādīnam aham sakadāgāmī iti ādi vasena
translated: and he is filled with joy at the realization of the ariyan qualities. He is free from doubt, and therefore conceit does not arise in the stream-enterer and the other ariyans in the form of “I am a once-returner,” etc.

original: māno na uppajjati, dussīlassa ca na uppajjati. So hi ariyaguṇādhigame nirāsova. Sīlavatopi
analyzed: mānaḥ na uppajjati dussīlassa ca na uppajjati saḥ hi ariya guṇa adhigame sīlavataḥ pi
translated: Conceit also does not arise in the unvirtuous, for he is utterly devoid of hope for the realization of the ariyan qualities.

original: pariccattakammaṭṭhānassa niddārāmatādimanuyuttassa na uppajjati, parisuddhasīlassa🔽pana kammaṭṭhāne appamattassa nāmarūpaṃ vavatthapetvā paccayapariggahena vitiṇṇakaṅkhassa
analyzed: pariccatta kammaṭṭhānassa niddā rāma tā ādi manuyuttassa na uppajjati parisuddha sīlassa  pana kammaṭṭhāne appamattassa nāma rūpam vavatthapetvā paccaya pariggahena vitiṇṇa kaṅkhassa
translated: It does not arise in one who has been given a meditation subject but who is devoted to drowsiness and so on.🔽But it arises in one who is scrupulous in observing the moral precepts,
