translated: Now, in order to show this by means of a sutta taught by the Blessed One, he said: “Bhikkhus, ‘I am’ is a conceit. ‘I am this’ is a view. ‘I shall be’ is a thicket of views, a wilderness of views, a contortion of views, a writhing of views, a fetter of views. It belongs to the side of defilement, belongs to the side of stress, belongs to the unsatisfactoriness of becoming.

original: Aññatra satipaṭṭhānehīti ṭhapetvā catusatipaṭṭhāne.
analyzed: aññatra sati paṭṭhānehi iti ṭhapetvā catu sati paṭṭhāne
translated: “‘I am’ is a conceit”: this is a designation for permanence. ‘I am this’ is a view”: this is a designation for the assumption of a view. ‘I shall be’ is a thicket of views … a fetter of views”: this is a designation for the assumption of a view in the future. It belongs to the side of defilement … the unsatisfactoriness of becoming”: this is a designation for the assumption of a view in the future.

original: Sabbe bālaputhujjanā rajjantīti sakalā andhabālā nānājanā lagganti. Satta sekkhā
analyzed: sabbe bāla puthujjanāḥ rajjanti iti sakalāḥ andha bālāḥ nānā janāḥ lagganti satta sekkhā
translated: “Bhikkhus, all those ascetics and brahmins who are bound by the bond of the view ‘I am’ are bound for the plane of misery, bound for hell” : all those blind ordinary people are caught in the various kinds of views.🔽“Bhikkhus, all those ascetics and brahmins who are bound by the bond of the view ‘I am’ are bound for the plane of misery, bound for hell” : all those blind ordinary people are caught in the various kinds of views.

original: virajjantīti sotāpannādayo satta ariyajanā virāgaṃ āpajjanti. Arahā neva rajjati
analyzed: virajjanti iti sotāpanna ādayo satta ariya janāḥ virāgam āpajjanti arahā na iva rajjati
translated: “They are dispassionate” : the seven kinds of noble persons beginning with the stream-enterer are dispassionate. The arahat neither lusts nor is dispassionate,

original: no virajjatīti kilesānaṃ parinibbāpitattā ubhayampi na karoti. Khayā rāgassātiādayo
analyzed: no virajjati iti kilesānam parinibbāpita ttā ubhayam pi na karoti khayā rāgassa ati ādayaḥ
translated: for he does not do either because the defilements have been extinguished in him. “By the destruction of lust” and so forth

original: tividhāpi nibbānameva.
analyzed: tividhā api nibbānam eva
translated: are the three kinds of nibbana.

original: Saddhammappajjotikāya mahāniddesaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: saddhammappajjotikāya mahā niddesa ṭṭhakathāya
translated: In the Mahāniddesa Commentary on the Saddhamma

original: Jarāsuttaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽7. Tissametteyyasuttaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: jarā sutta niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Jarasutta is finished.🔽. The commentary on the Tissametteyya Sutta

original: 49. Sattame tissametteyyasutte methunamanuyuttassāti methunadhammaṃ samāyuttassa.
analyzed: sattame tissametteyya sutte methunam anuyuttassa ati methuna dhammam samāyuttassa
translated: In the seventh sutta, on Tissametteyya, “he who is devoted to sexual intercourse” is he who is devoted to sexual intercourse.

original: Itīti evamāha. Āyasmāti piyavacanametaṃ. Tissoti nāmaṃ tassa therassa. Sopi hi tissoti
analyzed: iti iti evam āha tissaḥ iti nāmam tassa therassa saḥ api hi tissaḥ ti
translated: “Thus” : he spoke thus. “Venerable Sir” is a term of endearment. “Tissa” is the name of that elder. He was also called Tissa

original: nāmena. Metteyyoti gottaṃ, gottavaseneva esa pākaṭo ahosi. Tasmā aṭṭhuppattiyaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: nāmena metteyyaḥ ti gottam gotta vasena iva esa pākaṭaḥ ahosi tasmai aṭṭhuppattiyam vuttam
translated: by name. “Metteyya” is his clan. He was well known by his clan. Therefore it is said in the story of his origin:

original: – “tissametteyyā nāma dve sahāyā”ti. Vighātanti upaghātaṃ. Brūhīti ācikkha. Mārisāti
analyzed: tissametteyyā nāma dve sahāyā ati vighātam ti upaghātam brūhi iti ācikkha mārisa ati
translated: “There were two friends called Tissa and Metteyya.” “Harm” is injury. “Tell” means explain. “Friend” is a term of address.

original: piyavacanametaṃ, niddukkhāti vuttaṃ hoti. Sutvāna tava sāsananti tava vacanaṃ sutvā.
analyzed: piya vacanam etam niddukkha ati vuttam hoti sutvāna tava sāsanam ti tava vacanam sutvā
translated: ‘Pleasant words’ are words free from suffering. ‘Having heard your instruction’: having heard your speech.

original: Viveke sikkhissāmaseti sahāyaṃ ārabbha dhammadesanaṃ yācanto bhaṇati, so pana sikkhitasikkhoyeva.
analyzed: viveke sikkhissāmase iti sahāyam ārabbha dhamma desanam yācantaḥ bhaṇati saḥ pana sikkhita sikkhaḥ yā eva
translated: ‘In solitude we will train’: he speaks while requesting a teaching about a companion, but the latter is already well trained.

original: Methunadhammo nāmāti idaṃ niddisitabbassa methunadhammassa upadesapadaṃ. Asaddhammoti
analyzed: methuna dhammo nāma ati idam niddisitabbassa methuna dhammassa upadesa padam asat dhammaḥ ti
translated: ‘Sexual intercourse’: this is a term of reference to sexual intercourse. ‘Immoral’:

original: asataṃ nīcajanānaṃ dhammo. Gāmadhammoti gāmavāsīnaṃ sevanadhammo. Vasaladhammoti
analyzed: asatam nīca janānam dhammaḥ gāma dhammaḥ oti gāma vāsīnam sevana dhammaḥ vasala dhammaḥ iti
translated: it is the immoral practice of the low-class people. ‘Village practice’: it is the practice of those who live in villages. ‘Practice of slaves’:

original: vasalānaṃ dhammo, kilesavassanato vā sayameva vasalo dhammoti vasaladhammo. Duṭṭhulloti
analyzed: vasalānam dhammo kilesa vassanataḥ vā sayam eva vasalaḥ dhammo ti vasala dhammo duṭṭhullo ti
translated: it is the practice of slaves, or it is a practice that is itself a slave because of the raining down of defilements. ‘Heinous’:

original: duṭṭho ca kilesehi duṭṭhattā, thūlo ca anipuṇabhāvatoti duṭṭhullo. Yasmā ca tassa
analyzed: duṭṭhaḥ ca kilesehi duṭṭha ttā thūlaḥ ca a nipuṇa bhāvato ti duṭṭhullaḥ yasmā ca tassa
translated: it is defiled because of being defiled by defilements, and it is gross because of its unskillfulness.

original: dhammassa parivārabhūtaṃ dassanampi gahaṇampi āmasanampi phusanampi ghaṭṭanampi duṭṭhullaṃ,
analyzed: dhammassa parivāra bhūtam dassanam pi gahaṇam pi āmasanam pi phusanam pi ghaṭṭanam pi duṭṭhullam
translated: And because the seeing, the taking, the touching, the rubbing, and the knocking that surround this practice are gross,

original: tasmāpi duṭṭhullo so methunadhammo. Odakantikoti udakaṃ assa ante suddhatthaṃ ādiyatīti
analyzed: tasmā api duṭṭhullaḥ saḥ methuna dhammo odakantikaḥ iti udakam assa ante suddhattham ādiyati iti
translated: it is also ‘heinous’ because of that. ‘Water-purifying’: it is said that water is taken at the end of it for the purpose of purification,

original: udakanto, udakantoyeva odakantiko. Raho paṭicchanne okāse kattabbatāya rahasso. Vinaye🔽pana “duṭṭhullaṃ odakantikaṃ rahassa”nti pāṭho. Tattha tīsu padesu yo soti padaṃ🔽parivattetvā yaṃ tanti katvā yojetabbaṃ “yaṃ taṃ duṭṭhullaṃ, so methunadhammo, yaṃ
analyzed: udakantaḥ odakantoya iva odakantikaḥ raho paṭicchanne okāse kattabbatāya rahassaḥ vinaye  pana duṭṭhullam odaka ntikam rahassanti pāṭhaḥ tattha tīsu padesu yaḥ so ti padam  parivattetvā yam tanti katvā yojetabbam yam tam duṭṭhullam saḥ methuna dhammaḥ yam
translated: The water-symbol is the water-symbol itself. The secret is the secret because it is to be done in a concealed place.

original: taṃ odakantikaṃ so methunadhammo, yaṃ taṃ rahassaṃ, so methunadhammo”ti. Idha pana🔽“yo so asaddhammo, so methunadhammo…pe… yo so rahasso, so methunadhammo”ti evaṃ yojanā
analyzed: tam odakantikam saḥ methuna dhammo yam tam rahassam saḥ methuna dhammaḥ ti idha pana  yaḥ saḥ asat dhammo saḥ methuna dhammaḥ upe yaḥ saḥ rahassaḥ saḥ methuna dhammaḥ ti evam yojanā
translated: But in the Vinaya the reading is “a grave water-symbol, a secret” . Here the passage beginning with the words “What is that grave” should be construed as follows: “What is that grave, that is sexual intercourse; what is that water-symbol, that is sexual intercourse; what is that secret, that is sexual intercourse.” But here the construction should be understood as follows: “What is that evil thing, that is sexual intercourse … what is that secret, that is sexual intercourse.”

original: veditabbā. Dvayena dvayena samāpajjitabbato dvayaṃdvayasamāpatti. Tattha yojanā –🔽yā sā dvayaṃdvayasamāpatti, so methunadhammo nāmāti. Kiṃkāraṇā vuccati methunadhammoti
analyzed: veditabbā dvayena dvayena samāpajjitabbataḥ dvayaṃdvaya samāpatti tattha yojanā  yā sā dvayaṃdvaya samāpatti so methuna dhammaḥ nāma ati kiṃkāraṇā vuccati methuna dhammo ti
translated: The double-entry is the double-entry because it is to be entered into by a couple. Here the construction is as follows: “What is that double-entry, that is sexual intercourse.”🔽Why is it called sexual intercourse?🔽For what reason, by what definition, is it called sexual intercourse? Showing that reason, he said: “Because of the two, because of the pair,🔽because of the couple, because of the two sexes,🔽because of the two organs, because of the two orifices,

original: kena kāraṇena kena pariyāyena methunadhammoti kathīyati. Taṃ kāraṇaṃ dassento “ubhinnaṃ
analyzed: kena kāraṇena kena pariyāyena methuna dhammaḥ ti kathīyati tam kāraṇam dassentaḥ ubhinnam
translated: because of the two openings, because of the two entrances,🔽because of the two ways, because of the two methods,🔽because of the two kinds of action, because of the two kinds of performance,🔽because of the two kinds of contact, because of the two kinds of feeling,🔽because of the two kinds of satisfaction, because of the two kinds of enjoyment,🔽because of the two kinds of experience, because of the two kinds of consent,🔽because of the two kinds of lust, because of the two kinds of greed,🔽because of the two kinds of desire, because of the two kinds of passion,🔽because of the two kinds of burning, because of the two kinds of fever,🔽because of the two kinds of union, because of the two kinds of meeting,🔽because of the two kinds of intercourse, because of the two kinds of enjoyment,🔽because of the two kinds of pleasure, because of the two kinds of delight,🔽because of the two kinds of satisfaction, because of the two kinds of happiness,🔽because of the two kinds of consent, because of the two kinds of approval,🔽because of the two kinds of approval and satisfaction, because of the two kinds of approval and consent,🔽because of the two kinds of approval, satisfaction, and consent, because of the two kinds of approval,

original: rattāna”ntiādimāha. Tattha ubhinnaṃ rattānanti dvinnaṃ itthipurisānaṃ rāgena rañjitānaṃ.🔽Sārattānanti visesena suṭṭhu rañjitānaṃ. Avassutānanti kilesena tintānaṃ. Pariyuṭṭhitānanti
analyzed: rattānanti ādim āha tattha ubhinnam rattānanti dvinnam itthi purisānam rāgena rañjitānam  sārattānam ti visesena suṭṭhu rañjitānam avassutānam ti kilesena tintānam pariyuṭṭhitānam ti
translated: He says this, beginning with “Both of them are night-blind. ” Herein, both of them are night-blind means both of them, man and woman, are blinded by lust.

original: kusalācāraṃ pariyādiyitvā madditvā ṭhitānaṃ “magge corā pariyuṭṭhitā”tiādīsu viya.
analyzed: kusala ācāram madditvā ṭhitānam magge corā pariyuṭṭhitā ti ādīsu
translated: They are night-blind in a special way means they are blinded by lust in a special way. They are lustful means they are dyed with defilement. They are obsessed means they are standing after having overcome and crushed the practice of what is skillful, as in the passage beginning, “The road is blocked by brigands” .

original: Pariyādinnacittānanti kusalacittaṃ pariyādiyitvā khepetvā ṭhitacittānaṃ. Ubhinnaṃ
analyzed: pariyādinna cittānam ti kusala cittam pariyādiyitvā khepetvā ṭhita cittānam ubhinnam
translated: They are standing with their minds obsessed means they are standing with their minds obsessed and exhausted after having overcome and crushed the mind of what is skillful.

original: sadisānanti dvinnaṃ kilesena sadisānaṃ. Dhammoti sabhāvo. Taṃ kāraṇāti tena kāraṇena.
analyzed: dvinnam kilesena sadisānam dhammo ti sabhāvaḥ tam tena kāraṇena
translated: They are alike in both cases means they are alike in both cases in that they are dyed with defilement. Nature means individual essence. For that reason means for that reason.

original: Taṃ upamāya sādhento “ubho kalahakārakā”tiādimāha. Tattha ubho kalahakārakāti pubbabhāge🔽kalahakārakā dve. Methunakāti vuccantīti sadisāti vuccanti. Bhaṇḍanakārakāti tattha
analyzed: tam upamāya sādhentaḥ ubho kalahakāraka iti ādim āha tattha ubho kalahakāraka iti pubba bhāge  kalahakārakā dve methunakā ati vuccanti iti sadisā ati vuccanti bhaṇḍana kārakā ti tattha
translated: He says this, beginning with “Both of them are makers of quarrels”, in order to establish that by means of a simile. Herein, both of them are makers of quarrels means they are makers of quarrels in the prior stage.

original: tattha gantvā bhaṇḍanaṃ karontā. Bhassakārakāti vācākalahaṃ karontā. Vivādakārakāti
analyzed: tattha gantvā bhaṇḍanam karontā bhassa kārakā ati vācā kalaham karontā vivāda kārakā ati
translated: They are called adulterers means they are called alike. They are makers of disputes means they are makers of disputes here and there after having gone there. They are makers of quarrels means they are makers of verbal quarrels. They are makers of litigation means they are makers of litigation.

original: nānāvacanaṃ karontā. Adhikaraṇakārakāti vinicchayapāpuṇanavisesakāraṇaṃ karontā.🔽Vādinoti vādapaṭivādino. Sallāpakāti vācaṃ kathentā evamevanti upamāsaṃsandanaṃ.🔽Yuttassāti saññuttassa. Payuttassāti ādarena yuttassa. Āyuttassāti visesena yuttassa.
analyzed: nānā vacanam karontā adhikaraṇa kārakā ati vinicchaya pāpuṇana visesa kāraṇam karontā  vādinaḥ uti vāda paṭivādinaḥ sallāpakāḥ ati vācam kathentāḥ upamā saṃsandanam  yuttassa ati saññuttassa payuttassa ati ādarena yuttassa āyuttassa ati visesena yuttassa
translated: They are making a variety of statements. They are making a legal issue: they are making a specific cause for the legal issue to be brought.🔽They are disputing: they are disputing with each other. They are arguing: they are speaking. They are quarreling: they are making a comparison.🔽They are in conflict: they are in conflict. They are in disagreement: they are in disagreement. They are not in harmony: they are not in harmony. They are not of the same mind: they are not of the same mind. They are not of the same view: they are not of the same view.

original: Samāyuttassāti ekato yuttassa. Taccaritassāti taṃcaritaṃ karontassa. Tabbahulassāti🔽taṃbahulaṃ karontassa. Taggarukassāti taṃgaruṃ karontassa. Tanninnassāti tasmiṃ natacittassa.
analyzed: samāyuttassa ati ekatas yuttassa tad caritassa ati tad caritam karontassa tad bahulassa ati  taṃbahulam karontassa taggarukassa ati taṃgarum karontassa tad ninnassa ati tasmin nata cittassa
translated: They are not of the same approval: they are not of the same approval. They are not of the same persuasion: they are not of the same persuasion. They are not of the same inclination: they are not of the same inclination. They are not of the same disposition: they are not of the same disposition.

original: Tappoṇassāti tasmiṃ natakāyassa. Tappabbhārassāti tasmiṃ abhimukhakāyassa. Tadadhimuttassāti🔽tasmiṃ adhiharitassa. Tadadhipateyyassāti taṃ adhipatiṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā pavattassa.

translated: They are not of the same tendency: they are not of the same tendency. They are not of the same nature: they are not of the same nature. They are not of the same character: they are not of the same character. They are not of the same behavior: they are not of the same behavior. They are not of the same disposition: they are not of the same disposition.

analyzed: vighātanti niddesassa uddesa vacanam vighātanti pīḷanam upaghātanti samīpam katvā

original: pīḷanaṃ. Pīḷananti ghaṭṭanaṃ. Ghaṭṭananti pīḷanaṃ. Sabbaṃ aññamaññavevacanaṃ. Upaddavanti
analyzed: pīḷanam pīḷananti ghaṭṭanam ghaṭṭananti pīḷanam sabbam aññamaññavevacanam upaddavanti
translated: Oppression: pressure. Pressure: oppression. All are synonyms. Calamity:

analyzed: hiṃsanam tattha tattha upagantvā pīḷana ākāram brūhi iti kathehi ācikkhāti

analyzed: vissajjehi desehi iti dassehi paññapehi iti ñāpehi paṭṭhapehi iti ṭhapehi vivara ati

analyzed: pākaṭam karohi vibhajāti bhājehi uttānīkarohi iti tīram pāpehi pakāsehi iti pākaṭam karohi
translated: make evident. Analyze: divide. Make plain: bring to the shore. Make clear: make evident.

original: Tuyhaṃ vacananti tava vācaṃ. Byappathanti vacanaṃ. Desananti ācikkhanaṃ. Anusāsananti🔽ovādaṃ. Anusiṭṭhanti anusāsanaṃ. Sutvāti sotena sutvā. Suṇitvāti tasseva vevacanaṃ.

translated: Your word: your speech. Instruction: speech. Teaching: explanation. Advice:🔽instruction. Having been instructed: having been advised. Having heard: having heard with the ear. Having listened:

original: Uggahetvāti sammā gahetvā. Upadhārayitvāti anāsetvā. Upalakkhayitvāti sallakkhetvā.
analyzed: uggahetvā ati sammā gahetvā upadhārayitvā ati an āsetvā upalakkhayitvā ati sallakkhetvā
translated: that is a synonym for that. Having received: having received correctly. Having borne in mind: without forgetting. Having reflected: having considered.

analyzed: mussate vā api sāsananti pariyatti paṭipattitaḥ duvidham pi sāsanam nassati vā api iti
translated: . The Dispensation will be lost: the Dispensation, which is twofold as theory and practice, will be lost. Will be:

original: padapūraṇamattaṃ. Etaṃ tasmiṃ anariyanti tasmiṃ puggale etaṃ anariyaṃ, yadidaṃ micchāpaṭipadā.
analyzed: pada pūraṇa mattam etam tasmin tasmin puggale etam anariyam yat idam micchā paṭipadā
translated: It is merely a filling-out of the line. This is what is unedifying in that person, namely, his wrong practice.🔽The word “Blessed” is a word for respect, a word for esteem, a word for distinction, a word for excellence, a word for veneration, a word for honour, a word for the highest sense of all.

original: Gāravādhivacananti guṇavisiṭṭhasabbasattuttamagarugāravādhivacanaṃ. Tenāhu porāṇā –
analyzed: gārava adhivacanam ti guṇa visiṭṭha sabba sattu ttama garu gārava adhivacanam tena āhu porāṇāḥ
translated: That is why the ancients said:

analyzed: bhagavā ati vacanam seṭṭham bhagavā ati vacanam uttamam
translated: “Blessed is the best word, Blessed is the highest word;

original: Garu gāravayutto so, bhagavā tena vuccatī”ti. ;
analyzed: garu gārava yutto so bhagavā tena vuccati iti
translated: He is weighty, he is esteemed, therefore he is called Blessed.”

original: Catubbidhaṃ vā nāmaṃ āvatthikaṃ, liṅgikaṃ, nemittikaṃ, adhiccasamuppannanti. Adhiccasamuppannaṃ
analyzed: catubbidham vā nāmam āvatthikam liṅgikam nemittikam adhicca samuppannanti adhicca samuppannam

original: evamādi āvatthikaṃ, daṇḍī, chattī, sikhī, karīti evamādi liṅgikaṃ, tevijjo, chaḷabhiññoti
analyzed: evamādi āvatthikam daṇḍī chattī sikhī karī iti evamādi liṅgikam tevijjaḥ chaḷabhiñño ti
translated: etc., are as a basis. “Staff-bearer,” “umbrella-bearer,” “topknot-wearer,” “shaven- headed,” are as a sex. “One possessed of three knowledges,” “one possessed of six kinds of direct-knowledge,”

original: evamādi nemittikaṃ, sirivaḍḍhako, dhanavaḍḍhakoti evamādi vacanatthaṃ anapekkhitvā
analyzed: evamādi nemittikam siri vaḍḍhakaḥ dhanavaḍḍhakaḥ iti evamādi vacana attham an apekkhitvā
translated: are as a sign. “Prosperity-giver,” “wealth-giver,” are as a mere occurrence, since they are said without regard to meaning of the words.

original: pavattaṃ adhiccasamuppannaṃ. Idaṃ pana bhagavāti nāmaṃ nemittikaṃ, na mahāmāyāya,🔽na suddhodanamahārājena, na asītiyā ñātisahassehi kataṃ, na sakkasantusitādīhi devatāvisesehi
analyzed: pavattam adhicca samuppannam idam pana bhagavā ati nāmam nemittikam na mahāmāyāya  na suddhodana mahā rājena na asītiyā ñāti sahassehi katam na sakka santusita ādīhi devatā visesehi
translated: and what is called “the Blessed One” is not a name made by a mother,

original: kataṃ. Vakkhati ca “bhagavāti netaṃ nāmaṃ mātarā kataṃ…pe… paṭilābhā sacchikā paññatti yadidaṃ bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: katam vakkhati ca bhagavā ati na itam nāmam mātarā paṭilābhā sacchikā paññatti yat idam bhagavā ati
translated: or by a father, or by a brother, or by a sister, or by friends and companions, or by relatives, or by recluses and brahmans, or by gods. It is a name made by the special qualities themselves.

original: “Bhāgyavā bhaggavā yutto, bhagehi ca vibhattavā;
analyzed: bhāgyavā bhaggavā yuttaḥ bhagehi ca
translated: “He is fortunate, he is broken, he is joined, he is distributed with portions,

original: Bhattavā vantagamano, bhavesu bhagavā tato”ti. ;
analyzed: bhattavā vantagamanaḥ bhavesu bhagavā tatoti
translated: he is eaten, he has gone to the end, he is the lord in existences.”

original: Tattha –
analyzed: tattha
translated: Herein,

original: “Vaṇṇāgamo vaṇṇavipariyāyo, dve cāpare vaṇṇavikāranāsā;
analyzed: vaṇṇa āgamaḥ vaṇṇa vipariyāyaḥ dve ca apare vaṇṇa vikāra nāsā
translated: “The addition of a vowel, the reversal of a vowel, and two others, the alteration and the omission of a vowel,

original: Dhātūnamatthātisayena yogo, taduccate pañcavidhaṃ nirutti”nti. –
analyzed: yogaḥ tat uccate pañcavidham
translated: The combination of elements in excess, this is said to be the fivefold usage.”

original: Evaṃ vuttaniruttilakkhaṇaṃ gahetvā padasiddhi veditabbā. Tattha “nakkhattarājāriva
analyzed: evam vutta nirutti lakkhaṇam gahetvā pada siddhi veditabbā tattha
translated: Thus, after taking the characteristic of usage stated thus, the derivation of the words should be understood. Herein, just as in the case of the words “like the king of the stars”

original: tārakāna”nti ettha rakārāgamo viya avijjamānassa akkharassa āgamo vaṇṇāgamo nāma.
analyzed: ettha rakāra āgamaḥ viya a vijjamānassa akkharassa āgamaḥ vaṇṇāgamaḥ nāma
translated: and “like the chief of the stars,” the addition of the vowel a, which is not already there, is called the addition of a vowel;

original: “Hiṃsanā, hiṃso”ti vattabbe “sīho”ti viya vijjamānakkharānaṃ heṭṭhupariyavasena parivattanaṃ
analyzed: hiṃsanā hiṃso ti vattabbe sīhaḥ iti viya vijjamāna kkharānam heṭṭhu pariya vasena parivattanam
translated: “Sīha” is a permutation of the syllables of “hiṃsa” in the sense of “one who harms, one who is fierce.”

original: vaṇṇavipariyāyo nāma. “Nave channake dānaṃ diyyatī”ti ettha akārassa ekārāpajjanatā🔽viya aññakkharassa aññakkharāpajjanatā vaṇṇavikāro nāma. “Jīvanassa mūto jīvanamūto”ti
analyzed: vaṇṇa vipariyāyaḥ nāma nave channake dānam diyyati iti ettha akārassa ekāra āpajjana tā  viya aññakkharassa aññakkhara āpajjana tā vaṇṇa vikāraḥ nāma jīvanassa mūtaḥ jīvana mūto ti
translated: “Colour reversal” is the reversal of syllables that exist, as in “New cloth is given as a gift” where the “a” becomes “e.”🔽“Colour modification” is the modification of one syllable into another, as in “Jīmūto” instead of “Jīvanassa mūto jīvanamūto.”

original: vattabbe “jīmūto”ti vakāranakārānaṃ vināso viya vijjamānakkharavināso vaṇṇavināso🔽nāma. “Pharusāhi vācāhi pakrubbamāno āsajja maṃ tvaṃ vadasi kumārā”ti ettha pakrubbamānoti🔽padassa abhibhavamānoti atthapaṭipādanaṃ viya tattha tattha yathāyogaṃ visesatthayogo
analyzed: vattabbe jīmūtaḥ ti vakāra nakārānam vināsaḥ viya vijjamāna kkhara vināsaḥ vaṇṇa vināsaḥ  nāma pharusāhi vācāhi pakrubbamānaḥ āsajja mama tvam vadasi kumāra ati ettha pakrubbamānaḥ iti  padassa abhibhavamānaḥ ti attha paṭipādanam viya tattha tattha yathāyogam visesa attha yogo
translated: “Colour destruction” is the destruction of syllables that exist, as in “Jīmūto” instead of “Jīvanassa mūto jīvanamūto.”

original: dhātūnaṃ atthātisayena yogo nāma.
analyzed: dhātūnam yogaḥ nāma
translated: “Dhātūnaṃ atthātisayena yogo nāma” is the connection of a particular meaning according to the context, as in “Pharusāhi vācāhi pakrubbamāno āsajja maṃ tvaṃ vadasi kumārā” where “pakrubbamāno” has the meaning of “abhibhavamāno.”

original: Evaṃ niruttilakkhaṇaṃ gahetvā saddanayena vā pisodarādinissito patiṭṭhānīti pisodarādipakkhepalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: evam nirutti lakkhaṇam gahetvā sadda nayena vā patiṭṭhāni iti pisodara ādi pakkhepa lakkhaṇam
translated: Having thus grasped the characteristics of language, the “basis” in the statement “the basis called ‘pisodara’ and so on” is the characteristic of the grouping of pisodara and so on according to the method of language.

original: gahetvā yasmā lokiyalokuttarasukhābhinibbattakaṃ dānasīlādipārappattaṃ bhāgyamassa
analyzed: gahetvā yasmā lokiya lokuttara sukha abhinibbattakam dāna sīla ādi pāra ppattam bhāgyam assa
translated: and he has the fortune of having attained the perfection of giving, virtue, etc., which is the producer of mundane and supramundane kinds of happiness,

original: atthi, tasmā “bhāgyavā”ti vattabbe “bhagavā”ti vuccatīti ñātabbaṃ.🔽Yasmā pana lobhadosamohaviparītamanasikāraahirikānottappakodhūpanāhamakkhapaḷāsaissā-🔽macchariyamāyāsāṭheyyathambhasārambhamānātimānamadapamādataṇhāavijjātividhākusalamūladuccarita-🔽saṃkilesamalavisamasaññāvitakkapapañcacatubbidhavipariyesaāsavaganthaoghayogaagati-🔽taṇhuppādupādānapañcacetokhīlavinibandhanīvaraṇābhinandanachavivādamūlataṇhākāyasattānusaya-
analyzed: atthi tasmā bhāgyavā ati vattabbe bhagavā ati vuccati iti ñātabbam  yasmai pana lobha dosa moha viparīta manasikāra ahirika anottappa kodha upanāha makkha paḷāsa  mad śariya māyā sāṭheyī athambha sārambha māna ati māna mada pamāda taṇhā avid jāti vidhā kusala mūla duccarita  saṃkilesa mala visama saññā vitakka pa pañca catubbidha vipariyesa āsava gantha ogha yoga agati  taṇhā uppāda upādāna pañca cetaḥ khīla vinibandhanī varaṇa abhinandana chavi vāda mūla taṇhā kāya sattā anusaya
translated: therefore, when it is proper to say “he has fortune” , it should be understood that he is called “Blessed” .

original: aṭṭhamicchattanavataṇhāmūlakadasākusalakammapathadvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhigataaṭṭhasatataṇhāvicaritappabhesabbadaratha-
analyzed: aṭṭham icchat ta nava taṇhā mūlaka dasā kusala kamma patha dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi gata aṭṭha sata taṇhā vicarita ppa bhesa bbada ratha
translated: But because he has expelled the sixty-two wrong courses of ideas consisting of the ten courses of unwholesome kamma, the three kinds of misconduct, the four ties, the four faults, the four floods, the four bonds, the four cravings, the four perversenesses, the four perversions, the four cessations of perversions, the four corruptions, the four kinds of corruption, the four perversions the four perversions of mental birth, the four perversions of mental occurrence, the four perversions

original: pariḷāhakilesasatasahassāni, saṅkhepato vā pañca kilesakhandhaabhisaṅkhāradevaputtamaccumāre
analyzed: pariḷāha kilesa sata sahassāni saṅkhepataḥ vā pañca kilesa khandha abhisaṅkhāra devaputta maccumāre
translated: and the hundred thousand defilements of fever, or in brief the five aggregates as objects of clinging,

original: abhañji, tasmā bhaggattā etesaṃ parissayānaṃ “bhaggavā”ti vattabbe “bhagavā”ti vuccati. Āha cettha –
analyzed: abhañji tasmā bhagga ttā etesam parissayānam bhaggavā iti vattabbe bhagavā iti vuccati āha ca ittha
translated: he broke the young deva Māra’s power. Therefore, since these dangers were broken , he is “Blessed” in the sense of “broken” , but he is called “Blessed” in the same way as “blessed sandal” . Here it is said:

original: “Bhaggarāgo bhaggadoso, bhaggamoho anāsavo;
analyzed: bhagga rāgaḥ bhagga dosaḥ bhagga mohaḥ anāsavaḥ
translated: “Broken lust, broken hate, Broken delusion, stainless,

original: Bhaggāssa pāpakā dhammā, bhagavā tena vuccatī”ti. ;
analyzed: bhaggāḥ assa pāpakāḥ dhammāḥ bhagavā tena vuccati iti
translated: Broken are his evil states: Hence they call him Blessed One” .

original: Bhāgyavantatāya cassa satapuññajalakkhaṇavarassa rūpakāyasampatti dīpitā hoti. Bhaggadosatāya🔽dhammakāyasampatti. Tathā lokiyasarikkhakānaṃ bahumatabhāvo, gahaṭṭhapabbajitehi🔽abhigamanīyatā, abhigatānañca nesaṃ kāyacittadukkhāpanayane paṭibalabhāvo, āmisadānadhammadānehi
analyzed: bhāgyavanta tāya ca sata puñña ja lakkhaṇa varassa rūpa kāya sampatti dīpitā hoti bhagga dosa tāya  dhammakāya sampatti tathā lokiya sa rikkhakānam bahu mata bhāvaḥ gahaṭṭha pabbajitehi  abhigamanīya tā abhigatānam ca nesam kāya citta dukkha apanayane paṭibala bhāvaḥ āmisa dāna dhamma dānehi
translated: And by his blessedness his excellence of physical form is proclaimed, which is adorned with the hundred major and minor characteristics of beauty. By his brokenness

original: upakāritā, lokiyalokuttarasukhehi ca saññojanasamatthatā dīpitā hoti.
analyzed: upakāri tā lokiya lokuttara sukhehi ca saññojana samattha tā dīpitā hoti
translated: his excellence of Dhamma is proclaimed. And likewise his being worthy of honour by the world with its deities, his being approachable, his being able to remove the pain of those who approach him by body or by mind, his being helpful by giving material things and giving the Dhamma, and his being able to lead them to the happiness of the worlds and to Nibbāna.

original: Yasmā ca loke issariyadhammayasasirikāmapayattesu chasu dhammesu bhagasaddo pavattati,
analyzed: yasmā ca loke chasu dhammesu bhaga saddo pavattati
translated: And since the word “blessed” is used in the world for the six things, lordship, Dhamma, glory, fame, wish, and endeavour,

original: paramañcassa sakacitte issariyaṃ, aṇimālaṅghimādikaṃ vā lokiyasammataṃ sabbākāraparipūraṃ
analyzed: paramañcassa saka citte issariyam aṇima ālaṅghima ādikam vā lokiya sammatam sabba ākāra paripūram
translated: he is blessed with lordship over his own mind, with the eight deliverances, etc., or with the supramundane Dhamma,

original: atthi, tathā lokuttaro dhammo, lokattayabyāpako yathābhuccaguṇādhigato ativiya parisuddho
analyzed: atthi tathā lokuttaraḥ dhammaḥ loka ttaya byāpakaḥ yathābhucca guṇa adhigataḥ ativiya parisuddho
translated: with glory that is utterly pure because of being realized according to actuality in the three worlds,

original: yaso, rūpakāyadassanabyāvaṭajananayanappasādajananasamatthā sabbākāraparipūrā sabbaṅgapaccaṅgasirī,
analyzed: yasaḥ rūpa kāya dassana byāvaṭa jana nayana ppasāda janana samatthā sabba ākāra paripūrā sabbaṅga paccaṅga sirī
translated: with beauty that is complete in all its aspects and factors and is capable of gladdening the eyes of those who see the physical body,

original: yaṃ yaṃ etena icchitaṃ patthitaṃ attahitaṃ parahitaṃ vā, tassa tassa tatheva abhinipphannattā
analyzed: yam yam etena icchitam patthitam atta hitam para hitam vā tassa tassa tathā iva abhinipphanna ttā
translated: with wish that is recognized as the fulfilment of whatever is wished for that is for his own welfare and that of others,

original: icchiticchitatthanipphattisaññito kāmo, sabbalokagarubhāvappattihetubhūto sammāvāyāmasaṅkhāto🔽payatto ca atthi, tasmā imehi bhagehi yuttattāpi bhagā assa santīti iminā atthena
analyzed: icchiti chitattha nipphatti saññito kāmo sabba loka garu bhāva ppatti hetu bhūto sammāvāyāma saṅkhāto  payattaḥ ca atthi tasmai imehi bhagehi yutta ttā api bhagāḥ assa santi iti iminā atthena
translated: and with endeavour that is the right effort that is the cause for attaining the respect of the whole world,

original: “bhagavā”ti vuccati.
analyzed: bhagavā ati vuccati
translated: therefore he is called “blessed” because he possesses these blessings.

original: Yasmā pana kusalādīhi bhedehi sabbadhamme, khandhāyatanadhātusaccaindriyapaṭiccasamuppādādīhi
analyzed: yasmā pana kusala ādīhi bhedehi sabba dhamme khandha āyatana dhātu sacca indriya paṭiccasamuppāda ādīhi
translated: But since he has analyzed all dhammas by way of the wholesome, etc., and the aggregates, bases, elements, truths, faculties, dependent origination, etc.,

original: vā kusalādidhamme, pīḷanasaṅkhatasantāpavipariṇāmaṭṭhena vā dukkhamariyasaccaṃ, āyūhananidānasaṃyogapalibodhaṭṭhena🔽samudayaṃ, nissaraṇavivekāsaṅkhataamataṭṭhena nirodhaṃ, niyyānikahetudassanādhipateyyaṭṭhena
analyzed: vā kusala ādi dhamme pīḷana saṅkhata santāpa vipariṇāma ṭṭhena vā dukkham ariya saccam āyūhana nidāna saṃyoga palibodha ṭṭhena  samudayam nissaraṇa viveka asaṅkhata amata ṭṭhena nirodham niyyānika hetu dassana ādhipateyya ṭṭhena
translated: and the wholesome dhammas, etc., by way of the noble truth of suffering as characterized by affliction, the state of being formed, burning, and change,🔽by way of the origin of suffering as characterized by accumulation, cause, bondage, and impediment,

original: maggaṃ vibhattavā, vibhajitvā vivaritvā desitavāti vuttaṃ hoti, tasmā “vibhattavā”ti
analyzed: maggam vibhattavā vibhajitvā vivaritvā desitavā iti vuttam hoti tasmā vibhattavā iti
translated: by way of the cessation of suffering as characterized by escape, seclusion, the state of being unformed, and the deathless, and by way of the path as characterized by leading out, cause, seeing, and predominance,

original: vattabbe “bhagavā”ti vuccati.
analyzed: vattabbe bhagavā iti vuccati
translated: he is called “the analyzer” .

original: Yasmā ca esa dibbabrahmaariyavihāre kāyacittaupadhiviveke suññatappaṇihitānimittavimokkhe
analyzed: yasmai ca dibba brahma ariya vihāre kāya citta upadhi viveke suññata paṇihita a nimitta vimokkhe
translated: Since he has enjoyed, served, and cultivated much the divine, the Brahmā, and the noble abidings, the bodily and mental seclusion, the void, the desireless, and the signless liberations,

original: aññe ca lokiyalokuttare uttarimanussadhamme bhaji sevi bahulamakāsi, tasmā “bhattavā”ti🔽vattabbe “bhagavā”ti vuccati.
analyzed: aññe ca lokiya lokuttare uttari manussa dhamme bhaji sevi bahulam akāsi tasmai 🔽vattabbe bhagavā iti vuccati
translated: and the other supramundane and mundane higher-than-human dhammas, he is called “the enjoyer” .

original: Yasmā pana tīsu bhavesu taṇhāsaṅkhātaṃ gamanaṃ anena vantaṃ, tasmā “bhavesu vantagamano”ti
analyzed: yasmai pana tīsu bhavesu taṇhā saṅkhātam gamanam anena vantam tasmai bhavesu vantagamanā uti
translated: But since his going, called craving, is ended in the three kinds of becoming, he can be called “the one whose going is ended in the kinds of becoming” .

original: vattabbe bhavasaddato bhakāraṃ gamanasaddato gakāraṃ vantasaddato vakārañca dīghaṃ
analyzed: vattabbe bhava saddataḥ bhakāram gamana saddataḥ gakāram vanta saddataḥ vakāram ca dīgham
translated: But in order to avoid the fault of having a word of more syllables than are allowed, the syllable bha is taken from the word bhava , the syllable ga from the word gati , and the syllable va from the word vanta , and the vowel a is lengthened, and he is called “the Blessed One” ,

original: katvā ādāya “bhagavā”ti vuccati, yathā loke “mehanassa khassa mālā”ti vattabbe “mekhalā”ti vuccati.
analyzed: katvā ādāya bhagavā iti vuccati yathā loke mehanassa khassa mālā ati vattabbe mekhalā ati vuccati
translated: just as in the world they say “waistband” for “belt for the waist” .

original: Puna aparampi pariyāyaṃ niddisanto “api ca bhaggarāgoti bhagavā”tiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: puna aparam pi pariyāyam niddisantaḥ api ca bhagga rāgaḥ ti bhagavā iti ādim āha tattha
translated: Again, showing another method, he said, “Or alternatively, the Blessed One is so called because he has gone to the end of all becoming” . Herein,

original: bhaggo rāgo assāti bhaggarāgo. Bhaggadosādīsupi eseva nayo. Kaṇḍakoti vinivijjhanaṭṭhena🔽kilesā eva. Bhajīti uddesavasena vibhāgaṃ katvā bhājesi. Vibhajīti niddesavasena🔽vividhā bhājesi. Pavibhajīti paṭiniddesavasena pakārena vibhaji. Ugghaṭitaññūnaṃ
analyzed: bhaggaḥ rāgaḥ assa ati bhagga rāgaḥ bhagga dosa ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ kaṇḍako ti vinivijjhana ṭṭhena  kilesāḥ eva bhaji iti uddesa vasena vibhāgam katvā bhājesi vibhaji iti niddesa vasena  vividhā bhājesi pavibhaji iti paṭiniddesa vasena pakārena vibhaji ugghaṭita ññūnam
translated: he has gone to the end of lust, thus he is the one who has gone to the end of lust . The same method applies in the case of the one who has gone to the end of hate, and so on. The defilements themselves are the “knots” .

original: vasena bhaji. Vipañcitaññūnaṃ vasena vibhaji. Neyyānaṃ vasena pavibhaji.
analyzed: vasena bhaji vipañcitaññūnam vasena vibhaji neyyānam vasena pavibhaji
translated: He has untied them, thus he is the one who has untied knots . He has divided them by making a distinction by means of the description, thus he is the one who has divided . He has divided them in various ways by means of the demonstration, thus he is the one who has thoroughly divided . He has divided them by means of the explanation, thus he is the one who has fully explained .

original: Dhammaratananti –
analyzed: dhammaratananti
translated: The jewel of the Dhamma is this:

original: “Cittīkataṃ mahagghañca, atulaṃ dullabhadassanaṃ;
analyzed: cittīkatam mahaggham ca atulam dullabha dassanam
translated: Is incomparable, and hard to see,

original: Anomasattaparibhogaṃ, ratanaṃ tena vuccatī”ti. –
analyzed: a noma satta paribhogam ratanam tena vuccati iti
translated: And is enjoyed by the best of men.”

original: Evaṃ vaṇṇitaṃ dhammaratanaṃ tividhena bhājesi. Bhavānaṃ antakaroti kāmabhavādīnaṃ
analyzed: evam vaṇṇitam dhamma ratanam tividhena bhājesi bhavānam anta karoti kāma bhava ādīnam
translated: The Dhamma Jewel, thus extolled, he shared in three ways:

original: navannaṃ bhavānaṃ paricchedaṃ pariyantaṃ parivaṭumaṃ kārako. Bhāvitakāyoti vaḍḍhitakāyo.
analyzed: bhavānam paricchedam pariyantam parivaṭumam kārakaḥ bhāvita kāyaḥ ti vaḍḍhita kāyaḥ
translated: “It makes an end of suffering” : it makes an end of, puts an end to, finishes, annihilates, the nine kinds of suffering beginning with suffering due to the sphere of sense desire .🔽“It is the growth of the developed” : it is the growth of those who have developed it.🔽So too with the rest.

original: Tathā itaresupi. Bhajīti sevi. Araññavanapatthānīti gāmassa vā nagarassa vā indakhīlato
analyzed: tathā itaresu pi bhaji iti sevi arañña vana patthāni iti gāmassa vā nagarassa vā inda khīlato
translated: “He shared” : he used. “Forests and thickets” : forests are outside the ploughland of a village or town,

original: bahi araññaṃ. Vanapatthāni manussūpacārātikkantāni vanasaṇḍāni. Pantānīti yattha
analyzed: bahi araññam vana patthāni manussu upacāra atikkantāni vana saṇḍāni pantāni iti yattha
translated: “Thickets” are jungle thickets beyond the range of human traffic. “Solitudes” : places where people do not go,

original: manussā na kasanti na vapanti dūrāni senāsanāni. Keci pana “vanapattānīti yasmā yattha
analyzed: manussāḥ na kasanti na vapanti dūrāni senāsanāni keci pana vana pattāni iti yasmai yattha
translated: where there is no cultivation, no fields, no plantations.

original: byagghādayo atthi, taṃ vanaṃ te pālayanti rakkhanti, tasmā tehi rakkhitattā vanapattānī”ti
analyzed: byaggha ādayaḥ atthi tam vanam te pālayanti rakkhanti tasmā tehi rakkhita ttā vana pattāni iti
translated: But some say that “thickets” are so called because the wild beasts protect, guard, and keep them.

original: vadanti. Senāsanānīti seti ceva āsati ca etthāti senāsanāni. Appasaddānīti vacanasaddena🔽appasaddāni. Appanigghosānīti gāmanagaranigghosasaddena appanigghosāni. Vijanavātānīti🔽antosañcaraṇajanassa sarīravātena virahitāni. “Vijanavādānī”tipi pāṭho, “antojanavādena
analyzed: vadanti senāsanāni iti sā iti ca iva āsati ca ettha ati senāsanāni appasaddāni iti vacana saddena  appa saddāni appa nigghosāni iti gāma nagara nigghosa saddena appa nigghosāni vijana vātāni iti  antar sañcaraṇa janassa sarīra vātena virahitāni vijana vādāni iti pi pāṭhaḥ antar jana vādena
translated: “Sleeping places”: they are sleeping places because one sleeps and lies down there. “Quiet”: quiet because of the absence of the noise of speech.🔽“Secluded”: secluded because of the absence of the noise of the sounds of villages and towns. “Unfrequented by people”:

original: virahitānī”ti attho. “Vijanapātānī”tipi pāṭho, “janasañcāravirahitānī”ti attho. Manussarāhasseyyakānīti🔽manussānaṃ rahassakaraṇaṭṭhānāni. Paṭisallānasāruppānīti vivekānurūpāni. Bhāgī vāti🔽“bhāgo cīvarādikoṭṭhāso assa atthī”ti bhāgī. “Paṭilābhavasena attharasādibhāgo assa
analyzed: virahitāni iti atthaḥ vijana pātāni iti pi pāṭhaḥ jana sañcāra virahitāni iti atthaḥ manussa rāhasseyyakāni iti  manussānam rahassakaraṇa ṭhānāni paṭisallāna sāruppāni iti viveka anurūpāni bhāgī vā ati  bhāgo cīvara ādi koṭṭhāsaḥ assa atthi iti bhāgī paṭilābha vasena attha rasa ādi bhāgaḥ assa
translated: devoid of the bodily wind of people who move about. “Unfrequented by non-human beings”: devoid of the bodily wind of non-human beings. “Unfrequented by animals”: devoid of the bodily wind of animals. “Suitable for seclusion”: suitable for the attainment of seclusion.

original: atthī”ti bhāgī. Attharasassāti hetuphalasampattisaṅkhātassa attharasassa. Dhammarasassāti
analyzed: atthi iti bhāgī attha rasassa ati hetu phala sampatti saṅkhātassa attha rasassa dhamma rasassa ati
translated: “One who has a share”: one who has a share of robes, etc., is a “share-holder.” Or he is a “share-holder” because he has a share in the meaning of the word “attha” in the sense of acquisition. “One who has the taste of the meaning”: one who has the taste of the meaning called the fruit of the cause. “One who has the taste of the Dhamma”:

original: hetusampattisaṅkhātassa dhammarasassa. Vuttañhetaṃ “hetuphale ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā,
analyzed: hetu sampatti saṅkhātassa dhamma rasassa vuttam hetam hetu phale ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā
translated: The taste of the Dhamma called the excellence of the cause. For this is said: “Knowledge of cause and fruit is the discrimination of meaning.

original: hetumhi ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā”ti. Vimuttirasassāti phalasampattisaṅkhātassa vimuttirasassa.
analyzed: hetumhi ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā ati vimutti rasassa ati phala sampatti saṅkhātassa vimutti rasassa
translated: Knowledge of the cause is the discrimination of Dhamma” . The taste of the summit of liberation: the taste of the summit of liberation called the excellence of the fruit.

original: Vuttampi cetaṃ “kiccasampattiatthena, raso nāma pavuccatī”ti.
analyzed: vuttam pi ca itam kicca sampatti atthena rasaḥ nāma pavuccati iti
translated: And this is said: “The meaning of the accomplishment of the task is called the taste” .

original: Catunnaṃ jhānānanti paṭhamajjhānādīnaṃ catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ. Catunnaṃ appamaññānanti
analyzed: catunnam jhānānam ti paṭhamajjhāna ādīnam catunnam jhānānam catunnam appamaññānam
translated: Of the four jhānas: of the four jhānas beginning with the first. Of the four measureless states:

original: mettādīnaṃ pharaṇappamāṇavirahitānaṃ catunnaṃ brahmavihārānaṃ. Catunnaṃ arūpasamāpattīnanti🔽ākāsānañcāyatanādīnaṃ catunnaṃ arūpajjhānānaṃ. Aṭṭhannaṃ vimokkhānanti “rūpī rūpāni
analyzed: metta ādīnam catunnam brahmavihārānam catunnam arūpa samāpattīnam ti  ākāsa anañcāyatana ādīnam catunnam arūpa jhānānam aṭṭhannam vimokkhānanti rūpī rūpāni
translated: of the four divine abidings beginning with loving-kindness, which are devoid of the measure of extending as far as the bounds of the world. Of the four immaterial attainments:

original: passatī”tiādinā nayena vuttānaṃ ārammaṇavimuttānaṃ aṭṭhannaṃ vimokkhānaṃ. Abhibhāyatanānanti
analyzed: passati iti ādinā nayena vuttānam ārammaṇa vimuttānam aṭṭhannam vimokkhānam abhibha āyatanānam
translated: of the four immaterial jhānas beginning with the base consisting of boundless space. Of the eight deliverances: of the eight deliverances that are liberated by means of the object, which are stated in the way beginning, “Possessed of form, he sees forms” . Of the spheres of mastery:

original: ettha abhibhūtāni āyatanāni etesaṃ jhānānanti abhibhāyatanāni, jhānāni. Āyatanānīti
analyzed: ettha abhibhūtāni āyatanāni abhibhāyatanāni jhānāni āyatanāni iti
translated: herein, the jhānas are spheres of mastery because they master the objects, or because they master the jhānas that are their successors. Spheres of mastery are also called “spheres of mastery” because they master the objects.

original: adhiṭṭhānaṭṭhena āyatanasaṅkhātāni kasiṇārammaṇāni. Ñāṇuttariko hi puggalo visadañāṇoti
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena āyatana saṅkhātāni kasiṇa ārammaṇāni ñāṇuttarikaḥ hi puggalo visada ñāṇo ti
translated: The kasiṇa bases, which are the objects of the kasiṇas, are in the sense of predominance.

original: kiṃ ettha ārammaṇe samāpajjitabbaṃ, na mayi cittekaggatākaraṇe bhāro atthīti tāni
analyzed: kim ettha ārammaṇe samāpajjitabbam na mayi citta ekagga tā karaṇe bhāraḥ atthi iti tāni
translated: For a person who is superior in knowledge thinks, “What is there to be attained in the object? The burden is in the unification of mind on the object.”🔽So he attains jhāna by overcoming the object.

original: ārammaṇāni abhibhavitvā samāpajjati. Saha nimittuppādenevettha appanaṃ nibbattetīti
analyzed: ārammaṇāni abhibhavitvā samāpajjati saha nimitta uppādena iva ittha appanam nibbatteti iti
translated: The meaning is that he produces absorption with the mere arising of the sign.🔽The jhānas produced in this way are called “overcoming-of-obstacles bases.”

original: attho. Evaṃ uppāditāni jhānāni abhibhāyatanānīti vuccanti, tesaṃ aṭṭhannaṃ abhibhāyatanānaṃ.
analyzed: atthaḥ evam uppāditāni jhānāni abhibhāyatanāni iti vuccanti tesam aṭṭhannam abhibhāyatanānam
translated: Of the eight of these:🔽The nine successive cessations: successive means successively, one after the other.

original: Navannaṃ anupubbavihārasamāpattīnanti pubbaṃ pubbaṃ anu anupubbaṃ, anupubbaṃ viharitabbato
analyzed: navannam anupubba vihāra samāpattīnam ti pubbam pubbam anu anupubbam anupubbam viharitabbataḥ
translated: They are to be entered upon, to be attained, successively, one after the other,

original: samāpajjitabbato anupubbavihārasamāpatti, anupaṭipāṭiyā samāpajjitabbāti attho, tāsaṃ
analyzed: samāpajjitabbataḥ anupubba vihāra samāpatti anupaṭipāṭiyā samāpajjitabbā ti atthaḥ tāsam
translated: thus they are successive cessations; the meaning is that they are to be attained in unbroken sequence.🔽Of these nine successive cessations:

original: navannaṃ anupubbavihārasamāpattīnaṃ. Dasannaṃ saññābhāvanānanti girimānandasutte
analyzed: navannam anupubba vihāra samāpattīnam dasannam saññā bhāvanānam girima ānanda sutte
translated: The ten kinds of foulness: the ten kinds of foulness given in the Girimānanda Sutta🔽as the meditation namely, the bloated, the livid, the festering, the cut up, the gnawed, the scattered, the hacked and scattered, the bleeding, the worm infested, and a skeleton.

original: āgatānaṃ aniccasaññādīnaṃ dasannaṃ saññābhāvanānaṃ. Dasannaṃ kasiṇasamāpattīnanti
analyzed: āgatānam anicca saññā ādīnam dasannam saññā bhāvanānam dasannam kasiṇa samāpattīnam
translated: The ten kasiṇa attainments: the ten kasiṇa jhānas.

original: sakalaṭṭhena kasiṇasaṅkhātānaṃ pathavīkasiṇajjhānādīnaṃ dasannaṃ jhānānaṃ. Ānāpānassatisamādhissāti
analyzed: sakala aṭṭhena kasiṇa saṅkhātānam pathavī kasiṇa jhāna ādīnam dasannam jhānānam āna apāna sati samādhissa ati
translated: and by the whole of the ten kinds of jhāna called “kasspakas” , namely, the ten kinds of jhāna consisting of the earth kasiṇa jhāna, and so on. By the concentration of mindfulness of breathing:

original: ānāpānassatisampayuttasamādhissa. Asubhasamāpattiyāti asubhajjhānasamāpattiyā. Dasannaṃ
analyzed: āna apāna sati sampayutta samādhissa asubha samāpattiyā ti asubha jhāna samāpattiyā dasannam
translated: by the concentration associated with mindfulness of breathing. By the attainment of foulness: by the foulness meditation attainment. By the ten kinds of

original: tathāgatabalānanti dasabalabalānaṃ dasannaṃ. Catunnaṃ vesārajjānanti visāradabhāvānaṃ
analyzed: dasa bala balānam dasannam catunnam vesārajjānanti visārada bhāvānam
translated: knowledge of the ten powers: by the ten kinds of knowledge consisting of the ten powers. By the four kinds of self-confidence: by the four kinds of self-confidence consisting of fearlessness. By the four kinds of

original: catunnaṃ vesārajjānaṃ. Catunnaṃ paṭisambhidānanti paṭisambhidāñāṇānaṃ catunnaṃ. Channaṃ🔽abhiññāṇānanti iddhividhādīnaṃ channaṃ abhiññāṇānaṃ. Channaṃ buddhadhammānanti “sabbaṃ
analyzed: catunnam vesārajjānam catunnam paṭisambhidānanti catunnam channam  abhiññāṇānam ti iddhividha ādīnam channam abhiññāṇānam channam buddha dhammānam ti sabbam
translated: discrimination: by the four kinds of knowledge consisting of discrimination. By the six kinds of

original: kāyakammaṃ ñāṇānuparivattī”tiādinā nayena upari āgatānaṃ channaṃ buddhadhammānaṃ.
analyzed: kāya kammam ñāṇa anuparivattī iti ādinā nayena upari āgatānam channam buddha dhammānam
translated: direct knowledge: by the six kinds of direct knowledge consisting of the various kinds of supernormal power, and so on. By the six kinds of knowledge of a Buddha: by the six kinds of knowledge of a Buddha stated above in the way beginning, “All his bodily actions are accompanied by knowledge” .

original: Tattha cīvarādayo bhāgyasampattivasena vuttā. Attharasatiko paṭivedhavasena vutto.
analyzed: tattha cīvara ādayaḥ bhāgya sampatti vasena vuttāḥ attharasatiko paṭivedha vasena vutto
translated: Herein, the robe, etc., are stated as the good fortune of ownership. The thirty-two marks are stated as the good fortune of the physical support. The eighty minor characteristics are stated as the good fortune of adornment. The eighty koṭis of qualities are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The four kinds of perfect knowledge are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The four discriminations are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The six kinds of direct knowledge are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The ten powers are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The four kinds of self-confidence are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The eighteen Buddha-qualities are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The thirty-two marks, etc., are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The thirty-two marks, etc., are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The thirty-two marks, etc., are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The thirty-two marks, etc., are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support. The thirty-two marks, etc., are stated as the good fortune of the special qualities of the physical support.

original: Adhisīlatiko paṭipattivasena. Jhānattiko rūpārūpajjhānavasena. Vimokkhattiko samāpattivasena.🔽Saññācatukko upacārappanāvasena. Satipaṭṭhānādayo sattatiṃsabodhipakkhiyadhammavasena.🔽Tathāgatabalānantiādayo āveṇikadhammavasena vuttāti veditabbā.
analyzed: adhi sīla atikaḥ paṭipatti vasena jhāna attikaḥ rūpa arūpa jjhāna vasena vimokkha attikaḥ samāpatti vasena                                  tathāgata bala ananti ādayaḥ āveṇika dhamma vasena vuttā iti veditabbā
translated: The virtue-making type is the practice of virtue. The jhāna-making type is the jhāna of the fine-material and immaterial spheres. The liberation-making type is the attainment of the liberations.🔽The four kinds of perception are the kinds of perception associated with access and absorption. The thirty-seven states partaking of enlightenment are the foundations of mindfulness, etc.🔽The ten powers of the Tathāgata, etc., are the states unique to the Buddha.🔽

original: Ito paraṃ bhagavāti netaṃ nāmantiādi “atthamanugatā ayaṃ paññattī”ti ñāpanatthaṃ🔽vuttaṃ. Tattha samaṇā pabbajjupagatā. Brāhmaṇā bhovādino samitapāpabāhitapāpā vā.🔽Devatā sakkādayo brahmāno ca. Vimokkhantikanti vimokkho arahattamaggo, vimokkhassa🔽anto arahattaphalaṃ, tasmiṃ vimokkhante bhavaṃ vimokkhantikaṃ nāmaṃ. Sabbaññubhāvo🔽hi arahattamaggena sijjhati, arahattaphalādhigamena siddho hoti. Tasmā sabbaññubhāvo
analyzed: itas param bhagavā ati na itam nāma nti ādi attham anugatā ayam paññattī iti ñāpana attham 🔽vuttam tattha samaṇāḥ pabbajjupagatāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ bho vādinaḥ samitapāpa bāhitapāpāḥ vā 🔽devatā sakka ādayaḥ brahmāno ca vimokkhantikanti vimokkhaḥ arahatta maggaḥ vimokkhassa 🔽antaḥ arahatta phalam tasmin vimokkha ante bhavam vimokkhantikam nāmam sabbaññu bhāvaḥ 🔽hi arahatta maggena sijjhati arahatta phala adhigamena siddhaḥ hoti tasmā sabbaññu bhāvaḥ
translated: The “one who has gone beyond the states of existence” is the one who has gone beyond the states of existence by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has laid down the burden” is the one who has laid down the burden of kamma, defilements, and suffering by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has reached his own goal” is the one who has reached his own goal by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has utterly destroyed the cankers” is the one who has utterly destroyed the cankers by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has passed beyond attachment” is the one who has passed beyond attachment to the three realms of existence by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has reached the destruction of becoming” is the one who has reached the destruction of becoming by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has reached the end of the round” is the one who has reached the end of the round of existence by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has gone beyond the fetters” is the one who has gone beyond the fetters by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has passed beyond the states of existence” is the one who has passed beyond the states of existence by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has laid down the burden” is the one who has laid down the burden of kamma, defilements, and suffering by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has reached his own goal” is the one who has reached his own goal by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has utterly destroyed the cankers” is the one who has utterly destroyed the cankers by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has passed beyond attachment” is the one who has passed beyond attachment to the three realms of existence by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has reached the destruction of becoming” is the one who has reached the destruction of becoming by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has reached the end of the round” is the one who has reached the end of the round of existence by means of the path of arahatship. The “one who has gone beyond the fetters” is the one who has gone beyond the fetters

original: vimokkhante bhavo hoti. Taṃ nemittikampi nāmaṃ vimokkhante bhavaṃ nāma hoti. Tena
analyzed: vimokkhante bhavaḥ hoti tam nemittikam pi nāmam vimokkhante bhavam nāma hoti tena
translated: and when he is liberated, there is becoming. And this name “sign” is also called “liberation” when there is becoming.

original: vuttaṃ – “vimokkhantikametaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantāna”nti. Bodhiyā mūle saha sabbaññutaññāṇassa
analyzed: vuttam vimokkha antikam etam buddhānam bhagavantānam ti bodhiyā mūle saha sabbaññuta ññāṇassa
translated: “When there is liberation, there is becoming”: when there is liberation, there is the becoming called “name-and-form.” Therefore it is said: “This is a designation dependent on liberation of the Enlightened Ones, the Blessed Ones.”

original: paṭilābhāti mahābodhirukkhamūle yathāvuttakkhaṇe sabbaññutaññāṇassa paṭilābhena saha.
analyzed: mahā bodhi rukkha mūle yathāvutta kkhaṇe sabbaññuta ññāṇassa paṭilābhena saha
translated: “At the root of the Bodhi Tree together with the acquisition of omniscient knowledge”: at the moment of the acquisition of omniscient knowledge, together with the acquisition of omniscient knowledge, at the root of the Bodhi Tree.

original: Sacchikā paññattīti arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya sabbadhammasacchikiriyāya vā jātā
analyzed: sacchikā paññattī iti arahatta phala sacchikiriyāya sabba dhamma sacchikiriyāya vā jātā
translated: “The designation of realization”: the designation that has arisen through the realization of the fruit of arahantship, or through the realization of all dhammas.

original: paññatti. Yadidaṃ bhagavāti yā ayaṃ bhagavāti paññatti.
analyzed: paññatti yat idam bhagavā ati yā ayam bhagavā ati paññatti
translated: “The designation of the Blessed One”: the designation of the Blessed One.

original: Dvīhi kāraṇehīti dvīhi koṭṭhāsehi. Pariyattisāsananti tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ. Paṭipattīti
analyzed: dvīhi kāraṇehi iti dvīhi koṭṭhāsehi pariyatti sāsanan ti tepiṭakam buddha vacanam paṭipattī iti
translated: “For two reasons”: for two reasons. “The dispensation of the texts”: the Buddha’s word in three Piṭakas. “The practice”: that by which one practices is the practice.

original: paṭipajjati etāyāti paṭipatti. Yaṃ tassa pariyāpuṭanti tena puggalena yaṃ pariyāpuṭaṃ🔽sajjhāyitaṃ karaṇatthe sāmivacanaṃ. “Pariyāpuṭṭa”ntipi pāṭho. Suttanti ubhatovibhaṅganiddesakhandhakaparivārā,
analyzed: paṭipajjati etāya ati paṭipatti yam tassa pariyāpuṭanti tena puggalena yam pariyāpuṭam 🔽karaṇa atthe sāmi vacanam pāṭhaḥ ubhatas vibhaṅga niddesa khandhaka parivārā
translated: “The memorizing of that by that person”: the memorizing by that person. The word “that” is in the instrumental case. “The memorizing” is in the gerundive case. “The memorizing of that” is a compound word.🔽“The discourses”: the discourses, the Niddesa, the Khandhakas, and the Parivāra.

original: suttanipāte maṅgalasutta- ratanasutta- tuvaṭakasuttāni, aññampi ca suttanāmakaṃ tathāgatavacanaṃ
analyzed: sutta nipāte maṅgala sutta ratana sutta tuvaṭaka suttāni aññam pi ca sutta nāmakam tathāgata vacanaṃ
translated: In the Suttanipāta, the Mangala Sutta, the Ratana Sutta, the Tuvataka Sutta, and other suttas named after their contents.

original: suttanti veditabbaṃ. Geyyanti sabbampi sagāthakaṃ suttaṃ geyyanti veditabbaṃ, visesena
analyzed: suttanti veditabbam geyyanti sabbam pi sa gāthakam suttam geyyanti veditabbam visesena
translated: This is what should be understood as sutta. Geyya: all sutta with a metrical text should be understood as geyya.

original: saṃyuttake sakalopi sagāthāvaggo. Veyyākaraṇanti sakalaṃ abhidhammapiṭakaṃ niggāthakaṃ🔽suttaṃ, yañca aññampi aṭṭhahi aṅgehi asaṅgahitaṃ buddhavacanaṃ, taṃ “veyyākaraṇa”nti
analyzed: saṃyuttake sakalaḥ api sa gāthā vaggaḥ veyyākaraṇan ti sakalam abhidhamma piṭakam niggāthakam  suttam yat ca aññam pi aṭṭhahi aṅgehi a saṅgahitam buddha vacanam tam veyyākaraṇam ti
translated: In particular, the whole of the Sagāthāvagga in the Saṃyutta Nikāya. Veyyākaraṇa: the whole Abhidhamma Piṭaka, sutta with no metrical text,

original: veditabbaṃ. Gāthāti dhammapadaṃ, theragāthā, therīgāthā, suttanipāte nosuttanāmikā
analyzed: veditabbam gāthā ati dhamma padam thera gāthā therī gāthā sutta nipāte nosutta nāmikā
translated: and also any other word of the Buddha not included in the other eight kinds of the word of the Buddha should be understood as veyyākaraṇa. Gāthā: the Dhammapada, the Theragāthā, the Therīgāthā, the pure metrical texts in the Suttanipāta that are not called suttas,

original: suddhikagāthā ca “gāthā”ti veditabbā. Udānanti somanassañāṇamayikagāthāpaṭisaṃyuttā
analyzed: suddhika gāthā ca gāthā ti veditabbā udānanti somanassa ñāṇa mayika gāthā paṭisaṃyuttā
translated: and the Niddesa should be understood as gāthā. Udāna: the forty-two suttas beginning with the Cūḷabodhijjhānika Sutta, which are connected with metrical texts consisting of knowledge born of joy,

original: dveasīti suttantā “udāna”nti veditabbaṃ. Itivuttakanti “vuttañhetaṃ bhagavatā”tiādinayappavattā
analyzed: suttantāḥ udānanti veditabbam itivuttakam ti vuttam ha etam bhagavatā ati ādi naya ppavattā
translated: should be understood as udāna. Itivuttaka: the text that occurs in the way beginning, “This was said by the Blessed One,”

original: dasuttarasatasuttantā “itivuttaka”nti veditabbaṃ. Jātakanti apaṇṇakajātakādīni paṇṇāsādhikāni🔽pañcajātakasatāni “jātaka”nti veditabbaṃ. Abbhutadhammanti “cattārome, bhikkhave,🔽acchariyā abbhutadhammā ānande”tiādinayappavattā sabbepi acchariyaabbhutadhammapaṭisaṃyuttā🔽suttantā “abbhutadhamma”nti veditabbaṃ. Vedallanti cūḷavedalla- mahāvedalla- sammādiṭṭhi-🔽sakkapañha- saṅkhārabhājaniyamahāpuṇṇamasuttādayo sabbepi vedañca tuṭṭhiñca laddhā
analyzed: itivuttakanti veditabbam jātakanti apaṇṇaka jātaka ādīni paṇṇāsa adhikāni  pañca jātaka satāni jātakanti veditabbam abbhuta dhammanti cattāro me bhikkhave  acchariyāḥ abbhuta dhammāḥ ānanda iti ādi naya ppavattā sabbe pi acchariya abbhuta dhamma paṭisaṃyuttā  suttantā abbhuta dhammanti veditabbam vedallanti cūḷavedalla mahāvedalla sammādiṭṭhi  sabbe pi vedañca tuṭṭhiñca laddhā
translated: The one hundred and ten Suttas beginning with the one called “Thus have I heard” are to be understood as the “Thus-have-I-heard Collection.” The fifty-plus five hundred birth stories beginning with the Apaṇṇaka Jātaka are to be understood as the “Birth Stories Collection.” The “Marvelous Qualities” are all the Suttas included in the marvelous and wonderful qualities, such as the one beginning thus: “Bhikkhus, there are these four marvelous and wonderful qualities in Ānanda” . These are to be understood as the “Marvelous Qualities Collection.” The “Questions” are the Cūḷavedalla, the Mahāvedalla, the Sammādiṭṭhi, the Sakkapañha, the Saṅkhārabhājaniya, the Mahāpuṇṇamasa Sutta, and so on. All these Suttas are to be understood as the “Questions Collection.”

original: laddhā pucchitasuttantā “vedalla”nti veditabbaṃ. Idaṃ pariyattisāsananti idaṃ vuttappakāraṃ🔽tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṭṭhena pariyatti, anusāsanaṭṭhena sāsananti
analyzed: laddhā pucchita suttantā vedallanti veditabbam idam pariyatti sāsanan ti idam vutta ppakāram 🔽tepiṭakam buddha vacanam pariyāpuṇitabba ṭṭhena pariyatti anusāsana ṭṭhena sāsananti
translated: The one hundred and ten Suttas beginning with the one called “Thus have I heard” are to be understood as the “Thus have I heard” . The fifty-five Jātakas beginning with the Apaṇṇaka Jātaka are to be understood as the “Jātaka” . The Suttas beginning with the one called “Bhikkhus, there are these four wonderful and marvellous things in Ananda” are to be understood as the “Wonderful and Marvellous” . The Suttas beginning with the Cūḷa- and the Mahā-vedalla, the Sammādiṭṭhi, the Sakkapañha, the Saṅkhārabhājaniya, and the Mahā-Puṇṇamāsa, in which the questioner has attained to confidence and satisfaction, are to be understood as the “Questions and Answers” . This is the Dispensation as the Scriptures: this nine-factored Buddha-word, which has been described thus, is the “scripture” in the sense of what is to be learnt by heart, and it is the “dispensation” in the sense of what is to be taught.

original: katvā pariyattisāsanaṃ. Tampi mussatīti tampi pariyattisāsanaṃ nassati. Sammussatīti
analyzed: katvā pariyatti sāsanam tam pi mussati iti tam pi pariyatti sāsanam nassati sammussati iti
translated: And the Dispensation’s Teaching of the True Idea will be lost.

original: ādito nassati. Paribāhiro hotīti parammukho hoti.
analyzed: āditas nassati paribāhiraḥ hoti iti parammukhaḥ hoti
translated: It will be lost, will be destroyed, will disappear.

original: Katamaṃ paṭipattisāsananti lokuttaradhammato pubbabhāgo tadatthaṃ paṭipajjīyatīti paṭipatti. Sāsīyanti ettha veneyyāti sāsanaṃ. Sammāpaṭipadātiādayo vuttanayā eva.
analyzed: katamam paṭipatti sāsananti lokuttara dhammato pubba bhāgaḥ tad attham paṭipajjīyati iti paṭipatti sāsīyanti ettha veneyyā ati sāsanam sammāpaṭipadā ti ādayaḥ vutta nayāḥ eva
translated: What is the Dispensation’s Teaching of Practice? The prior stage of the supramundane states is called ‘practice’ because it is practised for the sake of that . ‘ Dispensation’ is what is taught here, since it is what is to be taught to those who are teachable. ‘ Right practice’ and so on are in the way already stated.

original: Pāṇampi hanatīti jīvitindriyampi ghāteti. Adinnampi ādiyatīti parapariggahitampi
analyzed: pāṇam pi hanati iti jīvitindriyam pi ghāteti adinnam pi ādiyati iti para pariggahitam pi
translated: He kills breathing things: he destroys the life faculty. He takes what is not given: he appropriates what is guarded by others’ ownership.

original: vatthuṃ gaṇhāti. Sandhimpi chindatīti gharasandhimpi chindati. Nillopampi haratīti🔽gāme paharitvā mahāvilopampi karoti. Ekāgārikampi karotīti paṇṇāsamattehipi saṭṭhimattehipi
analyzed: vatthum gaṇhāti sandhim pi chindati iti ghara sandhim pi chindati nillopam pi harati iti  gāme paharitvā mahā vilopam pi karoti ekāgārikam pi karoti iti paṇṇāsa mattehi saṭṭhi mattehi pi
translated: He breaks in: he breaks into houses. He steals by breaking in:

original: parivāretvā jīvaggāhaṃ gahetvāpi dhanaṃ āharāpeti. Paripanthepi tiṭṭhatīti panthadūhanakammaṃ
analyzed: parivāretvā jīvaggāham gahetvā api dhanam āhara apeti paripanthe pi tiṭṭhati iti panthadūhana kammaṃ
translated: he makes a great theft in a village by breaking in. He makes a raid: he surrounds twenty or thirty and seizes their living substance and has their wealth brought to him. He lies in ambush:🔽he lies in wait for a road.

original: karoti. Paradārampi gacchatīti paradāresu cārittaṃ āpajjati. Musāpi bhaṇatīti atthabhañjanakaṃ
analyzed: karoti para dāram pi gacchati iti para dāresu cārittam āpajjati musā api bhaṇati iti attha bhañjanakam
translated: He does it. He goes to others’ wives: he has intercourse with others’ wives. He speaks falsehood: he speaks the consciously🔽untrue.

original: musāpi vadati. Anariyadhammoti anariyasabhāvo.
analyzed: musā api vadati an ariya dhammaḥ ti an ariya sabhāvaḥ
translated: He is a man of no breeding: he is of no good breeding.

original: 51. Eko pubbe caritvānāti pabbajjāsaṅkhātena vā gaṇāvavassaggaṭṭhena vā pubbe loke🔽viharitvā. Yānaṃ bhantaṃva taṃ loke, hīnamāhu puthujjananti taṃ vibbhantakaṃ puggalaṃ
analyzed: ekaḥ pubbe caritvā nāti pabbajjā saṅkhātena vā gaṇa avavassagga ṭṭhena vā pubbe loke  viharitvā yānam tam loke hīnam āhu puthujjanan ti tam vibbhantakam puggalam
translated: Having lived alone: having lived in the world by means of the going forth or by means of the state of being a head of an order.

original: yathā hatthiyānādiyānaṃ adantaṃ visamampi ārohati, ārohanakampi bhañjati, papātepi
analyzed: yathā hatthi yāna ādi yānam adantam visamam pi ārohati ārohanakam pi bhañjati papāte pi
translated: The world calls him a wretch, a fool, a man of little sense: just as a horse-chariot, etc., that is out of control mounts the wrong path, and both the rider and the chariot are destroyed, and it falls into a pit,

original: papatati, evaṃ kāyaduccaritādivisamārohanena nirayādīsu, atthabhañjanena jātipapātādīsu
analyzed: papatati evam kāya duccarita ādi visamārohanena niraya ādīsu attha bhañjanena jāti papāta ādīsu
translated: so he mounts the wrong path of bodily misconduct, etc., and is destroyed in the hells, etc., and falls into the pit of rebirth as an animal, etc.,

original: papatanena ca yānaṃ bhantaṃva hīnaṃ puthujjanañca āhūti.
analyzed: ca yānam hīnam puthujjanam ca āhūti
translated: and therefore the world calls him a wretch, a fool, a man of little sense, like a broken chariot.

original: Pabbajjāsaṅkhātena vāti pabbajjākoṭṭhāsena vā “pabbajito samaṇo”ti gaṇanāropanena vā. Gaṇāvavassaggaṭṭhena vāti gaṇasaṅgaṇikārāmataṃ vissajjetvā vassaggaṭṭhena vā.
analyzed: pabbajjā saṅkhātena vā ati pabbajjā koṭṭhāsena vā pabbajitaḥ samaṇaḥ ti gaṇanā āropanena vā gaṇa avassagga ṭṭhena vā ati gaṇa saṅgaṇikā rāmatam vissajjetvā vassagga ṭṭhena vā
translated: By the going forth: either by the section on the going forth or by the ascription of the name “monk” to one who has gone forth. By the relinquishing of the group: by relinquishing the delight in the group, in society.🔽He goes back alone: he returns from the village alone by himself.

original: Eko paṭikkamatīti ekakova gāmato nivattati. Yo nisevatīti niddesassa uddesapadaṃ.
analyzed: ekaḥ paṭikkamati iti ekakaḥ iva gāmataḥ nivattati yaḥ nisevati iti niddesassa uddesa padam
translated: He who cultivates: this is a word of indication for the following exposition.

original: Aparena samayenāti aññasmiṃ kāle aparabhāge. Buddhanti sabbaññubuddhaṃ. Dhammanti
analyzed: aparena samayena ati aññasmin kāle aparabhāge buddham ti sabbaññu buddham dhammam ti
translated: At another time: at another occasion, later. The Buddha: the omniscient Buddha. The Dhamma:

original: svākkhātatādiguṇayuttaṃ dhammaṃ. Saṅghanti suppaṭipannatādiguṇayuttaṃ saṅghaṃ. Sikkhanti
analyzed: svākkhāta tā ādi guṇa yuttam dhammam saṅghanti suppaṭipanna tā ādi guṇa yuttam saṅgham sikkhanti
translated: the Dhamma endowed with the qualities of well-expoundedness, etc. The Sangha: the Sangha endowed with the qualities of good practice, etc. The training:

original: adhisīlādisikkhitabbaṃ sikkhaṃ. Paccakkhāyāti buddhādiṃ paṭikkhipitvā. Hīnāyāti hīnatthāya🔽gihibhāvāya. Āvattitvāti nivattitvā. Sevati ekavāraṃ sevati. Nisevati anekavidhena
analyzed: adhisīla ādi sikkhitabbam sikkham paccakkhāya ati buddha ādim paṭikkhipitvā hīnāya ati hīna atthāya  gihi bhāvāya āvattitvā ati nivattitvā sevati eka vāram sevati nisevati anekavidhena
translated: the training to be trained in, such as the higher virtue, etc. Having rejected: having repudiated the Buddha, etc. The lower: the lower state🔽for the sake of the lower state, for the sake of the house life. Having turned back: having turned back. Cultivates: cultivates once. Frequents:

original: sevati. Saṃsevati allīyitvā sevati. Paṭisevati punappunaṃ sevati.
analyzed: sevati saṃsevati allīyitvā sevati paṭisevati punappunam sevati
translated: cultivates in many ways. Consorts with: cultivates by cleaving to. Associates with: cultivates again and again.

original: Bhantanti vibbhantaṃ. Adantanti dantabhāvaṃ anupanītaṃ. Akāritanti susikkhitakiriyaṃ🔽asikkhāpitaṃ. Avinītanti na vinītaṃ ācārasampattiyā asikkhitaṃ. Uppathaṃ gaṇhātīti🔽vuttappakāraṃ yānaṃ adantātiyuttaṃ bhantaṃ visamamaggaṃ upeti. Visamaṃ khāṇumpi pāsāṇampi
analyzed: bhantanti vibbhantam a dantanti danta bhāvam an upanītam a kāritanti su sikkhita kiriyam  a sikkhāpitam a vinītam ti na vinītam ācāra sampattiyā a sikkhitam uppatham gaṇhāti iti  vutta ppakāram yānam adanta atiyuttam bhantam visama maggam upeti visamam khāṇum pi pāsāṇam pi
translated: “Uncontrolled” means uncontrolled, uncontrolled in its gait. “Untamed” means not brought to the state of being tamed. “Untrained” means not trained in good conduct.🔽“Uncivilized” means not civilized, not trained in good conduct. “Takes a wrong path” means🔽that the vehicle, which is of the kind described, and which is uncontrolled, uncontrolled in its gait, goes on an uneven path, on uneven ground with stumps and stones.

original: abhiruhatīti visamaṃ hutvā ṭhitaṃ kharakhāṇumpi tathā pabbatapāsāṇampi ārohati. Yānampi🔽ārohanakampi bhañjatīti vayhādiyānaṃ ārohantassa pājentassa hatthapādādimpi bhindati.🔽Papātepi papatatīti ekatocchinnapabbhārapapātepi pāteti. So vibbhantakoti so paṭikkantako.🔽Bhantayānapaṭibhāgoti anavaṭṭhitayānasadiso. Uppathaṃ gaṇhātīti kusalakammapathato🔽paṭikkamitvā apāyapathabhūtaṃ uppathaṃ micchāmaggaṃ upeti. Visamaṃ kāyakammaṃ abhiruhatīti
analyzed: abhiruhati iti visamam hutvā ṭhitam khara khāṇum pi tathā pabbata pāsāṇam pi ārohati yānam pi 🔽ārohanakam pi bhañjati iti vayha ādi yānaṃ ārohantassa pājentassa hattha pāda ādim pi bhindati 🔽papāte pi papatati iti ekata ucchinna pabbhāra papāte pi pāteti saḥ vibbhantako ti so paṭikkantako 🔽bhanta yāna paṭibhāgaḥ ti anavaṭṭhita yāna sadisaḥ uppatham gaṇhāti iti kusala kammapathato 🔽paṭikkamitvā apāya patha bhūtam uppatham micchāmaggam upeti visamam kāya kammam abhiruhati iti
translated: ‘Wild’: unbridled. ‘Untamed’: not brought to the state of being tamed. ‘Unworked’: not well trained in action. ‘Uninstructed’: not trained in the discipline. ‘Uncivilized’: not civilized, not trained in the possession of good manners. ‘Takes to the wrong road’: the vehicle of the aforementioned kind, unbridled, goes to an uneven road. ‘It goes over uneven ground, over stumps and over stones’: it goes over stumps and stones that are unevenly placed. ‘It breaks down even when mounting’: it breaks the hands, feet, etc., of one who is mounting a vehicle such as a palanquin. ‘It throws one down even into a precipice’: it throws one down even into a precipice with a sheer drop on one side. ‘It is like a wild colt’: it is like a wild horse. ‘Takes to the wrong road’: it goes to the wrong road, the road to the states of deprivation, turning away from the road of the wholesome. ‘It goes over uneven ground, over bad bodily actions’:

original: samassa paṭipakkhaṃ kāyaduccaritasaṅkhātaṃ visamaṃ kāyakammaṃ ārohati. Sesesupi eseva🔽nayo. Niraye attānaṃ bhañjatīti nirassādasaṅkhāte niraye attabhāvaṃ cuṇṇavicuṇṇaṃ🔽karoti. Manussaloke attānaṃ bhañjatīti vividhakammakāraṇavasena bhañjati. Devaloke🔽attānaṃ bhañjatīti piyavippayogādidukkhavasena. Jātipapātampi papatatīti jātipapātepi
analyzed: samassa paṭipakkham kāya duccarita saṅkhātam visamam kāya kammaṃ ārohati sesesu pi esā iva  nayaḥ niraye attānam bhañjati iti nirassāda saṅkhāte niraye atta bhāvam cuṇṇa vicuṇṇam  karoti manussa loke attānam bhañjati iti vividha kamma kāraṇa vasena bhañjati deva loke  attānam bhañjati iti piya vippayoga ādi dukkha vasena jāti papātam pi papatati iti jāti papāte pi
translated: and the opposite of that is “unrighteousness” . The same method applies in the case of the other two. He breaks himself in hell means he breaks himself up into minute particles in hell, which is called “without delight” . He breaks himself in the human world means he breaks himself up by the performance of various kinds of work. He breaks himself in the deva world means by the suffering of separation from what is dear, etc. He falls into the pit of birth means he falls into the pit of birth.

original: pāteti. Jarāpapātādīsupi eseva nayo. Manussaloketi idha adhippetalokameva dasseti.
analyzed: pāta iti jarā apapāta ādīsu pi esa eva nayaḥ manussa loke iti idha adhippeta lokam eva dasseti
translated: and he mounts the uneven, that is, the bodily misconduct which is the opposite of the even. So too with the rest. He breaks himself in hell: he reduces his self to a state of being pounded to pieces, in hell, which is called “without delight.” He breaks himself in the human world: he breaks himself by the performance of various kinds of work. He breaks himself in the deva world: by the suffering of separation from what is loved, and so on. He falls into the pit of birth: he falls into the pit called “birth.” So too with the pits of ageing, death, and so on. In the human world: he shows the world intended here.

original: Puthujjanāti niddesassa uddesapadaṃ. Tattha puthujjanāti –🔽Puthūnaṃ jananādīhi, kāraṇehi puthujjano;
analyzed: niddesassa uddesa padam tattha puthujjana ati  puthūnam janana ādīhi kāraṇehi puthujjanaḥ
translated: Ordinary men: this is a term of definition. Herein, ordinary men are so called🔽Because they generate various things, and so on.

original: Puthujjanantogadhattā, puthuvāyaṃ jano iti.🔽So hi puthūnaṃ nānappakārānaṃ kilesādīnaṃ jananādīhipi kāraṇehi puthujjano. Taṃ vibhāgato
analyzed: puthujjanantaḥ ugadhattā iti 🔽saḥ hi puthūnam nānappakārānam kilesa ādīnam janana ādīhi pi kāraṇehi puthujjanaḥ tam vibhāgataḥ
translated: They are ordinary men because they generate various defilements, etc., and so on.🔽The analysis of this is as follows:

original: dassetuṃ “puthu kilese janentī”tiādimāha. Tattha bahūnaṃ nānappakārānaṃ sakkāyadiṭṭhīnaṃ🔽avihatattā vā tā janenti, tāhi janitāti vā puthujjanā. Avihatamevatthaṃ janasaddo🔽vadati. Puthu satthārānaṃ mukhullokikāti ettha puthū nānājanā satthupaṭiññā etesanti🔽puthujjanāti vacanattho. Puthu sabbagatīhi avuṭṭhitāti ettha janetabbā janayanti🔽etthāti janā, gatiyo. Puthū janā etesanti puthujjanā. Ito pare jāyanti etehīti janā,
analyzed: dassetum puthu kilese janenti iti ādim āha tattha bahūnam nānappakārānam sakkāya diṭṭhīnam  avihata ttāḥ vā tāḥ janenti tāhi janitā ati vā puthujjanāḥ avihata mevattham jana saddaḥ  vadati puthu satthārānam mukhullokikā ati ettha puthū nānājanā satthu paṭiññā etesan ti  puthujjanā ti vacana atthaḥ puthu sabba gatīhi avuṭṭhitā ti ettha janetabbā janayanti  ettha ati janāḥ gatiyaḥ puthū janāḥ etesanti puthujjanāḥ itas pare jāyanti etehi iti janāḥ
translated: He says “They generate many defilements” in order to show this. Herein, they are “ordinary people” because they generate many kinds of wrong views about the body, or because they are generated by them. The word “generate” is used in the sense of “not having destroyed.”

original: abhisaṅkhārādayo. Te etesaṃ vijjantīti puthujjanā. Abhisaṅkharaṇādiattho eva vā janasaddo🔽daṭṭhabbo. Nānāsantāpehi santapantīti rāgaggiādayo santāpā. Te eva vā sabbepi vā
analyzed: abhisaṅkhāra ādayaḥ te etesam vijjanti iti puthujjanāḥ abhisaṅkharaṇa ādi atthaḥ eva vā jana saddo  daṭṭhabbaḥ nānā santāpehi santapanti iti rāga aggi ādayo santāpā te eva vā sabbe api vā
translated: They are “ordinary people” because they look up to many different teachers. The meaning of the word is this. They are “ordinary people” because they have not emerged from many kinds of destinies. Herein, “destinies” are “people” in the sense of “that which should be generated” . They are “ordinary people” because they are generated by these. Or “people” are the determinations, etc., and they occur in these, thus they are “ordinary people.” Or the word “generate” should be regarded as used in the sense of “determining,” etc.

original: kilesā pariḷāhā. Puthu pañcasu kāmaguṇesūti ettha jāyatīti jano, rāgo gedhoti evamādiko,
analyzed: kilesā pariḷāhā puthu pañcasu kāmaguṇesu iti ettha jāyati iti janaḥ rāgaḥ gedhaḥ iti evamādiko
translated: They are “ordinary people” because they are heated by many kinds of burning. Herein, the “burnings” are the fires of lust, etc., or all the defilements are “burnings” in the sense of “fever.” They are “ordinary people” because they are generated in the five strands of sensual desire. Herein, “people” are lust, greed, infatuation, etc.,

original: puthu jano etesanti puthujjanā. Puthu jātā rattāti evaṃ rāgādiattho eva vā janasaddo🔽daṭṭhabbo. Palibuddhāti sambaddhā. Āvutāti āvaritā. Nivutāti vāritā. Ovutāti uparito
analyzed: puthu janaḥ etesanti puthujjanā puthu jātā rattā ati evam rāga ādi atthaḥ eva vā jana saddo  daṭṭhabbaḥ palibuddhā ati sambaddhā āvutā ati āvaritā nivutā ati vāritā ovutā ati uparitas
translated: The word jana is to be taken in the sense of passion, etc., as in the passage: “The many-formed being has arisen in the many-formed world” .

original: pihitā. Pihitāti heṭṭhābhāgena pihitā. Paṭicchannāti apākaṭā. Paṭikujjitāti adhomukhagatā.🔽Atha vā puthūnaṃ vā gaṇanapathamatītānaṃ ariyadhammaparammukhānaṃ nīcadhammasamācārānaṃ🔽janānaṃ antogadhattāpi puthujjanā. Puthu vā ayaṃ visuṃyeva saṅkhaṃ gato, visaṃsaṭṭho
analyzed: pihitā pihitā ati heṭṭhā bhāgena pihitā paṭicchannā ati apākaṭā paṭikujjitā ati adhomukha gatā  atha vā puthūnam vā gaṇana patham atītānam ariya dhamma parammukhānam nīca dhamma samācārānam  janānam puthujjanā puthu vai ayam visuṃyā iva saṅkham gataḥ visaṃsaṭṭhaḥ
translated: They are obstructed because they are bound by the five kinds of bondage . They are covered because they are covered over. They are veiled because they are veiled. They are shrouded because they are shrouded above. They are hidden because they are hidden by a covering below. They are concealed because they are not manifest. They are turned away because they have turned away from the face of the Dhamma.🔽Or alternatively, they are ordinary people because they are included among the many kinds of people who are beyond number, who have turned their faces away from the noble Dhamma, and who behave in a lowly way.
