original: eva diṭṭhiyā patiṭṭhahanti, udāhu aññampi diṭṭhiṃ gaṇhantī”ti uppannacittānaṃ ekaccānaṃ
analyzed: eva diṭṭhiyā patiṭṭhahanti udāhu aññam pi diṭṭhim gaṇhanti iti uppanna cittānam ekaccānam
translated: and do they stand upon that view or do they take up another view? ”

original: devatānaṃ tamatthaṃ pakāsetuṃ purimanayeneva nimmitabuddhena attānaṃ pucchāpetvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: devatānam tam attham pakāsetum purima nayena iva nimmitabuddhena attānam pucchāpetvā vuttam
translated: and he asked the Emanated One to question him in the same way as before in order to make known the meaning to some deities whose minds were still not clear.

original: 113. Tattha ādito dvepi gāthā pucchāgāthāyeva. Tāsu sakaṃ sakaṃ diṭṭhiparibbasānāti🔽attano attano diṭṭhiyā vasamānā. Viggayha nānā kusalā vadantīti taṃ diṭṭhiṃ balavaggāhaṃ
analyzed: tattha āditaḥ dve api gāthā pucchā gāthāya iva tāsu sakam sakam  attanaḥ attanaḥ diṭṭhiyā vasamānāḥ viggayha nānā kusalāḥ vadanti iti tam diṭṭhim bala vaggāham
translated: Herein, the first two verses are the question verses. In them, “They are subject to their own views” means

original: gahetvā “tattha kusalāmhā”ti paṭijānamānā puthu puthu vadanti, ekaṃ na vadanti. Yo🔽evaṃ jānāti sa vedi dhammaṃ, idaṃ paṭikkosamakevalī soti tañca diṭṭhiṃ sandhāya yo
analyzed: gahetvā tattha kusalāmha ati paṭijānamānā puthu puthu vadanti ekam na vadanti  evam jānāti sa vedi dhammam idam paṭikkosama kevalī so ti tat ca diṭṭhim sandhāya yaḥ
translated: they are under the control of their own views. “They argue, saying ‘We are skilled’ ” means that, having taken up that view with a strong grip, they claim “We are skilled in that,” and they say it in various ways, not in one way.

original: evaṃ jānāti, so dhammaṃ vediyi. Idaṃ pana paṭikkosanto hīno hotīti ca vadanti.
analyzed: evam jānāti saḥ dhammam idam pana paṭikkosantaḥ hīnaḥ hoti iti ca vadanti
translated: “He who knows thus knows the Dhamma; he is the one who rejects all” means that he who knows thus in regard to that view knows the Dhamma. But they say that he who rejects it is inferior.

original: Nānā vadantīti nānākāraṇaṃ bhaṇanti. Vividhaṃ vadantīti nānāvidhaṃ bhaṇanti. Aññoññaṃ
analyzed: nānā vadanti iti nānā kāraṇam bhaṇanti vividham vadanti iti nānāvidham bhaṇanti aññoññam
translated: “They say in various ways” means they speak with various reasons. “They say in various ways” means they speak in various ways.

original: vadantīti ekaṃ avatvā aññaṃ aññaṃ gahetvā vadanti. Akevalī soti yo akusalo ayaṃ.
analyzed: vadanti iti ekam a vatvā aññam aññam gahetvā vadanti a kevalī saḥ iti yaḥ akusalaḥ ayam
translated: “They say” : not saying the same thing, they say different things. “He is not the only one” : he who is unskillful.

original: Asamattoti na paripūro. Aparipuṇṇoti na sampuṇṇo.
analyzed: a samattaḥ iti na paripūraḥ a paripuṇṇaḥ iti na sampuṇṇaḥ
translated: “They say” : not saying “one,” they say, taking one and another. “He is not complete” : he is not fulfilled. “He is not fulfilled” : he is not fulfilled.

original: 114. Bāloti hīno. Akkusaloti avidvā.
analyzed: bālaḥ iti hīnaḥ a vidvā
translated: “A fool” : he is low. “Unskilled” : he is unknowing.

original: 115. Idāni tisso vissajjanagāthā hontīti. Tā purimaḍḍhena vuttamatthaṃ pacchimaḍḍhena
analyzed: idāni tissaḥ vissajjana gāthāḥ honti iti tā purima ḍḍhena vutta mattham pacchima ḍḍhena
translated: Now there are three verses of reply. They are set out by the first half of the verse contradicting the meaning stated in the second half.

original: paṭibyūhitvā ṭhitā. Tena byūhena uttarasuttato ca appakattā idaṃ suttaṃ “cūḷabyūha”nti
analyzed: paṭibyūhitvā ṭhitā tena byūhena uttara suttataḥ ca appakattā idam suttam cūḷabyūhanti
translated: Because of that contradiction and because of the brevity of the following sutta, this sutta gets the name “Cūḷabyūha” .

original: nāmaṃ labhi. Tattha paṭhamagāthāyaṃ tāva parassa ce dhammanti parassa diṭṭhiṃ. Sabbevime
analyzed: nāmam labhi tattha paṭhama gāthāyam tāva parassa ce parassa diṭṭhim
translated: Therein, in the first verse, “If another’s Dhamma” : another’s view. “All these”

original: bālāti evaṃ sante sabbeva ime bālā hontīti adhippāyo. Kiṃkāraṇā? Sabbevime diṭṭhiparibbasānāti.🔽116. Sandiṭṭhiyā ceva na vīvadātā, saṃsuddhapaññā kusalā mutīmāti sakāya diṭṭhiyā
analyzed: bālā ati evam sante sabbe iva ime bālāḥ honti iti adhippāyaḥ kiṃkāraṇā sabbe iva ime diṭṭhi paribbasānā ti  sandiṭṭhiyā ca iva na vīvadātā saṃsuddha paññā kusalā sakāya diṭṭhiyā
translated: : the purport is, “If it is so, then all these are fools.” Why? “Because all these are submerged in views.”🔽“They do not dispute with what is seen here, they are pure in wisdom, skilled, and confident” : not disputing, not arguing with their own view,

original: anavīvadātā avodātā saṃkiliṭṭhāva samānā saṃsuddhapaññā ca kusalā ca mutimanto ca
analyzed: an avīvadātā avodātā saṃkiliṭṭhā ava samānā saṃsuddha paññā ca kusalā ca mutimanto ca
translated: they are defiled, and yet they are pure in wisdom, skilled, and confident.

original: te honti ce. Atha vā “sandiṭṭhiyā ce vadātā”ti pāṭho, tassattho – sakāya pana diṭṭhiyā
analyzed: te honti ce atha vā sandiṭṭhiyā ce vadāta iti pāṭho tassa attho sakāya pana diṭṭhiyā
translated: Or else, if the reading is “sandiṭṭhiyā ce vadātā” , the meaning is this: but if they are pure in their own view,

original: vodātā saṃsuddhapaññā kusalā mutimanto honti ce, na tesaṃ kocīti evaṃ sante tesaṃ
analyzed: vodātā saṃsuddha paññā kusalāḥ mutimanto honti ce na tesam koci iti evam sante tesam
translated: purified in their insight, skilled, intelligent,

original: ekopi nihīnapañño na hoti, kiṃkāraṇā? Diṭṭhī hi tesampi tathā samattā, yathā itaresanti.
analyzed: ekaḥ api nihīna paññaḥ na hoti kiṃkāraṇā diṭṭhī hi tesam pi tathā samattā yathā itaresanti
translated: then not one of them is of inferior understanding. Why? Because their views are all the same as those of the others.

original: 117. Na vāhametanti gāthāya saṅkhepattho – yaṃ te mithu dve dve janā aññamaññaṃ “bālo”ti🔽āhu, ahaṃ etaṃ tathiyanti tacchanti neva brūmi. Kiṃkāraṇā? Yasmā sabbeva te sakaṃ
analyzed: na vā aham etat ti gāthāya saṅkhepa atthaḥ yam te mithu dve dve janāḥ aññam aññam bālaḥ ti  āhu aham etam na iva brūmi kiṃkāraṇā yasmā te
translated: The condensed meaning of the verse “I do not say ‘thus’ ” is this: I do not say “thus” as those two people do who call each other a fool.

original: sakaṃ diṭṭhiṃ “idameva saccaṃ moghamañña”nti akaṃsu, tena ca kāraṇena paraṃ “bālo”ti
analyzed: sakam diṭṭhim idam eva saccam mogham aññanti tena ca kāraṇena param bālaḥ ti
translated: Why? Because all of them have made their own view the truth and the others false. And for that reason they call the other a fool.

original: dahanti. Ettha ca tathiyaṃ, tathevanti dvepi pāṭhā.
analyzed: dahanti ettha ca dve api
translated: And here there are two readings: “tathiyaṃ” and “tatheva.”

original: Tacchanti atucchaṃ. Tathanti aviparītaṃ, bhūtanti santaṃ. Yāthāvanti saṃvijjamānaṃ. Aviparitanti na visaṅketaṃ.
analyzed: a tuccham tathanti a viparītam bhūtanti santam yāthāvanti saṃvijjamānam a viparitanti na visaṅketam
translated: “Tacchanti” means “they do not speak falsely.” “Tathā” means “without distortion,” “bhūta” means “true,” “yāthāva” means “existing,” and “aviparīta” means “not confused.”

original: 118. Yamāhūti pucchāgāthāya “yaṃ diṭṭhisaccaṃ tathiya”nti eke āhu.
analyzed: pucchā gāthāya yam diṭṭhi saccam eke āhu
translated: “What they call ‘the truth of view’ ” : some say that the truth of view is the truth.

original: 119. Ekañhi saccanti vissajjanagāthāya ekaṃ saccaṃ nirodho maggo vā. Yasmiṃ pajā no vivade pajānanti yamhi sacce pajānanto pajā no vivadeyyuṃ. Sayaṃ thunantīti attanā vadanti.
analyzed: ekam hi saccam ti vissajjana gāthāyaḥ ekam saccam nirodhaḥ maggaḥ vā yasmin pajāḥ naḥ vivade pajānanti yamhi sacce pajānantaḥ pajāḥ naḥ vivadeyyum sayam thunanti iti attanā vadanti
translated: “One truth” : one truth is cessation or the path. “In which people do not dispute” : if people understood that truth, they would not dispute. “They themselves assert” : they themselves say.

original: 120. Kasmā nūti pucchāgāthāya pavādiyāseti vādino. Udāhu te takkamanussarantīti te vādino udāhu attano takkamattaṃ anugacchanti.
analyzed: kasmai nu iti pucchāgāthāya vādinaḥ udāhu te takkam anussaranti iti te vādinaḥ udāhu attano takkam attam anugacchanti
translated: “Why is it so?” : the disputants. “Do they follow their own opinion?” : do the disputants follow their own opinion?

original: Takkapariyāhatanti vitakkena samantato āhataṃ. Vīmaṃsānucaritanti attano upaṭṭhitapaññāya vicaritaṃ. Sayaṃpaṭibhānanti attano paṭibhānaṃ.
analyzed: takka pariyāhatanti vitakkena samantataḥ āhatam vīmaṃsa anucaritam ti attanaḥ upaṭṭhita paññāya vicaritam sayaṃpaṭibhānam ti attanaḥ paṭibhānam
translated: “Assailed by reasoning” : assailed all around by reasoning. “Investigated by the intellect” : investigated by their own understanding. “Their own invention” : their own invention.

original: 121. Na hevāti vissajjanagāthāya aññatra saññāya niccānīti ṭhapetvā saññāmattena
analyzed: na ha iva ati vissajjana gāthāya aññatra saññāya niccāni iti ṭhapetvā saññā mattena
translated: “Apart from perception” : apart from the perception that “the world is eternal.”

original: niccanti gahitaggahaṇāni. Takkañca diṭṭhīsu pakappayitvāti attano niccasaṅkappamattaṃ diṭṭhīsu janetvā.
analyzed: niccanti gahita ggahaṇāni takkam ca diṭṭhīsu pakappayitvā ti attanaḥ nicca saṅkappam attam diṭṭhīsu janetvā
translated: “Grasping at what is grasped” : grasping at what is grasped at by others. “And applying reasoning to views” : generating their own view of the eternal world.

original: Yasmā pana diṭṭhīsu vitakkaṃ janentā diṭṭhiyo sañjanenti, tasmā vuttaṃ “diṭṭhigatāni
analyzed: yasmā pana diṭṭhīsu vitakkam janentāḥ diṭṭhiyaḥ sañjanenti tasmā vuttam diṭṭhi gatāni
translated: Thus it is said: “They generate and bring into play the view-dependencies.

original: janenti sañjanentī”tiādi. Janentīti uparūpari diṭṭhiṃ uppādentā janenti. Sañjanentītiādīni🔽upasaggavasena padaṃ vaḍḍhetvā vuttāni. Mayhaṃ saccanti mama vacanaṃ tacchaṃ.
analyzed: janenti sañjanenti itiādi janenti iti upari upari diṭṭhim uppādentāḥ janenti sañjanenti itiādīni  upasagga vasena padam vaḍḍhetvā vuttāni mayham mama vacanam
translated: ” They generate: they generate by producing view after view. They bring into play: these words are stated by adding a prefix to the word “generate.” My word is true: my statement is true.

original: 122. Idāni evaṃ nānāsaccesu asantesu takkamattaṃ anussarantānaṃ diṭṭhigatikānaṃ vippaṭipattiṃ
analyzed: idāni evam nānāsaccesu asantesu takka mattam anussarantānam diṭṭhi gatikānam vippaṭipattim
translated: Now, in order to show the wrong practice of those who hold views, who remember only their own opinions when there are no such various truths, he spoke the stanzas beginning with “In what is seen, in what is heard.”

original: dassetuṃ “diṭṭhe sute”tiādikā gāthāyo abhāsi. Tattha diṭṭheti diṭṭhaṃ, diṭṭhasuddhinti
analyzed: dassetum diṭṭhe suta iti ādikāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsi tattha diṭṭha iti diṭṭham diṭṭha suddhi nti
translated: Herein, in what is seen: in what is seen, the intention is that it is purified.🔽This method applies also to what is heard, etc.

original: adhippāyo. Esa nayo sutādīsu. Ete ca nissāya vimānadassīti ete diṭṭhidhamme nissayitvā
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ esa nayaḥ suta ādīsu ete ca nissāya vimāna dassī iti ete diṭṭhi dhamme nissayitvā
translated: And he who, trusting in these, looks down on others: he who, trusting in these things that are views, looks down on others, thinking “I am purified,”🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,

original: suddhibhāvasaṅkhātaṃ vimānaṃ asammānaṃ passantopi. Vinicchaye ṭhatvā pahassamāno,🔽bālo paro akkusaloti cāhāti evaṃ vimānadassīpi tasmiṃ diṭṭhivinicchaye ṭhatvā tuṭṭhijāto
analyzed: suddhi bhāva saṅkhātam vimānam asammānam passantaḥ api vinicchaye ṭhatvā pahassamānaḥ 🔽bālo paraḥ akkusalo ti ca āha ati evam tasmin diṭṭhi vinicchaye tuṭṭhi jātaḥ
translated: while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,🔽while he is not purified,

original: hāsajāto hutvā paro “hīno ca avidvā cā”ti evaṃ vadatiyeva.
analyzed: hāsa jātaḥ hutvā paraḥ ca evam
translated: and he laughs and says, “He is low and ignorant” and so on.

original: Na sammānetītipi vimānadassīti na bahumānaṃ karotīti evampi vimānadassī na bahumānadassī.
analyzed: na sammāneti iti pi vimāna dassī iti na bahu mānam karoti iti evam pi vimāna dassī na bahu māna dassī
translated: “He does not honour” : he does not show great respect. “He is a conceited man” : he is not a man who sees greatness.

original: Domanassaṃ janetīti paṭhamaṃ diṭṭhinissayaṃ allīyitvā domanassaṃ patvā pacchā diṭṭhivinicchaye🔽ṭhitakāle somanassaṃ uppādetīti attho.
analyzed: domanassam janeti iti paṭhamam diṭṭhi nissayam allīyitvā domanassam patvā pacchā diṭṭhi vinicchaye  ṭhita kāle somanassam uppādeti iti attho
translated: “He causes him to feel grief” : first he makes him take up a view, and then, after he has felt grief, he causes him to feel joy when he is established in the investigation of views.🔽“He causes him to feel joy” : the meaning is that he causes him to feel joy when he is established in the investigation of views.

original: Vinicchayadiṭṭhiyā ṭhatvāti sanniṭṭhānaṃ katvā gahitadiṭṭhiyā ṭhatvā.
analyzed: vinicchaya diṭṭhiyā ṭhatvā ati sanniṭṭhānam katvā gahita diṭṭhiyā ṭhatvā
translated: “Established in the view of investigation” : having made a decision, having taken up a view, he is established in it.

original: 123. Evaṃ sante yenevāti gāthā. Tattha sayamattanāti sayameva attānaṃ. Vimānetīti garahati. Tadeva pāvāti tadeva vacanaṃ diṭṭhiṃ vadati, taṃ vā puggalaṃ.
analyzed: evam sante yena iva ati gāthā tattha sayam attanā ati sayam eva attānam vimāneti iti garahati tat eva pāvā ati tat eva vacanam diṭṭhim vadati tam vā puggalam
translated: “If he is thus” : the verse. Herein, “himself” : himself alone. “He conceives” : he disparages. “That very word” : that very statement, that view, or that person.

original: 124. Atisāradiṭṭhiyāti gāthāyattho – so evaṃ tāya lakkhaṇātisāriniyā atisāradiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: atisāra diṭṭhiyā ti gāthāyattho so evam tāya lakkhaṇa atisāriniyā atisāra diṭṭhiyā
translated: “With a view that is overbearing” : the meaning of the verse is this: He is filled, replete, and bloated with that view that is overbearing, that overflows with its own characteristics.

original: samatto paripuṇṇo uddhumāto, tena ca diṭṭhimānena matto “paripuṇṇo ahaṃ kevalī”ti
analyzed: sa mattaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ uddhu māto tena ca diṭṭhi mānena mattaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ aham kevalī iti
translated: “Drunk with that conceit of view” : “I am replete, I am perfect” he is drunk with that conceit of view.

original: evaṃ paripuṇṇamānī. Sayameva attānaṃ manasā “ahaṃ paṇḍito”ti abhisiñcati. Kiṃkāraṇā?
analyzed: evam paripuṇṇa mānī sayam eva attānam manasā aham paṇḍitaḥ iti abhisiñcati kiṃkāraṇā
translated: He is full of conceit. He anoints himself with the thought, “I am wise.” Why?

original: Diṭṭhī hi sā tassa tathā samattāti.
analyzed: diṭṭhī hi sā tassa tathā samattā ati
translated: Because that view of his is so complete.

original: Sabbā tā diṭṭhiyo lakkhaṇātikkantāti tā sabbā dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhiyo lakkhaṇaṃ atītā atisarantīti atikkantā. Anomoti anūno.
analyzed: sabbā tāḥ diṭṭhiyaḥ lakkhaṇa atikkantā ati tāḥ sabbāḥ dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhiyaḥ lakkhaṇam atītāḥ atisaranti iti atikkantāḥ anomaḥ iti anūnaḥ
translated: All those views are beyond the mark: all those sixty-two views are beyond the mark, they have overshot the mark. They are not deficient.

original: 125. Parassa ceti gāthāya sambandho attho ca – kiñca bhiyyo? Yo so vinicchaye ṭhatvā
analyzed: parassa ca iti gāthāya sambandhaḥ attho ca kiñca bhiyyas yaḥ saḥ vinicchaye
translated: The meaning of the verse “And if another should say of him” is this: And what is more,🔽when one who stands on judgment day🔽and says, “The other is a fool, unskilled,”

original: pahassamāno “bālo paro akkusalo”ti cāha, tassa parassa ce hi vacasā so tena vuccamāno
analyzed: pahassamānaḥ bālaḥ paraḥ akkusalaḥ iti ca āha tassa parassa ce hi vacasā saḥ tena vuccamāno
translated: if another should say of him

original: nihīno hoti, tumo sahā hoti nihīnapañño, sopi teneva saha nihīnapañño hoti. Sopi
analyzed: nihīnaḥ hoti tumo sahā hoti nihīna pañño saḥ api tena iva saha nihīna paññaḥ hoti saḥ api
translated: he is low, he is low in wisdom, he is low in wisdom together with that other.

original: hi taṃ “bālo”ti vadati. Atha tassa vacanaṃ appamāṇaṃ, so pana sayameva vedagū ca
analyzed: hi tam bālaḥ iti vadati atha tassa vacanam appamāṇam saḥ pana sayam eva vedagū ca
translated: For he too calls him a fool. Then his word is not authoritative, but he himself is a knower of the three Vedas

original: dhīro ca hoti. Evaṃ sante na koci bālo samaṇesu atthi. Sabbepi hi te attano icchāya paṇḍitā.
analyzed: dhīro ca hoti evam sante na koci bālo samaṇesu atthi sabbe pi hi te attanaḥ icchāya paṇḍitā
translated: and wise. If that is so, there is no fool among the ascetics. For all of them are wise according to their own wish.

original: Vācāyāti kathanena. Vacanenāti bhāsitena. Ninditakāraṇāti garahahetunā. Garahitakāraṇāti avaññātahetunā. Upavaditakāraṇāti upavādahetunā.
analyzed: vācāya ati kathanena vacanena ati bhāsitena nindita kāraṇā ati garaha hetunā garahita kāraṇā ati avaññāta hetunā upavadita kāraṇā ati upavāda hetunā
translated: By speech: by speaking. By voice: by what is spoken. By reason of blame: by reason of grounds for censure. By reason of censure: by reason of grounds for dispraise. By reason of accusation: by reason of grounds for accusation.

original: 126. Aññaṃ itoti gāthāya sambandho attho ca – “atha ce sayaṃ vedagū hoti dhīro. Na
analyzed: aññam itas ti gāthāya sambandhaḥ attho ca atha ce sayam vedagū hoti dhīraḥ na
translated: The meaning of the connection with the verse is this: “But if the wise man is himself a knower of the truth,

original: koci bālo samaṇesu atthī”ti evañhi vuttepi siyā kassaci “kasmā”ti. Tattha vuccate
analyzed: koci bālaḥ samaṇesu atthi iti evam hi vutte pi siyā kassaci kasmā ati tattha vuccate
translated: then there is no fool among the ascetics.” But even if this is said, someone might still ask, “Why?” So in reply to that it is said:

original: – yasmā aññaṃ ito yābhivadanti dhammaṃ, aparaddhā suddhimakevalī te. Evampi titthyā
analyzed: yasmai aññam itas yā abhivadanti dhammaṃ aparaddhā suddhim akevalī te evam pi titthyā
translated: “Because they are outside this, they claim another doctrine, and they have strayed from the path of purity and are not complete.”

original: puthuso vadanti, ye ito aññaṃ diṭṭhiṃ abhivadanti, te aparaddhā viraddhā suddhimaggaṃ,
analyzed: puthusaḥ vadanti ye itas aññam diṭṭhim abhivadanti te aparaddhāḥ viraddhā suddhi maggaṃ
translated: Those who claim a view other than this, they have strayed, they have gone astray from the path of purity, and they are not complete.🔽This is how it should be understood that the various sectarians are outside this.

original: akevalino ca teti evaṃ puthutitthiyā yasmā vadantīti vuttaṃ hoti. Kasmā panevaṃ vadantīti
analyzed: akevalino ca te ti evam puthu titthiyāḥ yasmai vadanti iti vuttam hoti kasmai pana evam vadanti iti
translated: But why do they claim thus?

original: ce? Sandiṭṭhirāgena hi tebhirattā, yasmā sakena diṭṭhirāgena te abhirattāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: ce sandiṭṭhi rāgena hi yasmā sakena diṭṭhi rāgena te abhirattā iti vuttam hoti
translated: Because they are attached to their own view, for they are attached to their own view. This is what is said.

original: Te suddhimagganti te aññatitthiyā akiliṭṭhamaggaṃ. Visuddhimagganti niddosamaggaṃ.
analyzed: te suddhi magganti te añña titthiyāḥ akiliṭṭha maggam visuddhi magganti niddosa maggam
translated: They are the “pure path” : they are the untorn path. The “purified path” : they are the path without defilements.

original: Parisuddhimagganti sukkamaggaṃ. Vodātamagganti paṇḍaramaggaṃ. Pariyodātamagganti
analyzed: parisuddhi magganti sukka maggam vodāta magganti paṇḍara maggam pariyodāta magganti
translated: The “clean path” : they are the bright path. The “bright path” : they are the pure path. The “clear path” :

original: pabhāvantamaggaṃ. Viraddhāti vuttavidhinā maggena virajjhitvā ṭhitā. Aparaddhāti
analyzed: pabhāvanta maggam viraddhā ati vutta vidhinā maggena virajjhitvā ṭhitā aparaddhā iti
translated: they are the path that is radiant. “They have fallen away” : they have fallen away by the path as described. “They have failed” :

original: aparajjhitvā ṭhitā. Khalitāti parihīnā. Galitāti tato bhaṭṭhā. Aññāyāti aññāṇena.
analyzed: aparajjhitvā ṭhitā khalitā ati parihīnā galitā ati tatas bhaṭṭhā aññāyā ati aññāṇena
translated: they have failed. “They have slipped” : they have fallen away. “They have fallen” : they have fallen from that . “They are ignorant” : they are ignorant.

original: Aparaddhāti parājayamāpannā. Atha vā “ñāyāparaddhā”tipi pāṭho. Ñāyena maggena viraddhāti attho.
analyzed: aparaddhā iti parājayam āpannā atha vā ñāya aparaddhā atipi pāṭhaḥ ñāyena maggena viraddhā ati attho
translated: “They have failed” : they have failed to attain. Or else, there is the reading “ñāyāparaddhā” , which means “they have fallen away from the right path.”🔽Thus delighted, they say: “Herein lies purity” .

original: 127. Evaṃ abhirattā ca – idheva suddhinti gāthā. Tattha sakāyaneti sakamagge. Daḷhaṃ vadānāti daḷhavādā.
analyzed: evam abhirattā ca idha iva suddhin ti gāthā tattha sa kāyanā iti saka magge daḷham vadānā ati daḷha vādā
translated: Herein, “in their own doctrine” : in their own path. “Firmly holding” : firmly grasping.

original: Thiravādāti sanniṭṭhānavādā. Balikavādāti balavantavādā. Avaṭṭhitavādāti patiṭṭhahitvā kathitavādā.
analyzed: thira vādā ati sanniṭṭhāna vādā balika vādā ati balavanta vādā avaṭṭhita vādā ati patiṭṭhahitvā kathita vādā
translated: “Stable” : they are resolved. “Powerful” : they are strong. “Unwavering” : they are speaking after having established themselves.

original: 128. Ye evañca daḷhavādā, tesu yo koci titthiyo sakāyane vāpi daḷhaṃ vadāno kamettha
analyzed: ye evañca daḷha vādā tesu yaḥ koci titthiyaḥ vā api daḷham vadānaḥ
translated: And so, whatever sectarians, whatever sectarians there be, who, in their own doctrine, speak strongly,

original: bāloti paraṃ daheyya, saṅkhepato tattha sassatucchedasaṅkhāte vitthārato natthikaissarakārakaniyatiādibhede
analyzed: bālaḥ iti param daheyya saṅkhepataḥ tattha sassatu cheda saṅkhāte vitthārataḥ
translated: Who will he condemn as fools? In brief, there are eternalists and annihilationists, and in detail there are those who hold the doctrines of the non-existent world, of fate, of necessity, and so on.

original: sake ayane “idameva sacca”nti daḷhaṃ vadāno kaṃ paraṃ ettha diṭṭhigate “bālo”ti saha
analyzed: sake ayane idam eva daḷham vadāno kam param ettha diṭṭhi gate bālo ti saha
translated: In his own doctrine he speaks strongly, saying: “Only this is the truth.” Who will he see as a fool in this view? Who will he see as one who is not in accordance with the Dhamma?

original: dhammena passeyya, nanu sabbopi tassa matena paṇḍito eva suppaṭipanno eva ca. Evaṃ🔽sante sayameva so medhagamāvaheyya, paraṃ vadaṃ bālamasuddhidhammaṃ. Sopi paraṃ “bālo
analyzed: dhammena passeyya nanu sabbaḥ api tassa matena paṇḍitaḥ eva suppaṭipannaḥ eva ca evam  sante sayam eva saḥ medha gam āvaheyya param vadam bālam asuddhi dhammam saḥ api param bālo
translated: Surely, according to his view, all are wise and all are well-practiced.

original: ca asuddhidhammo ca aya”nti vadanto attanāva kalahaṃ āvaheyya. Kasmā? Yasmā sabbopi🔽tassa matena paṇḍitoyeva suppaṭipannoyeva ca.
analyzed: ca asuddhi dhammo ca ayanti vadantaḥ attanā ava kalaham āvaheyya kasmai yasmai sabbaḥ upi  tassa matena paṇḍitaḥ yā iva suppaṭipannaḥ yā iva ca
translated: If this is so, then he himself will be the one to bring about the destruction of the path of wisdom. He will say that the other is a fool and not in accordance with the Dhamma. He too will be the one to bring about the destruction of the quarrel. Why? Because, according to his view, all are wise and all are well-practiced.

original: 129. Evaṃ sabbathāpi vinicchaye ṭhatvā sayaṃ pamāya, uddhaṃ sa lokasmiṃ vivādametīti
analyzed: evam sabbathā api vinicchaye sayam pamāya uddham sa lokasmim vivādam eti iti
translated: Thus, in every way, he who stands in judgment and measures himself, he brings about the quarrel in the world above.

original: diṭṭhiyā ṭhatvā sayañca satthārādiṃ minitvā so bhiyyo vivādametīti. Evaṃ pana vinicchayesu
analyzed: diṭṭhiyā sayam ca satthāra ādim minitvā saḥ bhiyyas vivādam eti iti evam pana vinicchayesu
translated: and he who, having taken his stand on views, himself makes a reckoning of the Teacher, etc., and then goes beyond that, he is the one who makes a reckoning of the world.”🔽But having understood the danger in reckonings,

original: ādīnavaṃ ñatvā ariyamaggena hitvāna sabbāni vinicchayāni, na medhagaṃ kubbati jantu
analyzed: ādīnavam ñatvā ariya maggena hitvāna sabbāni vinicchayāni na medha gam kubbati jantu
translated: and having abandoned all reckonings by means of the Noble Path, the man does not make a reckoning of the world.

original: loketi arahattanikūṭena desanaṃ niṭṭhāpesi.🔽Sayaṃ pamāyāti attanā minitvā. Paminitvāti pamāṇaṃ katvā. “Pavinetvā”tipi pāṭho,
analyzed: loke ti arahatta nikūṭena desanam niṭṭhāpesi  sayam pamāya ati minitvā paminitvā ati pamāṇam katvā
translated: Thus the Exalted One concluded the teaching with the peak of the arahants.🔽“Having himself made a reckoning”: having made a reckoning of the Teacher, etc. “Having reckoned”: having made a reckoning. The reading “having gone beyond” is not good. “Together with the talk of the world”: together with one who speaks about the world.

original: taṃ na sundaraṃ. Uddhaṃ vādena saddhinti attano upari kathentena saha. Desanāpariyosāne
analyzed: tam na sundaram uddham vādena saddhinti attanaḥ upari kathentena saha desanā pariyosāne
translated: At the conclusion of the teaching,

original: purābhedasutte vuttasadiso eva abhisamayo ahosīti.🔽Saddhammappajjotikāya mahāniddesaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: purābheda sutte vutta sadisaḥ eva abhisamayaḥ ahosi iti  saddhammappajjotikāya mahā niddesa ṭṭhakathāya
translated: there was an experience of the Dhamma similar to that described in the Purābheda Sutta.

original: Cūḷabyūhasuttaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽13. Mahābyūhasuttaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: cūḷabyūha sutta niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Cūḷabyūha Sutta in the Mahāniddesa section of the Saṃyutta Nikāya is finished.🔽The commentary on the Mahābyūha Sutta

original: 130. Terasame mahābyūhasuttaniddese ye kecime diṭṭhiparibbasānāti idampi “kiṃ nu
analyzed: terasame mahābyūha sutta niddese ye keci ime idam pi kim nu
translated: In the thirteenth sutta of the Mahābyūha, “these various views that arise in the world” . What is the meaning of this?

original: kho ime diṭṭhiparibbasānā viññūnaṃ santikā nindameva labhanti, udāhu pasaṃsampī”ti
analyzed: kho ime diṭṭhi paribbasānāḥ viññūnam santikā nindam eva labhanti udāhu pasaṃsam pi iti
translated: “Are these wanderers who are speculators about the past, when questioned and pressed for reasons, only open to blame and not to praise?”

original: uppannacittānaṃ ekaccānaṃ devatānaṃ tamatthaṃ āvikātuṃ purimanayeneva nimmitabuddhena
analyzed: uppanna cittānam ekaccānam devatānam tam attham āvikātum purima nayena iva nimmita buddhena
translated: Then, in order to make known that meaning to some deities whose minds were ready for instruction, the Emanated One asked the Self-Awakened One a question in the same way as before.🔽There, “they pursue” means they bring back again and again.

original: attānaṃ pucchāpetvā vuttaṃ. Tattha anvānayantīti anu ānayanti punappunaṃ āharanti.🔽Nindameva anventīti garahameva upagacchanti.
analyzed: attānam pucchāpetvā vuttam tattha anvānayanti iti anu ānayanti punappunam āharanti  nindam eva anventi iti garaham eva upagacchanti
translated: “They find only blame” means they only come to censure.

original: 131. Idāni yasmā te “idameva sacca”nti vadantāpi diṭṭhigatikavādino kadāci katthaci
analyzed: idāni yasmā te idam eva vadantā api diṭṭhigatika vādino kadāci katthaci
translated: Now, although those who say “This alone is the truth” are speculators about the past, sometimes somewhere

original: pasaṃsampi labhanti, yaṃ etaṃ pasaṃsāsaṅkhātaṃ vādaphalaṃ, taṃ appaṃ, rāgādīnaṃ samāya
analyzed: labhanti yam etam pasaṃsā saṅkhātam vāda phalam tam rāga ādīnam
translated: they also get praise. That fruit of the doctrine called praise is small, it is not able to destroy passion, etc.,

original: samatthaṃ na hoti, ko pana vādo dutiye nindāphale, tasmā etamatthaṃ dassento imaṃ
analyzed: samattham na hoti kaḥ pana vādaḥ dutiye nindā phale tasmai etam attham dassentaḥ imaṃ
translated: so what to say of the second fruit of censure? Therefore, showing this meaning, he spoke this

original: tāva vissajjanagāthaṃ āha “appañhi etaṃ na alaṃ samāya, duve vivādassa phalāni brūmī”ti.
analyzed: tāva vissajjana gātham āha na alam samāya duve vivādassa phalāni brūmi iti
translated: answering verse: “But this is small, not enough for destruction; I declare two fruits of dispute.”

original: Tattha duve vivādassa phalānīti nindā ca pasaṃsā ca jayaparājayādīni vā taṃsabhāgāni.
analyzed: tattha duve vivādassa phalāni iti nindā ca pasaṃsā ca jaya parājaya ādīni vā taṃsa bhāgāni
translated: Herein, the two fruits of dispute are dispraise and praise, or else the like of victory and defeat, etc.

original: Etampi disvāti “nindā aniṭṭhā eva, pasaṃsā nālaṃ samāyā”ti etampi vivādaphale ādīnavaṃ
analyzed: etam pi disvā ati nindā aniṭṭhā eva pasaṃsā na alam samāyāti etam pi vivāda phale ādīnavam
translated: Having seen this danger in the fruits of dispute, that is, that dispraise is undesirable and praise is not enough,

original: disvā. Khemābhipassaṃ avivādabhūminti avivādabhūmiṃ nibbānaṃ khemanti passamāno.
analyzed: disvā khema abhipassam avivāda bhūminti avivāda bhūmim nibbānam khemanti passamāno
translated: he sees the state of non-dispute as peace.

original: Appakanti mandaṃ. Parittakanti thokaṃ. Omakanti heṭṭhimakaṃ. Lāmakanti pāpakaṃ. Samāyāti
analyzed: appakam ti mandam parittakam ti thokam omakam ti heṭṭhimakam lāmakam ti pāpakam samāyāti
translated: Little: slight. Small: trifling. Inferior: lower. Inferior: bad. Enough:

original: rāgādīnaṃ samanatthāya. Upasamāyāti uparūpari samanatthāya. Vūpasamāyāti sannisīdāpanatthāya.
analyzed: rāga ādīnam samana tthāya upasamāyāti upari upari samana tthāya vūpasamāyāti sannisīdāpana tthāya
translated: for the purpose of equality of greed, etc. For the purpose of equality higher and higher: for the purpose of equality higher and higher. For the purpose of tranquillization: for the purpose of causing to subside.

original: Nibbānāyāti amatamahānibbānatthāya. Paṭinissaggāyāti maggena kilesānaṃ nissajjanatthāya.
analyzed: nibbānāya ati amata mahānibbāna atthāya paṭinissaggāya ati maggena kilesānam nissajjana tthāya
translated: For the purpose of extinction: for the purpose of the great deathless Nibbāna. For the purpose of relinquishment: for the purpose of relinquishing defilements by means of the path.

original: Paṭipassaddhiyāti phalena paṭipassaddhānaṃ anuppajjanatthāya nālaṃ.
analyzed: paṭipassaddhiyā ti phalena paṭipassaddhānam an uppajjana tthāya na alam
translated: For the purpose of appeasement: not enough for the purpose of non-arising of what has been appeased by fruition.🔽Thus, not disputing, he sees the state of non-dispute as peace.

original: 132. Evañhi avivādamāno – yā kācimāti gāthā. Tattha sammutiyoti diṭṭhiyo. Puthujjāti
analyzed: evam hi a vivāda mānaḥ yā kācimā ati gāthā tattha sammutiyā ti
translated: Any kind of view:

original: puthujjanasambhavā. So upayaṃ kimeyyāti so upagantabbaṭṭhena upayaṃ rūpādīsu ekampi
analyzed: puthujjana sambhavā saḥ upayam kim eyya iti saḥ upagantabba ṭṭhena upayam rūpa ādīsu ekam pi
translated: and they are produced by ordinary men. He does not go to them: what is meant is that he does not go to any one of the things beginning with form in the sense of approaching them.

original: dhammaṃ kiṃ upeyya, kena vā kāraṇena upeyya. Diṭṭhe sute khantimakubbamānoti diṭṭhasutasuddhīsu pemaṃ akaronto.
analyzed: dhammam kim upeyya kena vā kāraṇena upeyya diṭṭhe sute khantim akubbamāno ti diṭṭha suta suddhīsu pemam akarontaḥ
translated: Why does he not go to them? Because he does not make liking for them.

original: Puthujjanehi janitāti puthujjanehi uppāditā. Sammutiyoti diṭṭhiyo. Puthu nānājanehi
analyzed: puthujjanehi janitā ati puthujjanehi uppāditā sammutiyo puthu nānājanehi
translated: Produced by ordinary men: produced by ordinary men.🔽The views: the views called “the world is finite” and so on.🔽Produced by many kinds of men: produced by many kinds of theorists.

original: janitā vāti anekavidhehi diṭṭhigatikehi uppāditā vā. Netīti na eti. Na upetīti samīpaṃ
analyzed: janitā vā ati anekavidhehi diṭṭhigatikehi uppāditā vā na iti iti na eti na upeti iti samīpam
translated: He does not go: he does not go to them.🔽He does not approach: he does not approach near to them.🔽He does not come: he turns back.

original: na eti. Na upagacchatīti nivattati. Nābhinivisatīti pavisitvā nappatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: na eti na upagacchati iti nivattati na abhinivisati iti pavisitvā na patiṭṭhati
translated: He does not enter into: having entered he does not settle down.🔽But the outsiders,

original: 133. Ito bāhirā pana – sīluttamāti gāthā tassattho – sīlaṃyeva “uttama”nti maññamānā
analyzed: itas bāhirā pana sīluttamā ti gāthā tassa atthaḥ sīlaṃ yeva uttamanti maññamānā
translated: The verse “Sīluttamā” has this meaning: thinking “Virtue is the best,”🔽some good people say that purification is by mere restraint,

original: sīluttamāti eke bhonto saṃyamamattena suddhiṃ vadanti, hatthivatādiñca vataṃ samādāya
analyzed: eke bhonto saṃyama mattena suddhim vadanti hatthi vata ādim ca vatam samādāya
translated: and they are devoted to the practice of the vow of silence, etc.,

original: upaṭṭhitāse. Idheva diṭṭhiyaṃ assa satthuno suddhiṃ bhavūpanītā bhavajjhositā samānā
analyzed: upaṭṭhitā ase idha iva diṭṭhiyam assa satthunaḥ suddhim bhava upanītā bhavat jhositā samānā
translated: and they have recourse to existence, being devoted to existence,

original: vadanti, api ca te kusalāvadānā “kusalā maya”nti evaṃvādā.
analyzed: vadanti api ca te kusala avadānā kusalā evaṃvādā
translated: and they say so, and they are right in saying so.

original: 134. Evaṃ sīluttamesu ca tesu tathā paṭipanno yo koci – sace cutoti gāthā. Tassattho🔽– sace tato sīlavatato paravicchindanena vā anabhisambhuṇanto vā cuto hoti, so taṃ
analyzed: evam sīla uttamesu ca tesu tathā paṭipannaḥ yaḥ koci sace cuto ti gāthā tassa attho  sace para vicchindanena vā an abhisambhuṇantaḥ vā cutaḥ hoti saḥ tam
translated: And so, in regard to those who are foremost in virtue, whoever is practising in this way, if he should die,

original: sīlabbatakammaṃ puññābhisaṅkhārādikammaṃ vā virādhayitvā vedhatī. Na kevalañca vedhati,
analyzed: sīla bbata kammam puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādi kammam vā virādhayitvā vedhatī na kevalam ca vedhati
translated: the meaning is this: if he should die, having been cut off from that virtue, or being unable to continue in it, then he would regret that virtuous deed, or that deed of merit consisting in the formation of what is wholesome, etc., and he would grieve.🔽And not only would he regret and grieve,

original: api ca kho taṃ sīlabbatasuddhiṃ pajappatī ca vippalapati ca patthayatī ca. Kimiva?
analyzed: api ca kho tam sīlabbata suddhim pajappatī ca vippalapati ca patthayatī ca kim iva
translated: but he would also praise and extol that purification of virtue, and he would long for it. For what reason?🔽As one who, having left the world, is worse off than a teacher,

original: Satthāva hīno pavasaṃ gharamhā, gharamhā pavasanto satthato hīno yathā taṃ gharaṃ🔽vā satthaṃ vā patthayatīti.
analyzed: satthāva hīnaḥ pavasam gharamhā gharamhā pavasantaḥ satthataḥ hīnaḥ yathā tam gharam  vā sattham vā patthayati iti
translated: and as one who, having left home, is worse off than a layman.

original: Paravicchindanāya vāti parena vāriyamāno vā. Anabhisambhuṇanto vāti taṃ paṭipattiṃ asampādento vā.
analyzed: para vicchindanāya vāti parena vāriyamānaḥ vā an abhisambhuṇantaḥ vāti tam paṭipattim a sampādentaḥ vā
translated: “Being cut off by another” means being prevented by another. “Being unable to continue” means being unable to complete that practice.

original: Aññāya aparaddhoti nibbānena parihīno maggato vā. Taṃ vā satthaṃ anubandhatīti taṃ vā satthaṃ sabbattha pacchato gacchati.
analyzed: aññāya aparaddhaḥ ti nibbānena parihīnaḥ maggataḥ vā tam vā sattham anubandhati iti tam vā sattham sabbattha pacchatas gacchati
translated: ‘He who has failed to understand’ means he who has failed to attain extinction or the path. ‘That dart will follow him’ means that dart will go after him everywhere.🔽But the reason why the Noble Disciple proclaims the excellence of virtue is this verse:🔽‘Abandoning all observances of virtue,🔽He who is free from stain,

original: 135. Evaṃ pana sīluttamānaṃ pavedhanakāraṇaṃ ariyasāvako sīlabbataṃ vāpi pahāya sabbanti
analyzed: evam pana sīluttamānam pavedhana kāraṇam ariya sāvakaḥ sīla bbatam vā api pahāya sabbanti
translated: Not seeking purity or impurity,🔽He should wander, free from bondage.🔽There are those who cling to views,🔽The dark with dark result, the bright with bright,🔽The dark-and-bright with such-and-such result,🔽And that which is called the “pure white” .’

original: gāthā. Tattha sāvajjānavajjanti sabbākusalaṃ lokiyakusalañca. Etaṃ suddhiṃ asuddhinti
analyzed: gāthā tattha sabba akusalam lokiya kusalam ca etam suddhim a suddhim ti
translated: Herein, ‘blameworthy and blameless’ is all that is unprofitable and all mundane profitable. ‘Purity and impurity’ is

original: apatthayānoti pañcakāmaguṇādibhedaṃ suddhiṃ akusalādibhedaṃ asuddhiñca apatthayamāno.
analyzed: apatthayāno ti pañca kāmaguṇa ādi bhedam suddhim akusala ādi bhedam asuddhim ca apatthayamāno
translated: ‘Not seeking’ means not seeking purity consisting in the five cords of sensual pleasure, etc., and impurity consisting in the unprofitable, etc.

original: Virato careti suddhiyā asuddhiyā ca virato careyya. Santi manuggahāyāti diṭṭhiṃ aggahetvā.
analyzed: virataḥ cara iti suddhiyā asuddhiyā ca virataḥ careyya santi manuggahāya ati diṭṭhim aggahetvā
translated: ‘He should wander, free from bondage’ means he should wander free from bondage to purity and impurity. ‘There are those who cling to views’ means there are those who have taken up views.

original: Kaṇhaṃ kaṇhavipākanti akusalakammaṃ akusalavipākadāyakaṃ. Sukkaṃ sukkavipākanti lokiyakusalaṃ attanā sadisaṃ sukkavipākadāyakaṃ.
analyzed: kaṇham kaṇha vipākanti akusala kammam akusala vipāka dāyakam sukkam sukka vipākanti lokiya kusalam attanā sadisam sukka vipāka dāyakam
translated: ‘The dark with dark result, the bright with bright result’ means unprofitable action gives an unprofitable result and mundane profitable action gives a mundane profitable result. ‘The dark-and-bright with such-and-such result’ means profitable and unprofitable action gives a mixed result. ‘And that which is called the “pure white”’ means the supramundane profitable.

original: Niyāmāvakkantinti maggapavisanaṃ. Sekkhāti satta sekkhā. Aggadhammanti uttamadhammaṃ, arahattaphalaṃ.
analyzed: niyāma avakkantinti magga pavisanam sekkhā ati satta sekkhāḥ agga dhammanti uttama dhammam arahatta phalam
translated: Niyāma-avakkanti = entering into the order of the ariyans. Sekkhā = seven kinds of sekhas. Aggadhamma = the highest truth, the fruit of arahatship.

original: 136. Evaṃ ito bāhirake sīluttame saṃyamena visuddhivāde tesañca vipākaṃ sīlabbatapahāyino
analyzed: evam itas bāhirake sīla uttame saṃyamena visuddhi vāde tesam ca vipākam sīlabbata pahāyinaḥ
translated: Thus, after showing the highest virtue of the outsiders who are outside of this Dhamma, the purification by restraint, and the fruit of their virtue and ritual,

original: arahato ca paṭipattiṃ dassetvā idāni aññathāpi suddhivāde bāhirake dassento “tamūpanissāyā”ti
analyzed: arahataḥ ca paṭipattim dassetvā idāni aññathā api suddhi vāde bāhirake dassento tam ūpanissāya ati
translated: and the practice of the arahat, the Buddha now, in order to show the purification by other means of the outsiders who are outside of this Dhamma, says the stanza, “Tamūpanissāya.”

original: gāthamāha. Tassattho – santaññepi samaṇabrāhmaṇā, te jigucchitaṃ amarantapaṃ vā diṭṭhasuddhiādīsu
analyzed: gātham āha tassa atthaḥ santaññe pi samaṇa brāhmaṇā te jigucchitam amarantapam vā diṭṭha suddhi ādīsu
translated: The meaning is: although there are some samaṇas and brāhmaṇas, they are despised, and they are not the end of the world, or they are one or the other of those who have purification by seeing, etc.,

original: vā aññataraññataraṃ upanissāyaakiriyadiṭṭhiyā vā uddhaṃsarā hutvā bhavābhavesu avītataṇhā
analyzed: vā aññatara aññataram upanissāya akiriya diṭṭhiyāḥ vā uddhaṃsarā hutvā bhava abhavesu a vīta taṇhā
translated: or they are those who have the view of inaction, or they are those who are bound for a high state, or they are those who are not free from craving for existence and non-existence,

original: suddhi’manutthunanti vadanti kathentīti.
analyzed: suddhim anutthunanti vadanti kathenti iti
translated: they say: “We are purified.” They speak thus.

original: Tapojigucchavādāti kāyapīḷanāditapena pāpahirīyanavādā. Tapojigucchasārāti teneva tapena hirīyanasāravanto. Uddhaṃsarāvādāti saṃsārena suddhiṃ kathayantā.
analyzed: tapaḥ jiguccha vādā ati kāya pīḍana ādi tapena pāpa hirīyana vādā tapaḥ jiguccha sārā ati tena iva tapena hirīyana sāravantaḥ uddhaṃsarā vādā ati saṃsārena suddhim kathayantā
translated: Tapo-jigucchā-vādāti = those who have the doctrine of austerity and disgust. Tapo-jigucchā-sārāti = those who have the essence of austerity and disgust. Uddhaṃ-sarā-vādāti = those who speak of purification by saṃsāra.

original: 137. Evaṃ tesaṃ avītataṇhānaṃ suddhiṃ anutthunantānaṃ yopi suddhippattameva attānaṃ🔽maññeyya, tassāpi avītataṇhattā bhavābhavesu taṃ taṃ vatthuṃ patthayamānassa hi jappitāni
analyzed: evam tesam a vīta taṇhānam suddhim an utthunantānam yaḥ api suddhi ppattam eva attānam  maññeyya tassa api a vīta taṇha ttā bhava abhavesu tam tam vatthum patthayamānassa hi jappitāni
translated: So, in the case of those whose craving is unabandoned and who seek purification, even he who might think that he has attained purification, since his craving is unabandoned, he too, as he seeks this or that object in the various kinds of becoming and rebirth, will have his recitations,

original: punappunaṃ hontiyevāti adhippāyo. Taṇhā hi āsevitā taṇhaṃ vaḍḍhayateva, na kevalañca🔽jappitāni, pavedhitaṃ vāpi pakappitesu, taṇhādiṭṭhīhi cassa pakappitesu vatthūsu🔽pavedhitampi hotīti vuttaṃ hoti. Bhavābhavesu pana vītataṇhattā āyatiṃ cutūpapāto🔽idha yassa natthi, sa kena vedheyya kuhiṃ va jappeti ayametissā gāthāya sambandho.🔽Āgamananti puna āgamanaṃ. Gamananti ito aññattha gamanaṃ. Gamanāgamananti ito gantvā puna nivattanaṃ. Kālanti maraṇaṃ. Gatīti gamanavasena gatiyā gantabbaṃ.
analyzed: punappunam hontiyā iva ati adhippāyaḥ taṇhā hi āsevitā taṇham vaḍḍhayatā iva na kevalam ca  jappitāni pavedhitam vā api pakappitesu taṇhā diṭṭhīhi ca ssa pakappitesu vatthūsu  pavedhitam pi hoti iti vuttam hoti bhava abhavesu pana vīta taṇha ttā āyatim cutūpapāto  idha yassa natthi sa kena vedheyya kuhim va jappeti ayam etissā gāthāya sambandhaḥ  āgamananti puna āgamanam gamananti itas aññattha gamanam gamana āgamananti itas gantvā puna nivattanam maraṇam gatī iti gamana vasena gatiyā gantabbam
translated: his recitations will be repeated again and again. This is the meaning. For craving, when cultivated, increases craving,

analyzed: yam āhu pucchāgāthā

What is recited is what is recited

original: 139. Idāni yasmā ekopi ettha vādo sacco natthi, kevalaṃ diṭṭhimattakena hi te vadanti,
analyzed: idāni yasmai ekaḥ api ettha vādo saccaḥ na atthi kevalam diṭṭhimattakena hi te vadanti
translated: Now, since there is not even one statement here that is true, they speak only by way of mere view,

original: tasmā tamatthaṃ dassento “sakaṃ hī”ti imaṃ tāva vissajjanagāthamāha. Tattha sammutinti
analyzed: tasmā tam attham dassentaḥ sakam hi iti imam tāva vissajjana gātham āha tattha sammutin ti
translated: so the Exalted One, showing that meaning, first spoke this verse of reply, “Their own view they praise. “🔽Herein, view is opinion.

original: diṭṭhiṃ. Anomanti anūnaṃ.
analyzed: diṭṭhim anomanti anūnam
translated: Not less is not deficient.

original: 140. Evametesu sakaṃ dhammaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ brūvantesu aññassa dhammaṃ pana hīnanti vadantesu
analyzed: evam etesu sakam dhammam paripuṇṇam brūvantesu aññassa dhammam pana hīnanti vadantesu
translated: Thus, when they speak thus, praising their own Dhamma as complete and disparaging the Dhamma of others as deficient,

original: yassa kassaci – parassa ce vambhayitena hīnoti gāthā. Tassattho – yadi parassa ninditakāraṇā
analyzed: yassa kassaci parassa ce vambhayitena hīnaḥ iti gāthā tassa atthaḥ yadi parassa nindita kāraṇā
translated: “If anyone should disparage another’s Dhamma,

original: hīno bhaveyya, na koci dhammesu visesi aggo bhaveyya. Kiṃkāraṇā? Puthū hi aññassa
analyzed: hīnaḥ bhaveyya na koci dhammesu visesī aggaḥ bhaveyya kiṃkāraṇā puthū hi aññassa
translated: if he were deficient because of disparaging another’s Dhamma, then no one would be preeminent in the Dhamma. And why? Because many speak

original: vadanti dhammaṃ nihīnato sabbeva te samhi daḷhaṃ vadānāsakadhamme daḷhavādā eva.
analyzed: vadanti dhammam nihīnataḥ sabbe iva te samhi daḷham vadāna asaka dhamme daḷha vādāḥ eva
translated: of another’s Dhamma as deficient. All of them, indeed, speak strongly, speaking strongly about their own Dhamma.

original: Vambhayitakāraṇāti dhaṃsitakāraṇā. Garahitakāraṇāti lāmakakatakāraṇā. Upavaditakāraṇāti akkositakāraṇā. Sakāyananti sakamaggaṃ.
analyzed: vambhayita kāraṇā ati dhaṃsita kāraṇā garahita kāraṇā ati lāmakakata kāraṇā upavadita kāraṇā ati akkosita kāraṇā sa kāyananti saka maggam
translated: Because of disparaging is because of reproaching. Because of blaming is because of censuring. Because of reviling is because of abusing. Their own way is their own path.

original: 141. Kiñca bhiyyo – saddhammapūjāti gāthā. Tassattho – te ca titthiyā yathā pasaṃsanti
analyzed: kiñca bhiyyas saddhamma pūjā ati gāthā tassa atthaḥ te ca titthiyāḥ yathā pasaṃsanti
translated: And what is more, the verse beginning “And their worship of the True Idea” . Its meaning is this. Just as those sectarians praise their own doctrines,

original: sakāyanāni, saddhammapūjāpi nesaṃ tatheva vattati. Te hi ativiya satthārādīni sattaronti.
analyzed: sa kāyanāni saddhamma pūjā api nesam tathā iva vattati te hi ativiya satthāra ādīni
translated: so their worship of the True Idea occurs in the same way. For they are very much devoted to the seven scriptures, namely, the scriptures of the Brahmins, the scriptures of the Niganthas, the scriptures of the Jains, the scriptures of the Ājīvikas, the scriptures of the Ājīvakas, the scriptures of the Bārhaspatyas, and the scriptures of the Lokāyatas.

original: Tattha yadi te pamāṇā siyuṃ, evaṃ sante sabbeva vādā tathiyā bhaveyyuṃ. Kiṃkāraṇā?
analyzed: tattha yadi te pamāṇā siyum evam sante sabbe iva vādāḥ tathiyāḥ bhaveyyum kiṃkāraṇā
translated: Herein, if they were to be a measure, then all doctrines would be true. And why?

original: Suddhī hi nesaṃ paccattameva. Na sā aññattha sijjhati, nāpi paramatthato. Attani
analyzed: suddhī hi nesam paccattam eva na sā aññattha sijjhati nā api paramatthataḥ attani
translated: Because their purification is only for themselves, it does not succeed elsewhere, nor in the ultimate sense. It is only

original: diṭṭhigāhamattameva hi taṃ tesaṃ parapaccayaneyyabuddhīnaṃ. Paccattamevāti pāṭekkameva.
analyzed: diṭṭhi gāha mattam eva hi tam tesam para paccaya neyya buddhīnam paccattam eva ati pāṭekkam eva
translated: for themselves. It is only for themselves, that is, only for themselves.

original: 142. Yo pana viparītato bāhitapāpattā brāhmaṇo, tassa na brāhmaṇassa paraneyyamatthīti
analyzed: yaḥ pana viparītataḥ bāhitapāpattā brāhmaṇaḥ tassa na brāhmaṇassa paraneyyam atthi iti
translated: But the Brahmin who has expelled evil by the opposite way has no need of being led by another.

original: gāthā. Tassattho – brāhmaṇassa hi “sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā”tiādinā nayena sudiṭṭhattā
analyzed: gāthā tassa atthaḥ brāhmaṇassa hi sabbe saṅkhārāḥ aniccā ati ādinā nayena su diṭṭha ttā
translated: The verse beginning “The Brahmin who has expelled evil” . Its meaning is this. For the Brahmin, since it is well seen by the method “All formations are impermanent” ,

original: parena netabbaṃ ñāṇaṃ natthi. Diṭṭhidhammesu “idameva sacca”nti nicchinitvā sumaggahītampi
analyzed: parena netabbam ñāṇam natthi diṭṭhi dhammesu idam eva saccanti nicchinitvā su magga hītam pi
translated: there is no knowledge that needs to be led by another. Even if it is well grasped by deciding “This alone is the truth” in the case of views that are a matter of opinion,

original: natthi. Taṃkāraṇā so diṭṭhikalahāni atikkanto, na hi so seṭṭhato passati dhammamaññaṃ
analyzed: natthi taṃ kāraṇā so diṭṭhi kalahāni atikkantaḥ na hi so seṭṭhataḥ passati dhamma maññam
translated: There is not. For that reason he has gone beyond the disputes of views, for he does not see any other doctrine as superior.

original: aññatra satipaṭṭhānādīhi.
analyzed: aññatra sati paṭṭhāna ādīhi
translated: There is not. For that reason he has gone beyond the disputes of views. He does not see any other Dhamma as best apart from the foundations of mindfulness, etc.

original: Na paraneyyoti parena netabbo jānāpetabbo na hoti. Na parapattiyo na parapaccayoti paresaṃ paccetabbo na hoti. Na parapaṭibaddhagūti paresaṃ paṭibaddhagamano na hoti.🔽143. Jānāmīti gāthāya sambandho attho ca – evaṃ tāva paramatthabrāhmaṇo na hi seṭṭhato🔽passati dhammamaññaṃ, aññe pana titthiyā paracittañāṇādīhi jānantāpi passantāpi “jānāmi
analyzed: na para neyyaḥ ti parena netabbaḥ jānāpetabbaḥ na hoti na para pattiyaḥ na para paccayaḥ ti paresam paccetabbaḥ na hoti na para paṭibaddha gūti paresam paṭibaddha gamanaḥ na hoti  jānāmi iti gāthāya sambandhaḥ attho ca evam tāva parama attha brāhmaṇaḥ na hi seṭṭhataḥ  passati dhammam aññam aññe pana titthiyā para citta ñāṇa ādīhi jānantā api passantā api jānāmi
translated: Not led by another: he is not led by another, is not made to know. Not depending on another: he does not depend on another. Not following another: he does not go following another.

original: passāmi tatheva eta”nti evaṃ vadantāpi ca diṭṭhiyā suddhiṃ paccenti. Kasmā? Yasmā
analyzed: passāmi tathā iva etat ti evam vadantā api ca diṭṭhiyā suddhim paccenti kasmai yasmai
translated: The meaning of the verse is this. First, the one who is a brahmin in the ultimate sense does not see any other Dhamma as best apart from the foundations of mindfulness, etc. But other sectarians, though they know and see by means of the knowledge of others’ minds, etc., still claim: “I know, I see.” And though they claim this, they still purify their view. Why?

original: tesu ekopi adakkhi ce addasa cepi tena paracittañāṇādinā yathābhūtamatthaṃ, kiñhi
analyzed: tesu ekaḥ api adakkhi ce addasa ce pi tena para citta ñāṇa ādinā yathābhūtam attham kiñhi
translated: Because even if one of them has not seen or has seen by means of the knowledge of others’ minds, etc., what is true as it really is, what can he do?

original: tumassa tena tassa tena dassanena kiṃ kataṃ, kiṃ dukkhapariññā sādhitā, udāhu samudayappahānādīnaṃ
analyzed: tumassa tena tassa tena dassanena kim katam kim dukkha pariññā sādhitā udāhu samudaya ppahāna ādīnam
translated: What has he done by seeing that? Has he accomplished the full understanding of suffering, or is it one of the others beginning with the abandoning of origination?

original: aññataraṃ, yato sabbathāpi atikkamitvā ariyamaggaṃ te titthiyā aññeneva vadanti suddhiṃ,
analyzed: aññataram yatas sabbathā api atikkamitvā ariya maggam te titthiyāḥ aññena iva vadanti suddhim
translated: Since he has not transcended all by the noble path, those sectarians declare purification by something else,

original: atikkamitvā vā te titthiye buddhādayo aññeneva vadanti suddhinti.
analyzed: atikkamitvā vā te titthiye buddha ādayaḥ aññena iva vadanti suddhin ti
translated: or, having transcended those sectarians, the Buddhas and so on declare purification by something else.

original: 144. Passaṃ naroti gāthāya sambandho attho ca – kiñca bhiyyo? Yvāyaṃ paracittañāṇādīhi🔽addakkhi, so passaṃ naro dakkhati nāmarūpaṃ, na tato paraṃ, disvāna vā ñassati tānimeva🔽nāmarūpāni niccato sukhato vā, na aññathā; so evaṃ passanto kāmaṃ bahuṃ passatu appakaṃ
analyzed: passam naro ti gāthāya sambandhaḥ attho ca kiñca bhiyyas yvā ayam para citta ñāṇa ādīhi  addakkhi saḥ passam naraḥ dakkhati nāma rūpam na tatas param disvāna vā  nāma rūpāni niccatas sukhataḥ vā na aññathā saḥ evam passantaḥ kāmam bahum passatu appakam
translated: The connection and the meaning of the verse “Seeing, a man” are this. And what is more? He who has seen by means of the knowledge of others’ minds, etc.,🔽that man, seeing, will see mentality-materiality, not beyond that. Or, having seen, he will know only those same mentality-materialities as permanent or as pleasure, not otherwise. So let him see much or little mentality-materiality as permanent and as pleasure.

original: vā nāmarūpaṃ niccato sukhato ca athassa evarūpena dassanena na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.
analyzed: vā nāma rūpam niccatas sukhatas ca athassa evarūpena dassanena na hi tena suddhim kusalāḥ vadanti
translated: The wise do not declare purification by such seeing.

original: 145. Nivissavādīti gāthāya sambandho attho ca – tena ca dassanena suddhiyā asatiyāpi
analyzed: nivissa vādī iti gāthāya sambandhaḥ attho ca tena ca dassanena suddhiyā asatiyā api
translated: The connection and the meaning of the verse “The one who holds a view” are this. And since there is no purification by that seeing,

original: yo “jānāmi passāmi tatheva eta”nti evaṃ nivissavādī, etaṃ vā dassanaṃ paṭicca diṭṭhiyā
analyzed: yaḥ jānāmi passāmi tathā iva etat ti evam nivissa vādī etam vā dassanam paṭicca diṭṭhiyā
translated: having a view, declares purification to be through that view,

original: suddhiṃ paccento “idameva sacca”nti evaṃ nivissavādī, so subbinayo na hoti taṃ tathā
analyzed: suddhim paccentaḥ idam eva saccanti evam nivissa vādī saḥ su binayaḥ na hoti tam tathā
translated: “This alone is the truth,” is not one who has right conduct, for that view

original: pakappitaṃ abhisaṅkhataṃ diṭṭhiṃ purakkharāno. So hi yaṃ satthārādiṃ nissito, tattheva
analyzed: pakappitam abhisaṅkhatam diṭṭhim purakkharāno saḥ hi yam satthārā ādim nissitaḥ tattha eva
translated: is fabricated, made, and composed. He who is dependent on a teacher, etc.,🔽and declares purity by declaring it to be beautiful, thinking “I am one who

original: subhaṃ vadāno suddhiṃ vado, “parisuddhivādo parisuddhidassano vā aha”nti attānaṃ
analyzed: subham vadānaḥ suddhim vado parisuddhi vādo parisuddhi dassanaḥ vā ahanti attānam
translated: declares purification, or I am one who has a purified view,”🔽sees in accordance with that view. He sees only what is not contrary to his

original: maññamāno tattha tathaddasā so, tattha sakāya diṭṭhiyā aviparītameva so addasa. Yathā
analyzed: maññamāno tattha tathaddasā saḥ tattha sakāya diṭṭhiyā aviparītam eva saḥ addasa yathā
translated: own view. The intention is that he does not wish to see otherwise than as his🔽view proceeds.

original: sā diṭṭhi pavattati, tatheva taṃ addasa, na aññathā passituṃ icchatīti adhippāyo.🔽Nivissavādīti patiṭṭhahitvā kathento. Dubbinayoti vinetuṃ dukkho. Duppaññāpayoti
analyzed: sā diṭṭhi pavattati tathā iva tam addasa na aññathā passitum icchati iti adhippāyaḥ  nivissa vādī iti patiṭṭhahitvā kathentaḥ dubbinayo ti vinetum dukkho duppaññāpayo ti
translated: A “one-sided declarer” is one who speaks having taken a stand. “Not one🔽who has right conduct” is one who is difficult to guide. “Not one who has🔽right understanding” is one who is difficult to make understand, difficult to🔽make comprehend with the mind. “Not one who has right investigation” is

original: ñāpetuṃ cittena labbhāpetuṃ dukkho. Dunnijjhāpayoti cittena vīmaṃsitvā gahaṇatthaṃ
analyzed: ñāpetum cittena labbhāpetum dukkhaḥ cittena vīmaṃsitvā gahaṇa ttham
translated: one who is difficult to make grasp by investigating with the mind.

original: punappunaṃ nijjhāpayituṃ dukkho. Duppekkhāpayoti ikkhāpayituṃ dukkho. Duppasādayoti🔽citte pasādaṃ uppādetuṃ dukkho.
analyzed: punappunam nijjhāpayitum dukkhaḥ ikkhāpayitum dukkhaḥ duppasādayoti  citte pasādam uppādetum dukkhaḥ
translated: It is hard to make them understand again and again. It is hard to make them look on: it is hard to make them look on with equanimity. It is hard to convince: it is hard to arouse confidence in the mind.

original: Appassīti ñāṇena paṭivedhaṃ pāpuṇi. Paṭivijjhīti cittena avabodhaṃ pāpuṇi.
analyzed: appassī iti ñāṇena paṭivedham pāpuṇi paṭivijjhi iti cittena avabodham pāpuṇi
translated: He saw: he reached penetration by means of knowledge. He penetrated: he reached understanding by means of consciousness.

original: 146. Evaṃ pakappitaṃ diṭṭhiṃ purakkharānesu titthiyesu – na brāhmaṇo kappamupeti🔽saṅkhāti gāthā. Tattha saṅkhāti saṅkhāya, jānitvāti attho. Napi ñāṇabandhūti samāpattiñāṇādinā
analyzed: evam pakappitam diṭṭhim purakkharānesu titthiyesu  na brāhmaṇaḥ kappam upeti  saṅkhā ati gāthā tattha saṅkhā ati saṅkhāya jānitvā iti atthaḥ ñāṇa bandhu iti samāpatti ñāṇa ādinā
translated: Thus, having made his view known to the sectarians who were in the habit of going about in front, he spoke the verse beginning with the words, “No brahmin reaches the goal by counting” .

original: akatataṇhādiṭṭhibandhu. Tattha viggaho – nāpi assa ñāṇena kato bandhu atthīti napi
analyzed: akata taṇhā diṭṭhi bandhu tattha viggahaḥ na api assa ñāṇena kataḥ bandhu atthi iti na pi
translated: Herein, by counting is by reckoning, the meaning is by knowing. Nor by a kinsman of knowledge: he has no kinsman of knowledge made by means of craving and view, etc., that have been abandoned. Herein, the analysis is this. Nor by a kinsman of knowledge: he has no kinsman of knowledge made by means of knowledge.

original: ñāṇabandhu. Sammutiyoti diṭṭhisammutiyo. Puthujjāti puthujjanasambhavā. Uggahaṇanti
analyzed: ñāṇa bandhu sammutiyo ti diṭṭhi sammutiyo puthujjā ti puthujjana sambhavā uggahaṇanti
translated: By the conventional: by the conventional of view. By the origin: by the origin of the world. By the grasping: by the grasping of the world.

original: maññeti uggahaṇanti aññe, aññe tā sammutiyo uggaṇhantīti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: maññā iti aññe aññe tāḥ sammutiyaḥ uggaṇhanti iti vuttam hoti
translated: Others say that the grasping is the grasping of the world. What is meant is that other people grasp those conventions.

original: Upekkhatīti upapattito apakkhapatito hutvā passati.
analyzed: upekkhati iti upapattitaḥ a pakkha patitaḥ hutvā passati
translated: He looks on: he sees as one who has turned away from rebirth.

original: 147. Kiñca bhiyyo – vissajja ganthānīti gāthā. Tattha anuggahoti uggahaṇavirahito, sopi nāssa uggahoti anuggaho. Na vā uggaṇhātīti anuggaho.
analyzed: kiñca bhiyyas vissajja ganthāni iti gāthā tattha anuggaho ti uggahaṇa virahito saḥ api na assa uggaho ti anuggahaḥ na vā uggaṇhāti iti anuggahaḥ
translated: And what is more, ‘Having cast off the fetters’ is the verse. Herein, unlearned is unlearned in the sense of not having learned. He has no learning is unlearned. Or else, he does not learn is unlearned.

original: Ganthe vossajjitvāti abhijjhādike ganthe cajitvā. Vissajjāti puna anādiyanavasena🔽jahitvā. Gadhiteti ghaṭite. Ganthiteti suttena saṅgahite viya ganthite. Bandheti🔽suṭṭhu bandhe. Vibandheti vividhā bandhe. Palibuddheti samantato bandhanena bandhe.
analyzed: ganthe vā ussajjitvā ati abhijjhā ādike ganthe cajitvā vissajjāti puna an ādiyana vasena  jahitvā gadhitā iti ghaṭite ganthitā iti suttena saṅgahite viya ganthite bandha iti  suṭṭhu bandhe vibandhā iti vividhā bandhe palibuddhā iti samantataḥ bandhanena bandhe
translated: Having cast off the fetters is having cast off the fetters beginning with covetousness. Having cast off is having abandoned by not taking them up again.🔽Having bound together is having tied together. Having fastened together is having fastened together as if fastened together by a thread. Having bound is🔽having bound well. Having untied is having untied in various ways. Having unfastened is having unfastened by fastening all round.

original: Bandhaneti kilesabandhane. Phoṭayitvāti papphoṭetvā. Saccaṃ vissajjaṃ karontīti visaṅkharitvā
analyzed: bandhana iti kilesa bandhane phoṭayitvā iti papphoṭetvā saccam vissajjam karonti iti visaṅkharitvā
translated: Having fettered is having fettered with the fetter of defilement. Having shaken off is having shaken off.🔽Having cast off the truth is having made it unformed.

original: aparibhogaṃ karonti. Vikopentīti cuṇṇavicuṇṇaṃ karonti.
analyzed: a paribhogam karonti vikopenti iti cuṇṇa vicuṇṇam karonti
translated: Having destroyed is having made it into small pieces.

original: 148. Kiñca bhiyyo – so evarūpo – pubbāsaveti gāthā. Tattha pubbāsaveti atītarūpādīni
analyzed: kiñca bhiyyas saḥ evarūpaḥ pubba āsava iti gāthā tattha pubba āsava iti atīta rūpa ādīni
translated: And what is more, ‘Such a one as this’ is the verse. Herein, past effluents is past form, etc.

original: ārabbha uppajjanadhammakilese. Naveti paccuppannarūpādīni ārabbha uppajjanadhamme.
analyzed: ārabbha uppajjana dhamma kilese nave ti paccuppanna rūpa ādīni ārabbha uppajjana dhamme
translated: and the defilements that are liable to arise in dependence on them. “New” : those that are liable to arise in dependence on present materiality, etc.

original: Na chandagūti chandādivasena na gacchati. Anattagarahīti katākatavasena attānaṃ agarahanto.
analyzed: na chandagū iti chanda ādi vasena na gacchati an atta garahī iti kata a kata vasena attānam a garahantaḥ
translated: “Not going by desire” : he does not go by desire, etc. “Not finding fault with himself” : not finding fault with himself by way of what he has done and what he has not done.

original: 149. Evaṃ anattagarahī ca – sa sabbadhammesūti gāthā. Tattha sabbadhammesūti dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhidhammesu
analyzed: evam anatta garahī ca sa sabba dhammesu iti gāthā tattha sabba dhammesu iti dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi dhammesu
translated: “Thus not finding fault with himself” : the verse. Herein, in all ideas means in the sixty-two views .

original: “yaṃ kiñci diṭṭhaṃ vā”ti evaṃpabhedesu. Pannabhāroti patitabhāro. Na kappetīti na🔽kappiyo, duvidhampi kappaṃ na karotīti attho. Nūparatoti puthujjanakalyāṇakasekkhā🔽viya uparatisamaṅgīpi no hoti. Na patthiyoti nittaṇho. Taṇhā hi patthayatīti patthiyā,
analyzed: yam kiñci diṭṭham vāti evaṃpabhedesu panna bhāro ti patita bhāro na kappeti iti na  kappiyaḥ duvidham pi kappam na karoti iti atthaḥ puthujjana kalyāṇaka sekkhā  no hoti na patthiyaḥ ti nittaṇhaḥ taṇhā hi patthayati iti patthiyā
translated: “ Whatever is seen, heard, sensed, or cognized” , etc.,🔽“The burden laid down” : the burden laid down. “He does not take up” : he is not fit to; the meaning is that he does not take up any of the two kinds of “taking up” .🔽“Nor is he one who stops” : he is not one who is endowed with stopping, as are the good persons among worldlings and the Initiate.

original: nāssa patthiyāti na patthiyo. Ito parañca heṭṭhā ca tattha tattha vuttanayattā uttānatthameva.
analyzed: na assa patthiyā ti na patthiyaḥ itas param ca heṭṭhā ca tattha tattha vutta naya ttā uttāna attham eva
translated: “Nor is he one who hopes” : he is free from hope. For craving is called “ hope” because it hopes for what is not yet obtained.🔽He has no hope, thus he is “ one who hopes not” . And the rest of the meaning is plain.

original: Evaṃ arahattanikūṭeneva desanaṃ niṭṭhāpesi, desanāpariyosāne purābhedasutte vuttasadiso🔽eva abhisamayo ahosīti.🔽Saddhammappajjotikāya mahāniddesaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: evam arahatta nikūṭena iva desanam niṭṭhāpesi desanā pariyosāne purābheda sutte vutta sadiso  eva abhisamayaḥ ahosi iti  saddhammappajjotikāya mahā niddesa ṭṭhakathāya
translated: So he concluded the teaching with the peak of arahatship. At the conclusion of the teaching, the penetration was the same as that of the Pūraṇa-sutta.🔽The commentary on the Niddesa section of the Mahāniddesa, which is a lamp for the true Dhamma, is finished.

original: Mahābyūhasuttaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mahābyūha sutta niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Mahābyūha Sutta Niddesa is finished.

original: 14. Tuvaṭakasuttaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽150. Cuddasame tuvaṭakasuttaniddese pucchāmi tanti idampi tasmiṃyeva mahāsamaye “kā
analyzed: tuvaṭaka sutta niddesa vaṇṇanā  cuddasame tuvaṭaka sutta niddese pucchāmi idam pi tasmin yeva mahā samaye kā
translated: Tuvaṭaka Sutta Niddesa Commentary

original: nu kho arahattappattiyā paṭipattī”ti uppannacittānaṃ ekaccānaṃ devatānaṃ tamatthaṃ🔽pakāsetuṃ purimanayeneva nimmitabuddhena attānaṃ pucchāpetvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nu kho arahatta pattiyāḥ paṭipatti iti uppanna cittānam ekaccānam devatānam tam attham  pakāsetum purima nayena iva nimmita buddhena attānam pucchāpetvā vuttam
translated: In the fourteenth sutta niddesa, Tuvaṭaka, the question is asked. This too was spoken by the created Buddha, who asked himself in the same great occasion, “What is the practice for attaining arahatship?” In order to make known that meaning to some deities who had arisen with the thought,🔽he asked himself that meaning in the same way as before.

original: Tattha ādipucchāgāthāya tāva pucchāmīti ettha adiṭṭhajotanādivasena pucchā vibhajitā.
analyzed: tattha ādi pucchā gāthāya tāva pucchāmi iti ettha adiṭṭha jotana ādi vasena pucchā vibhajitā
translated: There, in the first question verse, he asked: “Pucchāmi tanti idampi” . Here, the questions are divided by way of the light of the seen, etc.

original: Ādiccabandhūti ādiccassa gottabandhu. Vivekaṃ santipadañcāti vivekañca santipadañca.
analyzed: ādiccabandhu uti ādiccassa gottabandhu vivekam santipadam ca ati vivekam ca santipadam ca
translated: “Ādiccabandhu” means a kinsman of the solar race. “Vivekaṃ santipadañca” means seclusion and the state of peace.

original: Kathaṃ disvāti kena kāraṇena disvā, kathaṃ pavattadassano hutvāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: katham disvā iti kena kāraṇena disvā katham pavatta dassanaḥ hutvā iti vuttam hoti
translated: How seeing? By what reason seeing? How occurring as seeing?

original: Tisso pucchāti gaṇanaparicchedo. Adiṭṭhajotanāti yaṃ na diṭṭhaṃ na paṭividdhaṃ, tassa
analyzed: tissaḥ pucchā ati gaṇana paricchedaḥ adiṭṭha jotanā ati yat na diṭṭham na paṭividdham tassa
translated: Three questions: the number is delimited. Not seen: what is not seen, not penetrated,

original: pākaṭakaraṇatthāya pucchā. Diṭṭhasaṃsandanāti yaṃ ñāṇacakkhunā diṭṭhaṃ, tassa ghaṭanatthāya.
analyzed: pākaṭa karaṇa tthāya pucchā diṭṭha saṃsandanā ti yam ñāṇa cakkhunā diṭṭham tassa ghaṭana tthāya
translated: for the purpose of making that clear, the question. Agreeing about what is seen: for the purpose of consolidating what is seen with the eye of knowledge.

original: Vimaticchedanāti yā kaṅkhā, tassācchedanatthaṃ. Pakatiyā lakkhaṇaṃ aññātanti dhammānaṃ🔽tathalakkhaṇaṃ pakatiyā na ñātaṃ. Adiṭṭhanti na diṭṭhaṃ. “Na niṭṭha”ntipi pāṭho.
analyzed: vimati chedanā ti yā kaṅkhā tassa a chedana attham pakatiyā lakkhaṇam dhammānam  tatha lakkhaṇam pakatiyā na ñātam a diṭṭhanti na diṭṭham na niṭṭhanti pi
translated: Cutting off doubt: for the purpose of cutting off any doubt there may be. The characteristic is not known by nature: the characteristic of dhammas🔽is not known by nature. Not seen: not seen. “Not reached” is another reading.

original: Atulitanti tulāya tulitaṃ viya na tulitaṃ. Atīritanti tīraṇāya na tīritaṃ. Avibhūtanti
analyzed: tulāya tulitam na tulitam tīraṇāya na tīritam
translated: Not weighed: not weighed as if weighed on a scale. Not measured: not measured by measuring. Not understood:

original: na pākaṭaṃ. Avibhāvitanti paññāya na vaḍḍhitaṃ. Tassa ñāṇāyāti tassa dhammassa lakkhaṇajānanatthāya.
analyzed: na pākaṭam a vibhāvitam ti paññāya na vaḍḍhitam tassa ñāṇāya ati tassa dhammassa lakkhaṇa jānana tthāya
translated: not clear. Not discerned: not increased by understanding. For the purpose of knowing that: for the purpose of knowing the characteristic of that dhamma.

original: Dassanāyāti dassanatthāya. Tulanāyāti tulanatthāya. Tīraṇāyāti tīraṇatthāya. Vibhāvanāyāti
analyzed: dassanāya ati dassana tthāya tulanāya ati tulana tthāya tīraṇāya ati tīraṇa tthāya vibhāvanāya ati
translated: For seeing: for the purpose of seeing. For comparison: for the purpose of comparison. For investigation: for the purpose of investigation. For full understanding: for the purpose of full understanding.

original: vibhāgakaraṇatthāya. Aññehi paṇḍitehīti aññehi buddhisampannehi. Saṃsayapakkhandoti sandehaṃ paviṭṭho.
analyzed: vibhāga karaṇa tthāya aññehi paṇḍitehi iti aññehi buddhi sampannehi saṃsaya pakkhando ti sandeham paviṭṭhaḥ
translated: For seeing: for the purpose of seeing. For comparing: for the purpose of comparing. For scrutinizing: for the purpose of scrutinizing. For analysing: for the purpose of making an analysis. By other wise men: by other wise men who are possessed of understanding. In a doubtful case: having entered into doubt.

original: Manussapucchāti manussānaṃ pucchā. Amanussapucchāti nāgasupaṇṇādīnaṃ pucchā. Gahaṭṭhāti
analyzed: manussa pucchā ati manussānam pucchā amanussa pucchā ati nāga supaṇṇa ādīnam pucchā gahaṭṭhā ati
translated: Questioned by men: questions asked by men. Questioned by non-humans: questions asked by nagas, supannas, and so on. Householders:

original: avasesagahaṭṭhā. Pabbajitāti liṅgavasena vuttā. Nāgāti suphassādayo nāgā. Supaṇṇāti
analyzed: avasesa gahaṭṭhā pabbajitā ti liṅga vasena vuttā nāgā ti suphassa ādayaḥ nāgā su paṇṇā ti
translated: the rest of the householders. Those gone forth: those spoken of by way of the characteristics . Nagas: nagas such as Suphassa. Supaṇṇas:

original: supaṇṇasaṃyuttavasena. Yakkhāti yakkhasaṃyuttavasena ca veditabbā. Asurāti pahārādādayo.
analyzed: supaṇṇa saṃyutta vasena yakkhā ati yakkha saṃyutta vasena ca veditabbāḥ asurā ti pahārāt ādayaḥ
translated: supaṇṇas should be understood by way of the Supaṇṇa Saṃyutta. Yakkhas: yakkhas should be understood by way of the Yakkha Saṃyutta. Asuras: Pahārāda and so on.

original: Gandhabbāti pañcasikhagandhabbaputtādayo. Mahārājānoti cattāro mahārājāno. Ahīnindriyanti
analyzed: gandhabbā ati pañca sikha gandhabba putta ādayaḥ mahā rājānoti cattāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ
translated: Gandhabbas: Pañcasikha, Gandhabba’s son, and so on. Great Kings: the four Great Kings. With unimpaired faculties:

original: saṇṭhānavasena avikalindriyaṃ. So nimmitoti so bhagavatā nimmito buddho.
analyzed: saṇṭhāna vasena avikalindriyam saḥ nimmitaḥ iti saḥ bhagavatā nimmitaḥ buddhaḥ
translated: with faculties that are not defective by way of shape. The created Buddha: the Buddha created by the Blessed One.

original: Vodānatthapucchāti visesadhammapucchā. Atītapucchāti atīte dhamme ārabbha pucchā.
analyzed: vodāna attha pucchā ati visesa dhamma pucchā atīta pucchā ati atīte dhamme ārabbha pucchā
translated: Questions about the meaning of the profound: questions about special qualities. Questions about the past: questions asked in regard to past things.

original: Anāgatādīsupi eseva nayo. Kusalapucchāti anavajjadhammapucchā. Akusalapucchāti sāvajjadhammapucchā.
analyzed: anāgata ādīsu pi esā iva nayo kusala pucchā ati anavajja dhamma pucchā akusala pucchā ati sāvajja dhamma pucchā
translated: So too with the future, etc. The profitable is the blameless state. The unprofitable is the blameless state.

original: Abyākatapucchāti tadubhayaviparītadhammapucchā.
analyzed: abyākata pucchā ati tad ubhaya viparīta dhamma pucchā
translated: The indeterminate is the state opposite to both of these.

original: Ajjhesāmi tanti taṃ āṇāpemi. Kathayassu meti mayhaṃ kathehi. Gottañātakoti gottena ñātako. Gottabandhūti gottajjhattiko. Ekenākārenāti ekena koṭṭhāsena.
analyzed: ajjhesāmi tam ti tam āṇāpemi kathayassu mā iti mayham kathehi gotta ñātakaḥ iti gottena ñātakaḥ gotta bandhu iti gotta jhattikaḥ ekena ākārena ati ekena koṭṭhāsena
translated: I will question you: I will order you. Tell me: tell me. Kinsman of the Gotama family: related by birth to the Gotama family. Kinsman of the Gotama clan: a clansman of the Gotama clan. In one way: in one aspect.

original: Santipadanti santisaṅkhātaṃ nibbānapadaṃ. Ye dhammā santādhigamāyāti ye satipaṭṭhānādayo
analyzed: santi padam ti santi saṅkhātam nibbāna padam ye dhammā santa adhigamāya ati ye sati paṭṭhāna ādayo
translated: The state of peace: the state of extinction called “peace.” The states of mind that lead to the attainment of peace: the states of mind beginning with the foundations of mindfulness

original: dhammā nibbānapaṭilābhatthāya. Santiphusanāyāti ñāṇaphassena nibbānaphusanatthāya.
analyzed: dhammāḥ nibbāna paṭilābha tthāya santi phusanāya ati ñāṇa phassena nibbāna phusana tthāya
translated: that lead to the attainment of extinction. The touching of peace: the touching of extinction by the touch of knowledge.

original: Sacchikiriyāyāti paccakkhakaraṇatthāya. Mahantaṃ sīlakkhandhanti mahantaṃ sīlarāsiṃ.
analyzed: sacchikiriyāya ati paccakkha karaṇa atthāya mahantam sīla kkhandhanti mahantam sīla rāsim
translated: The realization of peace: the realization of extinction by direct experience. The great mass of virtue: the great heap of virtue.

original: Samādhikkhandhādīsupi eseva nayo. Sīlakkhandhādayo lokiyalokuttarā, vimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ lokiyameva.
analyzed: samādhi kkhandha ādīsu pi esa eva nayaḥ sīla kkhandha ādayaḥ lokiya lokuttarāḥ vimutti ñāṇa dassanam lokiyam eva
translated: So too with the great mass of concentration, etc. The mass of virtue, etc., is both mundane and supramundane, but the knowledge and vision of deliverance is mundane only.

original: Tamokāyassa padālananti avijjārāsissa viddhaṃsanaṃ. Vipallāsassa bhedananti catubbidhavipallāsassa🔽bhedanaṃ. Taṇhāsallassa abbuhananti taṇhākaṇṭakassa luñcanaṃ. Abhisaṅkhārassa vūpasamanti
analyzed: tamokāyassa padālananti avijjā rāsissa viddhaṃsananti vipallāsassa bhedananti catubbidha vipallāsassa  bhedanam taṇhā sallassa taṇhā kaṇṭakassa luñcanam abhisaṅkhārassa vūpasamanti
translated: “Crushing the mass of darkness” means destroying the darkness of ignorance. “Breaking the perversions” means breaking the four perversions.

original: puññādiabhisaṅkhārassa nibbāpanaṃ. Bhārassa nikkhepananti pañcakkhandhabhārassa ṭhapanaṃ.🔽Saṃsāravaṭṭassa upacchedananti saṃsārapavattassa chedanaṃ. Santāpassa nibbāpananti
analyzed: puñña ādi abhisaṅkhārassa nibbāpanam bhārassa nikkhepanam ti pañca kkhandha bhārassa ṭhapanam  saṃsāra vaṭṭassa upacchedananti saṃsāra pavattassa chedanaṃ santāpassa nibbāpananti
translated: “Uprooting the dart of craving” means plucking out the dart of craving. “Allaying the formations” means extinguishing the formations of merit, etc. “Laying down the burden” means putting down the burden of the five aggregates.

original: kilesasantāpassa nibbuti. Pariḷāhassa paṭipassaddhinti kilesadarathassa sannisīdanaṃ.
analyzed: kilesa santāpassa nibbuti pariḷāhassa paṭipassaddhinti kilesa da rathassa sannisīdanaṃ
translated: “Severing the round of the saṃsāra” means cutting off the round of the saṃsāra. “Extinguishing the fever” means extinguishing the fever of defilements. “Allaying the fever” means allaying the fever of defilements.

original: Devadevoti devānaṃ atidevo.
analyzed: devadeva uti devānam atidevaḥ
translated: “God of gods” means the god of gods.

original: 151. Atha bhagavā yasmā yathā passanto kilese uparundhati, tathā disvā tathā pavattadassano
analyzed: atha bhagavā yasmai yathā passantaḥ kilese uparundhati tathā disvā tathā pavatta dassanaḥ
translated: . Then the Blessed One, since he crushes defilements by seeing in such a way, and having seen in such a way, his vision proceeds

original: hutvā parinibbāti, tasmā tamatthaṃ āvikaronto nānappakārena taṃ devaparisaṃ kilesappahāne
analyzed: hutvā parinibbāti tasmā tam attham āvikarontaḥ nānappakārena tam deva parisam kilesa ppahāne
translated: and he attains Nibbāna by burning, therefore, revealing that meaning, in various ways, that assembly of gods in the destruction of defilements

original: niyojento “mūlaṃ papañcasaṅkhāyā”ti ārabhitvā pañca gāthā abhāsi.
analyzed: niyojentaḥ mūlam ārabhitvā pañca gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: He spoke five stanzas beginning with “The root of the manifold of determinations” .

original: Tattha ādigāthāya tāva saṅkhepattho – papañcasaṅkhāti papañcāti saṅkhātattā papañcā
analyzed: tattha ādi gāthāya tāva saṅkhepa attho
translated: Herein, the meaning in brief is this: the manifold of determinations is called the manifold of determinations because it is reckoned as the manifold .

original: eva papañcasaṅkhā. Tassā avijjādayo kilesā mūlaṃ, taṃ papañcasaṅkhāya mūlaṃ asmīti🔽pavattamānañca sabbaṃ mantāya uparundhe. Yā kāci ajjhattaṃ taṇhā uppajjeyyuṃ. Tāsaṃ
analyzed: eva papañca saṅkhā tassāḥ avijjā ādayaḥ kilesāḥ mūlam tam mūlam asmi iti  pavattamānam ca sabbam mantāya uparundhe yā kāci ajjhattam taṇhāḥ uppajjeyyum tāsam
translated: The manifold of determinations is the same as the manifold of determinations. Its root is the defilements beginning with ignorance. He suppressed that root of the manifold of determinations with mindfulness, and he suppressed all that occurs as “I am” .

original: vinayāya pahānāya sadā sato sikkhe upaṭṭhitassati hutvā sikkheyyāti.🔽Ajjhattasamuṭṭhānā vāti citte uppannā vā. Purebhattanti divābhattato purekālaṃ. Accantasaṃyogatthe
analyzed: vinayāya pahānāya sadā sataḥ sikkhe upaṭṭhitassati hutvā sikkheyya ati  ajjhatta samuṭṭhānā vā ati citte uppannā vā purebhattanti divābhattataḥ purekālam
translated: He trained himself in being mindful, being established in mindfulness, for the purpose of the destruction, the giving up, the abandoning of whatever craving might arise internally.

original: upayogavacanaṃ, atthato pana bhummameva purebhatteti, esa nayo pacchābhattādīsu.
