translated: “Naked” : uncovered. “Ascetic” : the meaning is, “one who is naked.” “One of irregular practice” : one of irregular conduct. He stands and defecates and urinates. He eats and chews while standing. “One who licks his hands” :

original: hatthe piṇḍamhi ṭhite jivhāya hatthaṃ apalikhati, uccāraṃ vā katvā hatthamhiyeva
analyzed: hatthe piṇḍamhi ṭhite jivhāya hattham apalikhati uccāram vā katvā
translated: when a lump of food is placed in the hand, he licks his hand with his tongue. Or, after defecating, he licks his hand right there.

original: daṇḍakasaññī hutvā hatthena apalikhati. Te kira daṇḍakaṃ “satto”ti paññapenti. Bhikkhāgahaṇatthaṃ🔽“ehi bhadante”ti vutto na etīti na ehibhadantiko. Tena hi “tiṭṭha bhadante”ti vuttopi
analyzed: daṇḍaka saññī hutvā hatthena apalikhati te kira daṇḍakam satto ti paññapenti bhikkhā gahaṇa ttham  ehi bhadanta iti vutto na eti iti na ehibhadantiko tena hi tiṭṭha bhadanta iti vuttaḥ api
translated: He scratches with his hand, thinking it is a stick. They call a stick a “living being.”🔽When he is told, “Come, venerable sir,” he does not come for the sake of alms.

original: na tiṭṭhatīti na tiṭṭhabhadantiko. Tadubhayampi kira so “etassa vacanaṃ kataṃ bhavissatī”ti na karoti.
analyzed: na tiṭṭhati iti na tat ubhayam pi kira so etassa vacanam katam bhavissati iti na karoti
translated: When he is told, “Stop, venerable sir,” he does not stop. They say that he does not do what he is told in either case, thinking, “He will do what he is told.”

original: Abhihaṭanti puretaraṃ gahetvā āhaṭaṃ bhikkhaṃ. Uddissakatanti “idaṃ tumhe uddissa🔽kata”nti evaṃ ārocitaṃ bhikkhaṃ. Na nimantananti “asukaṃ nāma kulaṃ vā vīthiṃ vā🔽gāmaṃ vā paviseyyāthā”ti evaṃ nimantitabhikkhampi na sādiyati na gaṇhāti. Na kumbhimukhāti
analyzed: puretaram gahetvā āhaṭam bhikkham idam tumhe uddissa  katanti evam ārocitam bhikkham na asukam nāma kulam vā vīthim vā  gāmam vā paviseyyātha ati evam nimantita bhikkham pi na sādiyati na gaṇhāti na
translated: Alms already collected: alms brought back after being collected earlier. Alms dedicated: alms announced thus, “This has been prepared for you.”

original: kumbhito uddharitvā diyyamānaṃ bhikkhaṃ na gaṇhāti. Na kaḷopimukhāti kaḷopīti ukkhali
analyzed: kumbhitaḥ uddharitvā diyyamānam bhikkham na gaṇhāti na kaḷopimukhā ati kaḷopī iti ukkhali
translated: He does not accept an invitation: he does not accept or take alms announced thus, “Enter such-and-such a family, street, or village.” He does not take from the mouth: he does not take alms that are put into his mouth. He does not take from the vessel: he does not take alms that are put into a vessel.

original: vā pacchi vā, tatopi na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? Kumbhikaḷopiyo maṃ nissāya kaṭacchunā pahāraṃ
analyzed: vā pacchi vā tatas pi na gaṇhāti kasmā kumbhika ḷopiyaḥ mam nissāya kaṭacchunā pahāram
translated: He does not accept it even if it is given by a slave or a servant. Why not? “They get a beating from the master because of me.”

original: labhantīti. Na eḷakamantaranti ummāraṃ antaraṃ karitvā diyyamānaṃ na gaṇhāti. Kasmā?
analyzed: labhanti iti na ummāram antaram karitvā diyyamānam na gaṇhāti kasmai
translated: He does not accept it if it is given after making a detour. Why not?

original: Ayaṃ maṃ nissāya antarakaraṇaṃ labhatīti. Daṇḍamusalesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: ayam mam nissāya antara karaṇam labhati iti daṇḍa musalesu pi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: “They get a detour because of me.” The same explanation applies to a stick and a vessel.

original: Na dvinnanti dvīsu bhuñjamānesu ekasmiṃ uṭṭhāya dente na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? Kabaḷantarāyo
analyzed: na dvinnanti dvīsu bhuñjamānesu ekasmin uṭṭhāya dente na gaṇhāti kasmai kabaḷantarāyaḥ
translated: He does not accept it if it is given by two people who are eating together, one of whom gets up to give it. Why not?🔽“There is an interruption of the mouthful.”

original: hotīti. Na gabbhiniyātiādīsu pana “gabbhiniyā kucchiyaṃ dārako kilamatī”ti, pāyantiyā
analyzed: hoti iti na gabbhiniyā ati ādīsu pana gabbhiniyā kucchiyam dārako kilamati iti pāyantiyā
translated: As regards “a pregnant woman,” etc., he does not accept it from a pregnant woman, thinking, “The child in the womb is exhausted”;🔽from a woman giving suck, thinking, “There is an interruption of milk for the child”;

original: dārakassa khīrantarāyo hotī”ti, “purisantaragatāya ratiantarāyo hotī”ti na gaṇhāti.🔽Na saṃkittīsūti saṃkittetvā katabhattesu. Dubbhikkhasamaye kira acelakasāvakā acelakānamatthāya
analyzed: dārakassa khīra antarāyaḥ hoti iti purisa antara gatāya rati antarāyaḥ hoti iti na gaṇhāti  na saṃkittīsu iti saṃkittetvā kata bhattesu dubbhikkha samaye kira acelaka sāvakāḥ acelakānam atthāya
translated: and from a woman living with a man, thinking, “There is an interruption of pleasure for the man.”🔽He does not accept it from those who have prepared a meal by collecting alms. It seems that during a famine the disciples of the naked ascetics collected rice, etc.,

original: tato tato taṇḍulādīni samādapetvā bhattaṃ pacanti, ukkaṭṭho acelako tatopi na paṭiggaṇhāti.
analyzed: tato tato taṇḍula ādīni samādapetvā bhattam pacanti ukkaṭṭhaḥ acelako tatas api na paṭiggaṇhāti
translated: from here and there and prepared a meal for the naked ascetics. The strict one does not accept it even from that.

original: Na yattha sāti yattha sunakho “piṇḍaṃ labhissāmī”ti upaṭṭhito hoti, tattha tassa
analyzed: na yattha sā ati yattha su nakhaḥ piṇḍam labhissāmi iti upaṭṭhitaḥ hoti tattha tassa
translated: He does not take what is brought and put there without being offered to him, thinking, “Perhaps I shall get something.” Why not? Because it would be an obstacle to his alms.

original: adatvā āhaṭaṃ na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? Etassa piṇḍantarāyo hotīti. Saṇḍasaṇḍacārinīti samūhasamūhacārinī.
analyzed: a datvā āhaṭam na gaṇhāti kasmai etassa piṇḍa antarāyaḥ hoti iti saṇḍa saṇḍa cārinī iti samūha samūha cārinī
translated: He goes in a scattered way: he goes in a scattered way, not in a continuous way.

original: Sace hi acelakaṃ disvā “imassa bhikkhaṃ dassāmā”ti manussā bhattagehaṃ pavisanti,
analyzed: sace hi acelakam disvā imassa bhikkham dassāma ati manussāḥ bhatta geham pavisanti
translated: For if people see a naked ascetic and think, “We shall give him alms,” they enter their houses

original: tesu ca pavisantesu kaḷopimukhādīsu nilīnā makkhikā uppatitvā saṇḍasaṇḍā caranti.
analyzed: tesu ca pavisantesu kaḷopi mukha ādīsu nilīnāḥ makkhikāḥ uppatitvā saṇḍasaṇḍā caranti
translated: and while they are doing so flies settle on the food and so on in the dishes.

original: Tato āhaṭaṃ bhikkhaṃ na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? Maṃ nissāya makkhikānaṃ gocarantarāyo jātoti.
analyzed: tatas āhaṭam bhikkham na gaṇhāti kasmā mam nissāya makkhikānam gocara antarāyaḥ jātaḥ ti
translated: Then when the food is brought out the ascetic does not take it, thinking, “Because of me flies have settled on the food.”

original: Thusodakanti sabbasassasambhārehi kataṃ sovīrakaṃ. Ettha ca surāpānameva sāvajjaṃ,
analyzed: thusodakam ti sabba sassa sambhārehi katam sovīrakam ettha ca surā pānam eva sāvajjam
translated: He does not accept fermented liquor and jaggery-wash: fermented liquor is any kind of liquor;

original: ayaṃ pana sabbesupi sāvajjasaññī.
analyzed: ayam pana sabbesu pi sāvajja saññī
translated: but only the drinking of it is a thing to be avoided, not its seeing or touching.

original: Ekāgārikoti yo ekasmiṃyeva gehe bhikkhaṃ labhitvā nivattati. Ekālopikoti yo ekeneva
analyzed: ekāgāriko ti yaḥ ekasmiṃ yeva gehe bhikkham labhitvā nivattati ekālopikaḥ iti yaḥ ekena iva
translated: He lives in one house: he goes to one house for alms and returns. He lives in one lodging: he uses one lodging.

original: ālopena yāpeti. Dvāgārikādīsupi eseva nayo. Ekissāpi dattiyāti ekāya dattiyā. Datti
analyzed: ālopena yāpa iti dvāgārika ādīsu pi esa eva nayaḥ ekissā api dattiyā ati ekāya dattiyā datti
translated: On a single alms round: on a single alms round of a single family.🔽Alms round:

original: nāma ekā khuddakapāti hoti, yattha aggabhikkhaṃ pakkhipitvā ṭhapenti. Ekāhikanti
analyzed: nāma ekā khuddaka pāti hoti yattha agga bhikkham pakkhipitvā ṭhapenti ekāhikam ti
translated: a single small bowlful, in which they keep the first alms they get.🔽For a single day: for one day.🔽For two days: for two days.

original: ekadivasantarikaṃ. Aḍḍhamāsikanti aḍḍhamāsantarikaṃ. Pariyāyabhattabhojananti vārabhattabhojanaṃ,
analyzed: eka divasa antarikam aḍḍhamāsikam ti aḍḍha māsa antarikam pariyāya bhatta bhojanam iti vāra bhatta bhojanam
translated: For a single turn: for a single turn.

original: ekāhavārena dvīhavārena sattāhavārena aḍḍhamāsavārenāti evaṃ divasavārena ābhataṃ bhattabhojanaṃ.
analyzed: eka aha vārena dvīha vārena sattāha vārena aḍḍha māsa vārena ati evam divasa vārena bhatta bhojanam
translated: For a single day, for two days, for a single turn, for two turns, for seven days, for a fortnight: food that is brought at the time stated and eaten at that time.🔽Eating only greens, etc., are as already explained.

original: Sākabhakkhotiādīni vuttatthāneva. Ubbhaṭṭhakoti uddhaṃ ṭhitako. Ukkuṭikappadhānamanuyuttoti
analyzed: sākabhakkho ti ādīni vutta tthāni eva ubbhaṭṭhakaḥ ti uddham ṭhitakaḥ ukkuṭika padhānam anuyuttaḥ ti
translated: Standing: standing up.🔽Devoted to standing: devoted to the energy of standing.

original: ukkuṭikaṃ vīriyaṃ anuyutto. Gacchantopi ukkuṭikova hutvā uppatitvā uppatitvā gacchati.
analyzed: ukkuṭikam vīriyam anuyuttaḥ gacchantaḥ api ukkuṭikaḥ uva hutvā uppatitvā uppatitvā gacchati
translated: He goes jumping up into the air, still standing.

original: Kaṇṭakāpassayikoti ayakaṇṭake vā pakatikaṇṭake vā bhūmiyaṃ koṭṭetvā tattha cammaṃ
analyzed: kaṇṭakāpassayiko ti aya kaṇṭake vā pakati kaṇṭake vā bhūmiyam koṭṭetvā tattha cammaṃ
translated: Lying on a bed of thorns: he pricks his body on either iron spikes or ordinary spikes stuck into the ground.

original: attharitvā ṭhānacaṅkamādīni karoti. Seyyanti sayantopi tattheva seyyaṃ kappeti. Phalakaseyyanti🔽rukkhaphalake seyyaṃ. Thaṇḍilaseyyanti thaṇḍile ucce bhūmiṭṭhāne seyyaṃ. Ekapassayikoti
analyzed: attharitvā ṭhāna caṅkama ādīni karoti seyyanti sayantaḥ api tattha iva seyyam kappeti phalaka seyyanti  rukkha phalake seyyam thaṇḍila seyyam ti thaṇḍile ucce bhūmiṭṭhāne seyyam eka passayiko ti
translated: and he makes his bed there, on the bare ground, and lies down. On a bed of fruits:🔽on a bed of tree fruits. On a bed of spread grass: on a bed of grass spread on a raised piece of ground. He sleeps on one side:🔽he sleeps on one side only. He wears a dust-heap rag: he smears his body with oil and stands in a dusty place;

original: ekapasseneva sayati. Rajojalladharoti sarīraṃ telena makkhetvā rajuṭṭhānaṭṭhāne tiṭṭhati,
analyzed: eka passena iva sayati rajaḥ jalladharā uti sarīram telena makkhetvā raju ṭṭhāna ṭṭhāne tiṭṭhati
translated: the dust sticks to his body and he wears it. He is a “whatever-is-lying-down-user”: he is one who, without rejecting what is lying down,🔽sits down on whatever seat he gets. He is a “coarse-food-eater”: he is one who eats coarse food. “Coarse”

original: athassa sarīre rajojallaṃ laggati, taṃ dhāreti. Yathāsanthatikoti laddhaṃ āsanaṃ🔽akopetvā yadeva labhati, tattheva nisīdanasīlo. Vekaṭikoti vikaṭakhādanasīlo, vikaṭanti🔽gūthaṃ vuccati. Apānakoti paṭikkhittasītudakapāno. Sāyaṃ tatiyaṃ assāti sāyatatiyakaṃ.
analyzed: sarīre rajaḥ jallam laggati tam dhāreti yathā santhatikaḥ iti laddham āsanam  a kopetvā yat eva labhati tattha eva nisīdana sīlaḥ vekaṭikaḥ ti vikaṭa khādana sīlaḥ vikaṭanti  gūtham vuccati apānako ti paṭikkhitta sītudaka pāno sāyam tatiyam assa ati sāyatatiyakam
translated: refers to excrement. He drinks water that has not been offered: he drinks water that has not been offered to him. He eats in one session a day:

original: Pāto majjhanhike sāyanti divasassa tikkhattuṃ “pāpaṃ pavāhessāmī”ti udakorohanānuyogaṃ anuyutto viharati.
analyzed: pāto majjhanhike sāyanti divasassa tikkhattum pāpam pavāhessāmi iti udakorohana anuyogam anuyuttaḥ viharati
translated: he eats once a day, in the evening. He eats in three sessions: he eats in the morning, at midday, and in the evening. He eats in seven sessions: he eats in the morning, at midday, in the evening, and in the four watches of the night. He eats in one session in two days: he eats in the evening on one day and in the morning on the next. He eats in one session in seven days: he eats in the evening on one day and in the morning on the next, and so on, until he eats in the evening on the seventh day. He eats in one session in fifteen days: he eats in the evening on one day and in the morning on the next, and so on, until he eats in the evening on the fifteenth day. He eats in one session in thirty days: he eats in the evening on one day and in the morning on the next, and so on, until he eats in the evening on the thirtieth day. He eats in one session in sixty days: he eats in the evening on one day and in the morning on the next, and so on, until he eats in the evening on the sixtieth day. He eats in one session in ninety days: he eats in the evening on one day and in the morning on the next, and so on, until he eats in the evening on the ninetieth day. He eats in one session in a year: he eats in the evening on one day and in the morning on the next, and so on, until he eats in the evening on

original: Te salle abhisaṅkharotīti te rāgādisattasalle abhinibbatteti. Abhisaṅkharontoti abhinibbattento.
analyzed: te salle abhisaṅkharoti iti te rāga ādi satta salle abhinibbatteti abhisaṅkharontaḥ iti abhinibbattentaḥ
translated: He generates the defilements: he generates the seven defilements beginning with lust. Generating: producing.

original: Sallābhisaṅkhāravasenāti sallābhinibbattāpanakāraṇā. Puratthimaṃ disaṃ dhāvatīti
analyzed: sat lābhi saṅkhāra vasena ati sat lābhi nibbattāpana kāraṇā puratthimam disam dhāvati iti
translated: By means of the generation of the defilements: by means of the production of the defilements. He runs to the east:

original: purimaṃ disaṃ gacchati. Te sallābhisaṅkhārā appahīnāti ete rāgādisallā payogā nappahīnā.
analyzed: purimam disam gacchati te salla abhisaṅkhārāḥ ete rāga ādi sallā payogā na appahīnā
translated: he goes to the east. The generation of the defilements is not abandoned: the effort of the defilements beginning with lust is not abandoned.

original: Sallābhisaṅkhārānaṃ appahīnattāti sallapayogānaṃ appahīnabhāvena. Gatiyā dhāvatīti
analyzed: salla abhisaṅkhārānam appahīna ttā ati salla payogānam appahīna bhāvena gatiyā dhāvati iti
translated: By means of the non-abandonment of the generation of the defilements: by means of the non-abandonment of the effort of the defilements. He runs to destiny:

original: gatiyaṃ dhāvati. Gatiyā gatinti gatito gatiṃ.
analyzed: gatiyam dhāvati gatiyā gatinti gatitas gatim
translated: he runs to a destiny. To destiny from destiny: from one destiny to another.

original: Na sīdatīti na nimujjati. Na saṃsīdatīti na samantato mujjati. Na osīdatīti na osakkati. Na avasīdatīti na paccosakkati. Na avagacchatīti na heṭṭhā gacchati.
analyzed: na sīdati iti na nimujjati na saṃsīdati iti na samantataḥ mujjati na osīdati iti na osakkati na avasīdati iti na paccosakkati na avagacchati iti na heṭṭhā gacchati
translated: He does not sink: he does not drown. He does not get submerged: he does not drown completely. He does not get submerged: he does not sink down. He does not get submerged: he does not sink back. He does not get submerged: he does not go down.

original: 175. Evaṃ mahānubhāvena sallena otiṇṇesu ca sattesu – tattha sikkhānugīyanti, yāni
analyzed: evam mahā anubhāvena sallena otiṇṇesu ca sattesu tattha yāni
translated: Thus, in regard to beings who have been pierced by a dart of such great force, the training is taught:

original: loke gadhitānīti gāthā. Tassattho – ye loke pañca kāmaguṇā paṭilābhāya gijjhantīti
analyzed: loke gadhitāni iti gāthā tassa atthaḥ ye loke pañca kāmaguṇā paṭilābhāya gijjhanti iti
translated: The verse is: “The world is bound by bonds,🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.

original: katvā “gadhitānī”ti vuccanti, cirakālasevitattā vā “gadhitānī”ti vuccanti. Tattha🔽taṃ nimittaṃ hatthisikkhādikā anekā sikkhā kathīyanti, uggayhanti vā. Passatha yāva
analyzed: katvā gadhitāni iti vuccanti cira kāla sevita ttā vā gadhitāni iti vuccanti tattha  tam nimittam hatthi sikkhā ādikā anekā sikkhā kathīyanti uggayhanti vā passatha yāva
translated: The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.

original: samattho vāyaṃ loko, yato paṇḍito kulaputto tesu vā gadhitesu tāsu vā sikkhāsu adhimutto🔽na siyā, aññadatthu aniccādidassanena nibbijjha sabbaso kāme. Attano nibbānameva sikkheti.
analyzed: samatthaḥ vā ayam lokaḥ yatas paṇḍitaḥ kula putto tesu vā gadhitesu tāsu vā sikkhāsu adhimuttaḥ  na siyā añña datthu anicca ādi dassanena nibbijjha sabbaso kāme attanaḥ nibbānam eva sikkheti
translated: The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.

original: Paṭivijjhitvāti ñāṇena nikkhametvā vā nibbijjhitvā vā.🔽176. Idāni yathā nibbānāya sikkhitabbaṃ, taṃ dassento “sacco siyā”tiādimāha. Tattha🔽saccoti vācāsaccena ñāṇasaccena maggasaccena ca samannāgato. Rittapesuṇoti pahīnapesuṇo.
analyzed: paṭivijjhitvā ti ñāṇena nikkhametvā vā nibbijjhitvā vā  idāni yathā nibbānāya sikkhitabbam tam dassentaḥ sacco siyā ti ādim āha tattha  sacco ti vācā saccena ñāṇa saccena magga saccena ca samannāgataḥ ritta pesuṇo ti pahīna pesuṇaḥ
translated: The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.🔽The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.

original: Vevicchanti macchariyaṃ.
analyzed: vevicchanti mat śariyam
translated: The world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds, the world is bound by bonds.

original: 177. Niddaṃ tandiṃ sahe thīnanti pacalāyikañca kāyālasiyañca cittālasiyañcāti ime tayo dhamme abhibhaveyya. Nibbānamānasoti nibbānaninnacitto.
analyzed: niddam tandim sahe thīnanti pacalāyikam ca kāya alasiyam ca citta alasiyam ca ati ime tayaḥ dhamme abhibhaveyya nibbāna mānasaḥ ti nibbāna ninna cittaḥ
translated: He should overcome the three states, namely, sleepiness, idleness, and mental depression, which are called “sluggishness” and “mental sluggishness” respectively. He should be “bent on Nibbāna” with his mind inclined to Nibbāna.

original: Kāyassa akalyatāti khandhattayasaṅkhātassa nāmakāyassa gilānabhāvo. Gilāno hi akallakoti🔽vuccati. Vinayepi vuttaṃ – “nāhaṃ, bhante, akallako”ti. Akammaññatāti kāyagelaññasaṅkhāto🔽akammaññatākāro. Megho viya ākāsaṃ kāyaṃ onayhatīti onāho. Sabbato bhāgena onāho
analyzed: kāyassa a kalya tā ati khandha ttaya saṅkhātassa nāmakāyassa gilāna bhāvaḥ gilānaḥ hi a kallako ti  vuccati vinaye pi vuttam na aham bhante a kallakaḥ ti akammañña tā ati kāya gelañña saṅkhātaḥ  akammañña tā ākāraḥ meghaḥ viya ākāsam kāyam onayhati iti onāhaḥ sabbatas bhāgena onāhaḥ
translated: “Unfitness of the body”: the condition of the body consisting of the three aggregates called feeling, perception, and formations, when it is sick. For one who is sick is called “unfit” . And in the Vinaya it is said, “Venerable sir, I am unfit” . “Unfitness of mind”: the state of unfitness called “mental sluggishness” .

original: pariyonāho. Abbhantare samorundhatīti antosamorodho. Medhatīti middhaṃ, akammaññabhāvena🔽vihiṃsatīti attho. Supanti tenāti suppaṃ. Akkhidalādīnaṃ pacalabhāvaṃ karotīti pacalāyikā.🔽Suppanā suppitattanti ākārabhāvaniddesā. Olīyanāti olīyanākāro. Dutiyaṃ upasaggavasena
analyzed: pariyonāhaḥ abbhantare samorundhati iti antosamorodhaḥ medhati iti middham a kammañña bhāvena 🔽vihiṃsati iti attho supanti tena ati suppam akkhi dala ādīnam pacala bhāvam karoti iti pacalāyikā 🔽ākāra bhāva niddesā olīyanā ti olīyana ākāraḥ dutiyam upasagga vasena
translated: “Sluggishness” : it drags the body along like a cloud dragging through the sky. “Depression” : it is depression in all ways. “Mental depression” : it oppresses from within. “Drowsiness” : it is sleep. The meaning is that it oppresses by making one unfit. “Sluggishness” : it makes the eyes, etc., sluggish.🔽“Depression” : it is the state of depression. “Mental depression” : it is mental depression. “Sluggishness” : it is drowsiness. “Depression” : it is sleep. “Mental depression” : it is the state of being oppressed. “Sluggishness” : it makes the eyes, etc., sluggish. “Depression” : it makes the body sluggish. “Mental depression” : it makes the mind sluggish. “Sluggishness” : it makes the eyes, etc., sluggish. “Depression” : it makes the body sluggish. “Mental depression” : it makes the mind sluggish. “Sluggishness” : it makes the eyes, etc., sluggish. “Depression” : it makes the body sluggish. “Mental depression” : it makes the mind sluggish. “Sluggishness” : it makes the eyes, etc., sluggish. “Depression” : it makes the body sluggish. “Mental depression” : it makes the mind sluggish. “Sluggishness” : it makes the eyes, etc., sluggish. “Depression” : it makes the body sluggish. “Mental depression” : it makes the mind sluggish. “Sluggishness” : it makes the eyes, etc., sluggish. “Depression” : it makes the body sluggish. “Mental depression” : it makes the mind sluggish. “Sluggishness” : it makes the eyes, etc., sluggish. “Depression” : it makes the body sluggish. “Mental depression” : it makes

original: vaḍḍhitaṃ. Līnanti avipphārikatāya paṭikuṭikaṃ. Itare dve ākārabhāvaniddesā. Thinanti
analyzed: vaḍḍhitam līnanti a vipphārika tāya paṭikuṭikam itare dve ākāra bhāva niddesā thinanti
translated: and developed. Slack: not spread out, like a ball of yarn. The other two terms are descriptions of the mode of its presence. Stiff: not spread out, like a lump of dough. Stiffness:

original: sappipiṇḍo viya avipphārikatāya ghanabhāvena ṭhitaṃ. Thiyanāti ākāraniddeso. Thiyitassa🔽bhāvo thiyitattaṃ, avipphāravasena thaddhatāti attho.
analyzed: sappi piṇḍaḥ viya a vipphārika tāya ghana bhāvena ṭhitam ākāra niddeso  bhāvaḥ thiyitattam a vipphāra vasena thaddhatā ati attho
translated: the state of being stiff. The meaning is: unyieldingness in the sense of unpliancy.

original: Sabbasaṅkhāradhātuyāti nibbānaninnamānaso sabbatebhūmikasaṅkhātadhātuyā. Cittaṃ paṭivāpetvāti
analyzed: sabba saṅkhāra dhātuyā ati nibbāna ninna mānasaḥ sabba tebhūmika saṅkhāta dhātuyā cittam paṭivāpetvā ati
translated: In the element of all formations: with his mind inclined to Nibbāna, in the element of formations consisting of all the planes.

original: cittaṃ nivattāpetvā. Etaṃ santanti etaṃ nibbānaṃ. Kilesasantatāya santaṃ. Atappakaṭṭhena paṇītaṃ.
analyzed: cittam nivattāpetvā etam santanti etam nibbānam kilesa santatāya santam a tappakaṭṭhena paṇītam
translated: Having turned his mind away: having turned his mind back. This is peaceful: this Nibbāna is peaceful in the sense of being free from defilements. It is sublime in the sense of being free from burning.

original: Na paṇḍitā upadhisukhassa hetūti dabbajātikā kāmasukhassa kāraṇā dānāni na denti.🔽Kāmañca te upadhiparikkhayāyāti ekaṃsena te paṇḍitā kāmakkhayāya kāmakkhepanatthaṃ
analyzed: na paṇḍitāḥ upadhi sukhassa hetu uti dabba jātikāḥ kāma sukhassa kāraṇā dānāni na denti  kāmam ca te upadhi parikkhayāya ati ekaṃsena te paṇḍitā kāma kkhayāya kāma kkhepana attham
translated: The wise do not give gifts for the sake of sensual pleasure: the wise, who are of noble birth, do not give gifts for the sake of sensual pleasure.🔽But they give gifts for the sake of the destruction of all attachments: the wise definitely give gifts for the sake of the destruction of all attachments, for the purpose of casting off all attachments.

original: dānāni denti. Apunabbhavāyāti nibbānatthāya. Jhānāni bhāventīti paṭhamajjhānādīni
analyzed: dānāni denti apunabbhavāya ati nibbāna atthāya jhānāni bhāventi iti paṭhamajjhāna ādīni
translated: For the sake of non-becoming: for the sake of Nibbāna. Developing jhānas: developing the first jhāna, etc.

original: vaḍḍhenti. Punabbhavāyāti punabbhavakāraṇā. Te paṇḍitā nibbānaṃ abhimukhaṃ hutvā dānaṃ dadanti.
analyzed: vaḍḍhenti punabbhavāya ati punabbhava kāraṇā te paṇḍitāḥ nibbānam abhimukham hutvā dānam dadanti
translated: They give gifts with Nibbāna as their aim.

original: 178. Sāhasāti rattassa rāgacaritādibhedā sāhasākāraṇā. Niddeso uttānatthoyeva.
analyzed: sāhasā ati rattassa rāga carita ādi bhedā sāhasā kāraṇā niddesaḥ
translated: “The rash” are those who are rash because of the causes for rashness classed as the lust resort, etc. The commentary is self-evident.

original: 179. Purāṇaṃ nābhinandeyyāti atītaṃ rūpādiṃ nābhinandeyya. Naveti paccuppanne. Hīyamāneti
analyzed: purāṇam na abhinandeyya ati atītam rūpa ādim na abhinandeyya nava iti paccuppanne hīyamāne iti
translated: “He should not delight in the old”: he should not delight in past visible forms, etc.,🔽“The decaying”: what is perishing.

original: vinassamāne. Ākāsaṃ na sito siyāti taṇhānissito na bhaveyya. Taṇhā hi rūpādīnaṃ ākāsanato “ākāso”ti vuccati.
analyzed: vinassamāne ākāsam na sito siyāti taṇhā nissitaḥ na bhaveyya taṇhā hi rūpa ādīnam ākāsanato ākāsaḥ ti vuccati
translated: “He should not be attached to space”: he should not be attached to craving, for craving is called “space” because it is “spacious” with regard to visible forms, etc.

original: Vemāneti abhavamāne. Vigacchamāneti apagacchamāne.
analyzed: vemānā iti a bhavamāne vigacchamānā iti apagacchamāne
translated: “The non-existent”: what is not becoming. “The vanishing”: what is disappearing.

original: “Ākāsatī”ti “ākassatī”ti ca duvidho pāṭho.
analyzed: ākāsati iti ākassati iti ca duvidhaḥ pāṭhaḥ
translated: There are two readings: “ākāsatī” and “ākassatī.”

original: 180. Kiṃ kāraṇā ākāsaṃ na sito siyāti ce? Gedhaṃ brūmīti gāthā. Tassattho – ahañhi
analyzed: kim kāraṇā ākāsam na sitaḥ siyā iti ce gedham brūmi iti gāthā tassa atthaḥ aham hi
translated: Why should he not be attached to space? The verse “The snare I call space” . Its meaning is this:

original: imaṃ ākāsasaṅkhātaṃ taṇhaṃ rūpādīsu gijjhanato gedhaṃ brūmi “gedho”ti vadāmi. Kiñca
analyzed: imam ākāsa saṅkhātam taṇham rūpa ādīsu gijjhanataḥ gedham brūmi gedha uti vadāmi kiñca
translated: I call this craving, which is called “space,” a “snare” because it ensnares one in visible forms, etc.🔽And why?

original: bhiyyo – avahananaṭṭhena “ogho”ti ca ājavanaṭṭhena “ājava”nti ca “idaṃ mayhaṃ, idaṃ
analyzed: bhiyyas avahanana ṭṭhena oghoti ca ājavana ṭṭhena ca idam mayham idam
translated: and further, in the sense of submerging, it is a “flood”, and in the sense of swiftness, it is a “swift current”, and “this is mine, this I am, this is my self”

original: mayha”nti jappakāraṇato “jappana”nti ca dummuñcanaṭṭhena “ārammaṇa”nti ca kampakaraṇaṭṭhena🔽“kampana”nti ca brūmi, esāva lokassa palibodhaṭṭhena duratikkamanīyaṭṭhena ca “kāmapaṅko duraccayo”ti.
analyzed: mayhanti jappa kāraṇataḥ jappananti ca dummuñcana ṭhena ārammaṇanti ca kampa karaṇa ṭṭhena  kampananti ca brūmi esā ava lokassa palibodha ṭṭhena duratikkamanīya ṭṭhena ca kāma paṅkaḥ duraccayaḥ ti
translated: and further, as to the meaning of dragging down, it is a flood, as to the meaning of running, it is a flood, as to the meaning of “This is mine, this I am, this is my self,” it is a clinging, as to the meaning of letting go, it is a footing, as to the meaning of shaking, it is a shaking, I say. This is the meaning of “The mire of sensuality is hard to cross” .

original: Ājavanti āpaṭisandhito javati dhāvatīti ājavaṃ, vaṭṭamūlatāya punabbhave paṭisandhidānataṇhāyetaṃ
analyzed: ājavanti ā paṭisandhitaḥ javati dhāvati iti ājavam vaṭṭa mūla tāya punabbhave paṭisandhi dāna taṇhāya itam
translated: It runs : it runs, it hastens, from the rebirth-linking ; this is a term for craving for rebirth-linking in the root of the round.🔽It clings : it is aspiration; this is a term for craving.

original: adhivacanaṃ. Jappananti patthanā, taṇhāyetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Ārammaṇampi vuccati taṇhāti
analyzed: adhivacanam jappananti patthanā taṇhāya etam adhivacanam ārammaṇam pi vuccati taṇhā ati
translated: A footing is also said to be craving.

original: rūpādīsu ārammaṇesu uppannataṇhā muccituṃ asakkuṇeyyaṭṭhena ārammaṇāti kathīyati.
analyzed: rūpa ādīsu ārammaṇesu uppanna taṇhā muccitum asakkuṇeyya ṭṭhena ārammaṇā iti kathīyati
translated: Craving that has arisen in the objects of craving consisting of visible forms, etc., is called a footing because it is incapable of being freed from them.

original: Kāmapaṅkoti osīdanaṭṭhena kalalaṃ. Kaddamoti saṅgaṭṭhena kaddamo. Tāpanaṭṭhena kileso.
analyzed: kāma paṅko ti osīdana ṭṭhena kalalam kaddamo ti saṅga ṭṭhena kaddamo tāpana ṭṭhena kileso
translated: The mire of sensuality is a term for the putrescence in the sense of putrescence. The mud is the mud in the sense of sticking. The defilement is the defilement in the sense of burning.

original: Niyyāsaṃ viya laggāpanaṭṭhena palipo. Rundhitvā dhāraṇaṭṭhena palirodho. Evametaṃ
analyzed: niyyāsam viya laggāpana ṭṭhena palipaḥ rundhitvā dhāraṇa ṭṭhena palirodhaḥ evam etam
translated: and Palipo is like a tying post in the sense of being a fastening post. And Palirodho is like a tying post in the sense of being a post for tethering. So this

original: gedhādipariyāyaṃ ākāsaṃ anissito.
analyzed: gedha ādi pariyāyam ākāsam a nissitaḥ
translated: is the simile for the sky in the sense of the non-attachment of the three kinds of truth stated above.

original: 181. Saccā avokkamanti gāthā. Tassattho – pubbe vuttā tividhāpi saccā avokkamaṃ moneyyapattiyā
analyzed: saccāḥ avokkamanti gāthā tassa atthaḥ pubbe vuttā tividhā api saccāḥ avokkamam moneyya pattiyā
translated: The verse ‘The truths, not straying, ‘ is stated. Its meaning is this. The three kinds of truth stated above, not straying, not going out of the way,

original: munīti saṅkhaṃ gato nibbānathale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo, sa veevarūpo sabbāni āyatanāni
analyzed: muni iti saṅkham gataḥ nibbāna thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo sa veevarūpo sabbāni āyatanāni
translated: the sage, who has gone to the state of a sage by the attainment of the state of a sage, stands in the plane of extinction, the brahmin, he, of such a form, having abandoned all the sense bases,

original: nissajjitvā “santo”ti vuccati. Niddese vattabbaṃ natthi.
analyzed: nissajjitvā santo ti vuccati niddese vattabbam natthi
translated: is called ‘ peaceful ‘ . There is nothing to be stated in the Niddesa.

original: 182. Kiñca bhiyyo – sa ve vidvāti gāthā. Tattha ñatvā dhammanti aniccādinayena saṅkhatadhammaṃ
analyzed: kiñca bhiyyas sa ve vidvā iti gāthā tattha ñatvā anicca ādi nayena saṅkhata dhammaṃ
translated: And what is more, the verse ‘ He indeed is wise ‘ . There, having known the truth by way of impermanence, etc.,

original: aññāya. Sammā so loke iriyānoti asammāiriyanakarānaṃ kilesānaṃ pahānā sammā so loke iriyamāno.
analyzed: aññāya sammā saḥ loke iriyāno ti a sammā iriyana karānam kilesānam pahānā sammā saḥ loke iriyamāno
translated: having known the formed truth, he, being rightly behaved in the world, by the abandonment of the defilements that are wrongly behaved, he, being rightly behaved in the world,

original: 183. Evaṃ apihento ca – yodha kāmeti gāthā. Tattha saṅganti sattavidhaṃ saṅgaṃ yo accatari. Nājjhetīti na abhijjhāyati.
analyzed: evam ca yodha kāma iti gāthā tattha saṅganti sattavidham saṅgam yaḥ accatari na ajjheti iti na abhijjhāyati
translated: . And thus, having rejected, the verse ‘ He who has overcome ‘ . There, the seven kinds of attachment, he who has overcome, does not long for, does not desire.

original: 184. Tasmā tumhesupi yo evarūpo hotuṃ icchati, taṃ vadāmi – yaṃ pubbeti gāthā. Tattha
analyzed: tasmā yaḥ evarūpaḥ hotum icchati tam vadāmi yam pubbā iti gāthā tattha
translated: So I say to you, whoever wishes to be like that:

original: yaṃ pubbeti atīte saṅkhāre ārabbha uppajjanadhammaṃ kilesajātaṃ atītaṃ kammañca.🔽Pacchā te māhu kiñcananti anāgatepi saṅkhāre ārabbha uppajjanadhammaṃ rāgādikiñcanaṃ
analyzed: yam pubbe ti atīte saṅkhāre ārabbha uppajjana dhammam kilesa jātam atītam kammañca  pacchā te mā āhu kiñcananti anāgate pi saṅkhāre ārabbha uppajjana dhammam rāga ādi kiñcanaṃ
translated: “What was before, let that be now no more;🔽Let there be nothing hereafter for you.

original: mā ahu. Majjhe ce no gahessasīti paccuppannarūpādidhammepi na gahessasi ce. Evaṃ upasanto carissasi.
analyzed: mā ahu majjhe ce no gahessasi iti paccuppanna rūpa ādi dhamme pi na gahessasi ce evam upasantaḥ carissasi
translated: If you do not grasp in the middle,🔽You will go about quite quenched.🔽Make the seed fruitless,🔽Do not be a slave to lust,🔽Do not be a slave to hatred,

original: Abījaṃ karohīti maggañāṇena na bījaṃ karohi. Rāgakiñcananti rāgaphandanaṃ. Dosakiñcanādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: abījam karohi iti magga ñāṇena na bījam karohi rāga kiñcanam ti rāga phandanam dosa kiñcana ādīsu pi esa eva nayo
translated: Do not be a slave to delusion.”

original: 185. Evaṃ arahattappattiṃ dassetvā idāni arahato thutivasena ito parā gāthāyo abhāsi.
analyzed: evam arahatta pattim dassetvā idāni arahataḥ thuti vasena itas parāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsi
translated: Having thus shown the attainment of Arahantship, he now spoke the following verses in praise of the Arahant.

original: Tattha sabbasoti gāthāya mamāyitanti mamattakaraṇaṃ. “Mama ida”nti gahitaṃ vā vatthu.
analyzed: tattha sabbaso ti gāthāya mamāyitam ti mamatta karaṇam mama idam ti gahitam vā vatthu
translated: Herein, in the verse beginning “Sabba” , mamāyitaṃ = mamattakaraṇaṃ . The object grasped as “mine” is vatthu .

original: Asatā ca na socatīti avijjamānakāraṇā asantakāraṇā na socati. Na jīyatīti jāniṃ nādhigacchati.🔽Ahu vata meti mayhaṃ ahosi vata. Taṃ vata me natthīti yaṃ atīte ahosi, taṃ mayhaṃ
analyzed: asatā ca na socati iti avijjamāna kāraṇā asanta kāraṇā na socati na jīyati iti jānim na adhigacchati  ahu vata mā iti mayham ahosi vata tam vata me natthi iti yam atīte ahosi tam mayham
translated: He does not grieve for what is not : he does not grieve for a non-existent cause, for a cause that is not. He is not elated : he does not attain to conceit.

original: idāni na santi. Siyā vata meti yaṃ mayhaṃ bhavissati, taṃ vatāhaṃ na labhāmīti idāni🔽ahaṃ ekaṃsena na pāpuṇāmi.
analyzed: idāni na santi siyā vata mā iti yam mayham bhavissati tam vata aham na labhāmi iti idāni  aham ekaṃsena na pāpuṇāmi
translated: What was mine : what was mine, indeed. That is not mine : what was in the past is not mine now. What might be mine : what might be mine, indeed. I do not get that : I do not now obtain it in any way.

original: 186. Kiñca bhiyyo – yassa natthīti gāthā. Tattha kiñcananti kiñci rūpādidhammajātaṃ.
analyzed: kiñca bhiyyas yassa na atthi iti gāthā tattha kiñcana nti kiñci rūpa ādi dhamma jātam
translated: And what is more, there is the verse beginning “What is not, that is not mine, that I am not, let that be destroyed.” Herein, what is not is any kind of formed thing beginning with material form.

original: Abhisaṅkhatanti kammena saṅkharitaṃ. Abhisañcetayitanti cittena rāsikataṃ. Avijjāya tvevāti avijjāya tu eva. Asesavirāganirodhāti virāgasaṅkhātena maggena niravasesanirodhā.
analyzed: abhisaṅkhatanti kammena saṅkharitam abhisañcetayitanti cittena rāsikatam avijjāya tu eva ati avijjāya tu eva asesa virāga nirodhā ati virāga saṅkhātena maggena niravasesa nirodhā
translated: What is made : what is made by kamma. What is intended : what is intended by consciousness. But only through ignorance : only through ignorance. By the complete fading away and cessation of ignorance : by the complete cessation of ignorance by means of the path called “fading away of lust.”

original: Suññato lokaṃ avekkhassūti avasavattisallakkhaṇavasena vā tucchasaṅkhārasamanupassanavasena
analyzed: suññatas lokam avekkhassu iti avasavatti sat lakkhaṇa vasena vā tuccha saṅkhāra samanupassana vasena
translated: He should look upon the world as empty : he should look upon it as empty by means of the contemplation of non-self and by means of the contemplation of the empty aspect of the contemplation of impermanence.

original: vāti dvīhākārehi suññato lokaṃ passa. Attānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhaccāti sakkāyadiṭṭhiṃ uddharitvā.
analyzed: vāti dvīhākārehi suññatas lokam passa attā anudiṭṭhim ūhati ca ati sakkāya diṭṭhim uddharitvā
translated: “See the world as void in two ways” : in the sense of “lay aside the view of self” and in the sense of “lay aside the view of the world.”

original: Evaṃ maccutaro siyāti evaṃ maraṇassa taraṇo bhaveyya. Evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantanti evaṃ
analyzed: evam maccutaraḥ siyāti evam maraṇassa taraṇaḥ bhaveyya evam lokam evam
translated: “Thus one may cross over death” : thus one may cross over death. “Thus one may see the world” : thus one may see the aggregates.

original: khandhalokaṃ passantaṃ. Maccurājā na passatīti maraṇarājā na oloketi na dakkhati.
analyzed: khandha lokam passantam maccu rājā na passati iti maraṇa rājā na oloketi na dakkhati
translated: “The king of death does not see him” : the king of death does not look at him, does not see him.🔽“He does not wish for anything else” : he does not wish for, does not long for, anything else, even the least. “Except for non-rebirth” : some read “except for rebirth” .

original: Nāññaṃ patthayate kiñcīti aññaṃ appamattakampi na patthayati na pihayati. Aññatra appaṭisandhiyāti nibbānaṃ ṭhapetvā. “Aññatrappaṭisandhiyā”ti ekapadaṃ katvāpi paṭhanti.
analyzed: na aññam patthayate kiñci iti aññam appamattakam pi na patthayati na pihayati aññatra appaṭisandhiyā ati nibbānam ṭhapetvā aññatra appaṭisandhiyā ati eka padam katvā api paṭhanti
translated: “And what is more” : the verse “The unperturbed one” .

original: 187. Kiñca bhiyyo – aniṭṭhurīti gāthā. Tattha aniṭṭhurīti anissukī. “Aniṭṭharī”tipi
analyzed: kiñca bhiyyas aniṭṭhurī iti gāthā tattha aniṭṭhurī iti anissukī
translated: There, “the unperturbed one” : the unperturbed one is the one who is not perturbed. Some read “the unperturbed one” .

original: keci paṭhanti. Sabbadhī samoti sabbattha samo, upekkhakoti adhippāyo. Kiṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: keci paṭhanti sabbadhī samaḥ ti sabbattha samaḥ upekkhakaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ kim vuttam
translated: “The one who is the same in every way” : the one who is the same everywhere; the meaning is, the one who is equanimous. What is meant?

original: hoti? Yo so “natthi me”ti na socati, tamahaṃ avikampinaṃ puggalaṃ puṭṭho samāno aniṭṭhurī
analyzed: hoti yaḥ saḥ natthi mā iti na socati tam aham avikampinam puggalam puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ aniṭṭhurī
translated: “I ask about the person who does not grieve, saying ‘He does not exist.’ The unperturbed one,

original: ananugiddho, anejo sabbadhī samoti imaṃ tasmiṃ puggale catubbidhaṃ ānisaṃsaṃ brūmīti.
analyzed: an anugiddhaḥ an ejaḥ sabbadhī samaḥ ti imam tasmin puggale catubbidham ānisaṃsam brūmi iti
translated: I declare that these four benefits are to be expected in a person who is not envious, who is not fraudulent, who is not hypocritical, who is not pretentious, who is not deceitful, who is not obstinate, who is not treacherous, who is not a swindler, who is not a cheat, who is not a miser, who is not a cheat with the measure, balance, or scale, who is not deceitful in the use of the tongue, who is not fraudulent in the use of the world, who is not envious, who is not restless, and who has attained to equanimity in all things.🔽“Scoundrel” is a jealous person. “Scoundrel-ness” is the state of being a scoundrel.

original: Niṭṭhuriyoti issukī. Niṭṭhurabhāvo niṭṭhuriyaṃ, taṃ nissāya ettakampi natthīti kheḷapātanti
analyzed: niṭṭhuriyā ti issukī niṭṭhura bhāvaḥ niṭṭhuriyam tam nissāya ettakam pi natthi iti kheḷa pātam ti
translated: The meaning is: “He is a cheat who says ‘There is not even that much’ depending on a scoundrel.”

original: attho. Niṭṭhuriyakammanti niṭṭhuriyakaraṇaṃ. Gahaṭṭho vā hi gahaṭṭhaṃ bhikkhu vā
analyzed: atthaḥ niṭṭhuriya kammanti niṭṭhuriya karaṇam gahaṭṭhaḥ vā hi gahaṭṭham bhikkhu vā
translated: “Scoundrel-action” is the action of a scoundrel. For a householder or a monk

original: bhikkhuṃ nissāya vasanto appamattakeneva kujjhitvā taṃ nissāya ettakampi natthīti
analyzed: bhikkhum nissāya vasanto appamattakena iva kujjhitvā tam nissāya ettakam pi natthi iti
translated: who lives depending on a householder or a monk, when he gets angry over a trifle, he is said to be a scoundrel who says “There is not even that much”

original: kheḷaṃ pātetvā pādena maddanto viya niṭṭhuriyaṃ nāma karoti. Tassa taṃ kammaṃ “niṭṭhuriyakamma”nti🔽vuccati. Issāti sabhāvaniddeso. Tato parā dve ākārabhāvaniddesā. Itarattayaṃ pariyāyavacanaṃ.
analyzed: kheḷam pātetvā pādena maddantaḥ viya niṭṭhuriyam nāma karoti tassa tam kammam niṭṭhuriya kammanti  vuccati sa bhāva niddeso tatas parā dve ākāra bhāva niddesā pariyāya vacanam
translated: and kicks up a fuss, as if he were kicking up dust with his foot. That action of his is called “scoundrel-action.”🔽“Envious” is a description of the individual essence. The next two are descriptions of the mode of being and the manifestation. The other three are synonyms.🔽But envy has as its individual essence the state of being jealous of the success of others. Its function is to be dissatisfied with that.

original: Lakkhaṇādito panesā parasampattīnaṃ usūyanalakkhaṇā issā; tattha ca anabhiratirasā;🔽tato vimukhabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānā; parasampattipadaṭṭhānā.
analyzed: lakkhaṇa āditaḥ pana isā para sampattīnam usūyana lakkhaṇā issā tattha ca an abhirati rasā 🔽tatas vimukha bhāva paccupaṭṭhānā para sampatti padaṭṭhānā
translated: It is manifested as a desire to turn away from it. Its proximate cause is the success of others.

original: Lābhepi na iñjatīti paccayalābhe na calati. Alābhepīti paccayānaṃ alābhepi.🔽188. Kiñca bhiyyo – anejassāti gāthā. Tattha nisaṅkhatīti puññābhisaṅkhārādīsu yo
analyzed: lābhe api na iñjati iti paccaya lābhe na calati alābhe api iti paccayānam alābhe api  kiñca bhiyyas anejassa ati gāthā tattha nisaṅkhati iti puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādīsu yaḥ
translated: He does not waver at gain: he does not waver at the gain of requisites. Nor at loss: nor at the loss of requisites.🔽And what is more, he is not bound by any bond,

original: koci saṅkhāro. So hi yasmā nisaṅkhariyati, nisaṅkharoti vā, tasmā “nisaṅkhatī”ti
analyzed: saṅkhāraḥ saḥ hi yasmai nisaṅkhariyati nisaṅkharoti vā tasmai
translated: Nor does he stir himself to action,🔽Nor does he see security anywhere.

original: vuccati. Viyārambhāti vividhā puññābhisaṅkhārādikā ārambhā. Khemaṃ passati sabbadhīti
analyzed: vuccati viya ārambhā ti vividhā puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādikā ārambhā khemam passati sabbadhi iti
translated: He does not stir himself to action: he does not stir himself to action by forming any formations such as formations of merit.

original: sabbattha abhayameva passati.
analyzed: sabbattha abhayam eva passati
translated: Nor does he see security anywhere: he does not see any security anywhere.

original: Ārambhāti kammānaṃ paṭhamārambhā. Viyārambhāti uparūpari vividhaārambhanavasena vīriyārambhā. Tīsu bhavesu paṭisandhijanakakammānaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Tasmā viyārambhā ārato.🔽189. Evaṃ passanto na samesūti gāthā. Tattha na vadateti “sadisohamasmī”tiādinā mānavasena
analyzed: ārambhā ati kammānam paṭhama ārambhā viyārambhā ati upari upari vividha ārambhana vasena vīriya ārambhā tīsu bhavesu paṭisandhi janaka kammānam adhivacanam tasmā  evam passantaḥ na samesu iti gāthā tattha na vadata iti sadisaḥ ham asmi iti ādinā māna vasena
translated: He does not stir himself to action: he does not begin any action. Nor does he stir himself to action: he does not stir himself to action by repeated action. This is a term for the kinds of kamma that generate rebirth-linking in the three kinds of becoming. Therefore he is “not stirred to action.”🔽He does not boast of his equality,🔽Nor does he deprecate his inferiority.🔽He does not boast of his equality: he does not boast of himself by means of conceit such as “I am equal to them” .

original: samesupi attānaṃ na vadati omesupi ussesupi. Nādeti na nirassatīti rūpādīsu kañci
analyzed: attānam na vadati omesupi ussesupi na ādeti na nirassati iti rūpa ādīsu kañci
translated: Nor does he deprecate his inferiority: he does not deprecate himself by means of conceit such as “I am inferior to them” .

original: dhammaṃ na gaṇhāti na nissajjati. Sesaṃ sabbattha tattha tattha vuttanayattā pākaṭameva.
analyzed: dhammam na gaṇhāti na nissajjati sesam sabbattha tattha tattha vutta naya ttā pākaṭam eva
translated: he does not take up or put aside the Dhamma. The rest is clear in every instance according to the way it is stated there and there.

original: Evaṃ arahattanikūṭeneva desanaṃ niṭṭhāpesīti.
analyzed: evam arahatta nikūṭena iva desanam niṭṭhāpesi iti
translated: So he concluded the teaching with the peak of arahatship.

original: Saddhammappajjotikāya mahāniddesaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: saddhammappajjotikāya mahā niddesa ṭṭhakathāya
translated: In the Great Commentary on the Niddesa, a lamp for the true Dhamma,

original: Attadaṇḍasuttaniddesavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: attadaṇḍa sutta niddesa vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the Attadaṇḍa Sutta is finished.

original: 16. Sāriputtasuttaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the Sāriputta Sutta

original: 190. Soḷasame na me diṭṭhoti sāriputtasuttaniddeso. Tattha ito pubbeti ito saṅkassanagare🔽otaraṇato pubbe. Vagguvadoti sundaravado. Tusitā gaṇimāgatoti tusitakāyā cavitvā🔽mātukucchiṃ āgatattā tusitā āgato. Gaṇācariyattā gaṇī. Santuṭṭhaṭṭhena vā tusitasaṅkhātā
analyzed: soḷasame na me diṭṭho ti sāriputta sutta niddeso tattha itas pubbe ti itas saṅkassanagare  otaraṇato pubbe tusitā tusita kāyā cavitvā  mātukucchim āgatattā tusitā āgataḥ gaṇācariyattā gaṇī santuṭṭhaṭṭhena vā tusita saṅkhātā
translated: In the sixteenth sutta, “I have not seen” , the exposition of the Sāriputta Sutta. Herein, before this means before the descent from the Tusita heaven.

original: devalokā gaṇiṃ āgato, tusitānaṃ vā arahantānaṃ gaṇiṃ āgatoti.
analyzed: deva lokāḥ tusitānam vai arahantānam gaṇim āgataḥ iti
translated: Fine speaker: a good speaker. He came from the Tusita host: he came from the Tusita world, having passed away from there and entered his mother’s womb. He is a host because he is a teacher of a community. Or alternatively, he came from the host of gods called Tusita, which is so called because of the satisfaction of the gods there. Or he came from the host of tusita arahants.

original: Iminā cakkhunāti iminā attabhāvapariyāpannena pakatimaṃsacakkhunā. Iminā attabhāvenāti
analyzed: iminā cakkhunā ati iminā atta bhāva pariyāpannena pakati maṃsa cakkhunā iminā atta bhāvena ati
translated: With this eye: with this eye of flesh belonging to his own person. With this self:

original: iminā pacchimena attabhāvena. Tāvatiṃsabhavaneti tāvatiṃsadevaloke. Pāricchattakamūleti
analyzed: iminā pacchimena atta bhāvena tāvatiṃsa bhavanā iti tāvatiṃsa deva loke pāricchattaka mūlā iti
translated: with this last existence. In the Tāvatiṃsa heaven: in the Tāvatiṃsa divine world. At the foot of the Pāricchattaka tree:

original: koviḷārarukkhassa heṭṭhā. Paṇḍukambalasilāyanti rattakambalasadisapāsāṇapiṭṭhe. Vassaṃ
analyzed: koviḷāra rukkhassa heṭṭhā paṇḍu kambala silāyanti ratta kambala sadisa pāsāṇa piṭṭhe vassam
translated: under the Koviḷāra tree. On the white coral-stone slab: on a stone slab like a red blanket. After

original: vuṭṭhoti vuṭṭhavasso. Devagaṇaparivutoti devasaṅghena parivārito. Otiṇṇoti avatiṇṇo.
analyzed: vuṭṭhaḥ ti vuṭṭha vassaḥ deva gaṇa parivutaḥ iti deva saṅghena parivāritaḥ otiṇṇaḥ ati avatiṇṇaḥ
translated: spending the rains: after the rains had passed. Surrounded by the hosts of gods: surrounded by the groups of gods. Not yet entered: not yet entered.

original: Imaṃ dassanaṃ pubbeti aññatra imamhā dassanā pubbe. Na diṭṭhoti aññadā na diṭṭhapubbo.
analyzed: imam dassanam pubbe iti aññatra imamhā dassanā pubbe na diṭṭhaḥ ti aññadā na diṭṭha pubbaḥ
translated: This sight: this sight. Before: other than this sight. Never seen: never seen before.

original: Khattiyassa vāti khattiyassa vadantassa na suto. Brāhmaṇādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: khattiyassa vā ati khattiyassa vadantassa na sutaḥ brāhmaṇa ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: The khattiya: the khattiya who speaks. Not heard: not heard before. The same method applies to the brahmin, etc.

original: Madhuravadotiādīsu byañjanasampannaṃ madhuraṃ vadatīti madhuravado. Pemajanakaṃ pemārahaṃ
analyzed: byañjana sampannam madhuram vadati iti pema janakam
translated: Sweet-voiced: etc. He speaks sweetly with a voice endowed with the characteristics of a good voice, thus he is sweet-voiced. He speaks in a way that produces love, in a way that is worthy of love,

original: vadatīti pemanīyavado. Hadayaṅgamacitte ṭhapanayogyaṃ vadatīti hadayaṅgamavado. Karavīkasakuṇasaddo
analyzed: vadati iti pemanīya vadaḥ hadayaṅgama citte ṭhapana yogyam vadati iti hadayaṅgama vadaḥ karavīka sakuṇa saddaḥ
translated: thus he is loveable-voiced. He speaks in a way that is suitable for fixing the mind on the heart, thus he is heart-seizing-voiced. His voice is sweet like the voice of the karavīka bird,

original: viya madhuraghoso assāti karavīkarutamañjughoso. Vissaṭṭho cāti apalibuddho tattha
analyzed: viya madhura ghosaḥ assa ati vissaṭṭhaḥ ca ati apalibuddhaḥ tattha
translated: thus he is sweet-voiced like the karavīka bird. And distinct: not obstructed there.

original: tattha apakkhalano. Viññeyyo cāti suvijāneyyo ca. Mañju cāti madhuro ca. Savanīyo🔽cāti kaṇṇasukho ca. Bindu cāti ghano ca. Avisārī cāti na patthaṭo ca. Gambhīro cāti🔽na uttāno ca. Ninnādi cāti ghosavanto ca. Assāti assa satthuno. Bahiddhā parisāyāti🔽parisato bahi. Na niccharatīti na nikkhamati. Kiṃkāraṇā? Evarūpo madhurasaddo nikkāraṇā
analyzed: tattha apakkhalanaḥ viññeyyaḥ ca ati su vijāneyyaḥ ca mañju ca ati madhuraḥ ca savanīyaḥ  ca ati kaṇṇa sukho ca bindu ca ati ghano ca avisārī ca ati na patthaṭo ca gambhīro ca ati  na uttānaḥ ca ninna ādi ca ati ghosavanto ca assa ati assa satthuno bahiddhā parisāya ati  parisataḥ bahi na niccharati iti na nikkhamati kiṃkāraṇā evarūpaḥ madhura saddaḥ nikkāraṇā
translated: Herein, the word “fault” is apakkhalana . The word “to be known” is suvijāneyya . The word “sweet” is madhura . The word “to be heard” is savanīya .🔽The word “drop” is bindu . The word “not dribbling” is avisārī . The word “profound” is gambhīra . The word “resonant” is ninnādi . The word “his” is assa . The word “outside” is bahiddhā parisāya .

original: mā vinassatūti. Brahmassaroti aññe chinnassarāpi bhinnassarāpi kākassarāpi honti,
analyzed: mā vinassatu uti brahmassarā uti aññe chinnassarā api bhinnassarā api kākassarā api honti
translated: The word “does not issue forth” is na niccharati . Why does it not issue forth? Because it is a sweet sound, let it not be destroyed. The word “Brahma-like” is brahmassara . Others have a cut-off voice, a broken voice, a crow’s voice,

original: ayaṃ pana mahābrahmuno sarasadisena sarena samannāgato. Mahābrahmuno hi pittasemhehi🔽apalibuddhattā saro visuddho hoti, bhagavatāpi katakammaṃ vatthuṃ sodheti, vatthuno
analyzed: ayam pana mahābrahmuno sara sadisena sarena samannāgataḥ mahābrahmuno hi pitta semhehi  a palibuddha ttā saraḥ visuddhaḥ hoti bhagavatā api kata kammam vatthum sodheti vatthuno
translated: but this one is endowed with a voice like that of the Great Brahma. For the Great Brahma’s voice is pure because it is not affected by bile and phlegm,

original: suddhattā nābhito paṭṭhāya samuṭṭhahanto saro visuddho aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgatāva samuṭṭhāti.
analyzed: suddhattā nābhitas paṭṭhāya samuṭṭhahanto saraḥ visuddhaḥ aṭṭhaṅga samannāgatā ava samuṭṭhāti
translated: and the Blessed One’s voice is pure because it arises from a pure physical basis, for the action he performed purified the physical basis.

original: Karavīko viya bhaṇatīti karavīkabhāṇī, mattakaravīkarutamañjughosoti attho.🔽Tāretīti akhemantaṭṭhānaṃ atikkāmeti. Uttāretīti khemantabhūmiṃ upanento tāreti.
analyzed: karavīkaḥ viya bhaṇati iti karavīka bhāṇī matta karavīka ruta mañju ghosaḥ ti attho  tāreti iti a khemanta ṭṭhānam atikkāmeti uttāreti iti khemanta bhūmim upanentaḥ tāreti
translated: He speaks like a karavīka bird, thus he is a karavīka-speaker; the meaning is, he has a voice as sweet as a karavīka bird’s call.🔽He causes to cross over : he causes to go beyond the place that is not safe. He causes to come out : he causes to cross over by bringing to the place that is safe.

original: Nittāretīti akhemantaṭṭhānato nikkhāmento tāreti. Patāretīti pariggahetvā tāreti,
analyzed: nittāreti iti akhemanta ṭṭhānataḥ nikkhāmento tāreti patāreti iti pariggahetvā tāreti
translated: He causes to go out : he causes to cross over by taking out from the place that is not safe. He causes to go forth : he causes to cross over by taking hold of;

original: hatthena pariggahetvā viya tāretīti attho. Sabbampetaṃ tāraṇuttāraṇādikhemantaṭṭhāne
analyzed: hatthena pariggahetvā viya tāreti iti attho sabbam petam tāraṇa uttāraṇa ādi khemanta ṭṭhāne
translated: the meaning is, he causes to cross over as if taking hold of with his hand. All this is the placing in the place that is safe, which is the crossing over, the coming out, the going out, and the going forth.

original: ṭhapanamevāti āha – “khemantabhūmiṃ sampāpetī”ti. Satteti veneyyasatte. Mahāgahanatāya
analyzed: ṭhapanam eva iti āha khemanta bhūmim sampāpeti iti satta iti veneyya satte mahā gahana tāya
translated: So he said, “He brings to the place that is safe” . Beings : beings who are teachable. Birth itself is a jungle because it is a great thicket,

original: mahānatthatāya dunnittariyatāya ca jātiyeva kantāro jātikantāro, taṃ jātikantāraṃ.🔽Gaṇassa sussūsatīti gaṇo assa vacanaṃ sussūsati suṇāti upalakkheti. Sotaṃ odahatīti
analyzed: mahānattha tāya dunnittariya tāya ca jātiyā iva kantāraḥ jāti kantāraḥ tam jāti kantāram  gaṇassa sussūsati iti gaṇaḥ assa vacanam sussūsati suṇāti upalakkheti sotam odahati iti
translated: because it is a great calamity, and because it is hard to cross over, thus birth is a jungle-thicket. He causes to cross over the jungle-thicket of birth.🔽He has a following : his following listens to his word, hears it, and attends to it. He causes to hear :

original: sotukāmatāya sotaṃ avadahati patiṭṭhāpeti. Aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapetīti ñātukāmaṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: sotu kāma tāya sotam avadahati patiṭṭhāpeti aññā cittam upaṭṭhapeti iti ñātu kāmam cittam
translated: he causes to hear by arousing the ear, by setting the ear going, through desire to hear. He causes to establish the mind : he causes to establish the mind that desires to know,

original: paṇidahati. Gaṇaṃ akusalā vuṭṭhāpetvāti janasamūhaṃ akosallasambhūtā akusalā uṭṭhāpetvā.🔽Kusale patiṭṭhāpetīti kosallasambhūte kusale ṭhapeti. Saṅghīti rāsivasena saṅgho
analyzed: paṇidahati gaṇam akusalāḥ vuṭṭhāpetvā ati jana samūham akosalla sambhūtāḥ akusalāḥ uṭṭhāpetvā  kusale patiṭṭhāpeti iti kosalla sambhūte kusale ṭhapeti saṅghī iti rāsi vasena saṅghaḥ
translated: He dedicates. Having made a multitude rise from the unwholesome: having made a crowd rise from the unwholesome that has arisen from unskillfulness.

original: assa atthīti saṅghī. Parisavasena gaṇo assa atthīti gaṇī. Gaṇassa ācariyoti gaṇācariyo.
analyzed: assa atthi iti saṅghī parisa vasena gaṇaḥ assa atthi iti gaṇī gaṇassa ācariyo ti gaṇa ācariyo
translated: He establishes in the wholesome: he places in the wholesome that has arisen from skillfulness. He is a Saṅghi because he has a Saṅgha by way of a retinue. He is a Gaṇī because he has a multitude by way of a retinue. He is a Gaṇācariyo because he is a teacher of the multitude.

original: 191. Dutiyagāthāya sadevakassa lokassa, yathā dissatīti sadevakassa lokassa viya
analyzed: dutiya gāthāya sa devakassa lokassa yathā dissati iti sa devakassa lokassa viya
translated: In the second verse: of the world with its gods, as it is seen: as it is seen in the world with its gods,

original: manussānampi dissati. Yathā vā dissatīti tacchato aviparītato dissati. Cakkhumāti
analyzed: manussānam pi dissati yathā vā dissati iti tacchataḥ aviparītataḥ dissati cakkhumā ti
translated: so it is seen in the world of men. Or, as it is seen: it is seen as it really is, without distortion. The eye:

original: uttamacakkhumā. Ekoti pabbajjāsaṅkhātādīhi eko. Ratinti nekkhammaratiādiṃ.🔽Patirūpakoti suvaṇṇapatirūpako kuṇḍalo. Mattikākuṇḍalovāti mattikāya katakuṇḍalo
analyzed: uttama cakkhumā ekaḥ ti pabbajjā saṅkhāta ādīhi ekaḥ ratinti nekkhamma rati ādim  patirūpakaḥ iti suvaṇṇa patirūpakaḥ kuṇḍalaḥ mattikā kuṇḍalo vā ati mattikāya kata kuṇḍalo
translated: the supreme eye. Alone: alone by way of the going forth and so on. Delight: delight in renunciation and so on.🔽A counterpart: a counterpart to a golden earring. Like an earring made of clay: like an earring made of clay.

original: viya. Lohaḍḍhamāsova suvaṇṇachannoti suvaṇṇena paṭicchanno lohamāsako viya. Parivārachannāti
analyzed: viya lohaḍḍha māsaḥ uva suvaṇṇa channaḥ ti suvaṇṇena paṭicchannaḥ loha māsakaḥ viya parivāra channā ati
translated: Like a half-month of iron covered with gold: like a half-month of iron covered with gold. Surrounded by a retinue:

original: parivārena chāditā. Anto asuddhāti abbhantarato rāgādīhi aparisuddhā. Bahi sobhamānāti🔽cīvarādīhi bāhirato sundarā.
analyzed: parivārena chāditā antar asuddhā ati abbhantarataḥ rāga ādīhi aparisuddhā bahi sobhamānā iti  bāhirataḥ sundarā
translated: Covered by a covering. Unclean within: not purified within by the absence of greed, etc.🔽Shining without: beautiful without, with the beauty of the robes, etc.

original: Akappitairiyāpathā cāti asajjitairiyāpathā. Paṇidhisampannāti paripuṇṇapatthanā.
analyzed: a kappita airiyā pathā ca ati a sajjita airiyā pathā paṇidhi sampannā ati paripuṇṇa patthanā
translated: Not with limbs distorted: not with limbs distorted by greed, etc.🔽Endowed with vows: endowed with fulfilled vows.

original: Visuddhasaddoti parisuddhakittisaddo, yathābhūtathutighosoti attho. Gatakittisaddasilokoti🔽kittisaddañca silokañca gahetvā caraṇasīlo. Kattha visuddhasaddoti ce? “Nāgabhavane
analyzed: visuddha saddo ti parisuddha kitti saddaḥ yathā bhūta thuti ghoso ti atthaḥ gata kitti sadda silokaḥ ti  kittisaddam ca silokam ca gahetvā caraṇasīlaḥ kattha visuddhasaddo ti ce nāga bhavane
translated: Pure in character: pure in the character of his good conduct.🔽His fame and glory spread: taking his fame and glory, he went.

original: ca supaṇṇabhavane cā”tiādinā nayena vitthāretvā vuttaṭṭhāne. Tato ca bhiyyoti tato
analyzed: ca supaṇṇa bhavane ca ati ādinā nayena vitthāretvā vutta ṭṭhāne tato ca tato
translated: Where is his pure character? In the places stated in the passage beginning, “In the abodes of the nāgas, in the abodes of the supaṇṇas” .

original: vuttappakārato ca veneyyavasena atirekataropi dissati.
analyzed: vutta ppakārataḥ ca veneyya vasena atirekataraḥ api dissati
translated: And more than that: he is seen to be even more than the kind described.

original: Sabbaṃ rāgatamanti sakalaṃ rāgandhakāraṃ. Dosatamādīsupi eseva nayo. Andhakaraṇanti
analyzed: sabbam rāgatamanti sakalam rāga andhakāram dosatama ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ andha karaṇanti
translated: The whole darkness of lust: the whole darkness of the gloom of lust. The same method applies in the case of the darkness of hate, etc.🔽Darkness-maker: maker of darkness for the light of wisdom.

original: paññālokanivāraṇakaraṇaṃ. Acakkhukaraṇanti paññācakkhuno akaraṇaṃ. Aññāṇakaraṇanti
analyzed: paññāloka nivāraṇa karaṇam a cakkhu karaṇanti paññā cakkhuno a karaṇam aññāṇa karaṇanti
translated: Eye-destroyer: maker of the non-eye, the non-eye of wisdom.

original: ñāṇena ajānanakaraṇaṃ. Paññānirodhikanti paññānayananāsakaṃ. Vighātapakkhikanti pīḷākoṭṭhāsikaṃ.
analyzed: ñāṇena a jānana karaṇam paññā nirodhikanti paññā nayana nāsakam vighāta pakkhikanti pīḷā koṭṭhāsikam
translated: and by knowledge, the state of not knowing. It is a “knowledge-stopper” : it stops the search by knowledge. It is a “trouble-maker” : it makes trouble.

original: Anibbānasaṃvattanikanti apaccayaamatanibbānatthāya na saṃvattanikaṃ.
analyzed: a nibbāna saṃvattanikam ti apaccaya amata nibbāna atthāya na saṃvattanikam
translated: It is not conducive to Nibbāna : it is not conducive to the non-existence of conditions and to Nibbāna.

original: Sabbaṃ taṃ tena bodhiñāṇena bujjhīti taṃ sakalaṃ tena catumaggañāṇavasena bujjhi.
analyzed: sabbam tam tena bodhi ñāṇena bujjhi iti tam sakalam tena catu magga ñāṇa vasena bujjhi
translated: He awakened to all that by that knowledge of enlightenment : he awakened to all that by means of the four paths of knowledge.

original: Paṭhamamaggavasena jāni anubujjhi. Dutiyamaggavasena puna aññāsi paṭivijjhi. Tatiyamaggavasena
analyzed: paṭhama magga vasena anubujjhi dutiya magga vasena puna aññāsi paṭivijjhi tatiya magga vasena
translated: By means of the first path he knew and awakened to it. By means of the second path he knew it again and penetrated it. By means of the third path

original: paṭivedhaṃ pāpuṇi sambujjhi. Catutthamaggavasena nissesapaṭivedhena sammābujjhi.🔽Adhigacchi phassesi sacchākāsīti etaṃ tayaṃ phalavasena yojetabbaṃ. Paṭhamadutiyavasena🔽paṭilabhi. Tatiyavasena ñāṇaphassena phusi. Catutthavasena paccakkhaṃ akāsi. Atha
analyzed: paṭivedham pāpuṇi sambujjhi catuttha magga vasena nissesa paṭivedhena sammābujjhi  adhigacchi phassesi sacchākāsi iti etam tayam phala vasena yojetabbam paṭhama dutiya vasena  paṭilabhi tatiya vasena ñāṇa phassena phusi catuttha vasena paccakkham akāsi atha
translated: he reached penetration and awakened to it. By means of the fourth path he awakened to it rightly by means of the penetration of the remainderless.🔽He attained, he touched with his body, he realized : this triad should be construed with the fruit. By means of the first and second paths he obtained it. By means of the third path

original: vā ekekaphalassa tayopi labbhanti eva.
analyzed: vā ekeka phalassa tayo pi labbhanti eva
translated: he touched it with the touch of knowledge. By means of the fourth path he made it manifest. Or else, all three are applicable to each fruit.

original: Nekkhammaratinti pabbajjādīni nissāya uppannaratiṃ. Vivekaratinti kāyavivekādimhi
analyzed: nekkhamma ratim ti pabbajja ādīni nissāya uppanna ratim viveka ratim ti kāya viveka ādimhi
translated: ‘Delight in seclusion’: delight arisen in bodily seclusion, etc.,🔽‘Delight in peace’: delight in the stilling of defilements,

original: uppannaratiṃ. Upasamaratinti kilesavūpasame ratiṃ. Sambodhiratinti maggaṃ paccavekkhantassa uppannaratiṃ.
analyzed: uppanna ratim upasama ratim ti kilesa vūpasame ratim sambodhi ratim ti maggam paccavekkhantassa uppanna ratim
translated: ‘Delight in enlightenment’: delight arisen in one who reviews the path.

original: 192. Tatiyagāthāya bahūnamidha baddhānanti idha bahūnaṃ khattiyādīnaṃ sissānaṃ. Sissā
analyzed: tatiya gāthāya bahūnam idha baddhānam ati idha bahūnam khattiya ādīnam sissānam sissā
translated: In the third stanza, ‘bound to many here’: to many pupils, khattiyas, etc.,

original: hi ācariyapaṭibaddhavuttittā “baddhā”ti vuccanti. Atthi pañhena āgamanti atthiko
analyzed: hi ācariya paṭibaddha vutti ttā baddhā ati vuccanti atthi pañhena āgamanti atthiko
translated: For pupils are called ‘bound’ because they live bound to their teachers.🔽‘I have come with a question’: I have come with a question as one who seeks,

original: pañhena āgatomhi, atthikānaṃ vā pañhena āgamanaṃ, pañhena atthi āgamanaṃ vāti.
analyzed: pañhena āgataḥ amhi atthikānam vā pañhena āgamanam pañhena atthi āgamanam vā ati
translated: or the coming with a question of those who seek, is the coming with a question.

original: Buddhoti padassa abhāvepi taṃ buddhanti pade yo so buddho, taṃ niddisitukāmena “buddho”ti
analyzed: buddhaḥ iti padassa abhāve pi tam buddhanti pade yaḥ saḥ buddhaḥ tam niddisitu kāmena buddhaḥ ti
translated: ‘The Enlightened One’: although the word ‘enlightened’ is not there, the word ‘that’ refers to the enlightened one, and it is said ‘enlightened’

original: vuttaṃ. Sayambhūti upadesaṃ vinā sayameva bhūto. Anācariyakoti sayambhūpadassa atthavivaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam sayambhu ti upadesam vinā sayam eva bhūtaḥ anācariyakaḥ ti sayambhu padassa attha vivaraṇam
translated: in order to point him out. ‘Self-becoming’: without instruction, he became by himself. ‘Self-taught’: this explains the meaning of the word ‘self-becoming.’

original: Yo hi ācariyaṃ vinā saccāni paṭivijjhati, so sayambhū nāma hotīti. Pubbe ananussutesūtiādi
analyzed: yaḥ hi ācariyam vinā saccāni paṭivijjhati saḥ sayambhū nāma hoti iti pubbe ananussutesu utiādi
translated: For he who penetrates the Truths without a teacher is called self-taught. “In things unheard before” and so on

original: anācariyakabhāvassa atthappakāsanaṃ. Ananussutesūti ācariyato ananussutesu. Sāmanti
analyzed: an ācariyaka bhāvassa attha ppakāsanam ananussutesu ti ācariyataḥ ananussutesu sāmanti
translated: is the explanation of the meaning of the absence of a teacher. “In things unheard before” means in things not heard from a teacher. “By himself”

original: sayameva. Abhisambujjhīti bhusaṃ sammā paṭivijjhi. Tattha ca sabbaññutaṃ pāpuṇīti
analyzed: sayam eva abhisambujjhi iti bhusam sammā paṭivijjhi tattha ca sabbaññu tam pāpuṇi iti
translated: means by himself alone. “He comprehended” means he penetrated thoroughly. And “he attained to omniscience”

original: tesu ca saccesu sabbaññubhāvaṃ pāpuṇi. Yathā saccāni paṭivijjhantā sabbaññuno honti,
analyzed: tesu ca saccesu sabbaññu bhāvam pāpuṇi yathā saccāni paṭivijjhantā sabbaññunaḥ honti
translated: means he attained to the state of omniscience in regard to those Truths. For it is by penetrating the Truths that one becomes omniscient.

original: tathā saccānaṃ paṭividdhattā evaṃ vuttaṃ. “Sabbaññutaṃ patto”tipi pāṭho. Balesu ca
analyzed: tathā saccānam paṭividdha ttā evam vuttam sabbaññu tam patto ti pi pāṭhaḥ balesu ca
translated: This is said because it is by penetrating the Truths that one becomes omniscient. The reading “he attained to omniscience” is also correct. “And mastery of the powers”

original: vasībhāvanti dasasu ca tathāgatabalesu issarabhāvaṃ pāpuṇi. Yo so evaṃ bhūto, so🔽buddhoti vuttaṃ hoti. Tattha sabbadhammesu appaṭihatañāṇanimittānuttaravimokkhādhigamaparibhāvitakhandhasantānaṃ
analyzed: dasasu ca tathāgata balesu issara bhāvam yaḥ saḥ evam bhūtaḥ saḥ  buddho ti vuttam hoti tattha sabba dhammesu appaṭihata ñāṇa nimitta anuttara vimokkha adhigama paribhāvita khandha santānam
translated: means he attained to lordship over the ten powers of a Tathāgata. He who is such is🔽called a Buddha. Herein, the designation “Buddha” is based on the continuity of aggregates that is developed by the attainment of the supreme liberation, which is characterized by unobstructed knowledge of all dhammas.

original: upādāya paṇṇattiko, sabbaññutapadaṭṭhānaṃ vā saccābhisambodhimupādāya paṇṇattiko
analyzed: upādāya paṇṇattiko sabbaññu ta padaṭṭhānam vā sacca abhisambodhim upādāya paṇṇattiko
translated: Or the designation is based on the realization of the Truths, which is the basis for omniscience.

original: sattaviseso buddho. Ettāvatā atthato buddhavibhāvanā katā hoti.🔽Idāni byañjanato vibhāvento “buddhoti kenaṭṭhena buddho”tiādimāha. Tattha yathā loke🔽avagantā “avagato”ti vuccati, evaṃ bujjhitā saccānīti buddho. Yathā paṇṇasosā vātā🔽“paṇṇasusā”ti vuccanti, evaṃ bodhetā pajāyāti buddho. Sabbaññutāya buddhoti sabbadhammabujjhanasamatthāya🔽buddhiyā buddhoti vuttaṃ hoti. Sabbadassāvitāya buddhoti sabbadhammānaṃ ñāṇacakkhunā
analyzed: satta visesaḥ buddhaḥ ettāvatā atthataḥ buddha vibhāvanā katā hoti  idāni byañjanataḥ vibhāventaḥ buddhaḥ ti kena aṭṭhena buddhaḥ ti ādim āha tattha yathā loke  avagantā avagataḥ iti vuccati evam bujjhitā saccāni iti buddhaḥ yathā paṇṇasosāḥ vātā  vuccanti evam bodhetā pajāya ati buddhaḥ sabbaññutāya buddhaḥ iti sabba dhamma bujjhana samatthāya  buddhiyāḥ buddho ti vuttam hoti sabba dassāvitāya buddho ti sabba dhammānam ñāṇa cakkhunā
translated: and the seven kinds of distinction are the Enlightened One. This is how the exposition should be known here as to meaning.

original: diṭṭhattā buddhoti vuttaṃ hoti. Anaññaneyyatāya buddhoti aññena abodhanīyato sayameva🔽buddhattā buddhoti vuttaṃ hoti. Visavitāya buddhoti nānāguṇavikasanato padumamiva🔽vikasanaṭṭhena buddhoti vuttaṃ hoti. Khīṇāsavasaṅkhātena buddhotiādīhi chahi pariyāyehi
analyzed: diṭṭha ttā buddhaḥ iti vuttam hoti anaññaneyyatāya buddhaḥ iti aññena a bodhanīyataḥ sayam eva 🔽buddha ttā buddhaḥ iti vuttam hoti visavitāya buddhaḥ iti nānā guṇa vikasanato padumam iva 🔽vikasana ṭṭhena buddhaḥ ti vuttam hoti khīṇāsava saṅkhātena buddhaḥ iti ādīhi chahi pariyāyehi
translated: Now, as to phrasing, he asks, “In what sense is he Enlightened? ” and so on. Herein, just as in the world one who understands is called “ enlightened ” , so he is Enlightened because he has awakened to the truths . Just as winds that blow away the chaff are called “chaff-blowers” , so he is Enlightened because he has awakened the world . He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to awaken to all states of the kind of dhammas beginning with the four noble truths. He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to see all dhammas with the eye of knowledge. He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to awaken by himself without being instructed by anyone else. He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to open up and reveal, like the opening up and revealing of a lotus, by the blossoming of the various special qualities. He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to destroy the defilements and the kinds of ignorance, like the sun’s power to destroy darkness. He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to make the four kinds of bhikkhus, namely, the bhikkhu who is a lion, the bhikkhu who is a lion-like elephant, the bhikkhu who is a thoroughbred horse, and the bhikkhu who is a cock, attain their several kinds of distinction. He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to make the four kinds of bhikkhunīs, namely, the bhikkhunī who is a lion, the bhikkhunī who is a lion-like elephant, the bhikkhunī who is a thoroughbred mare, and the bhikkhunī who is a cock, attain their several kinds of distinction. He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to make the four kinds of male lay followers, namely, the male lay follower who is a lion, the male lay follower who is a lion-like elephant, the male lay follower who is a thoroughbred horse, and the male lay follower who is a cock, attain their several kinds of distinction. He is Enlightened because of the enlightenment that is able to make the four kinds of female lay followers, namely, the female lay follower who is a lion, the female lay follower who is a lion-like

original: cittasaṅkocakaradhammappahānena niddāya vibuddho puriso viya sabbakilesaniddāya vibuddhattā🔽buddhoti vuttaṃ hoti. Saṅkhā saṅkhātanti atthato ekattā saṅkhātenāti vacanassa koṭṭhāsenāti🔽attho. Taṇhālepadiṭṭhilepābhāvena nirupalepasaṅkhātena savāsanānaṃ sabbakilesānaṃ🔽pahīnattā ekantavacanena visesetvā vuttaṃ. Ekantanikkilesoti rāgadosamohāvasesehi🔽sabbakilesehi nikkileso.
analyzed: citta saṅkoca kara dhamma ppahānena niddāya vibuddhaḥ purisaḥ viya sabba kilesa niddāya vibuddha ttā  buddhaḥ ti vuttam hoti saṅkhā saṅkhātanti atthataḥ ekattā saṅkhātena ati vacanassa koṭṭhāsena ati  attho taṇhā lepa diṭṭhi lepa abhāvena nirupalepa saṅkhātena sa vāsanānam sabba kilesānam  pahīna ttā ekanta vacanena visesetvā vuttam ekanta nikkilesaḥ ti rāga dosa moha avasesehi  sabba kilesehi nikkilesaḥ
translated: He is awakened, like a man awakened from sleep by the removal of the contraction of mind that is the cause of sleep.

original: Ekāyanamaggaṃ gatoti buddhoti gamanatthānaṃ dhātūnaṃ bujjhanatthattā bujjhanatthāpi🔽dhātuyo gamanatthā honteva, tasmā ekāyanamaggaṃ gatattā buddhoti vuttaṃ hoti. Ekāyanamaggo cettha –🔽“Maggo pantho patho pajjo, añjasaṃ vaṭumāyanaṃ;🔽Nāvā uttarasetū ca, kullo ca bhisi saṅkamo”ti. –
analyzed: ekāyana maggam gataḥ ti buddhaḥ ti gamana tthānam dhātūnam bujjhanatthattā bujjhanatthā api 🔽dhātuyaḥ gamana atthāḥ hontā iva tasmai ekāyana maggam gata ttā buddhaḥ ti vuttam hoti ekāyana maggaḥ ca ittha 🔽maggaḥ panthaḥ pathaḥ pajjaḥ añjasam vaṭuma ayanam 🔽nāvā uttarasetū ca kullo ca bhisi saṅkamoti
translated: The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhātā. The meaning of the word saṅkhāta is the same as that of saṅkhāt

original: Maggassa bahūsu nāmesu ayananāmena vuttamagganāmena vutto. Tasmā ekamaggabhūto maggo,
analyzed: maggassa bahūsu nāmesu ayana nāmena vutta magga nāmena vuttaḥ tasmai eka magga bhūtaḥ maggaḥ
translated: The “one-way path” is the path spoken of by the name “way” among the many names for the path. Therefore the path is the one-way path,

original: na dvedhāpathabhūtoti attho. Atha vā ekena ayitabbo maggoti ekāyanamaggo. Ekenāti
analyzed: na dvedhā patha bhūto ti atthaḥ atha vā ekena ayitabbaḥ maggo ti ekāyana maggaḥ ekena ati
translated: not the two-way path, is the meaning. Or alternatively, it is the one-way path because it is to be gone by one. By one means

original: gaṇasaṅgaṇikaṃ pahāya pavivittena. Ayitabboti paṭipajjitabbo, ayanti vā etenāti ayano,
analyzed: gaṇa saṅgaṇikam pahāya pavivittena ayitabbaḥ iti paṭipajjitabbaḥ ayanti vā etena ati ayanaḥ
translated: by one who has gone forth after abandoning the society of the multitude. To be gone by means to be practised. Or the way is that by which one goes;

original: saṃsārato nibbānaṃ gacchantīti attho. Ekesaṃ ayanoti ekāyano. Ekesanti seṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: saṃsārataḥ nibbānam gacchanti iti attho ekesam ayano ti eka ayanaḥ ekesam ti seṭṭhānam
translated: the meaning is that it is the way to go from the round of rebirths to Nibbāna. It is the one-way path because it is the way for one. For one means for the best.

original: Sabbasattaseṭṭhā ca sammāsambuddhā, tasmā ekesaṃ maggabhūto sammāsambuddhānaṃ ayanabhūto
analyzed: sabba satta seṭṭhā ca sammāsambuddhā tasmai ekesam magga bhūto sammāsambuddhānam ayana bhūto
translated: And the best of all beings are the Perfectly Enlightened Ones. Therefore it is said that the path is the one-way path because it is the way for one, that is, for the Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: maggoti vuttaṃ hoti. Ayatīti vā ayano, gacchati pavattatīti attho. Ekasmiṃ ayano🔽maggoti ekāyanamaggo. Ekasmiṃyeva buddhasāsane pavattamāno maggo, na aññatthāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: maggo ti vuttam hoti ayati iti vā ayanaḥ gacchati pavattati iti atthaḥ ekasmin ayanaḥ  maggo ti ekāyana maggaḥ ekasmiṃ yeva buddha sāsane pavattamānaḥ maggaḥ na aññattha ati vuttam
translated: Or the way is that by which one goes; the meaning is that it is the way in which one goes, in which one occurs. It is the one-way path because it is the way in one.

original: hoti. Api ca ekaṃ ayatīti ekāyano. Pubbabhāge nānāmukhabhāvanānayappavattopi aparabhāge
analyzed: hoti api ca ekam ayati iti ekāyanaḥ pubbabhāge nānā mukha bhāvanā naya ppavatto api aparabhāge
translated: The meaning is that it is the path that occurs only in the Dispensation of the Buddha, not elsewhere. Moreover, it is the one-way path because it goes to one. Although in the earlier stage it occurs as the way of the development of the many-faceted path,

original: ekaṃ nibbānameva gacchatīti vuttaṃ hoti, tasmā ekāyanamaggoti ekanibbānagamanamaggoti attho.
analyzed: ekam nibbānam eva gacchati iti vuttam hoti tasmai ekāyana maggo ti eka nibbāna gamana maggo ti attho
translated: “It goes to a single extinction” means that it goes to a single Nibbāna. Therefore the meaning of “the one-way path” is the path that goes to a single Nibbāna.

original: Eko anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddhoti na parehi buddhattā buddho, kintu sayameva
analyzed: ekaḥ anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ iti na parehi buddha ttā buddhaḥ kintu sayam eva
translated: “One has awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment” means that he is not a Buddha because of being awakened by others, but rather

original: anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddhattā buddhoti vuttaṃ hoti. Abuddhivihatattā🔽buddhipaṭilābhattā buddhoti buddhi buddhaṃ bodhoti pariyāyavacanametaṃ. Tattha yathā
analyzed: anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddha ttā buddhaḥ iti vuttam hoti a buddhi vihata ttā  buddhi paṭilābhattā buddho ti buddhi buddham bodho ti pariyāya vacanam etam tattha yathā
translated: that he is a Buddha because of having awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment by himself. The meaning of “awakened” is “having destroyed non-awakening”

original: “nīlarattaguṇayogā nīlo paṭo, ratto paṭo”ti vuccati, evaṃ buddhaguṇayogā “buddho”ti ñāpetuṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nīla ratta guṇa yogā nīlaḥ paṭaḥ ratto paṭo ti vuccati evam buddha guṇa yogā buddhaḥ iti ñāpetum vuttam
